column6: No comment

Ambiance was a 10/10. The music and decor was perfect for a girls night out or a date night. Service was a 6/10. Very attentive servers, but come off as trying to rush you and would clean your plate before you were done. Honestly slightly bizarre interactions with severs. Food was a 6.75/10, sushi itself was good and fresh but nothing ground breaking. The serving sizes were small. The wine serving size was outrageous. We ordered 5 glasses of wine instead of the bottle in order to receive more wine per person. Instead we received a bottle to split between 5 people and still charged the individual glass price. Overall a fine experience but nothing phenomenal.
Delicious yakisoba   Wonderful salmon skin roll  freshest sashimi  very flavorful miso
No comment

No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Wanted to try their pancake but it's only on weekends. Tried their dinner and it was great. Service was also good! We ate when they just opened for dinner so there weren't a lot of people yet
No comment
No comment
We had a great dinner, great service, everything we order was great! The special rolls, meatballs, sashimi platter, drinks, sake, all great.

Great food, cocktails, environment and service, definitely will visit again! The tempura is good to try, fresh and not oily. Each cocktail has great combination, really match the sake and refresh, love it so much! The eel rice and the Momoya tasting box are great! I hope I can eat more because I haven't try the dessert yet, I will be back. I highly recommended this place if you look for good Japanese food.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Go whenever you can but if possible I recommend brunch on the weekend! Then not only can you get their delicious sushi - you can also order their fluffy soufflé pancakes! We absolutely loved the tempura, momoya box, black cod & soufflé pancakes. And of course we had to finish with one of their beautiful parfaits. And everything here tastes as good as it looks! Services was excellent - kudos to our waiter Alejandro. Enjoy!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for brunch primarily because of their fancy parfaits!  They seem to be seasonal as they had just changed it up prior to one I had seen on social media.  The quality of that parfait was excellent.  At other restaurants, they usually aren't made with quality ingredients, but the parfait here tasted as good as it looked!  It may be pricey, but it is worth it.  I would definitely come back again to try other renditions of it.  I also had the pancakes which were solid Japanese-style ones.  They were fluffy, but not so much the jiggly ones like some people might expect, so just a warning.  But that was fine by me as the flavor was perfection.

My friend and I went to Momoya for dessert after brunch and made a reservation for 2:30 pm on Sunday. We arrived an hour early, but we were still thankfully seated. We indulged in the seasonal parfait, which comes with a small pamphlet detailing all the parts of the parfait along with the backstory of the dessert. We enjoyed consuming each component with the many different flavors and textures elegantly combined together in the parfait. The white wine jelly layer on the bottom was particularly interesting. Although the parfait is pricy, coming in at $28, it was an enjoyable experience!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Instagram knows how to find me. I saw the parfait & I kept saying wow.. I need to get this! What shook me was the savory dishes this restaurant has to offer! I enjoyed the crispy rice since it's not common to get. My boyfriend enjoyed the spicy tuna more where I enjoyed the waygu appetizer. It's a filling dish, so everything we ordered was just perfect to not over stuff us. But, let's get to the Momoya box featuring 9 mini chirashi bowls. This was perfect for two of us and worth the money! Of course, the main event was the dessert. I love the creativity & complexity of the ingredients and presentation. Definitely worth it in my book. Also cute interior & bathroom!
Super cute and clean looking place. Wonderful sushi bento box. and great drinks!
No comment

This place was phenomenal in terms of food and customer service! I and may party all got variants of the sushi meals, 2 of us got the sushi and sashimi platter, one person got the sushi special, and my partner got the sushi lunch. All of the sushi and sashimi offerings were super fresh and tasty and the presentation was lovely! My partner also got the Yuzu Ricotta soufflé pancake and she thoroughly enjoyed it. On top of that the two ladies in our party of 4 got the lychee cocktail which is a sleeper of a drink if one ever did exist because it tasted like straight juice. Then I got the Suntory beer. The ambiance of the restaurant was very bright and fresh and there was a lot of aquamarine color tones in the restaurant mixed with white which made the restaurant feel super crisp and refreshing if that's even a way to describe interior decoration. Would definitely come back!
No comment

Short and sweet rating. This place was delightful, the service was outstanding, the food was unique and so fresh and flavorful. We just rolled up without reservations and the staff worked really hard to seat us and accommodate our variety of food allergies. This was a random impromptu choice and we are SO glad to have stumbled in. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The location was in soho so it was convenient after a shopping trip. The place looked cute. We got a sushi entree, which was a little bit disappointing because the rice fell apart. We also got the sukiyaki gozen, which was ok and the beef was a little bit too fatty. For dessert, we cannot miss their tiktok-famous seasonal parfait. The parfait looked huge and tasted very nice. It had bunches of fall flavors like apple, cinnamon, sweet potato and they even gave you an instruction and a breakdown of the ingredients on a paper. Overall, I would only come back for the parfait.
No comment

Had a great experience for lunch at Momoya SoHo. I made a reservation in advance on resy for a Thursday lunch, during the holidays. The host was very welcoming and my friend and I were seated right away. The restaurant itself is very refined and the decor is great (especially the small touches of holiday decor). For appetizers we ordered the wagyu beef tataki which was very tender and the ponzu sauce was a nice touch. For lunch my friend and I ordered the sushi and sashimi combo which comes with one roll choice ( I got yellowtail and she got spicy salmon) four pieces of sushi and four types of sashimi with two pieces for each type. We also had a choice of soup or salad. The sushi and sashimi was very fresh and of good quality. It's a fine lunch option and for the quality you get I would say it's worth it although there are cheaper sushi lunch options (but you get what you pay for, and for soho this is a good deal). For drinks we got a lychee cocktail and it was sweet and refreshing (could only taste a hint of alcohol which I actually preferred). For dessert we split the seasonal dessert which was the "Tsuru No Ongaeshi" -White Wine Gelée, Ginger White Chocolate Ice Cream, Clementine Sorbet, Lemon Verbena Espuma, Apricot Shiratama, Rare Cheesecake, Genmai Crumble, Kinmoku-sei. It was very intricate and there were several layers of flavors to it. At $28 it is definitely on the pricier side but it is an experience and worth while if you are splitting it with at least one other person. I'm curious to try the other seasonal desserts available as the winter parfait was delicious and light. Overall I would definitely come back for lunch!
No comment

Sushi was pretty good and they have a decent sushi/sashimi deals for lunch. I got 2 maki rolls and 5 pieces nigiri for ~$28. We also came during a weekend day during restaurant week and they had a very good nigiri plate on the menu! The ambiance was nice and the downstairs was very open and airy. We sat upstairs which was much smaller and quiet, which would be good for larger families.

Came here on a Saturday for brunch and was really impressed. We ordered the matcha molten French toast, yuzu soufflé pancakes, shokadou bento box, and sushi and sashimi combo. The fish was really fresh and the bento box had a great variety of things to try. However, my favorites were definitely the matcha molten French toast and yuzu soufflé pancakes. The combination of whipped cream, red bean, mochi pieces, and matcha filling was incredible and super unique. The yuzu soufflé pancakes were also super light and fluffy, and the honey added the perfect touch of sweetness.

Went here for brunch and my pancakes were soooo fluffy & yummy. My friend liked her matcha toast as well! The inside and outside were really pretty and visually stunning. The service was great too! I didn't like the dessert that much but it was definitely beautiful!

Amazing restaurant week deal! Appetizer, entree, and dessert all for $60. I've been looking for a good sushi place and Momoya Soho is the first place in a long time to really wow me with their sushi! Truly fresh, authentic, and balanced with their menu offerings. Definitely looking forward to coming back soon.
Some of the best sushi we've had in the city. Our server, Yisi, was truly incredible - attentive, kind, and all of his recommendations were top notch!
No comment
No comment

Everything was delicious & fresh! The staff was very friendly.. the ambience in the outdoor patio was a bit awkward. It was completely silent and felt weird to carry on with conversation. I am obsessed with the crispy rice! Overall, great experience!

Love the box. 9 pieces which looked small but because they had rice in each small bowl, this 9 pieces box was able to fill you up. The spicy scallop and shrimp roll was delicious. Really wanted to try the jasmine crème brûlée but it was not available last night. Overall I had a good pleasant experience.

Great restaurant week offering, their momoya box is awesome, it comes with the freshest fish possible, probably the best o'toro I've had in a while. I think it might be a good date spot, but only indoors, the atmosphere is much better there compared to outdoors.

Such a pretty spot for brunch or dinner (perfect for a date)! It's really modern and bright inside! There are plenty of outdoor seatings too. They use blue chairs that reminds you of Tiffany vibe. The food looked pretty and it tasted good! My friend and I ordered two lunch sets and they came with a dessert each (I wasn't a fan of the tofu one). We also ordered sangrias, it had variety of fruits and looked really pretty but it tasted just okay. The price is on the higher end but I'll wouldn't mind going back one day to try their other items.

Ambiance is very on point. Different from their other restaurant in Chelsea but still very cute!! Love the Japanese hosts with their welcoming energies. Sitting at the sushi bar was nice to see all the dishes they offer. King crab roll was a standout and super tasty. You can taste how fresh the king crab is. This is a go to sushi restaurant and they even had reservations available on Valentine's Day still!
No comment

So it's weird that the Momoya in Soho is THIS bad but Momoya Chelsea is SOOOO GOOD. The soho location is so aesthetically pleasing, but the service is completely lacking. We came here when there were literally 1 other table there, and several servers just pass us by. I usually don't care about service, but on top of that, the food is just okay. Go to Momoya Chelsea instead!
No comment

I will freely admit that the main reason I wanted to try this place was because of their desserts. After ordering several of their most popular dishes, including the seasonal parfait (currently autumn themed), Momoya box, and crispy rice, I feel like everything looks better than it tastes (which is not to say that anything tastes bad, but I do feel like presentation takes precedence here). Visually, everything is stunning, particularly the parfait and the Momoya box. Like, literally made for Instagram. Regarding the parfait, I'm not sure how well the flavors and various components really meshed together. Figuring out how to eat it was a challenge and I'm like 80% sure I did it wrong. Momoya Box had a nice variety of fish; wasn't the best sashimi I've had but it was good. Crispy rice was tasty, just nothing special. Also had a lychee cocktail which was average; don't think that one was worth the price.
No comment
No comment

Gotta get brunch at Momoya Soho for that matcha lava french toast!! Their signature crispy spicy tuna roll did not disappoint, the uni soba and the sushi and sashimi combo were great. A nice meal option for the summer to cool off in the bustling Soho neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

The sushi and sashimi are fresh! Their sesame agedashi tofu is unusual like mochi and delicious. They do a good job with the eggplants too! The only minus is that I find the price point higher than places with comparable quality of food
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: I sat at the bar by myself. The bar tender was super attentive asking me right away if I needed another drink when my first one became empty. She was also super attentive with how much water I had and asked to refill it as soon as it was needed. The food was extremely tasty and fresh. The restaurant has a warm and bright atmosphere and is so welcoming. I would definitely come back here.
No comment

Sushi was delicious. You have to get the crispy rice spicy tuna roll if you go. Devoured everything in under an hour, and was left completely satisfied. The restaurant is very pretty. Our server accidentally seated us outside when our reservation was for inside, but it was a nice night so it wasn't a big deal.

We came here on a Thursday evening and ordered off the "Restaurant Week" dinner menu. I will say the Chicken Karaage and Brussel Sprouts did not stand out but were still good. However, the Momoya Box was excellent and fresh! Surprisingly filling too. The Dorayaki we also very good--not too sweet. The decor was trendy but I prefer the ambience of the Upper West Side location more. Service was great.

I wasn't sure how to review this restaurant and wanted to be very clear that my expectations was met but i would not go back. Now walking in i was extremely excited I felt everything in me so nervous because i heard a lot of good things about this restaurant and it was beautiful. I stopped by after doing some birthday shopping on a Friday. I was alone and was in a great mood, Soon as i walked in the host greeted me and was very pleasant i sat at the bar and couldn't stop checking out the details "it was eye appealing"  the aesthetic was everything u would want your Friday after work to be like and feel because the music was on point and i was smiling because i was enjoying every moment. The bar tender came he was very basic gave me a menu and i placed my order. My drink was pretty good and i was happy that i order something simple and it came out in a timely fashion. I noticed the bartender was very short with me not much smiling or conversation and that's okay but the service he gave the other guess was by far what i expected. He asked what was they food allergies and what was the mood they was going for because it seem like we all wasn't sure on what to order "it was many great options" I did love that for them so i was upset my service was so dry. Things did change i ordered the seasonal dessert and I'm not sure if he was the manager and i hope he was because he did a great job putting a smile back on my face. Every detail about the dessert was explained and how to eat it as well  i felt that the money i spent was about to be worth it. Because of him act of kindness i left a great tip and was okay with stopping by. Would i go back hell no but i would say u have to experience this restaurant once. If the service wasn't so off i would go back it would be no question asked.

Absolutely had a great meal here. Their food was so good I had to talk about it to my colleagues and friends too. Their dessert was also very different from other places I've tried too. Different in a good and surprising way since I didn't expect some things to taste the way they taste, but better. Such as finding a pink pineapple, to a floral looking jelly, to a thin piece of mochi in the pancake ice cream. Way too good! I would recommend going to try this place!
No comment

Good ambiance and location. The parfait was really fun to eat and their lunch menu was decent for sushi. The staff is new just like the restaurant so there are small kinks to work out but nothing major.

The food was actually quite good, but the service was horrendous. We ordered a bottle of champagne right when we sat down, and over an hour later, it still hadn't arrived. After canceling the order (since we were done eating), the restaurant offered to give us two glasses for free. Thirty minutes later, those didn't even arrive. Knowing restaurants make the majority of their money from drinks, it was bizarre to say the least that you couldn't score a drink in this place under any circumstance. A real shame, considering the food was pretty decent.
No comment

It was pretty busy on a weeknight at 8:30pm but that didn't stop us from having amazing service from our waitress Kritta (sorry, I have bad memory but her name was longer). She was so sweet and attentive to us and made sure to top our sparkling rose wine and sparkling seltzer as we ate. Once our plates were finished they were cleared out immediately and we didn't have to wait long for our food. The Crispy Rice definitely gets the hype it receives, it was delicious! The Wagyu Tataki was chewy, and fatty. It's something worth trying out, if you like it cold. I was very very happy with the Crispy Duck, it was juicy and tender and bursting with flavor, besides the typical gamey flavor you get from eating duck. I wasn't impressed with the Toro Scallion but it's okay because my date enjoyed it, as with the Chef's Choice sushi! The most anticipated menu item was the infamous Sakura Strawberry Parfait. Kritta was sweet to explain our menu items once she served us and what was on the platter. For dessert she showed us pictures of the dessert menu (of course we got the parfait!). If you like super sweet and fruity flavors, it's so good! The homemade strawberry sauce was amazing and the parfait itself had all kinds of treasure chest pieces like Sakura dango and macaroon and raspberry chocolate shards! We loved our time here, we would definitely come back, especially if Kritta was serving us! She also fixed our wobbly table, lol.

The food was amazing, as was the service and ambiance at Momoya soho. We had several appetizers and entrees, my favorite was the wagyu takati, as well as the sushi which is so fresh and melt in your mouth delish! I would definitely come back, and don't forget to try the dessert menu - it was the cherry on top to my experience at Momoya :)

Well worth the visit and a great addition to the neighborhood - momoya fills the the void for loan upscale sushi restaurant with lots of options on the menu (not just a 200/person omakase) - our meal was great - sashimi was very fresh as was our sushi - dessert was also awesome - service at momoya was top notch

Very cool atmosphere, gives off LA vibes when you're inside. Skip all of the appetizers, the edamame was kind of tasteless and the calamari was really sour and had the consistency of a funnel cake. Wagyu beef was delicious but very thin slices. No liquor license yet so we couldn't get a cocktail but even if we could the menu seemed like it would present better than it tasted. The rolls were the best part, crispy rice tuna and the shrimp and lobster roll were the best. Skip desert and go to Van Leeuwen down the street.

Very attractive building and sleek interiors. I ducked in from the rain thinking of just having a drink at the bar. From the receptionists to the managers, everyone was welcoming and helpful. I got Kumamoto oysters, a seasonal sake with a lovely aroma, and spicy salmon roll with crunchy rice. I could stay there all day! The food presentation is amazing.  Special thanks to Yummy at the bar.

I have been to Momoya twice already since it's opening, once for the dinner menu and once for the omakase. Both times were mind blowing and fantastic! This is my number one favorite Japanese restaurant in NYC - they use the finest quality fish and have many delicious menu combinations. I was very happy to see this location open after visiting Momoya UWS countless times. Highly recommend! I'll be back again and again.

Exactly what this neighborhood needed! Momoya Soho has the freshest sushi / fish in the area and the sake selection is second to none. The prices are more than justified by the welcoming staff, delicious food and lively environment. I'll be back!!

GUYS, you have to go to Momoya Soho! The food is amazing and reasonably priced. They have the best crispy rice in the city, yes even better than Nobu. Also, all the employees are so welcoming and the service is great. So basically if you want to go to a hip sushi place that isn't too stuffy than go to Momoya.

Went with a group of 4. The sushi is good, nothing crazy. Everything is more on the pricier side which is why the food could be better. Fish tastes fresh, portions are very small. However, the service was horrible! We had a middle aged Hispanic lady with pink hair serving the patio Saturday night and she took our order and that was the only time we really saw her. Then there was another middle aged Hispanic man serving other tables on the patio the same night who was killing it and checking on all his tables. He kept walking by and we wish he was our server! When we got our check we waited like 30-45 and the lady never went to get it. The man did instead and we wished we gave him our tip. At the end, she tried to tell us that our Visa gift card couldn't be accepted because there wasn't enough on there for her tip even though we said we would tip in cash! So when she made us pay another way instead, we paid in cash and she awkwardly stood there waiting for us to give her more cash for her tip. We told her to just take the payment for the bill first and we would leave a tip on the table. Weirdest service encounter any of us ever had! We had to ask for a dessert menu and she literally never checked on us. If the service wasn't so bad I'd come back!
Overpriced sushi, long wait for food, not friendly serving - I would not come here again.
Great new sushi in soho. Fish was very fresh and service was great. Recommend dimming the lighting more but other than that the atmosphere is perfect for a night out
No comment
No comment
Amazing fresh sushi for restaurant week, very generous with portion. Highly recommend

Celebrating a 27th wedding anniversary, I wanted this to be special. Unfortunately, our experience was incredibly mediocre! The waitress was nice but forgot to put our order in as we waited forever for starters. When we asked her she apologized and said it was her mistake. The fish quality was just ok. Did not have that super fresh delicate quality at all. Then my husband ordered 2 more pieces of fatty tuna and same waitress brought out uni. She again apologized and said, "not sure what's wrong with me tonight?" We also ordered sparkling water and a gentleman refilled our glasses with tap while our sparkling was still in our glass. I didn't want to stay any longer as I was disappointed in the meal, so we just skipped dessert. The bill came to $450.. not $$ well spent and would not recommend or go back.
Amazing restaurant, I travel a lot and this is THE BEST SEAFOOD restaurant in NYC. Favorite place to come with my husband and friends after a long work week.
What impeccable and attentive service matched with exquisite and high quality tasting food! Bravo!

Do not come to this restaurant for quality or fresh sushi. My friend ordered the 8 piece nigiri and I ordered the 12 piece one. Both of our plates came out with fish that looks and tasted old some of the fish was literally browning. Neither of us finished our plates and left. This place is lively and inviting but that's it

Honestly overall very uncomfortable experience. The staff are lovely however the managers are rude. My friend and I were told to wait for our table at the bar we did, at the same time two of the managers sat beside us watching us the whole time I over heard them whisper "let's kick them out". We were sat far away from other customers. Terrible would not recommend this location AT ALL.

Worst restaurant experience I have ever had! Our table was completely neglected. Our food came out an hour after ordering and there were still dishes missing that we had to remind the staff about. Our waiter (Costas) was extremely rude, did not check up on us all night and did not address the delay. As someone who's been a server for over 4 years I would have never treated my customers the way I was treated tonight. Costas, don't work in customer service if you can't be respectful.
Momoya soho is the best sushi combination! Beautiful and trendy vibe coupled with fabulous fresh fish and impeccable service. This spot is worth the trek to soho!! 5+ stars
Delicious specials, friendly service/owner, and great outdoor area. Perfect spot to eat good food and people watch

Great restaurant but Omakase is overpriced for what you get. Do not recommend doing the $150/person tasting. However I Would highly recommend sitting at a regular table and ordering from the main menu.
This is has an awesome vibe and welcoming to everyone. Thank you for keeping Soho cool.

My friends and I recently dined there, and we were blown away by the food, drinks, service, and atmosphere. The waitstaff was incredibly knowledgeable, and was attentive to all of our needs. The sushi was some of the best I've ever had, and I'm still dreaming about the crispy rice! This is a perfect place for a celebratory dinner, or a low-key night with friends. Can't wait to go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing food. Each dish was packed with flavor. Got the dumplings, fish, lamb, chicken, eggplant, tuna. Every dish as good as the last.  Go here!!!

We took a chance and walked up with no reservation. We were seated right away. The space has great decor and comfortable distance between the tables. The Frena Bread is a must have. The fish feeds 3 but our party of 2 devoured it. Note that your bill already has gratuity included.

Amazing food and drinks. Loved the family style options. The chicken was stellar. I wish I had more. The mushroom appetizer plate was just as tasty. All staff members were fully versed on the menu, offering a breakdown of the plates, sharing recommendations and answering all questions. The ambiance was a perfect vibe for the night. Overall loved the experience and am looking forward to going again.

My wife and I went to Mesiba during their first week and were blown away by the food, drinks, and vibe. The whole crispy fish was a show stopper - I haven't tried anything like it before and it was delicious! The cocktails were super creative and beautiful, I loved how fresh the limonana was. All the servers had great attitudes and were really helpful in explaining the menu. The design of the restaurant is beautiful and helped to create the super lively atmosphere. There's really nothing like Mesiba in Williamsburg - Moxy Williamsburg is a great add to the neighborhood and we can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The kings of Kobe was a great burger place and the food was amazingly tasty and delicious and with out a doubt the best place for burgers I believe everyone should go there for a great time. The service was great and no problems and the ambiance was great. I would recommend this place to all families and friends.

I've been coming here for quiet some time and I could say the service has changed drastically, a beyond burger with fries took over 30 minutes to serve on an empty restaurant literally 9 customers and no burger... I'm not sure what going on in the kitchen but they aren't working fast enough...
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delicious food. Lots of options. The service was really slow. The busboy was able to help us more than the waitresses.
This is a place where you want good old all-American burger, frank, steak....truffle fries done to perfection and the creamy coleslaw done to perfection.

Came in close to closing time and we could tell it was a little slow that evening with the downpour that was happening outside. The ambiance was nice with them having space for if you wanted to just get some drinks or if you wanted to sit in and eat. The burgers were phenomenal! I got the Duke Of Lux and I believe the other was called the Empress. You can definitely taste the difference in the meat from your regular burger. It can be a little pricey but for the quality of food you get, it is worth it. I came here once during the pandemic and I'm glad to see the place still thriving. I will be returning :)
From wonderful food to excellent service, KoK was great!  The serving portions are fitting for a King!
No comment
No comment

Food is great. Lunch was ordered and I had the best truffle fries ever. Even when they were cold! I ordered an american gliz.. I mean hotdog, chocolate cake, and sweet tea. Everything was really good. Everyone else ordered burgers and the cake pops. Our only complaint is all of the cake pops ordered were not in the bag.

Don't normally come on and write reviews, but this place is awesome!  The food was fantastic, creative but comforting, perfect blend.  The prices were reasonable, and everything was just fantastic tasting.  We had just finished at the Intrepid, and stumbled on it walking back to Times Square, so glad we did!!

I've been meaning to write a review since the first time we visited Kings of Kobe about a year ago. Since the first time, we've visited the them every time we are craving burgers and this has become our burger go-to place.
No comment
No comment
This place was great. If you're looking for solid burgers this is the place to go. The fries are also so good every time!! I don't know what they do with them, but they're so good every time!
No comment
No comment

The burgers came out cold at first. However, the waiter was very kind and had them remade. The burger was very flavorful and the toppings generous. The drinks are not worth the price, so stick to beer. The sweet potato tots are AMAZING! The choices of sauces, mayos and toppings are great. Will come back if in the area but won't make a special trip.
Excellent food and service! The burgers were amazing! Definitely one of the best burgers I've ever had!
No comment
How does this place have positive reviews? Salad was disappointing and the wings were chewy
one of the best hot dogs in New York, go there with your eyes closed I  recommend 100% the excellent Kobe beef sausage, the magnificent truffle fries, the impeccable service. Very good address.

We had just completed a sunset boat tour of the city skyline and needed a bite to eat. This place did NOT disappoint. I had the frydom hot dog (bacon wrapped dog with frizzled onions and specia sauce) - it was so yummy! Jared had a pulled pork hamburger, which was amazing. Jared was the winner last night although everything was good. We shared the truffle fries and the red onion rings, also good. We will be back, this spot has great food and a great ambiance. We sat outside and enjoyed the warm summer night.
No comment

I really enjoyed both sandwiches, they tasted delicious and were exactly what I expected.  The fries were really good as well.  The staff were friendly and got my food to me fast.  Would recommend stopping by here if you want a quick meal.
No comment

We had just finished a Statue of Liberty tour and we were looking for someplace fun to eat. We stumbled on this restaurant and we are so glad we did. Let me start by saying I can appreciate a very warm welcome when we walk in the door. Especially since I have a five-year-old daughter. After that welcome we received nothing but warmth,  and recommendations on food items. Now talking about the food we had the sultan which was absolutely amazing, the truffle fries, the sliders and the cheesecake bites for dessert. If you are in the neighborhood and you wanna have a nice easy laid-back lunch or dinner I highly recommend this place.
No comment
One of the best burgers i've ever eaten. It has a perfect location and the service is great.

Burger was good and nothing to complain about the food quality here, but today we came at 5pm and we were seated outside, we sat outside for about 30mins there's no waiter to come take the order; in the end we moved inside instead. But still waited for another 30mins I had to wave at the waiter to take order, and it took another 30mins for the food to arrive. The service was just tooooo slow. And my glass was empty before I start eating the burger but there's no one came to refill the water either. Such a disappointment of the service received

I was starving, and for some reason, really craving a burger. We looked on Yelp and saw that Kings of Kobe had some really great reviews, and a pretty interesting burger menu. We walked in pretty early for dinner, so we were seated immediately. I didn't really know what to get because everything sounded so good, so we decided we would split our two burgers. We ordered the Duke of Lux and the Louis XIII, both half pound. I liked that we were also asked about how we wanted the burgers cooked. One thing I didn't like is that sides don't come with the burgers, so we ended up ordering sweet potato tots a bit after the burgers came. I thought the tots were okay, but the burgers were so, so good. Juicy, and everything you could really ever want from a burger. Between the Duke of Lux and the Louis XIII, I preferred the Louis XIII (but that's not to say the Duke of Lux wasn't good!). All the ingredients that came together in were amazing--the mushrooms, the truffle oil, everything together was a perfect combination. I want to go back and try other burgers, but I know I'll probably just end up getting the Louis the XIII again (and again, and again).
Insanely good burgers, one of the best Ive had in the city.   A bit pricey though, which is why I didn't give it 5 stars.

One of the most burger joint I have ever been in the atmosphere is awesome and the food is the most tasteful food I have ever had. I took my girlfriend there and she loved it so much that she wants to go back there. Yes I will be back there soon again.

Great burger, salad and drinks. But, as good as they were the service was the best!  Can't wait to go back.

Great service and staff. Food was delicious and i loved sitting outside with my wife and daughter was such a nice team. Thanks kings of Kobe
Food was fantastic. Staff very friendly and attentive.  The burger patty was moist and the pretzel bun was a nice touch.

this place was fantastic! we were in a hurry to make our boat cruise and they were very accommodating to our speed. very friendly staff and delicious food! only complaint was that the large onion rings were so many we could barely finish with four people
What a fabulous place. Extraordinary regular and vegan burgers and good happy hour. Wonderful bartender and great vibe in the place.

I love this place.  The burgers are always amazing and they deliver fast. I always get their wings too, they are so good you don't even need any dipping sauce. Also the buttered fries always arrive crisp which it's hard to get on delivered fries.

This is Definitely the best burger I've ever had in my life. The Duke was spectacular. Service was wonderful. Super fast. Onion rings were amazing as were the fries. I think I gained 100 pounds. So so happy. This will be my number one place to have an incredibly decadent and amazing Burger. We also ordered the Louis. Although I did not try it. It got rave reviews.

Food tasted ok, but the price is expensive. I ordered a 2nd beer and the waitress forgot, so I remind her. She brought up like 10 minutes later and she told it was free due to long waiting. I didn't cancelled it due to politeness and at the end she still charged me and asked for tips. I have running stomach at that night and I pretty sure is their food.

Disaster. I'm usually not someone to complain about the price of a meal. But this place REALLY nickel and dimes you for every little thing. $1.50 for less than an ounce of salad dressing and even more for thousand island. What kind of places charges for the sauce?!!! Everywhere else hands you the bottle!! I was shocked to see that this place had a 4.5 star rating. Their burgers are made with Wagyu beef but let me tell you something, there is good wagyu and bad wagyu... this place clearly had the bad kind. The food did not agree with me at all and the burger did not taste good. It wasn't that it tasted bad, it was that is was TASTELESS, which is actually very hard to accomplish when you have bacon and cheese on the burger. Perhaps they were stingy with their sauces (wouldn't surprise me). The fries came out room temperature and stiff and had no flavor in them. Crazy to think a place with such low quality and quantity ingredients could squeeze out every little penny. There are way better options in NYC if you want a burger.

I have now been here twice and I've had a great experience every time. Our server was maira (i think that's how you spell her name) . The waffle dog is so good & the sauce it comes with makes it so good . Be careful when ordering wings though because the sauce is not free . Our sauces came out to $1.70 . I really love it here and the fact that they have outdoor dining during this pandemic and their staff wears gloves and masks .
No comment

I was there yesterday with my brother it was his birthday. Our waitress named was Melba she was amazing. Her energy was amazing it made us feel right at home. I love the drinks the freshness of the food boy when I tell you me and my brother was shocked best place ever. I highly recommend this place if you ever want to enjoy some burgers and some drinks. But when you get there make sure you say hi to Melba you would love her energy thank you once again Melba thank you to the staff definitely the chef my compliments to the chef as well I never been So Satisfied eating burgers and fries and definitely try those truffle fries amazing I love you guys I can't wait to see you soon thank you for a wonderful experience

Simply put everything was cool except for the half pound burgers we ordered. It's a burger spot and the burgers aren't anything to rave about. I spent $85 for one beer, small milkshake, lg fries (very big basket and tasty) and two basic tasting burgers (create your own burger and another one with thousand island tomato fried onions and cheese) cooked medium well (we asked for medium). Very unimpressed with our burgers and the cost. If you really like burgers (we love them) don't waste your money here.

Loved loved loved this place!! The food, the drinks, the staff, and the seating area were just awesome! Our server Rocco was super nice and really made it a great experience. We had a lot of fun, as it was my fiancé's birthday. We had a Tito's and soda, and then tried the "Summer loving had me" cocktail and it was delicious. Vodka, muddled strawberries, pear liquor, Campari and cranberry juice. I highly recommend trying the waffle dog for a starter. It's basically a corn dog, but instead of cornmeal, it's waffle batter. It comes with a spicy maple flavored mayo dipping sauce that is such a good complement to the waffle and the hotdog. I ordered the chili project dog (wagyu beef chili, diced red onions, and shredded cheese). It's fantastic, but I also tried the frydom fighter dog as well, (bacon wrapped and fried hot dog, crispy onions, royal fry sauce), and it was sooooo good!  The red onion rings were perfectly cooked and delicious. If you haven't already been here, get yourself down there because this place is fire!!!

Stopped in on 8/1 with my wife and 2 of our daughters after going on " The Beast" tour boat. Greeted and seated quickly.  Server was very attentive and gave advice on ordering. 3 of us had different burgers. All were delicious. Fries are great. My wife had a salad, she said it was fresh. They use quality meat and you can taste it. The kids had milk shakes they said were great. My wife and I shared a mixed drink it was well made. If your in Hells Kitchen I highly recommend coming here if you're Hungry you will be glad you did.
Where have you been all my life? Got the King's Standard Burger and onion rings. Perfection!!!!!

Elite...simply elite...I couldn't be happier with my meal. The burger was enormous and I only got the single, almost had to take a nap right in my booth after eating from catching the itis. Can't wait to stop back next time I'm in the big Apple to further explore the menu.

Let me start by saying this place probably has the best burger I have ever had in my life. We were craving a big juicy burger after our run in the park, so we got to googling and this spot kept coming up. I ordered the duke of luxe and it was mouth watering good! I got my burger medium and it was very tender and flavorful, the chipolte mayo sauce and the smoky gouda cheese complimented it perfectly. The half pounder was still a huge burger, I ended up eating it over two meals. We also ordered the sweet potato tots, which were delicious, they were crispy, sweet and salty, all my favorite characteristics. The staff was also really helpful and nice! They offer great indoor and outdoor seating options which is always a plus as well. All in all we had a great time, 10/10 recommend.
Best hotdogs in town. Not sure the names, but they were both delicious. Definitely recommend this place

If you it someone in your party is disabled and needs to be relieved before sitting down avoid this place like the plaque. Was just literally accosted and treated like we had leprosy by their ignorant door man because my husband desperately needed to use the restroom before we could even think of sitting down or doing anything. Even when I was speaking to the "owner" manager, the door guy continued to pipe in. If he worked for me he would be FIRED instantly. Never ever, ever, ever eat here if there is literally nowhere else to go!!!!! The ignorance does not go un noticed.
Great spot near the water for a quick lunch and good drink. Zero complaints.  Felt welcomed and had a phenomenal burger.

Good burgers, nice that they have vegan and vegetarian options so everyone can go and not be left out. Delicious sides too. A little pricy but that's to be expected for the area. Overall good food and defiantly worth the stop if you're in the area!

Terrible experience and  owner Itay!! Didn't let my 9 year old son go to the bathroom, and when I asked why, started screaming at us and saying obscenities. I would think twice before going to this place!!! Never go here!

This may be one of the best burger joints, ever. The Duke of Lux is a perfect blend of meat, cheese, bun, sauce, and everything else that makes a wonderful burger. I can't get enough of it...thank you chef

I know this restaurant since it was on 9ave and 52street. This is my favorite burger place in the area. I keep getting Duke of Lux burger from here. It's really delicious! Please go enjoy and support this local restaurant. Sorry, no pictures today we ate our food before I could think of it :)

Came here for the hotdogs. Each one of our 4 guests got a different hotdog and sides and everything was AMAZING.  The service was good and they do require proof of COVID vaccines to eat indoors. Probably one of the best hot dogs I have ever eaten. I recommend this restaurant most highly.

Hi. Not sure what was going on tonight, but after I placed my order, I was told I would get an email when my order would be ready. I waited over 30 minutes for a burger and sweet potato tator tots. I finally went it to see what was going on and ask about my order and it was already there. The burger was room temperature and I got fries instead of the sweet potato tots I ordered. I was really looking forward to this place, since I heard the burgers were great. This was my first time there and the service could've been friendlier. There was nobody at the front for help directing orders. It was very disappointing!

The Empress burger was delicious with the mango relish. I added some of the crispy fried onion rings inside and it gave it an extra crunchy texture to it. The waiter who handed me the takeout order was very polite.

Tried two different dogs and the onion rings. The dog itself is WONDERFUL, great snap and very high quality. Burrata burger with classic hot dog. Service was incredible and management was above and beyond. One of the best burgers I've ever

Took another trip down the street to try a few more items! The waffle dog, a fat juicy beef hot dog battered in waffle mix, was amazing and paired nicely with the spicy maple aioli dipping sauce. Mac n cheese balls came out perfect: crispy on the outside and full of gooey delicious comfort on the inside. The garlic aioli that came with them was sooo good and went well with the fries as well! We weren't super hungry so went with sliders in lieu of a burger and those too were delicious. It was nice to be able to still sit outside on a warmer day.
Totally impressed. My first time ordering and not the last. Loved the Viva salad - fresh and creative with an incredible dressing. Good packaging too! Will be back...

Went here on a Saturday night after taking a twilight harbor cruise at the nearby dock. The fun atmosphere inside although the music was a little loud. Despite the name, the burgers are made with American Wagyu beef.  I ordered the Kings Standard burger (marinated roasted tomatoes, white cheddar, pickles, cherry pepper mayo). My wife ordered the Go Fish sandwich (Alaskan salmon burger, lettuce, red onions, avocado, tomatoes, pickled ginger, citrus mayo) and we shared an order of battered fries with dipping sauce.  The burger was excellent- perfectly juicy and delicious, although the toppings sometimes overwhelmed the flavor of the Wagyu beef (I'd probably go with the build-your-own option next time with fewer toppings).  My wife enjoyed her fish sandwich as well, although the pickled ginger was aggressive.   The fries were very good as well.  The bar offered a small selection of draft beers but a more extensive menu of cocktails.  The service was friendly and attentive.  I would definitely recommend and return here!

I've came to Kings of Kobe on a Sunday afternoon with a few friends after the NY Giants game. (All happy because the Giants finally won their first home game).  The food was mediocre at best as my order of a burger was done well instead of medium rare. The "Not Good" review is based on the service which was sub-par at most. Part way through, I decided, I wanted pickles with my dry burger. I've ask the bus boy since the waitress was working 5 tables and he said he would put it in the system and inform the waitress. As I waited a few minutes and yet to receive anything, I asked the waitress and she said that she wasn't aware and started to berate me in front of my friends stating that "she is a server and put the order through her and not ask the bus boy. I am your waitress and that why it was never put in. and I should have known to ask her and not the bus boy." The rudeness was uncalled and felt unjust. This put a damper on our meal and we just wanted to leave. Personally, Waste of time and money. 10/10, I would avoid and wouldn't recommend.

Got the duke of lux great tasting burger. This thing had smoked Gouda , caramelized onions, bacon,and chipotle aioli. I had them make it medium which was perfect. Everything together made a perfect marriage of flavors. The gentleman behind the counter was super friendly. Will be back when I'm in NYC. Came back again for second meal had the golden pineapple hot dog the dog has sauerkraut, pineapple relish, shaved cheddar and bacon bits. This was a great dog the flavors explode. The pineapple relish is sweet and spicy. Also had the red onion rings and herb truffle fries which I split with my wife. These were both very good both very crisp and the dipping sauce was excellent. Then finished it off with chocolate royal this was very rich and creamy and a great crunch with the pretzels. The whipped cream was very silky smooth. Friendly service once again.

Came here craving for a good burger, and boy did they deliver! Opted for "Build your own" with chipotle mayo- yummy! Hubby went for truffle mushroom burger- also super satisfied. Portion size is huge (I am a foodie and managed only to finish half + fries).

If I could give this place a 0 star review I would. First of all let's start out with the fact that this location was completely empty and 5pm and on a Thursday that should be an indication of the quality of food here. Second of all the prices are absolutely inflated for the quality of food that you get here. Don't be fooled by the reviews as I'm told by my neighbors that they have on good authority that the majority are actually fake, purchased reviews. Lastly and most importantly was the "manager" Etsi's attitude which you can clearly see reflected in his other responses to reviews, he feels that you are "lucky" to be able to eat at "his" establishment. I was with a party of seven people and as a result of some of the reviews that I saw decided to finally try this location after going on the circle line. One of our party was an eight-year-old boy, this young man does not like to eat cheeseburgers as crazy as it sounds. As a result we went across the street and purchased him a slice of pizza. Well at this point the rest of the party was in the process of placing an order when the manager comes out and says "you can't eat that pizza here" in a very condescending tone. My wife explained that my son doesn't care for hamburgers and respectfully asked if we could stay. At that point he says "I don't care you can't eat that here." I try to appeal to the manager Etai stating  that the two elderly people that we were with were hungry and we'd rather not go to another location and if he would make an exception. He did not. He stated "no please leave go sit in the park and eat the pizza then come back" I don't think that any one wants to be subjected to that type of behavior from a manager, he basically lost out on an approximately $300 check because he didn't want a child to eat a slice of pizza. Hopefully there Is someone with authority at this restaurant that will speak with this manager and help him to understand that sometimes you have to be flexible.

I actually dined in at this restaurant yesterday. I usually take pictures, but I was so hungry lol. I came here with my family after a long day at the museum and boy did the burger not disappoint! I ordered the Duke of Lux burger medium. First, I was surprised at the size of the burger. Second, when I cut the burger in half to eat (since it is huge) it was prepared just right. It was mouthwatering and it melted it your mouth. I didn't order fries with it and I'm glad I didn't because it would have went to waste due to the burger being so filling! I am definitely coming back here. Our waiter was also very friendly. Parties were social distanced as well. The also have a few apparitions within tables. We are deciding on a day next month now to go back! Lol

So I am posting on behalf of my friend because he doesn't have a Yelp account. Ordered the Cheeseburger Royale through Meal Pal and filtered a large meal since he typically doesn't get full quickly. Super friendly staff, trendy but casual seating area (probably seats about 15-20), limited menu so you're not holding up the line haha, and delicious food (good-sized portion too)!  My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey for a burger, but I guess it's understandable because it's all healthy and stuff.  I got the standard burger ($9.95) w the royal flush combo ($5.50 for a drink and fries), which was yummy and filling.  Though this spot wouldn't be my go-to (I'd probably opt for a cheaper spot), I'd def recommend it for a quick bite!

Stopped by after a circle line cruise and had a great burger beer and the waffle dog! Great service and I felt like they were observing reasonable COVID precautions. Definitely would recommend!

My boyfriend and I came to New York during Christmas. Let me say this restaurant was the highlight of our trip. We ordered two burgers and truffle fries. Expensive!! These are some bougie hot dogs. But quality of meat on point. Best hot dog I've had so far. Went here today, and we had the Louis Louis burger, King's Classic hot dog and the Truffle fries.   The burger is serious.   You will need many napkins to finish it, but it's definitely worth it, the Kobe meat has great texture and tastes great.  The hot dog is huge and the toppings are great.  The fries are probably some of my favorite truffle fries I have had, tons of Parmesan.   The spices on them are excellent and they are just the right amount of crunchy on the outside and tender inside.  Overall I would highly recommend checking out Kings of Kobe, and will definitely be returning,

This review is for delivery -- and using the "built-in" Yelp delivery tech as well. Building the delivery menu was easy and the delivery service from Kings of Kobe actually arrived ahead of their scheduled time. I was somewhat leery of things like fries that sometimes do not travel well (in other words, they tend to get soggy) but be it the cold weather or fast service everything came in great shape and tasted awesome. I had the DUKE OF LUX burger (smoked gouda, caramelized onions, applewood smoked bacon, chipotle aioli) and was very happy with it plus the medium rare request actually seemed perfectly performed.

Get the Banh manh! Okay I definitely spelled that wrong but you'll see it on the menu. It's the hot dog with chipotle mayo, cucumbers, and carrots. It's delicious! The service is quick and prices are good. And this is probably the cleanest fast food-esk restaurant in all of Manhattan! I took mine to go, it came out in maybe 7 mins, but they have a small amount of seating inside and the walls open up during summer. There wasn't many people inside but I hope this place stays for a while because the food is delicious! Oh also get the truffle fries. I've been meaning to try the burgers, and the corn, and the Mac n cheese balls, and I guess the entire rest of the menu :)

For me this one of the best burgers that I ever eaten, I went like 6 times with friends and families and the taste and quantity was the same or better, if you want to eat a really good burger this is the place to go.

I'm not sure why this place has 4.5 stars. It is decent, not stellar. The servers are over attentive, making us feel a little rushed. The food was all pretty good, not great.  We tried the mac and cheese balls which were a little bland. We also tried the pastrami sliders. They were good but the pastrami was a little thin. We also had the chili project hotdog. It had too much chili making it difficult to taste anything other than the chili, which wasn't the best chili in the world. And at $11 or $12 it was certainly overpriced. We also got one of the burgers, I forget the name. Maybe king of luxe or something.  It had bacon, gouda, caramelized onions and chipotle mayo. Pretty good burger--cooked as we specified. They would not let us swap the gouda for cheddar which is a little outrageous for a $20+ dollar burger (without fries).  The caramelized onion taste was too strong and overpowered the rest of the ingredients. Milkshakes were top notch. I would not come back here or recommend, but if you stop by you'll probably have a decent experience.
Great flavors but the delivery was late and our food was cold. I expect it would have been much better had it arrived earlier. Disappointed. I would suggest going in person.

Kinda pricey just for a Ban MI hot dog but really good food! Good service! I just fell in on my lunch break and started staring at the menu. Burgers are expensive and maybe when I'm not broke and living my best life, I'll spend $20 on a kobe slab. All in all.. Tasty food! Stop in if you have a few dollars to burn.

The burgers my wife and I ordered were absolutely delicious! Easily the best burgers I've had in a year or two. The fries were also delicious. The desserts however were quite terrible. The cookies are definitely not fresh.. and the cheesecake was not tasty either.
Excellent Burgers.  My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed every bite.  I had a Duke of Lux . My better half had King Louis XIII. .  Perfect birthday dinner for a quarantined couple!
