The lunch special is the way to go I think. Their burgers were delicious and satisfying when you are craving a cheeseburger. However, I do not think the hot dog was worth the price of about $9. Don't get me wrong, it was a good hotdog according to my boyfriend but he also agrees that it's probably worth around $6. However, if you are in the mood, you can certainly get the hot dog (and I suppose since the location is Hell's Kitchen, the prices would be higher due to rent as well). But I fell in love with their fries. Their fries are delicious. 10/10 would recommend their fries!
Great burgers, great beer, chill atmosphere with games on (TVs easy to see from the dining area). We have also ordered takeout from here many times. Yum!!!

I love this place! originally came in to avoid the cold on new years, ended up finding a new favourite place to eat. the vegan burger is to die for, the Mac and cheese balls aren't greasy or oily, the sweet potato fries are mouth watering and perfect in every way.
No comment

I visited this location on 12/24/17. The cashier was helpful in suggestions she made . I ended up going the route of building my own burger . The food was good but not good enough for the price ! $25 for a burger and fries is a bit much . They charge for every topping you add on the BYOB do keep that in mind .
No comment

Had a fantastic lunch! Their chili is the best I've ever had. Sweet potato tater tots were amazing. Very chill vibe, and the service was great. It's exterior is unassuming at first but very warm on the inside.
Friendly staff with tasty food. It a small place with great music. I came here last week but I forgot to post my review; If you looking for a  awesome burger with a unique twist look no further.
No comment

We stayed at an Airbnb right around the corner and when I searched for a NYC hotdog place, this was the first result that showed up on Yelp. So my wife and I decided to give it a shot. And I'm sure glad we did! Not your average hot dog, these guys have some really wild and creative flavors. I got the Monarque BBQ hot dog, which came recommended from the employee, and it was delicious. We also got the truffle fries, also amazing, and the Notorious P.I.B., which was just ok. My wife liked it, but I was a little underwhelmed, and the dog inside seemed not so hot. Other than that, this place is awesome! The staff was very friendly and attentive. Definitely would come back again and have some more! I recommend.

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME.. love this spot.. i joined the Service called mealpal and saw this on the list and decided to try it out .. wow Was AWESOME loved it.. i ate the standard burger with fries. the portion is great and the fries are delicious as well. if you are in the  area of Hells Kitchen go here! its great! i will have to try the other dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment
First time here and already I'm impress by the service and cleanest of this place. Good tasty burgers and fries.

I'm pretty surprised at how great the reviews are for Kings of Kobe so far. I ordered the sweet potato tots and King's Standard with bacon and honestly can't say I enjoyed any of it except the pickles on the burger. The tots were fine but not great, and while the pickles were awesome, that's not really saying much about a burger joint. Of all the places to grab food from in Hell's Kitchen, I would not recommend making a trip out here, unfortunately. The bun was toasted in an awkward way so that the corners got hard while the center was still squishy, and the sheer flavor of the burger meat so off that after a few bites I had to come to terms with the fact that this meal wasn't going to get any better. Perhaps the hotdogs are better, but I don't think I'll be giving Kings of Kobe another try to make that judgement call.
No comment
No comment
I never write Yelp reviews. Like EVER. But this burger was so damn good omg! Totally worth it. I got the Louis XIII and it was everything. Please do yourself the favor and eat here!

Really good burgers!! A small place with limited seating and a little pricey for burger / hot dog type food (but, it's Manhattan...). The food was excellent though. If you plan to eat there, you can make a reservation for seating on open table. Even though it's walk up counter ordering, if you want a seat, may be good to reserve a spot, especially if with a group. Serves wine, beer, and milk shakes among other beverages. Sweet potato tots were good but enjoyed the regular fries better. I would return!

The burgers both me and my friend got were very good, they were also happy to put my bun less burger on a salad. We loved the mac and cheese bites, those were definitely our favourite at Kings of Kobe and their fries had a good crisp crunchy bite to them too. Overall a good place for a burger and some fried appies.

This was our first time here. The shop was clean, organized and had a nice mix of Christmas music playing in the background. They were kind enough to let me use the bathroom in the back, which was also super clean. It's a small shop but man are the burgers delicious, the fries are super good too! Service was top notch. We loved our lunch!

I got the duke of lux burger and battered fries. The burger was huge and delicious, however, undercooked for my liking. I asked for medium well and it was very, very pink inside. Closer to medium/medium rare. As long as blood isn't pouring out though, I can still eat it. I'm saving the other half for lunch tomorrow and already can't wait. I also ordered the battered fries as a side. Man, for $4.50 this was the smallest portion of fries ever. They were so good though. Expensive but worth a try.
No comment

The hubby saw this place on his way to meet me at a pizza shop and convinced me to give it a try-so happy we did!  I got the classic dog and he the Duke of lux burger.  We split the batter fries and the chocolate shake.  All were great. The dog's doctor mustard had enough of a kick that it will clear up your sinus (I do wish it had ketchup), the hubby loved the burger said it was juicy with great flavors but he wishes it was bigger (esp for a 13 dollar price tag). The shake was delicious with real ice cream and the batter fries were probably the best I have had in years.  Great find!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Kings of Kobe is a new burger restaurant in Hell's Kitchen. It offers hamburgers as well as hot dogs, snacks, drinks, sides and sweets. The hot dogs as well as the burgers are garnished with various condiments. It is a small space, around 10 tables and when your food is ready it willl be brought to you where you are seated. I got the Duke of Lux burger medium well which came with smoked gouda, caramelized onions, bacon and chipotle aoili. It was delicious. The staff was very accommodating and despite their burger and hot dog menu, where is also a vegan option [a three bean and roasted vegetable burger which comes with roasted tomato, baby arugula and vegan herb mayo.] Drinks include milk shakes, fountain drinks, fizzy teas, coffee and tea, beer and wine. Desserts include chocolate royal [a chocolate pudding] a banana pudding and ice cream. I would recommend and return.

I've been trying burgers and onion rings in NYC for over a year and this is the first time I fell in love with the food!! I ordered the Duke of Lux burger, and it was AMAZING!!! The onion rings were amazing too! P.s.: you can probably get away with ordering the smaller versions, as they are really big (even the onion rings to share, the smaller one was perfect). Thank you for this great experience!!

Could be the best burger I've ever had. My husband and I went here for lunch and stuffed ourselves stupid. He tried the King's Standard, and I had the Duke of Lux. They were both huge, outstanding, perfectly cooked burgers. As for sides, the onion rings were perfection--perfectly crispy with a delicious dipping sauce. And the truffle fries were just as good. We tried to do dessert, and they were so yummy, but we were so full from the burgers we couldn't finish. Loved the Cinnamon Toast Crunch-banana pudding combo! The desserts were definitely big enough to share. They recently added breakfast to their offerings, and I'm hoping we'll get to try that French toast before we leave the city. Make sure to stop in if you're in Hell's Kitchen. You won't regret it!
This is a great place for hotdogs! We tried the chili project and banh mine. Both tasted extremely good.
No comment

This is a nice alternative when all the other shops in the area is jammed packed on a Saturday night at 6pm. I ordered the regular hot dog and it was loaded with sauerkraut, onion and mustard. It was good but I could have gone with less because it was a little overwhelming. I'd come back for a quick bite and also to try the fries and waffle dog.

I was looking for a great burger in the area and came across this spot on Yelp. Now I will say that this place is pricey considering that it is takeout. You will be spending over $20 if you get a burger, fries and a drink. Typically anything over dollar amount I'd like to be served but this place is pretty good so I can make the exception. They do offer a lunch special during the week which is probably your best bet to initially try this place. Overall its a good spot, cant complain if you're looking for a good fresh burger!

I will start off by saying I was pretty disappointed with my burger, it wasn't what I was expecting after hearing such great things about it. It wasn't bad but it was nothing out of the ordinary. It was pretty average. The patty also lacked flavor (a lot). I did however enjoy the fries, they were very crunchy, even though they were in desperate need of salt. I will say that the waiter was very nice and helpful so I appreciate that. In all just an over priced average burger.

Two thumbs up for Kings of Kobe. Menu, location, staff and ambiance are all the reasons why I love this place. I couldn't decided what to order, but I am so happy that I had Louis Louis Burger, it was absolutely amazing. Staff ensured every thing was alright. I certainly recommend this place!
No comment

Best burgers in HK. I know that's a big statement but it's a fact - build your own perfect burger or choose from their menu's appetizing selection. Great options for sides and reasonable prices. Definitely worth checking out!

A great spot to get a counter-service burger...well you order the burger at the counter and they bring it to you so kind of a hybrid? Anyway, my burger was cooked to a perfect medium and was juicy but not greasy. I ate the whole 8 ounce burger and didn't feel gross. The quality of meat was very good and the whole thing felt very much worth the cost. The menu isn't extensive but the choices are almost endless with the build your own burger options. The fries are the only issue which is why I would say a 4.5 - the burger was so good but the fries were lacking. Very crispy but not salted at all. I recommend getting one of their sauces on the side which was an extra $1.00 but added the flavor I was missing. All in all a great place! Definitely going to go back for a hot dog because my husband loved his.

This place has been picking up traction on Instagram promoted by the local food bloggers pretty fast. But the actual experience is nothing that the pics will do its justice. Their patties are delicious. Cooked to perfection based on your preference. I got the Queen Rules burger and it was absolutely amazing. Their sweet tater tots are great. The service is great and rather quick. Highly recommend it.
No comment
Just a great dog! These are natural casing, butcher-style dogs which are amazingly complemented by the topping combinations. Great flavor from the dog itself. Juicy.

I was excited to come here since I've read great things about this place. My friend and I came here because we were craving a satisfying burger. When we got there we were greeted by the really friendly guy at the counter. We ordered the King's Standard Burger and were disappointed. I wasn't expecting nothing extraordinary since it was a standard, but I was hoping to at least enjoy it. It just lacked flavor. We also got fries. They were really crunchy which I loved, but something I would never crave.

Came across this place after leaving holey cream down the block. Decided to give it try. I ordered the mac and cheese balls and waffle dog. Mac and cheese was nice an cheesy like it should be. Waffle dog was a decent size and taste pretty good. The real winner of both these apps were the sauces they came with. Along with the friendly staff i think this place will do alright.

The $25.09 meal was far beyond average. The delivery guy was early and the food was very hot and fresh. The fries were still crisp and only needed additional salt to meet my salt level. And the 1/2 pound of beef was a perfect "medium rare!" Absolutely Perfect!  I will definitely be ordering from King of Kobe again. If there is a negative, it is that every selection comes with an extra charge. Even chopped red onions came with an 82 cent charge (although the amount of red onions included was huge and certainly not stingy). I'm thinking a giant strawberry milk shake or malt with Haagen Dax and Truffle Fries would be nice if I work extra hard.
No comment
No comment

I should have posted a review sooner as I have eaten here several times and always the food and service has been fantastic.   My favorite burgers are either The Urban Picnic or Louis X111 along with an order of truffle fries and an IPA beer.  Perfect combinations.  Highly recommend this restaurant for the best burgers in NYC.
No comment

I want to thank Asia first for being so accommodating, she was very Courteous and Patient as we asked many questions and asked to take pictures. The Food was very good and the service only served to enhance our experience. The decor is very midtown in a good way. We really enjoyed our time at Kings of Kobe :)
No comment

Came here for July 4th for a good burger. I got the salmon burger which was really amazing. I was expecting lots of filler and it was pure salmon, no filler as per the owner. In a potato bun (I could live without) I only ate half the bun, it had arugula, tomato and sliced ginger with avocado cream (got it on the side) the cream was so good but very spicy. My husband built his med rare burger with sautéed onions, tomato and avocado cream. He loved it and said the beef was some of the best he's eaten. We got the sweet potato tots as our side and they were delicious with or without the sweet and spicy sauce that came with them. Small place, but so great. Owner is friendly and thanks you as you leave. We'll be back for sure!!

Super Delish.  The burgers are not average burgers but exciting, flavor bursting, designer ones with terrific sauces and exciting combinations. Also, they are quality and BIG. I've ordered many times now. Rolls are toasted, burgers are layered with flavor. Vegan burger and it's sauce of vegan mayo and tomato is off the hook..hits the spot.  If you love fries.. they are the BEST around.. super texture people!  If you don't love fries (I am typically NOT a huge fries guy)... but i LOVE these.. TRUFFLE ones KILL it.. so good. Cocktails also top notch..not bistro standard ones... but fresh, well crafted.  Cool decor / music.  Gleaming, Spotless clean including restrooms. Huge outdoor space now. No complaints whatsoever.. One of best, cool, casual places on West side now..and near river which is nice.

One of the best burgers I have ever had!!! I don't remember the name of the exact burger, but it had a coleslaw and some apple slices (very thin slices, and not a lot so it's not over powering) IT WAS BOMB. Our last meal in NYC, and shout out to ADRIAN for being the nicest person we ever met in NYC lol considering we got there 30 min prior to closing.

Thanks for letting us order at 10:55pm! And the rush from Brooklyn to King's of Kobe was well worth it! The beef is just different and way better than any of the burger place I have been thus far. I guess this is the magic of wagyu beef! We ordered King's Standard and Duke of Lux (both 8 oz.) and we are very satisfied with everything that comes along with these two burgers. Juicy. Freshness. I can definitely see why other Yelpers like this place so much! I'll definitely come back when I visit NYC next time!
Wagyu burgers and hot dogs customizable almost any way you want. Truffle fries and red onion rings.
Amazing burgers and fries - I love coming here for lunch through MealPal. Give it a try!

This was probably the best burger that I've ever had. Came here on an early Wednesday night and it was empty, but seems like they get a lot of take out orders. I ordered the lux burger, which comes with bacon, caramelized onions and chipotle mayo. I got the half pound, which was more than enough for one person. I mean there was a ton of filling! I also got the onion rings and truffle fries which were just as good. There's happy hour until 6:30 so $4 beers were a plus. I'm definitely coming back here again. The food is five stars but I gave this place 4 because there is no bathroom. You have to ask the cashier and they'll lead you to the back where the employee restroom is.

First off the service here was incredible, the guy behind the counter was super nice and helpful with our order and man it was delicious! I had the egg and spinach burger with onion rings and monarqe? Dog and seriously it was delicious.  You could really tell the difference in the beef everything combined well and the sauce they give you with the onion rings really kicks it up a notch! My girlfriend also ordered the mac and cheese balls and had the peach tea (which is sparkling) and everything was just delicious.  Will definitely be back!

This place is incredible. Words cannot describe how good the burgers are. The quality is way above a store front burger joint. The same can be said for the fries. If you're ever in the upper west side of NYC, get a burger at this place. Your welcome!!!

This place is very clean/new, the food is good, and it's not too pricey.  The interior is fancier than I expected after reading the mostly-burger menu.  Not very crowded yet either - I'm not sure how many people realize it's here, since it's on the side of a residential spot by west side highway.  I've tried the salmon burger and bean burger, but my friends liked the meat burgers too.  The fries are nice and batter-y.  Staff has been nice.
No comment
No comment

This has to be the best burger and fries I've ever had. It's such an unassuming place but damn the burger was perfectly seasoned and cooked, the toppings all tasted homemade and perfectly complimented the burger. The bun was even soft and flavorful and the perfect consistency so the burger didn't slide off. It was cooked exactly how I asked, too. The fries were crispy and delicious. Honestly can't say enough good things about the food here! Prices are a little high but totally worth it for quality. As soon as you eat here you'll know why!

Just like most people I read the reviews and decided to try this place. Omg, when I walked in I expected to be hit by the scent of grilled meat, but instead was hit with a strong scent of musk. The place smelled really bad. In addition to this the food wasn't that good. My husband and I spent $53 on 2 waters, 2 burgers, and 2 fries. I wasted my entire meal because it just wasn't good. And if this wasn't annoying enough, their AC wasn't working so we were burning up. I'm sorry but I wont be visiting this place again and I advise you to do the same.

Not new to trying new restaurants without knowing a little about them but I can tell you I will be back! Great staff! And GREAT GREAT BURGERS!!! I would definitely recommend this place to many of my co-workers!!!!
No comment

A clean, nicely designed spot, with exceptionally helpful and friendly staff; shout out to Larry! A bit on the pricey side but worth it! I ordered the Duke of Lux with truffle fries, my burger was cooked perfectly and the truffle fries were AMAZING.  Great place to stop by in Hell's kitchen if you like craft burgers.

Boyfriend and I decided to visit this place after seeing a Facebook video featuring it + he was craving a burger and this place was pretty phenomenal all around! The shop itself is quite small but was not packed at all when we came in. It's interior is clean and modern, and the girl taking our order was super nice especially since we took 5ever to order. We got one hot dog ($9.25), one burger combo ($14-$15, any burger and comes with side of fries and cup of soda), and a side of sweet potato tots. Both the hot dog and the burger were delicious, and the fries were BOMBBB I definitely could not stop. I'm not a big sweet potato person but the tots were also very good (though I wish a little crispier!) Their burgers come with very interesting sauces, like a cherry pepper aioli that my boyfriend loved. The food came out quickly and the quality was on point. We will definitely be back when back in NY!

Great dogs for sure. Best I have tried in multiple NYC trips. In fact, this will be a stop for me every time in the future. I had the Kings Classic (sauerkraut, onions, mustard) and my wife needed some spice (being from Mexico) so she went with the Banh Mine (onions, cilantro, sriracha mayo, cucumber/carrots...like a Vietnamese style) and she loved it. Thanks again Collin!
Amazing burger. One of the best in New York City and I  live here for 3 years. I have been ordering from this place to go more than 10x. Louis Louis is my go to. Try it! Great fries!
Awesome burgers, they really are different from everything I've tried before. Quite expensive but I would say it's worth it.

Wasn't hungry enough for a Kobe burger but got the Mac & Cheese ball and fries. Though the fries weren't the "best" I've ever had, they were light and crunchy. And on the servers recommend I had the Mac & Cheese balls and they were super crunchy and tasty. Totally worth it for the Mac & Cheese balls alone.

Found this place through mealpal and must say I was really impressed. I got the monarque dog with fries and every bite of the hotdog was filled with creamy slaw, hotdog, pickles, bacon and other goodness. The fries were super crispy, I would come back for the fries alone!
I had Urban Picnic with onion rings and Mexican coke. My burger was cooked perfectly and the onion rings were delicious!! Definitely recommend.
Insanely good burger and large portion of actually Good French fries. Friendly service. Small dining area with limited seating, but I had no problem finding a seat.
REALLY good burgers, chili, and onion rings. We found it on Yelp and weren't disappointed! Yum!
Place is small, seats 16 max, casual vibe. Had fast, friendly service. I had the Queen burger,  not too spicy, delicious. Would go back.

This was hands down the best hamburger I have ever had!! I had the Duke of Lux and it was cooked perfectly. My husband ordered the chili project dog and said it was the best hot dog. The Parmesan truffle fries are delicious as well! I would highly recommend this restaurant. The price point is better than I expected for such high quality products!
The best hamburguer ever!! We ate the Kings, perfect combination of flavors!! A must to go when visiting Manhattan!!

Great food and service.  BF and I came in the middle of the night before closing and were able to get food on the go for second dinner.  I got the vegetarian option - scrambled eggs, cheese on branded sweet Hawaiian buns.  The eggs were cooked perfectly.  I did not need this meal, but I ate the whole thing.  Too good to be true.
Great service, food, and place! Would definitely recommend it! They have good burgers, hot dogs, and milkshakes.

This place was AMAZING! From the customer service to the food and then prices!! We came in and was welcomed very nicely by the employees. We were new to the place and they never hesitated to help with questions and suggestions of their menu! The food was delicious! Definitely one for the books when we return!
The King's Standard is very good! Cooked perfect as requested. I would recommend it as your first order, but be aware of the pepper mayo, it is quite spicy.

Best burger I've ever sunk my teeth into. I got the duke of lux. The caramelized onions were so sweet and juicy and would have totally made up for a dry burger if that were the case, but it wasn't. The burger was so juicy and flavorful and was still the standout star, even under all the toppings. You will not go wrong with anything you pick.
Great chili dogs. On the high side in price but well worth it. Definitely would go back.
I loved the burgers from here and the staff is nice and attentive. THEIR PLAYLIST WAS MY FAVORITE. the whole place radiates good vibes n good food
No comment
YUM. The iced tea is really good, and my burger was delicious, tried to make room for a hotdog but it was all way too filling.

Best Hot Dogs and Burgers in NYC... The service was great and the Mac and Cheese Balls are orgasmic I'm loving the sauces and the milk shakes. It is worth the trip but you can also get delivery. The menu is creative and delicious

I read a lot of good reviews from this place from yelp that's why me, my husband and my friend went here. It wasn't too busy, place is small, then the cashier is also the server. One table was reserved and the counters are available. I saw only one person also working inside the kitchen. As we order the food, the guy was so RUDE! We were waiting for the food then the tables were free because guests finished eating. I sit on one, he said, I couldn't, I can only sit on the counter because it is reserved. Then the two american groups who were next to us, they sat on there and he didn't say anything. Btw, we were Asian. When the order came, our orderes, were mixed up, my husband and my friend ordered med-well, received, med rare and well done. I ordered a med-rare and received a med well. We let that slide, but the time we asked for water, he seemed so mad at us and was so RUDE! Then when the other group asked, he was smiling and greeting them. We were feeling so messed up because it felt like he was being racist to us. I don't recommend this place at all. Thinking it has a 4.5 score in yelp, then being treated and having that experience, IT IS A BIG NO! Don't go to this place! Horrible!

This place is amazing! It was a fall back when we tried to get into Shake Shack at lunch time. We walked right in and there was no wait. Only open 3 weeks and I fear it will be the last time we get to walk in and not wait.  The burger with the cherry pepper aioli was unbelievable. Got the onion rings which might be the best I ever had. We will be going back many times to try all the other tasty choices on the menu.

Ordered the Duke of Lux burger and it was incredible! The fries were delicious but a bit of a tease as the burger was very filling and didn't leave much space for fries. Staff was also very friendly and accommodating.

I was in NY for the week with my family for my mothers 60th bday. We were staying a block away from this place and I found it on google. I was searching for a good hot dog as I was told the hot dog vendors were the spot to get them - which is such bullshit! This place had good reviews so I brought my family to it. Got there and knew I was in the right spot. The food was a smash! We tried 3 burgers and hot dogs between the 6 of us and the fries and onion rings. A MUST GO!! Ended up meeting both owners and they were awesome! Do not eat the street meet - it's a waste of money and it's nasty. Think of where they wash their hands and how long that meats been on the cart. Do yourself a favour!

Had looked this restaurant up on Instagram and; needless to say, I had high expectations. Service was friendly and prompt. Food came out piping hot and tasted incredible. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family. Will be returning on our next trip!
Fantastic burger and great service. I got the first burger on the menu and it was fantastic . The truffle fries were nail as wel
We were there on vacation and the burgers were awesome. Everyone was super nice there!!! Would recommend eating here.

Very nice and clean. I loved the look of the inside very good to take pictures in. The food was very good & the workers were very sweet. They played good music. The food came out pretty fast. I recommend the onion rings super good. If you are looking for a place with delicious food and is very aesthetic this is the place for you!
Decent burger that hits the spot,but not sure ill be back.... the simple fact is there are better burgers out there.

Great hot dogs, really good burgers. Ordered a late night delivery and there was no indication of having slacked off or sacrificed craftsmanship. The Notorious P.I.G was a real treat! Will definitely be dropping in to this place to give the dine-in experience a try.
Seriously GREAT burgers!  Perfect sides, shakes and beer . Awesome stop after a full day of touristy stuff in NYC!! We will definitely be back before we head home

Burgers are good and french fries are good. However, it really pissed me off that they ask you to tip with the boxes options (20-25-30%) even before you get the service, and when I have to go to the register to order. Those tip boxes options are a rip off and really pissed me off. Also, they offer drinks and sauces in plastic containers, plastic straw and all that crap. Common really? haven't you guys catch up on the news? We are screwing up this world with the plastic residues ! Also really expensive, order for two with drinks and only one french fries was 60 dollars, geeeeez.  But for now guys, really prioritize the plastic issue!! You can do better for the environment!

I wish my burger resembled the photos.  It tasted almost stewed.  No char or grill marks.  Probably precooked and warmed in micro.  Bun was not grilled either.  Very disappointing.  Update...as I was leaving the owner came by and gave me a refund for my burger and was genuinely sorry that I was disappointed..  impressive!!
No comment
Great burger, decent price. Ordered ahead for pick up and it was ready to go

I have never been compelled to write a Yelp review before until now. Kings of Kobe is by far one of the best burgers in NYC. I order from there on seamless all the time and the food delivered is always hot, picture perfect and fast. The burgers are juicy and really tasty, the beer battered fries are perfectly crispy and the hot dogs are out of this world. I have even heard the salad is pretty good too. I have been to plenty of those fancy Manhattan burger spots, but I must say by far Kings of Kobe is the best!

I wanted to try this new burger joint based on the 4.5 reviews. However, I was disappointed. The staff was nice and the interior is clean. Burger was good but the patty didn't really taste like anything. The sauce and topping on the King's standard overpowered the hint of "wagyu" flavor. The fries Mac and cheese balls were okay. They're not good or bad .... I would come back to try the hot dog but not dying to

Used Uber eats for delivery, and despite the cold weather food was still warm and everything was packed perfectly for delivery. My boyfriend built his owns burger and thought it was delicious. I got the waffle dog, loved it. The maple chipotle sauce was AMAZING. Fries were delicious too.
Love this place!!!! I'm a vegetarian and the veggie burger is amazing! And they have a ton of great side dishes too!  If you're in midtown this is a must-go place!

I been here a few times. I bragged a little that it was pretty decent. Brought my girl friend and i was totally embarrassed. They told me they cant substitute bbq sauce for a different sauce. LAME! don't let you pride get in the way of what the customer wants! That is totally childish, unless ur burgers are pre-made with the sauce already on them. Either way, TOTALLY LAME. She tells me this one sounds really good except for the bbq sauce. what other sauces do they have? I reassured her, i'm sure they can take off the sauce. Extra charge for different sauce? I chuckled at first, i said come on just switch the sauce lol come on thats ridiculous. they said NO with no remorse. If i want the different sauce they can give me a tiny cup of sauce for extra money! I still laugh about it today and every time i pass buy it with someone i let them know exactly what they did to us there that day. You have became a joke on the block, congratulations! I hope in the future you will be replaced by someone that can throw mayo on a burger.
I really liked the Duke of Lux burger I got, but would not recommend the Manhattanite hot dog. Flavors didn't jive together. This place is definitely pricey for technically still being fast food.

Amazing place! Upscale selection of hot dogs and hamburgers in amazing buns. Awesome sides . Food is fresh and beautifully presented. Staff is super friendly and cool. The banh mine hotdog is to die for. Oh and try the mac and cheese balls and the Hagen Dazs milkshakes....
No comment
The waffle dog and onion rings were a hit for us!! Cool little joint in Hell's Kitchen!
I am very picky about burgers but this burger was on point so juicy I savored every bite

So I was looking for a nice burger joint.  The menu will lower you in.  However. The burger in my opinion was mediocre.  The price was decent because the burger was filling. However, I'm just saying 25.00 for burger fries. Maybe I was paying for the kobe. ‍

Came here on a Saturday night and the food really hit the spot. We got the bahn mine and classic and shared mac and cheese balls. It was all delicious and great quality.  The vibe made you feel like you were eating something fresh and never greasy. Would come here again since we live around the corner.

Very tasty. Ordered "The Queens Rules" burger cooked medium along with some fries. The burger was cooked correctly with interesting, flavorful toppings. The fries were fresh and crispy. Would eat here again.
No comment
Meh...Had one of the burgers today at lunch. Oversized doughy bun, somewhat smallish burger, wasn't really impressed. Will go back again though and get one of the hot dogs as they looked much better.
Incorrectly cooked two of our orders. Truffles fries are overwhelmingly perfumed with trifle oil. Meat was so-so in terms of quality. Loud and hot. Not recommended as a place to eat with friends

My family was craving a good burger and Kings of Kobe came through!  Our burger with carmelized onions was absolutely delicious.  The sweet potato fries were cooked to perfection.  The onion rings looked great but we were too full to try them. Can't wait to go back again
No comment
No comment
Simply excellent ! Def worth a stop for a great burger before a show. Sweet potato Tater tots are a must!
Service FINE and food was spot on - we walked for blocks this Friday night and couldn't be happier to discover this hole in the wall
No comment

Found this place on Yelp.  I ordered the Duke of Lux and a side of fries.  The burger was really, really good!  If you're a burger aficionado, I recommend giving it a shot.  Next time I'm in the City I'll come back and try the Kings Standard!

My fiance ordered us burgers and sweet potato fries via seamless (i think!) last night and IT WAS SO GOOD. burgers sometimes don't travel well but they were seriously so yummy, cooked to perfection and juicy and cheesy. I want it again tonight. Bareburger is where I usually go for a quick burger but I think I found my new spot!!!!!!

This was a really delicious dog. The King's Classic was a plump beefy dog (had a great snap when you bite in it too!) with a perfect heaping topping of tangy sauerkraut, sweet red onion marmalade and a sharp spicy yellow mustard (ready to make your nose run) all cuddle up on a nice fluffy bun. The side of battered fries were great too! They were served up in a generous helping and came out hot and crispy, just the way you'd want. I would definitely stop by again for another dog, burger, or milkshake.

ok seriously?  who came up with this amazing idea?  first, the fries not greasy and have a crunch that makes you crave more.  the chili project is a masterpiece, great dog and chili pouring over the bun.  the queen rules says it all.  this burger would make a vegan eat meat.  delicious choice for a rockin lunch!!
Incredible burger in hell's kitchen. The queen of lux was excellent the go fish was delicious (and light) and fries were great!
This place is awesome. Definitely the best spot to get a ridiculous delicious burger in midtown! And the red onion rings are my favorite side to get when i grab a burger.
I loved this place so much because when the burgers came out they were not very greasy at all! :). The battered fries were very good as well.  I definitely recommend this place a lot! :)
Excellent food, service and music. I tried the Duke of Deluxe and was awesome. Definitely I recommend this place.

Yum! I had the Queen's Rule and my son had a make your own burger. The Queen's Rule was a perfect mix of favors and the meat was truly fantastic. We also got the fries and onion rings. Both were hot and delicious!  The burgers were so big though we didn't finish our sides.

I have been living in New York for three years and have been able to most burgers in the city. Once I tried the Duke Of Lux, whenever I crave a burger, I go to Kings of Kobe. The patty is delicious, great flavor, juicy and always perfectly cooked. The caramelized onions and gouda cheese topped with bacon is a great add on. The bread is perfect, love the flavor and texture. Definitely my favorite!!! And the truffle fries are crisp and great flavor, but my favorite are the onion rings!!!
Best food we had while in NYC! We ordered delivery  super late and it came right on time & hot!! Really delicious- highly recommend!!!!

Solid burger.  Impressive offerings for burgers and toppings. Enjoyed the Mac and cheese balls but don't need them ever time.  Got the parmesan fries, next time I will go with the regular ones. The fries were really good but to much spices on them.  Overall good burger place and I look forward to trying some more of the Buger offerings they have.

First time trying this place. I had their standard burger and the waffle dog. I love their waffle batter as well as the maple mayo that comes with it. Overall a very good mix. Their burgers are a good portion, not cheap at all and so delicious. Plus I ordered for delivery and the food came quickly and still hot. Cant wait to see what their dine in experience is like

It was aiight, the burgers were lacking flavor. I thought the prosciutto was thin sliced, but it was too thick to bite with the burger and came out as one big chunk. I ordered the burger medium- rare and it was definitely undercooked. Won't be going back.
Had an Excellent experience.  The Duke of Lux burger was exceptional. The Mac and cheese balls are to die for.  Red onion rings are a good choice too.
This place is amazing. The burgers are delicious and the fries are SO GOOD. This place will be my new go to burger spot.
Wow!!! The Duke of Lux burger is delicious. Great customer service quick delivery. I just found my new favorite burger joint.
Just opened but already the best burger in the neighborhood also great sweet potato tots!!
Had the burger with egg and spinach amazing and french fries and mac and chesse ball were also amazing . The food made up for fact there no restroom and little pricey but definely worth it.
Awesome hotdogs!  We ordered the Golden Pineapple and the Empire City (basically a BLT hotdog). Both were great.  Hotdog was really flavorful.  Will be back to try the others!
Really good food. Burger was delicious and mac & cheese balls were to die for. I highly recommend it and will go again
Great burgers and hot dogs. I bring my family here and they love it. Must get the truffle fries too!

Definitely one of the best burger places in Manhattan.  They have a great selection of burgers/hot dogs and a relatively inexpensive menu considering what you're getting.  The key though is the quality of their meat, which is possibly the best burger quality I've had.  I try to mix it into the lunch schedule a couple times every month.

Ordered their delivery from the breakfast menu this morning for the first time. It was mind-blowingly good. This coming from a guy who has lived in hell's kitchen for years and who has tried every burger and seamless place in the neighborhood. I actually am ordering a second burger as I write this review! Keep up the good work!

DUH-licious! A must visit, especially if you are in the area. I ordered the King's Standard, the macaroni salad, and the Seattle wine. Fresh ingredients, good-sized portions. The mac sal was off the chain. Loved the ambiance, friendly owner/staff, good tunes, great vibes. Don't hold yourself back - go get some KOK today!
No comment

I was meeting some friends in the area for drinks, so I popped into Kings of Kobe for a quick bite to eat.  Wow, am I glad I did.  Thinking I'd just snack on something, I ended up having the mac and cheese balls, which were out of this world and the dip was amazing.  I then had the Queen Rules burger, it was so flavorful and delicious and cooked perfectly.  I was having a sweet craving, so I got a milkshake which was probably the best milkshake I have ever had.  I don't know how they do it, but I will definitely be back to try the hot dogs and other things on the menu!
Outstanding fast and very friendly service, clean and cool interior, and absolutely awesome, big hot dogs. Monarque has some really great flavors with good crispy bacon.

Got a King's standard burger and battered fries. Asked for the burger to be medium, it came medium rare, but I don't mind the difference. The burger was still good, though there were a lot of flavours going on, so I couldn't taste the Wagyu difference. Fries were great, no need for ketchup.

I stopped in on a Monday afternoon and was greeted warmly by the nice gentlemen behind the counter. He was very helpful suggesting items. My friend and I both decided on the Duke of Lux, which was DELIGHTFUL. In addition to that we had the onion rings and the sweet potato tots. The spicy maple aioli that came with the tots was ridiculously delicious. After we finished our meals and mexican coke we sat and chatted for so long that we realized we'd inadvertently saved room for dessert. Holy Hell! The chocolate royal was life changing. I can't wait to go back to try a hot dog and a few of the the burgers... although, you'll be hard pressed to find me bypassing the dipping sauce for the tots or changing up my dessert order. Thanks Kings of Kobe, welcome to the neighborhood!!

Great new spot in the area .stopped by with some work colleague's and we loved it.I tried the Louis Louis burger along with the mac and cheese balls and sweet potato tots .the wagyu kobe beef used for my burger was great being my 1st time trying it. Definitely worth trying out.

I went here for the first time on Friday night. It was GREAT! I was really impressed with the extensive menu given it's a hot dog/hamburger joint! Although it only has a few tables, the vibe inside is so cool. MOD and trendy but not stuffy. Although I didn't try one of the mainstay burgers on this trip :-( everything else I had was really good. Can't wait to go back!!!

I didn't know a hot dog can be so good. Wow! Couldn't decide between the hot dogs and the burgers so we ended up getting the Manhattanite and shared a Louis Louis burger with sweet potato tots. Amazing and amazing. Super fun place to either dine in or take out. Will be back for more.

i had delivery but their lunch special hot dog, fries, and a drink. it was pretty yummy their fries were sooo tastyyyy! they did forget my drink and i had to call them and she was sweet enough to have them redeliver it since they forgot. i am looking forward to getting their tots next time. the hot dog was very filling- basically everything i want in a hotdog haha i wanted a simple and filling lunch. they had sauerkraut, pickles, onions? mustard. ketchup on the side for you. though a bit larger in size , but still the classic hot dog that really satisfies the craving- still enjoyable and not overwhelming. the fries i'm not sure what seasoning it was maybe a bit of cajun? but regardless yummy in my tummy. it seemed to be a bit battered, which i actually really liked. i kind of wish they gave more fries haha but the portion for me was just right; haha it was yummy - my hearts greedy for yummy fries.
Excellent night Great service Atmosphere was elegant lots of fun Food and drinks were great
No comment

Came across this restaurant with my colleagues. Surprisingly great! The ambiance was fantastic they have a live music, exquisite menu/ food and impressive cocktails. The service was equally great.  Make sure to make reservations because they are busy. Can't wait to comeback here. I do hope they open for brunch soon, I heard the food was awesome.

What can I say but only this is a true jazz restaurant/lounge and one of the best. Great menu, but what an amazing cocktail menu... pages & pages of superb mixologies. Tonight we had the pleasure to be in the presence of the one and only Izze Stein... what an amazing jazz vocalist with fantastic range and pitch and a voice as soft as silk. Add the live music with the food and cocktail menu and you are heaven on earth... just love the intimate vibe here and great customer service. Truly old New York. Highly recommend taking your love one to dinner here and let the magic begin. Thank you Fine & Rare for a fabulous night! Shout out to Nash, great knowledgeable and professional waiter

Ambiance was incredible and the service was terrific.  I ordered the strip steak with the bone marrow add on. My steak was a bit tough considering it was medium rare but not bad. The bone marrow didn't have much on it but i think I've been spoiled by other places. We ordered the Hazelnut grove for dessert which was a little disappointing. Overall it was a nice meal but nothing memorable.

Great music, good food, cool vibe. The bartenders are great and there's a variety of specialty drinks with tropical twists and all.

Great atmosphere, staff very attentive but not overbearing. We had reservations for 6pm and when we arrived, we were not thrilled with the seating location.  The staff were very accommodating even though they had a full house that night.  Drinks were top notch - $20 a $1,800 (no kidding) in price range. Had appetizers (kale salad and Oysters) which were excellent.  The rest of the party had dinner and we're very happy with the quality.  Live 'Jazz' music but not New Orleans loud... perfect for business or romantic dinner.  Will be back!

This place has a light but intimate feel to it. Food was all very good. Drinks are great. Service was good. Service was good. Great date spot! Great live band.

Nice staff, great service. We went during live music night, very nice and had a lot of appeal. My drink.was recommended by the server after asking about my taste and he was spot on. I had the F&R Burger with Fries but forgot to take a picture. Food was made well and exactly what I asked for. Big thumbs up...
No comment

Gotta check this place out.  The entrance is modest and currently obscured by construction, but inside is old NYC gold. Three piece blues band playing, no cover, AMAZING cocktails... but there are only about four of us here on a Friday night. Feel like I walked in on a hidden gem. Exactly what I was looking for tonight.  . And just 3 blocks from my hotel.

So disappointed. My go to menu item was the burger. They changed and ruined it. Rather than coming with bacon and egg, it's all a la carte. The problem is when you order the bacon, they literally bring you a side of bacon instead of adding thin strips of bacon to the burger. On top of that, the bacon was all fat and the fries did not come with the truffle aioli. Since it's all a la carte, what used to be $28 cost me over $40. The menu stated the price of the bacon was $5, but when the bill came, we got charged $12!!! If the burger had been good or better than the original,  I wouldn't have minded the price increase given inflation. My mom's risotto came out cold. If we hadn't purchased another scotch bottle tonight, we probably wouldn't return. To top it all off, we found out that the great and lovely manager Dasha left the place. It is no wonder this was such a different experience from the past. At this point, it is clear they are catering to clueless tourists rather than regulars.

Cool. Was pretty good. I would come back again. The live performance is nice. .........

Absolutely amazing. I came here to hear live music and dinner for my Dad's birthday. The staff was great and the music was a great addition. We really enjoyed the live band. They chef sent out a birthday cupcake for my Dad which was great. All the food and drinks were PERFECT. I can't wait to go back.

This restaurant is perfect for date night! The menu choices are wonderful, service is excellent and food taste / presentation is on point. It's also beautiful inside with lovely live jazz playing on stage in front. Definitely lives up to its name :-)

When I quit my last job, a guy I was dating at the time brought me here to celebrate before dinner. A swanky spot with live jazz. I normally don't like jazz bars, but this one is exceptionally good. Fast forward to this past Thursday, my boss told me to pick a pricey spot nearby to get drinks after a firm happy hour. We had some work to discuss and catch up since he is not based in the city. Service consistently great. Date or work, this place is A+. Totally forgot about this place, but so happy I got to come here again. Will have to come here for dinner one day to try out the food. Only had drinks here so far.

Stopped in for wine and live jazz on a cold Saturday fall evening. The drink menu is vast and the jazz singer kept us entertained. If you enjoy a more modern jazz with witty covers, a great ambiance, and good drinks... check out fine and rare!

Beautiful place. Amazing music. Admittedly have not tried the food yet but will definitely be back. Wine/drink list is extensive. We sat 4 of us in two beautiful leather couches and listened to jazz music all night. If you like great music and also to hear the people you're with, this is a great place.

I am completely appalled and taken aback by the behavior of everyone who works here, in particular whoever I spoke to on the phone.  On the phone, I confirmed reservations for the "floor seats" where the jazz band plays.  Unfortunately I did not get the name of the person who I spoke to but I can tell you that either she doesn't know what she's talking about or she just blatantly lied to my face- a really bad look either way.  When my friend and I showed up, we were seated in the correct area and ordered drinks.  However, later on the manager came and informed us that we cannot sit there without purchasing dinner.  That is totally fine- I get that, policy is policy.  My problem is if I tell you that whoever I spoke to on the phone misspoke, isn't it customary to apologize?  Instead I get a "oh really" and a very dismissive attitude. On top of that, our waiter was blatantly racist.  A very, very disappointing experience for what was supposed to be a nice night out.  And the drinks weren't strong and quite watered down as well- two thumbs down, if you're a person of color I would avoid this place at all costs.

I absolutely loved the jazz. The ambiance just welcomed. The drinks dazzled. The food fell short. I came here with realistic expectations about the food as the jazz is literally the star of the show. However, they need to step it up a little with the food to justify what they are charging. Overall I really enjoyed the place. The music pushed it up a few notches. However , if you you are not an avid jazz listener,  I do not think you will be overly taken by just the food selection.

Dined in for resturant week. Per usual, drinks are AMAZING. Food was good as well. Once again, the vibes are there and its such a good date night spot. Will be coming here again and again!

$30 cocktails yes it is worth it. Well really it's worth it if the vibe/music is good. I've been here several time however it is not always worth the hefty price.  For example a band playing 20s music (washboard and all) sorta killed the ambiance however the cocktails and delicious smell of wood burning made up for it :) overall a great place to splurge, have a yummy meal and occasionally listen to some good jazz.

This place was amazing.  Party of one for me on this NYC trip.  Bar tenders were amazing.  The music and the vibe was great.

The atmosphere was wonderful and great for a date night although my girlfriend and I had a girls nite!!! The food was mediocre and drinks were ok. The atmosphere made up for it and funny I would definitely go again!!! The entertainment was a 10!!!
live jazz on a sunday night.  exquisite cocktails- get a smoking old fashioned w bourbon.

Really lovely jazz band, good service, nice atmosphere.  However, we came for dinner and it was so underwhelming.  I joked that the chef might be english because there was no seasoning or flavor.  We had the strip steak (they don't have filet!?), the chicken, scallops, carrots, and crab cakes, and the gluten-free vegan desert.  All really unimpressive unfortunately.  Wanted to love it, neither of us did.
Delightful place! Not really a destination for food, but it was fine. What was notable were the fab craft cocktails, lively music and fun atmosphere.
No comment
Took a friend of mine into the city for live music and a nice atmosphere. Which we definitely received. The food and drinks on the other hand were subpar. The cake was horrible - so don't get that.
Wonderful place for a date night with great cocktails, food, and live music. Definitely the place for craft cocktail and jazz lovers. Great service and a very cool ambiance. Will definitely return!

Absolutely not worth the trouble or the bread in your pocket. I took my man here for his birthday weekend and was unbelievably shocked by how much the drinks were but given so little and BARELY any alcohol in said drinks. The food was eh to say the least. Porterhouse was alright I suppose and the teeny tiny cupcake given for birthday guests is a slap in the face to the price we payed. Cupcake is smaller than my pinky. Will not be returning.
No comment
If you're looking for an old feel vibe with Live jazz included.... This is the place!!! Cozy Romantic spot for good food and good jazz!! Waiters are great..
My new favorite Jazz/ Whiskey venue. Great atmosphere, service and food. The ambiance is exactly what one may imagine in a Jazz/ Whiskey venue.
This was the best decision I've made in a long time. Our waiter, Greg, was phenomenal. Really added to the experience. Amazing food and even better music. Great option for dinner!
No comment
No comment
Took my mom for her birthday. Amazing place! The food, the ambiance, the service. The live Band was a hit!  Very intimate space. Will definitely be back!
Amazing music great food. The steak was okay. The sides were great portions. Drinks were strong but should be considering the price.

I loved dining at Fine & Rare because of its ambiance, delicious drinks and food. I had oysters and wow, I was surprised because they were so fresh! Way better than other seafood restaurants that serve oysters. Live music was just a cherry on top. Not only was the performance great but it paired well with the drinks!
Drinks and food is great, and wait staff seemed generally okay. The young male host was pretty rude to us and others which was a bummer.

Loved it. Amazing atmosphere with great jazz. The strip steak was cooked perfectly and the green peppercorn sauce was probably the best sauce I've ever had on a steak. Date had the gnocchi which she said was ok, but great experience and we both can't wait to go back.
No comment

Fine and Rare in Midtown is a swanky bar with impeccable cocktails, a great live music scene, and a cozy, roaring fire place. We loved the smoked old fashion (you can customize it with your preferred bourbon / rye and wood smoke), the blackberry glimlet,Take me back to Tulum, and Oaxacan potion. This place is perfect place to impress a date and overall just a great place to grab drinks
It was fine, it wasn't fantastic. Food was mediocre, music was great. May come back but only for drinks.

Came here for a dinner out, cocktails  and some Jazz. The perfect venue for a cool date, business dinner or a fun experience with friends . The cocktail menu is loaded with crafted drinks to your hearts desire along with plenty of fine spirits . The menu is quite nice as well : we ordered crabs cakes , Shrimp cocktail , Brussels sprouts, fries and the Tomahawk steak . Everything was excellent although the steak was a tad on the cold side . That aside , the jazz and drinks were flowing nicely and the vibe was perfect . Naturally I will be back to enjoy this special venue
No comment

This place was amazing!  The ambiance first of all, was great!  Love that they had live music which was actually fun to listen to! The service was great!  Sometimes I judge the level of service by how empty my water glass gets and it never got below half full which is a sign they are always watching!  The food was outstanding.  I had the jumbo lump crab cakes and just one was almost good enough as a meal.  They were quite large!  The accompaniments were unique, cornichons, lemons, pickles and a crema.  I tried the crabcake with all of them and thought the cornichons paired best.   I was able to try the chilean seabass that my colleage ordered and it was melt in your mouth heaven.  Last but not least, we had the famous tiramisu.  Man is that sooo worth it!  You have to get it even if just to watch the presentation of it all.  Everything at this place was great!  The only thing that did not allow me to give a 5 star rating was I asked a couple questions about the menu and water that was served and no one had any answers for me which was weird.  Anyway, it is still worth a trip!  Enjoy!

I came here on a date and for whatever reason the hostess and waiter were so racist and rude to me! Lolol Get your act together! And that's so disrespectful to all of the entertainers there! The jazz band was amazing but unfortunately the waitstaff did not make me want to come back.

Had an absolutely lovely time here celebrating my wedding anniversary with my husband. They immediately wished us a happy anniversary upon arrival and also provided a happy anniversary chocolate and cupcake. All of the food was great. We had the grilled octopus which was a bit chewy but overall good. The lobster ravioli was amazing. My husband had the organic chicken and loved it with a side of creamed spinach. We topped it off with their famous 28 layer chocolate cake - man what a treat!! We even had some to take home. The live jazz was amazing. It's a bit loud as everyone is trying to converse over the music but it's not obnoxious! The value is amazing and the experience is just awesome. The service was also phenomenal.

Amazing experience ! The ambiance is perfect for date night or girls night. Last night was "world music" which was a little bit of everything and my boyfriend and I loved it. Also I can't say enough good things about the food and drinks. The sea bass specifically was probably the best fish I have ever had - cooked to absolute perfection. 10/10 recommend and we will definitely be back the next time we want great food, drinks and awesome live music!

This place is definitely cool looking I read a review that called it a 1920's jazz spot and  I have to agree with that statement 100% ... it's definitely has a more fancier /delicate feel the bar menu is 20 pages full of pricey / high class drinks most of which was lost to me ... the staff is super attentive and kind we arrived a good 30 mins earlier there where no seats at the bar but they have these very uncomfortable pull out stools right by the show/ jazz performers we sat there and where attended to right away .. once the rest of our family arrived we began our course , we started the night with oysters they had 2 different types  honestly I have had better they tasted to fishy for me , we also ordered grilled octopus very good , shrimp cocktail ehhh, salad was good,  for entree I had Chilean sea bass I was not impressed I don't know if my taste buds Where off but it also seemed to fishy the tomahawk steak was delicious! Truffle fries good too, the organic chicken was very tasty ! Staff was sooo nice and attentive also drinks where super impressive ! And very good i took a star off because honestly the food could've been better it's not cheap !
No comment

We visited during summer restaurant week and the tasting menu was a great bargain.  We had our best drinks of the trip here and I recreated the Garden of Eden when I got home I loved it so much.  The service was great and I'd definitely go back in the future.  The chocolate cake is a MUST.  Bring a friend or your fat pants!
Great service. Delicious food plated as beautiful works of art. Music was nice. So we're our bar drinks. Would recommend.
Great food, drinks, service and ambiance along with live entertainment. Pricey but great value for all the above. Check it out for a fun night with good food in NYC.

What a gem!  Tried this place on a whim and was astonished.  Excellent food, incredible drink selection and mixing.  Live music on a Friday that was more tasteful than I thought Manhattan could pull off in 2022.   Great design aesthetic too.  Food: We all had seafood and the flavors were off the charts .
Amazing spot.  Super sleek and Charlie is the man.  Bourbon old fashioned is the best in nyc.  Highly recommend.

I spent my birthday at Fine & Rare. It has a great vibe and ambiance. The 20s style music from the live band during dinner was a treat. The cocktails were tasty and well crafted. I got the Cod for dinner. It was excellent. I cleaned my plate. And because it was my birthday, they gave me a little cupcake with a Happy Birthday message.  The experience was certainly memorable. I'd definitely go back.

I have been coming for this place for almost 4 years now. I love this restaurant. The atmosphere is good, food tastes great, and performance is always enjoyable. Servers are all very friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant for a dinner and drinks.

What a hidden gem!!! We had an amazing experience here for my husband's birthday. We loved the live music (Cait and the Critters!) and the food/drinks were exceptional. I loved our waiter and he kindly brought a cupcake and candle for my husband at the end of our meal. Can't wait to come back!!! Highly recommend!

Chronically Hip, with outdoor and indoor dining, Fine and Rare is Extra Rare and lives up to its name. We tried the Mezcal Passion Signature Cocktail that challenged the palate with every sip. After some great Jazz, we were given privy to an off-menu jewel. Short Rib Pappardelle Bolognese. Yes, Manhattan is the center of the universe, even at midnight.

Best chicken of my life. Oh, did I mention the live jazz, amazing drinks, and good service? You feel like you've been transported back in time, in exactly the right way. Go now!

The space is well decorated and creates a beautiful atmosphere.  The band is extremely musical and adds to the overall ambiance. Drinks and food are good but drinks are very overpriced.  The break music for the band kills the vibe.    It goes from 1912 to 2012....quite literally.
Expensive and food mediocre. Live music was great but one of us had to have our backs to the stage with the way the table was setup. Won't return.

We had a reservation for a group of 9 for outdoor seating. We were immediately impressed by their outdoor seating decor. After having been to many many sidewalk cafes over the past 2 years, this was clearly different. Unfortunately that's were our positive experience stopped. We ordered 2 bottomed of a sparkling and 2 bottles of Rioja from their wine list and they didn't have either.  So we picked different options. We ordered Burrata and we were discouraged from ordering that. The fork provided to one of my colleagues had a prong that was bent out of shape. The mushroom gnocchi was tough and greasy, I could not eat more than a couple of bites. The scallops were nothing to write home about. Overall a solid average rating place.

This is such a charming place! I enjoyed brunch here in addition to hearing some wonderful jazz music! The service was impeccable. The ambiance was oozing with old warm charm and the food was delicious. The cocktails were incredible and very creative. All in all, this place is phenomenal.

I had a delightful birthday experience with my family of 8. The staff is incredible! Everyone was extremely kind, attentive and skilled. I can't speak highly enough of our waiter, Greg. He was thoughtful and made my evening exceptional. The ambiance is lovely, we sat near a gorgeous fire place with a wonderful view of the stage (from one side of the table). We really enjoyed the entertainment, they were talented and personable. Cocktails were good and everyone had a great meal, there was enough selection to make everyone happy. We will definitely be back.
No comment

I LOVED the live music. Was so different than the typical dinner night out. The ambience is very old school jazz. Cheese board, I enjoyed. I also got the gin samplers, presentation is adorable, deconstructed cocktails, but way too strong, doesn't really come together as a cocktail. The sea bass is YUM. Red snapper was no bueno at all, super fishy, but the manager was very apologetic and switched it for us. Ended up getting tartar instead, but was disappointing. Caesar salad was one of the bests I've ever had. A very cool and different dining experience .
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoyed the evening. Had dinnner with our adult children and their spouses. The food was very good, the music was excellent, and the wait staff could not be nicer. The cocktail menu is rather exotic for me, but everyone seemed to enjoy. I highly recommend for special occasions. It's a little pricey for your weekly go to place. Don't hesitate to give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

For my birthday this year, I wanted a cozy, intimate spot that was more than just a restaurant - and we got just that! The ambiance & decor of the place is fantastic. The live music was entertaining & great - it wasn't too loud or intrusive. It was just enough to be fun without being over bearing. The drinks were great & the food was fantastic. After reading the reviews, I was excited, and it truly lived up to my expectations.
Great Jazz Club with plenty of spacious seating and food was excellent ..  Worth the trip when in New York if you want to relax and listen to great Jazz  scene ..
No comment
Beautiful ambiance, speciality cocktails, delicious food and decadent dessert. Our waiter Chris was amazing and the jazz musicians brought an extra special experience.

A lovely place with beautiful cocktails, an impressive spirits selection, a well executed menu, and live music. For cocktails we went with an old fashioned made with an Elijah Craig Bourbon and the Oaxacan from the menu. The presentation on the Oaxacan was creative and helped keep it at the proper temperature. No spoiler - you'll have to go to see it! We split the cocktail shrimp - always a good test - and passed easily. The scallops were excellent although the corn spoon bread could have been warmer. Chicken with mashed and Brussell sprouts had a delicious crust. Coffee gelato was a nice finish and paired well with another old fashioned. Service was attentive, too! We'd have felt good about the value in NYC - but the live music totally put this place over the top. On Sunday night it was an excellent trio playing 1920s traditional jazz that evoked Coney Island. A great night out!
No comment

our server Ray, was absolutely amazing and so kind and welcoming!! It was my birthday and i felt very celebrated and he was such an amazing server!!! the live music is also so fun and very good, they are very talented! everything about this place is great! the food, exquisite!!
No comment

Lovely spot with class. Midtown is really a food dessert and full of tourist traps. But glad we gave Fine & Rare a go. Their menu was thoughtful and concise with something for everyone. The drinks are yummy and good looking. Look forward to be back for some jazz music!
Just incredible, top to bottom. I am now a jazz fan!! Highly recommend for a great NYC experience.
No comment
No comment

I put five stars for drinks, the best desserts and service. The food was terrible, especially the large Tomahawk was like rubber, the red snapper was semi-raw and no poorly fried, the risotto stank incomprehensibly, as if from a  fast food place. Disappointed in the food satisfied with the end of our stay as mentioned above, pleased with the desserts and drinks, the bartender more respect.

everything was lovely. from the decor and cozy vibes, to the music, service and food. no matter where you sit in the restaurant, you'll have a unique experience. i had the chicken, the kale caesar salad, and the chocolate cake. everything was delicious, especially the chicken and cake! my favorite cocktail i tried was the Oaxaca potion, it looked so pretty and tasted so good. we had a two hour time limit for our table which seemed more than reasonable, and were able to hang out at the bar after dinner to continue watching the band. can't wait to come back soon! thanks for a wonderful evening.

Delicious octopus, oysters and crab cakes. Excellent drinks list and thoughtful, delightful service team. My group was not a group of dessert eaters but I'm excited to go back and try the desserts, too. Outdoor seating is fully enclosed but they allow you to keep the doors open for better ventilation on request. Looking forward to returning.
No comment

Service is amazing! Drinks are amazing as well. Food is bomb! I love how truffle the fries are as well as the yukon mash potatoes. The ambiance of the place was just spectacular. Recommend!!!!!! Will definitely come back!

I want to take the time out to thank the wonderful staff for accommodating my friends and I. Temperature checks are taken upon arrival. I'm so happy I chose this place to celebrate my friends birthday. The decor was stunning giving you a Renaissance feel with a twist. The jazz band was absolutely amazing and our waiter Nash was phenomenal. I can't thank you enough for making my best friends birthday spectacular. I had a wonderful time from the food, to the beautiful cocktails. This place is a gem! I can't wait to come back here!

Had a good time. Ordered scallops for main course which was great and Celt it had a sweet sauce which I did not care for. I understand the octopus and kale salad was good as well. We ordered the 24 layer chocolate. I thought it was fine layers like lady M but this was a tower. Had to pack it up. Was yummy though so if you are in a group of 4 or 5 definitely order this.
No comment
No comment

Every time here was perfect - the cocktails, the wine, the whiskey, the jazz band, the food the hostess and the waiters. Perfect for friends and dates..or even a small gathering. The owner was absolutely hospitable and knows his business. Love this place.

We wanted to top off a busy Saturday with a quiet dinner in Midtown near our hotel. Instead we ended up at Fine & Rare, with a blasting jazz band with Brian Newman at the helm - trumpeter extraordinaire and jazz bebop flowing. Really good vibe at this place. True to the name the drinks were fine (a smoky bourbon Old-Fashioned spewing liquid smoke) and the meat was rare (too rare- the kitchen whiffed on this one).  But the manager, Kristin, rescued the situation- sending back the meat to be done right.  All was well from then on!   A great place, with top-notch attention to detail by Kristin and her team.
No comment
Best atmosphere I've experienced in NYC. Great food, great alcohol, great music. Couldn't ask for a better experience.
Food was amazing. The atmosphere, the employee's and the live music were  up to par. Will definitely return

A friend of mine got a promotion so I took him to dinner to celebrate.  We had a great time, live music, amazing drinks, good food, and impeccable service.  A European friend who joined us said "This is the NYC I expected to see when I fist came to the US."  Yes, the 1920s Speak Easy ambience/supper club vibe is real.  And no cover for the live music!  Truly one of my favorite NYC spots.
The music was so great. The craft cocktail were delicious but absolve all the manager made our experience so great. I will be back with all my friends and I highly recommend fine and rare
This was a grerestaurant from the food, atmosphere and music! Desserts were tasty!The sphere chocolate cake was delicious!!!
We had a nice diner with my wife there for her birthday. There was a live concert with great singer. The food was great. The service is on the very high level, staff was very polite and attentive.
No comment
No comment
Amazing place. Love it. Ambiance of the bar magnificent. Makes you feel so special. I really recommend
No comment
No comment

Okay, This was my first time at Fine & Rare, to celebrate my birthday with a little brunch with two of my closest friends, and believe me, it won't be the last time. Everything about this restaurant got me very excited about the dining out again, from the staff friendly and attentive Demeanor to the smooths sounds of Jazz players and last but not least, the food and drinks. I had the steak, potatoes, and scrambled eggs, so delicious. Thank you, Fine &Rare, for your Hospitality!

It is unfortunate that the service is extremely lacking. Both customer service and table service. This was my second time visiting and I was not thrilled the first time so I had been holding back on returning. Well after the experience with the host/manager being quite rude on the phone and at the door, as well as the difficult communication with my server, I'm not sure if I will return again. I also asked for a mock-tail and instead of double checking the server brought me a drink with alcohol. I also tried to email the restaurant to adjust my reservation and never received a reply.

Wow. My new favorite spot in NYC. Bands were incredible (Kelly and Brian Newman both performed). Absolutely fantastic food, had a wonderful server Chris. Drinks were divine!!! Food was superb. Can't wait to go back.
No comment
