No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friends live around the corner and brought me here, we had cocktails and listened to the live jazz music.  It ended up being the last live music I saw before covid destroyed all my hobbies.  If I had to pick a bar to have my last cocktails and live music for several months (maybe a year?), Fine & Rare was a great place to have it.  I can't wait to come back and cheers to live music again here, but until then, I will continuously watch the short snapchat video I have of my night here and reminisce about what it was like to sit in a bar, have a delicious cocktail, and listen to live music.
No comment
No comment
I love everything about this restaurant. I will definitely visit again. Sorry don't have pictures to share I was busy enjoying the Jazz and everything else.
No comment

Live music we had the evening we went was from 1910s-1920s. It was great. The presentation of the food was great. However, the taste of almost every dish we had was extremely underwhelming. The trout was cooked beautifully. The skin was crispy, but it needed salt badly. Portions were small, too. Did not enjoy the food overall. It could just be because it was restaurant week, but you figure restaurant week is when restaurants would put forward their best to attract new customers. I'll try it one more time for regular meals, but if it's the same experience, I will not return.

Wow. Just was there last night. Ambience, food and drink all get 5 stars. If you're looking for the perfect date night, come here. Their outdoor setup is hands down the best I've seen in NYC this past year. They've even setup air conditioning in the unit, so no worries about overheating on the hot street this summer! Very classy, pricey spot.
No comment
Amazing place to take a date. Great background music especially with live jazz music. Also, they have amazing drinks! Definitely coming back to this place
No comment
This place was rare and true gem. The waiter and the hosts were so sweet and attentive they even gave us the best seat in the house. The live music was amazing and drinks were amazingly delicious.
No comment
Clean, kind staffs! They have a band playing beautiful music!! Good quality food with good quantity as well. Will def come back!! Bathroom door was huge for mirror selfies too:)

We came here with friends during restaurant week and it was beautiful. The ambience is great and had live jazz music playing. The performers were amazing. Most of us ordered from the restaurant week menu and really enjoyed it. Some also ordered the drink pairings. Everything was beautifully prepared and tasted delicious. I loved the vibe of this place and really enjoyed coming here. I would highly recommend if you enjoy jazz music also.

I can't believe this place hasn't been exposed and blown up yet! It's such a hidden gem . Mark such an incredible attribute to those restaurant! He gave us such a warm welcome as soon as we walked in and I'd be honored to have him as the face as my company! They have live jazz bands play during brunch and many other nights! Their food is amazing and their drinks are even better! They have over a thousand wines and spirits in house! When you come here you get treated with the best service, receive quality food, and listen to great music! The best mimosa is the honey one! Also must try love bread. Also Mark brought us a dessert tasting complimentary for us to try! SOMEONE promote this man! Will definitely be back and recommending to everyone I know!
No comment
No comment
Place is incredible..A bit on the pricier side but the cocktails are amazing..Staff is very knowledgeable and accommodating. One of the best cocktail vibes in the city, for sure.

Took my husband here for our anniversary. We had never been but the live jazz, great reviews, and healthy menu options drew us in. We ordered a bunch of apps- burrata, crab cocktail, beet salad, wagyu special, truffle fries. Everything was divine. Our favorite was the crab cocktail bc it was a lot of crab and so tasty. My husband also ordered the steak and it was cooked to perfection. I requested a sidecar cocktail and they were able to make it no problem and it was fabulous. Our waitress was great and we will definitely be back.
No comment

As someone who doesn't always take the time out to leave reviews when I have a good experience, I had to leave a rave review for this restaurant because my experience last night was UNBELIEVABLE. My waitress' name  was Young and if I could leave a review for her alone, I would give her 10 stars! From start to finish, this restaurant exceeded my expectations. I went for a special birthday dinner and the ambiance was incredible. The live music was excellent (not too loud and we were sitting right in front of the stage), and the food/drinks were absolutely divine. We started with the combo meat/cheese/paté board and octopus, then had the NY strip and the Chilean sea bass as entrees (the Chilean sea bass with cauliflower purée was OUTSTANDING, I swear I dreamt about it in my sleep), and because it was my boyfriend's birthday, they sent over a very cute complimentary chocolate cupcake with a candle, and we ordered the Sphere for dessert which was gorgeous and worth every penny. Their whiskey selection is out of this world (so many to choose from, almost overwhelmingly so) so we chose to do a whiskey flight. Young was so informative and really took the time out to explain each and every whiskey to us. She even gave him a little whiskey on the house while we were waiting for dinner just as a birthday gesture. I ordered two cocktails beforehand which were both also great. We never felt unattended because they checked on us frequently, and I can't stress enough, this was probably the best dining experience I've ever had BAR NONE. If you're thinking about going to this restaurant and bringing someone special, RUN don't walk. I'll certainly be back in the future!!
No comment

My husband and I went to Fine & Rare for our anniversary.  It was the most amazing experience.  The service was spectacular and the food was breathtaking,  From the appearance to the taste, it was just wonderful.  Now to the drinks, the Bourbon Explorer to the wines, it was delicious!  Most of all the service was so wonderful. I can't wait to go again.  Thank you to a wonderful staff and many memories
No comment
No comment

Love Fine and Rare. The cocktails were good, especially the whiskey selection. While the food isn't mind1blowing, I don't thing that's the reason for coming here. The atmosphere is throwback and the entertainment likewise. The music kept us engaged the whole time. Definitely will be returning.

Absolutely unique and wonderful spot. Fine dining experience with the warm comfort of quality live jazz bands. Candle lights, mellow, sultry mood. The menu was delicious and the ambience was phenomenal. Staff extremely attentive. Great for a date night. Love.

Oh my! The ambience here is everything. Only topped by their craft cocktails and live music. I was celebrating and this is the perfect venue.  Very hospitable and low key venue. Five stars even though I think they can do better with their food menu. The experience of a nice dinner here is everything!

Fine & Rare is simply absolutely marvelous. Honestly great value for the price. Pretty much every menu item that we purchased was incredibly fresh and yummy. Folks working there are always so friendly. All in all Fine & Rare has great experience, great staff, great spot, reasonable price.

Can I just start off by saying that I been wanting to come to this place for a year ! This place was so amazing & i'm so happy to have came here. I took my mother here for Mother's Day & it was so warm and inviting. They have live jazz music every night and the musicians were incredible! We were a party of four & we all ordered something different on the menu and all enjoyed everything that was ordered! The place had a Great Gatsby feel to it. Throughout the Interior  we noticed that there were alcohol displayed all around & were labeled under names for regulars & their drink of choice. Might sound corny but I thought it was interesting ;) too bad I can't upload my video of the jazz band that was playing! The guitar player was amazing to watch and listen to, especially the solo he had!!! Only thing that was a little disappointing was that the salmon lacked flavor. I asked for the skin to be crispy & unfortunately my plate did not come really hot (right off the pan) however we all still enjoyed our time & experience! Out waiter Chris was very helpful and informative & was very attentive! The buss boy was also very efficient and was very on point! Our table appreciated him as well!
No comment
No comment

Hostess was foul and rude.  Would not recommend this place which is trying to come off as high class.  It takes more than a name and attitude to be a classy establishment.  Try the Gold Room or really anything else.

I am certainly not a New Yorker, so I enjoy when I am in the city just walking to find different, off the beaten path places for dinner, with the help of my friend Yelp, of course.  Fine and Rare came across my radar tonight.  Quite a quaint place, would be nice if my wife were here for a date.  A low key jazz group and vocals playing, a bar menu that was a book.  I settled in to the recommended bologna section, which can be great if it is genuine (ok, I am a bolognese snob), or awful if it comes out of boxes and cans.  I am happy to say this was excellent!  I will have to come back and try the Bronzino.  A nice out of the way find in Manhattan. Dark, jazzy, music, classic bar menu, good food.
Great drinks, amazing live music, and the staff members are so friendly. We had a blast!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Incredible night out with my college friends who I have not seen since right before the pandemic hit. We had amazing service, cocktails and food. The outside seating area was really beautiful. Highly recommend.
No comment
Here for brunch.  Great food, jazz, atmoshpere and service at a reasonable price.  Will be back with more friends for dinner!!

Went here for a friends birthday, I have to say that there is liquors like rare ones all over the restaurant in these shelves that looks like the library but with liquors. Live jazz music was a plus without hearing other people's conversation, the food was very food but pricey. Dessert on the other hand was artistic and crafty especially the sphere where they use chocolate to melt the sphere and opens to a ice cream dessert, overall an enjoyable experience and would want to come back here to try the rare dishes such as the ostrich egg or the scorpion fish.
No comment

I absolutely love this place. The atmosphere is incredible- live jazz music in the background setting the ambiance, not like some places where you get yelled at if you talk to the person you're having dinner with. I love the food. The drinks are excellent- they can make pretty much anything and they get really creative with what they do! The bookshelves lined with bottles is an awesome view. Cozy in winter with a fireplace. Highly recommend!
No comment

Fine & Rare takes you back in time. I like coming here for the mouth watering cocktails, it's so entertaining watching the bartender make your drink. Their collection of whiskeys are something to really brag about. I can't wait to go back!
No comment

Amazing place to come in and enjoy great drinks, small plates and great musicians. Stop here every time I can when visiting the city.
No comment

No comment

Every aspect of the food, service, and atmosphere at Fine & Rare was immaculate! My boyfriend and I had such a wonderful experience, we are both already dying to go back. The drinks were flowing, food was absolutely delicious, and the service was top-notch! Not to mention they have live music every night? The venue itself is also very impressive. Fine & Rare will be my new secret weapon when I want to have an unforgettable night.
No comment
No comment

The place has great decor and the service was good. Managers came to check on the table twice. The food was good, not great. But the jazz was really good and enjoyable.  This is a nice place if you want to do something different. By the way the cocktails were perfect!

I came here for an earlyish dinner reservation with a group of 4 of us. We all arrive by 510 pm (10 minutes after the reservation time) and were scolded for being late... then 15 minutes after we seated the hostess came again and said we'd have to leave by 630 pm. I don't think anyone should feel like they're being kicked out before ordering food! Okay so we order drinks and then it takes a while for the waiter to come back for ordering our meals. Meanwhile the hostess comes back again and says we can stay until 8 pm... I imagine the next table party cancelled? We eventually order and receive our meals... I enjoyed the roasted chicken and my husband wasn't impressed by the steak. The fries were very thick cut and more soggy than fried. The sphere dessert was beautifully presented and incredibly rich. The bartenders here are skilled and artistic, loved the drinks! In the background were some excellent 20's style performers. This was a cool place with great drinks, an overall unique atmosphere, but subpar hostess service. Next time, don't try to kick your customers out before they've even ordered!

This place is perfect for a special occasion. They really pay attention to every detail and look like they enjoy it too, which makes all the difference in New York. The selection of drinks is wonderful, and the food was delicious. The musicians and the lady singer this evening killed it. We really enjoy our dinner and entertainment. Five stars all the way.

It was not crowded and very pleasant on a Friday evening. The two of us did have to sit at the bar though, as some tables were reserved. We got a good view of the stage, with the live music. They have a good selection of cocktails. We were amazed at how beautiful "the garden of eden" was. I would return.
No comment
No comment

Our temperatures were taken at the door and waitstaff were masked. Drinks were very good (especially the blackberry gimlet) but that's where my good experience ends. The live music was so loud I felt like I was burning calories listening to it. Could not have a conversation. Secondly, the waitress and management practically rushed us out of the restaurant, coming by our table every five minutes to make sure we had ordered entrees. And the food? Hm. A $135 steak was 90% fat, crab cakes were cold, and the short rib pasta just subpar. What a disappointment. Hopes were high, but ultimately a letdown.

One of my favorite venues especially for the ambiance and music! You step in and instantly transported back to the prohibition era. Live sounds of jazz, great food and cocktails. The walls are filled with bottles upon bottles of the finest whiskey scotch and bourbons. They even have a fireplace to cozy up to in the cold months. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Tommy Tardie is a great owner and always looking to keep the cocktails Unique and up to date. This is the sister location of the Flatiron room and it lives up to the hype! It's the perfect venue for a date night or just to go solo and be consumed by the music. I go as much as I can especially on a Saturday night when the Brian Newman band plays from 9-12pm. A+++

Amazing! Took my boyfriend for his birthday and everything was so great. The delicious food coupled with the ambiance was amazing. We ordered a smoking old fashioned, 2 Husband #2 cocktails (soooooo good), the salmon, steak, mashed potatoes, and chocolate cake and vanilla gelato for dessert. We will be coming back!
No comment
No comment

Fine & Rare is an experience far above many I've had in the city. The restaurant is classy and they take the extra mile to make sure you feel welcome and special. The waiter we had was so engaging and knowledgeable. We got a charcuterie board to share and we all got different drinks that you could tell were made with high quality spirits. All of our entrees were divine, I got the mushroom ravioli special and was so pleasantly surprised by the decadence of the meal. Our waiter coerced us into getting the Fine & Rare Sphere for dessert and we were so glad he did. Very cool to see them melt the sphere in front of you! We truly had a fine and rare experience at this restaurant.

Came for dinner and drinks Saturday night. Beautiful outdoor seating, great ambiance with light jazz on the street playing in the background. The staff were super sweet & attentive. Amazing scallops! Definitely going back for more of those :) Very creative / fun cocktail menu to choose from too! Tommy the owner is lovely and has really put a great deal of effort into the new outdoor set up. I shall return!
No comment

My daughter and I were trying to squeeze in as much experience on our last day in the midst of freezing rain (celebrating her 21st birthday in mid December) and our Lyft driver dropped us at this ideal spot..it was heavenly from start to finish..ambiance, the cuisine, and our amazing Lauren who treated us as royalty, educating us on the special beverage and choice of local fresh ingredients, while surprising my daughter with a lovely Smorgasbord of dessert tastes..I have sung this restaurant's praises since returning to Texas. The food was succulent, wine was superb, but especially was the treat of polite and friendly staff in a city supposedly known for its abrupt and impatient citizenry. I found this the antithesis..cannot wait to return when there is live music!
No comment

I had a great experience at this restaurant. It has a cool vibe and the staff was very friendly, especially the hostess. I rarely order chicken out, but my server recommended it so I gave it a try. It was amazing! I can't wait to go back the next time I am in town.
No comment

Really cool atmosphere!  Jazz music is a great touch and not too loud as to ruin the quiet lively vibe of the restaurant. Service was excellent. Food - must haves include truffle fries and brussel sprouts!  The chicken dish is nice and highly recommended. Don't plan to have a super private conversation here though. Tables are quite close in some places in the dining room. Would definitely visit again despite the tight quarters.
Fantastic Food + Live Jazz + Sophisticated Design + First-Class Service = 5 Stars

They had live music the night I went (Friday), which was nice. Had some drink there and friends had the food (I didn't try the food). Drinks are good and are the standard NYC price. Large choice of alcoholic beverages. You can also sit along the bar or they have a counter near the stage for you to have drinks and listen to music. It's a nice place to have a drink and chill out with some music.
Lets talk about great menu, impeccable service, class, live music, super friendly staff and selected clientele. I highly recommend the osso buco with lentils. AMAZING!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love it love it love it. Period. My go to place for Sunday brunch. Not only isn't it packed to sht like the Smith for brunch where you're sardines, this place is spacious, HAS A LIVE BAND! Jazz. And food was great. But honestly, I can't emphasize how good the service was. I must've been approached by a good half dozen customer service oriented servers who wanted to know how I was doing. Sunday brunch at Fine and Fare is an absolute must if you're not a brute. Prices were fair, food great, decor was simply gorgeous, I just love this classy place. 5-Stars + 1. Of all the brunches in the City I've been to, this place was the most....pleasant. Chris our server was amazing, so attentive to us, offering unique menu items, making recommendations. He really took pride in his job. Dasha was also very friendly. The whole staff really. Thank you guys for an amazing brunch.
No comment

If you want an upscale dine-in experience, there is no better place than fine and rare. Food portions are incredible along with the taste so definitely worth every penny you spend. I hosted my fiancé's birthday party here but the reservation alone required a pre-order of food and a deposit which can be very frustrating to deal with if guests don't show up so you lose money. However, the service is just so exceptional and the management/chef are there to give you the best time you can have. Even going back and forth via email with the manager/director was prompt and easy. They do need to accommodate guests of larger than 6/7 parties with the ability to pay individually for what they order, that would've saved me a lot of trouble and money. The 28-layer cake was custom made for my fiancé and was hands down the best cake I've ever had. I truly want to thank the chef for such an art piece. Every guest who tried the cake literally wanted to take a slice home with them. My only problem with the place is the ridiculously loud music that makes it impossible to have a normal conversation. If the jazz musicians are performing, please at least turn the regular music off.
No comment
No comment

Excellent service. We went for an early Saturday evening meal. The live band and decor provide great ambience. Lovely meal. Generous portions. It came to $225 for three entrees, an appetizer salad, and three glasses of wine. NYC prices. Highly recommend for a special night out.
No comment
No comment

I spent my birthday here and it is by far one of the best in the city. Superb service, amazing food, and the jazz performances were great. They also have bourbon tasting and a Bottle Keep Member Program. A new favorite! 5 Stars!!!
No comment

The decorations,  the services and the jazz and food are terrific. The volume is just right allowing a private conversation and the lighting is very soothing to the eyes.  The burger is a real tasty and also a very good deal at the same time.  The appetizers are tasty but a little small in portion.  I love my veggie and the rare beef.  It was a late dinner for me,  their sizes are just right but if I was doing a real dinner,  would definitely go for the main.

I had a great time here. The jazz set was awesome. I definitely recommend the seafood tower for an appetizer, the mussels were amazing! I ordered the seafood paella which was great aside from me having to send it back because the rice was undercooked. The only real complaint I have is the bathroom lighting being so dark and not being able to take a decent mirror selfie in that gorgeous bathroom

What a lovely find. My friends who were visiting from out of town wanted to do a jazz brunch. We were seated right away newr the stage. The live band was great. The food delicious. We ordered a bottle of white wine which was smooth and crisp. We then ordered some fries to start. Our main course included the quinoa salad bowl (YUM!!), the Brioche French Toast (also YUM!) and the skillet eggs (very good). The service was impeccable. It gets a wee bit loud but then any place with live music will be. Definitely going back and would definitely recommend. The fries were so good we ordered another and wiped our plates clean.

I really liked it the food was good from scallops to the burrata to the pay la Frieda burger .. those picks were so good i can't stop thinking about it!! Drinks were great and strong! I would def come back!! Can't wait to try the sister restaurant flat iron !! Thanks for making the night very accommodating!!!
Impeccable service by waitstaff and managers. Great ambiance, music, romantic. Food, drinks, all good! Highly recommend.

One of my favorite restaurants...came when they first opened up and they have progressed very well to the well established place that is Fine and Rare that we come to know.  Food quality has definitely improved and the music has always been a great accompaniment to the dinners.  Only drawback, it tends to be chilly in there, so bring an extra layer just in case.  Will return as usual.

Awesome experience!!! Great, knowledgeable servers that ask the right questions to give you the best experience. My husband and I went to dinner for our anniversary and our server was amazing! Food was delicious and the ambiance was pretty awesome. We will definitely be back the next time we go to New York!
