No comment
The drinks can be better here, a bit disappointed. But comfortable space to chill, chatting with friends, while live music is on~

We were in the neighborhood and decided to walk in, originally I was afraid I was not dressed appropriately but saw 2 couples go in with shorts and T shirts and got seated. So we decided to give it a try... when we went in we were denied seats because we were too casual....  I can respect that policy but not when they apply it based on discrimination

My friends and I have been here twice before for the live music and whiskey selections. It's a great atmosphere but I was thrilled to know that they have lunch during the week. Since I work in mid-town and I often need to entertain clients, this was the perfect spot for a business lunch. The setting is elegant and the service and food spot on. If you've been here for dinner than try their lunch. You won't be disappointed.
Can't stress how amazing their service is!They truly stand by their customers and try to make it an enjoyable experience. Food is reasonable but can be more flavorful. Have to go for Sunday brunch!

Nice decor and pleasant staff.  The band that night was Blue Opal and we enjoyed listening to them for a few hours.  The food however was not up to the standards that this type of establishment should have.   My meal including French fries seemed undercooked.

We had a good experience here. Music was good and wait staff was polite. I hear this place is owned by the same people that own the "Flat Iron Room" I like the set up in flat iron better. My husband had his back towards the band the whole time. Other than that no complaints. the food was very good!
Awesome little gem of a place.  Highly recommend.  Great music and food.  But the highlight of this gem are the bartenders and the concoctions they mix up.  Visit this joint.  You will not regret it.

Great ambiance, amazing cocktails and food. Went with my brother and I pretty much tried every cocktail on the menu! All were perfectly made, flavorful but not too sweet. The live jazz was great! I think it's a great spot for after work drinks and dates. Honesty, if I lived in NYC I'd hang out here on the regular!

We went here to celebrate the completion of my best friend's presentation for work. The ambiance is very sophisticated and comfortable. We loved the live jazz. The drinks were AMAZING! We loved husband #3 in particular. I also had their chicken dish with mashed potatoes - very tasty/delicious. Service was top notch, our hostess Leti was great! we will definitely be back!!
I love this place ! Had my birthday dinner last Monday and it was amazing experience. Food, service and atmosphere were great.

Came here for a Saturday Jazz Brunch. We ordered the Pork Belly Cornmeal Pancakes, Eggs Constance, French Toast and Egg white, Spinach Omelet and some drinks. Overall the food, drinks and the service were all good. Taste wise not much different than other cheaper brunch places but the ambiance and the music were a plus. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a "can't go wrong" brunch place.

Great ambiance and food!  Live music, huge spirits list and a thoughtful and amazing menu.  This is a perfect date night spot.  I ordered the grilled baby octopus and the NY Strip.  Both items were perfect.  Splurge on the Sphere desert! well worth it.
Fantastic place to enjoy great food and live jazz. They have a cozy atmosphere, a great wine selection, and excellent acoustics for the live music!

All in all, Fine and Rare is one of the best cocktails places in NYC. Tommy has set the bar for decor, mixology, and ambiance. He use of jazz music, he different elements of the venue whether it is floor depth, booth sizing,or the finishes, speak volumes. Don't be surprised when movies, tv shows, and al types of other happenings occur here. They hit the mark on all aspects. Add in Devin who is a mixology expert, as well as the management and staff, and it's the perfect experience. Congratulations to the team. The #devilsreef beverages are some of the best in the city. This is a new spirit that is Cinnamon Spiced Rum that has just the right amount of panache to a bundle of cocktails. Truly something not to be missed.

Another fantastic agave class and tasting! I really enjoyed last month's tasting and thought it was worth checking it out again and I'm glad that I did. The selection this time was completely different than the last and they were very odd and exotic.  Each of the offerings were barreled differently and the teacher, Amanda, was very knowledgeable about all of them. There was a group celebrating something that was a little loud, but the instructor kept it interesting and fun so it was fine. Definitely looking forward to being able to make it to the next one.

The food here is outstanding!!!! The choices of signature cocktails. The selection of bourbon and whiskey and wines!!!! Please get the Mac and cheese! Jazz music the ambience is so chill and warm! Please come and experience this zibe

Every single time we come here it is exceptional. Not sure if the hostess really remembers every single person or if she is just the best actress but we always feel like we are being welcomed to someone's home. Cocktails at the bar were perfect as we waited for our table. Food was cooked to perfection and the service was just the right amount of attention. We didn't feel rushed but they checked in at the right points.

Been here several times for drinks and food and FR never disappoints. It is indeed fine & rare. The cocktails here are very innovative and delicious. I don't think I can ever praise enough about the ambiance and decor. Every decor piece seems to have been carefully picked out and a lot of them have a rich history behind them. If you're looking for fine drinks, elegant ambiance and pleasant live music, then FR is the right spot for you!
Where do I start? The drinks are great and the ambiance is outstanding. I highly recommend going here for a date but make sure you have a reservation so you get a good spot!

The seafood tower in a sight to see! Highly recommend this gem! Tried the burger at wine and food festival and was dying to try the whole burger in person. Safe to say I was not disappointed! We came in a Friday night and the band was remarkable!
The service was great.  The decor and atmosphere is ultra chic, old Hollywood chic.  The food and drinks... wow!!! Amazing!

Great music, impeccable service, delicious food, and out of this world smoked drinks. What more can you ask for? Well firstly a steak that is not drenched in sauce. The description of the Tamahauk steak states it comes with a chimichurri sauce. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but it wasn't doing the meat justice. The steak came drenched in some sort of sauce that overpowered the flavour of the meat. The said chimichurri sauce came on the side together with blue cheese sauce. When I ordered the same steak in other steak houses it was always seasoned and dry to showcase the meat. Also, a small order of asparagus that costs $14 seems odd since it wasn't anyhting special. Everything else was top notch. The scallops, the octopus, and crab cocktail. Will I be back? Yes, but not for the steak. I think most steak enthusiasts will agree that proper steak is served to showcase the meat, and if the meat is good then only salt and pepper are needed.
Incredible atmosphere. Food was exceptional. Service a bit slow but was made up with their professionalism. Perfect kind of place for a night out or just drinks and live music.

Really enjoyed the dinner and drinks. Menu choices okay, but not exceptional. What we ordered ( scallops and crab cakes were good, but not exceptional. Drinks were good but again not exceptional. Dasha was very attentive, at first it seemed that she was a bit pushy to move us along, but she really was there to help. Music was very good! Would go back the next time in NYC.
Great ambience, music, and waiting staff is wonderful. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Food is excellent.

This place has great decor and plays live jazz music at night.  The service was decent and the food was underwhelming. The drinks were amazing here as expected. They need to put more effort in to their food. My burger tasted like it was previously frozen and my wife's steak left much to be desired. The place has a lot of potential. Hope to revisit again.

I love Fine & Rare as a spot to get together with my girlfriends. It gets a little loud near the stage, but the ambiance more than makes up for it. The food and the cocktails are great. I highly recommend the scallops and greens and a blackberry gimlet or the Colorado.
Here doing a photoshoot for a firm/client event, feat whisky selection above average finger food, love their lobster sliders

I took my girlfriend on a Friday night for our anniversary. I would 100% come back even if for a drink. One of the coolest - and classiest places I've gone for a date night in New York. You certainly get what you pay for in terms of the food, wildly tasty and unique cocktails and awesome live music. I will be coming back here not only for date night but also for drinks with friends. If you are a whiskey lover - they have a menu with 7+ pages of whiskies.
I ate brunch here recently, and it was phenomenal! The cocktail selection is amazing! The benedict was perfectly cooked and the thick cut bacon was delicious! Can't wait to come back!
No comment

We came here on the suggestion of a stranger at the airport and wow was he right! The atmosphere is amazing, and the food and drinks were superb! The Bolognese was possibly one of the best things I've ever eaten. The live jazz music was just perfect and the staff more than accommodating. We didn't even have a reservation and despite being fully booked, they still found room at a little table by a fireplace in the front waiting area. Thanks again for an amazing experience!

Overall an "okay" experience for restaurant week. For the first course, the scallop appetizers were overcooked, rubbery and small. The main course we got grilled chicken that was dry but decently flavored. What made this place special and an acceptable venue is the live jazz and ambiance but i probably wont be returning in the future for the food. I recommend this place as a date venue since the drinks were exceptional and a pretty heavy pour.

Had an amazing time the ambiance was just the perfect setting for date night. The chop was amazing! The scallops as well but the charred octopus was my favorite! Drinks were very good and presentation was A1. All in all I shall return!

This place is beautiful, intimate, romantic, perfect for that date night to impress and take you away from 2019 NYC. The restaurant, ambiance, service is spot on, not pretentious, and just makes you feel like they're happy to be there and share the experience with you. With a place that probably attracts snobbery, this place still did not. I loved it. The jazz was at the perfect balance of not too loud so you can still talk, but not too soft that you don't feel it's live. Compared to other jazz bars, the talent here is top notch. The drinks were so, so unique and good. The selection of whiskey and scotch is so extensive that just looking at the list was overwhelming; but I asked the server what he would recommend given what I like to drink and now I've discovered a new scotch to drink! We ordered a scallops and grilled octopus for apps; presentation was beautiful. For entrees, we ordered a strip steak and salmon. Portions were generous and I left so full. I'd love to come back again!

Attentive service, nice ambiance, but a mediocre, disappointing dining experience. The pork cop was fatty, tasteless. They did offer to replace my dish, but I wasn't in the mood to wait another 15-20 minutes for another dish. There was no dessert menu (weird), and was only offered after dinner drinks, which I didn't care for. Nice jazz band. Go for the music and something else that's NOT pork chops. Willing to give it another try. But this first time sucked.
Food was amazing and drinks were absolutely delicious! Perfect for a date night.. you can't get more romantic than some playing the Chello live across from your table !
I love Fine & Rare... the best bar in midtown with live music, awesome drinks and the staff from the front to the back could not have been better.   Wish we had something similar in St. Louis.
Amazing food, beautiful setting, excellent service, and I enjoyed the live performance from the jazz band. Great restaurant for date night when visiting NYC. definitely will be coming back next time

GREAT PLACE BUT NOT FOR STEAK.  We've been all over for steak but wanted to try a new place for a birthday.  Lets start with the great ... the smokey drinks are absolutely delicious and will leave you craving for refills, the live jazz set the perfect mood, the waitstaff was extremely attentive, and the overall design with a large fireplace was perfect.  Very few places are so beautiful and allow you to sit at a table right next to soothing jazz.  The coat check was a nice option.  The menu is very diverse so whether you're in the mood for meat, fish, or pasta, you wont leave hungry.  There is also a great selection of whiskey, cognac and other "flights" so you get to try a drop of a handful of variations.  If you end up buying a bottle of liquor, they offer the option of saving it for you whenever you come back.  I truly enjoyed absolutely everything about this restaurant except for the steak because it was covered with some sort of a brown sauce.  A $140.00 steak should not have any sort of spices, sauces or anything else on it besides perhaps a dash of salt & pepper.  Adding anything on a steak is equally shameful as cooking it 'well done' as both options will kill it a 2nd time and you wont experience the mouth watering flavor that a good quality steak should deliver.  Oddly enough, this is the 1st restaurant that has done such a thing and the menu description hasn't included it.  While the menu did say that 2 sauces will come with the steak, they came on the side, so I'm not sure what the brown sauce was since it wasnt listed on the menu.  I truly hope that such an amazing restaurant will drop the steak sauce.  Perhaps place it on the side, but definitely not on the steak.

Not a place for food but it's a nice little place if you want to bring friends for a not so jazzy jazz night or watch a live show of confused New Yorkers trying to impress each other. I mostly like the font and their match box. It's the nice little things.
No comment

Wow!  Took my parents here randomly on a Saturday night because they wanted to see live music while we were in town.  We were so impressed!  My father really enjoys rare whiskey and this place delivered providing him with the opportunity to enjoy a pour from a bottle from the 1950s that they purchased at auction.  It was recommended by our expert server who was excellent.  Everything was just phenomenal including the live music from Brian Newman.  Look him up...he's just amazing.  The decore is beautiful and the drinks were fabulous.  What a great, classy, fun New York evening.  Thanks for helping us make a wonderful memory!
Food, service, atmosphere and music was amazing !!!! When you walk it feels like you stepped into 1960's. Such an amazing place.

Recommended by a friend I invited a few more and had a great night of live music and some of the best smoked Scotch and Mezcal. We started with a tower of fresh seafood, the oysters, shrimp and lobsters were amazing. We moved on to some great Benzino dishes and NY Strip medium rare made to perfection. We finished the evening with some of their best after dinner Scotch. I was definitely pleased by the service and vast selection of dishes, wine and spi
No comment
We had a wonderful time here last weekend. The food was amazing and so was the live music. Recommend for a special evening.
No comment
No comment

Didn't get to try anything as we arrived to the bar around 11:30 on a weeknight and since no one was around we looked to find a bartender who then informed us they are closed. I was surprised- I said don't you close at 2 am? He said well yes we are supposed to but it depends, we close whenever we feel like it. Welp there goes that. bye!

Went for a four course dinner w/ jazz by Brian Newman. Surpassed expectations--cool spot. I'm not a jazz super fan-just like good music-loved Brian and his band. Excellent! Food was good, nice variety. Amazing cocktails, and great service.
No comment
We found this place by accident. Great selection of 400+ whiskeys and custom cocktails. Vibe is laid back and cool. A must visit for anyone who enjoys a spectacular cocktail alongside some cool jazz.

Last minute reservations for a Saturday night proved to be a winner. Got a table in front of the stage (the wife got to watch the show and I was only able to hear it). It was loud at the table, but I expect that when sitting 4 feet from a band!  Food was good. We left full. The Smoking Old Fashioned was a hit. I recommend the scotch with Maple smoke.

Very nice place, great atmosphere and music. Service is also very attentive and quick. I would recommend this if you are going for a romantic date . The only wish is for them to have few more sharing options. Came with a party of 3 and while we did enjoy the meal options were limited.

Very cool place! We had a great night! The food and entertainment were outstanding! "Brian Newman's Residency" was unbelievable! All of the musicians are extremely talented! The only negative was that after the first set, the band took a break, and then we felt like we were being rushed out and pressured to order more food or drinks - Even though we had 2 rounds of drinks, full course meal, and dessert. We ended up giving up our table front and center, and moved to the back stools on the second level. All in all, we will definitely go back on our next trip to NYC!
No comment

This was a great find, came here for Sunday Jazz Brunch, food was great , cocktails were fabulous and then the jazz trio started...really gave it a cool vibe, would highly recommend and will definitely be added to my "must return" list when in NY.
No comment
Love this spot and found it through opentable. I keep going back over and over. The food is great and the atmosphere is perfect for a meeting. Not loud for lunch!
No comment
No comment

This place was really charming ... the chops were delicious as was my bolognese pasta. We heard a great band that we enjoyed a lot . It was a Thursday night and place was not completely full which surprised me. I think it's lacking a vibe while you wait in between music sets ... I would say playing some upbeat music in between would do it . Lovely place with good service and good live music ! Miami 2018
No comment
Delicious food, fabulous cocktails and a very funky atmosphere combined with lovely jazz performances makes Fine & Rare one of my new favorite spots for dinner.

Very cool dinner spot for some amazing selection of whisky. Love jazz bar with talented musicians. The food was amazing and the dessert was delicious!!! Must go if you are looking for some fine dining with live music. Cocktail menu had great variety. Would come here again when in NYC.
No comment
Always the best. Food and drinks are amazing. Worth the price. Service is excellent. The music is always on point. We try and visit once an month.
No comment
No comment

Had dinner here with friends who are "out-of-towners". The food was very good, the space is beautiful. We were there for the early show which wasn't an overly stimulating performance, however it was just after New Years so a tough time for entertainment. The food and service could not have been better. Just keep in mind this is a cocktail/Scotch (bottles are displayed suspended above the venue; very cool wait staff climb ladders to get bottles) place wine is an afterthought with not a great selection. Fun place to go. I'll try the Flatiron Room next.

The reviews are right! This place was awesome. Went for an early dinner with my family. They made a pasta with red sauce for my vegetarian son even though it wasn't on the menu. Cocktails were amazing. Food was excellent. Service was impeccable. They even had five pages of single malt scotch, so I doubt anyone would be disappointed by the drink selection.
Very impressive! Excellent service, food, and jazz. The staff are incredibly welcoming and accommodating. Will return soon!
The food was incredibly bad, nothing at all what we expected! The ambiance is great and the drinks are very good, so if you want to go there just stay at the bar and go have dinner somewhere else.

What a great find!! Fine and Rare is exactly that the food is wonderful, the service is excellent and the ambiance is perfect. I had a great meal listening to world class jazz talent! Thanks again Fine and Rare!!

I would say my experience here was just okay. Given the friendly service and luxe ambiance, I wanted to love it here. To me, though, food is still the most important feature of a restaurant and it missed the mark for me. My nearly $30 bowl of vegetarian gnocchi was chewy and therefore difficult to eat. Couldn't finish the dish, but luckily there was some bread served alongside dinner that was accompanied by a delicious butter spread. That aside, the drinks were unique and the music was a nice touch.

Great evening with my girlfriend and another couple. The music is excellent and the smoke Old Fashioned are something special. I would give the food 4/4.5 stars but the rest of the experience puts it over the top.

I'm glad this business has remained open during Covid. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They helped me find a scotch I really enjoyed that I would not have otherwise ever planned to try. I would give the staff 5 stars. The atmosphere with the live music on a Saturday night in the middle of Covid was amazing... made you forget there is a pandemic going on. It was on the louder side so having a conversation with all 4 of us was difficult but it was nice to have live music. The reason I only give this place 3 stars is because the food was not very good. I went with 4 people and all of us were disappointed in our dishes. The steak I got had good seasoning but it was very tough. When I spend $40 plus on a steak I don't want to have to chew each bite 15 times or have to saw through it with the knife. My girlfriend has an allergy and we asked for the carrots to be served on a separate plate they put them on the same plate as the steak. The food was also on the saltier side, which made some of the meal difficult to eat. The drink selection and staff saved the night but I probably wouldn't order food here again.
No comment

This is a really awesome spot.  The atmosphere is very low key and sexy.  The live music is nice and adds to the vibe but isn't overwhelming.  Devin, the head of the cocktail program, is great, knowledgeable, professional, and helpful.  I think this place is a hidden gem that is in progress and I'd rather keep it hidden (because I hate crowds); however, I believe people should be aware of a good place.

Great place to hang out. I love the live jazz music and raw bar. Wonderful service. The servers are very attentive and always cleared used plates and cutlery quick. I definitely recommend the oysters and other items from the raw bar. They were very fresh. I had gotten the paella. It was filled with seafood and well seasoned, but the rice was a bit watery. I would recommend a different entree since there are better places for paella. I got the Fine and Rare Sphere. If you love desserts on the sweeter side, I would recommend it. The dessert was great and very good in the beginning, but it was a bit too sweet halfway through. I would have preferred the sphere to be made of dark chocolate and the liquid chocolate to the dark chocolate as well. This is my personal preference. It is a great take on a classic American dessert nonetheless.
No comment
Thanks to Dacha and Evelina and Tom and Greg our group had a wonderful evening. Loved the food and music. Thank you!

Not sure how this place has gotten such great reviews. My husband and I had dinner last night and while the jazz music was good, the food was sub par and the prices exorbitant. Don't waste your time on this place.

My girlfriend and I were in NYC for her birthday trip and I found this place while looking through Yelp for dinner ideas. I picked it because it seemed like a unique decor with live jazz and interesting cocktails. We were not disappointed! The decor feels very old-fashioned and has a very classy atmosphere. It was great having the live music while we ate and drank. We both ordered cocktails and enjoyed them both! The food was great as well, we both got the NY strip (which you could probably get away with just splitting) but it is very good! We also got a side of the Mac N' cheese which was definitely one of the highlights of our meal. Our server, Greg, provided excellent service. We would definitely come back to this place.
Amazing cocktails and incredible live jazz. Definitely a hidden gem and perfect for a date night.

I took a friend here for her birthday. I'd been before with a large group and quite liked the drinks. The live music is great and the songstress belted our some heartfelt tunes. My back was to the stage but my friend enjoyed it. We opted not to drink and just had dinner. I got the bolognese and she tried the fish (I think it was bass?). She liked it but didn't love it. I didn't try it as it was sitting on a bed of veggies which included bloody onions. My dish was fine. The pasta was a good consistency but the sauce left a lot to be desired. I actually put hot sauce in it to give it some flavour and that is blasphemy. Sigh. I really wanted to like it. We then had the creme brûlée which was the winner of the night. There were flecks of vanilla bean which leant it some complexity and bits of fruit on top. All in all I'd rate the dessert a 6/10 and the food 3.5/10 so average-ish. One nice touch is I mentioned to the waiter when I ordered the creme brûlée that it was my friends birthday and he brought out extra desert offerings with a candle. We really appreciated it (too bad the taste wasn't there). The two dishes and one dessert came out to 100 after tip. So meh. At least there's live music?
This is one of my favorite places in NYC! The decoration is incredible! There's a lot of history there. The food and cocktails are amazing!!!

This place was very full at 7:30pm on a Saturday. There would have been no room if we wanted a table for dinner without a reservation. We got seats at the bar, which gave us a nice view of the stage. There were two different jazz bands that came on that evening. Besides my friend and me, there was an older couple who seemed like regulars sitting at the bar, a young man having a drink alone, and a group of friends standing around and chatting. The tables seemed to be mostly filled with couples. The music was nice, and was quiet enough that people could still have conversations. They had a great selection of whiskeys, and the bartender had a lot of information about each of them. It looked like someone would climb up on a ladder when people ordered less-common drinks that weren't kept in the main bar area. I was served my 1792 Sweet Wheat Bourbon from the flask, and given a glass with water, a glass with ice, and an eyedropper to add water more carefully. My friend got a Penicillin (the cocktail, not the antibiotic), and it was very complex.
So glad I found this gem! The ambiance is excellent, the jazz is great and yet not better than the NY steak! Just delicious! A great place for a night out on the city that never sleeps
This is great for fancy date night and dinner with a corporate card. The jazz was fab and easy listening, whisky list was of course extensive but pricey! A refined place for the more mature crowd.
No comment
No comment
Cool place, jazz atmosphere is great!  Service was top notch.  Love the bourbon options and we didn't feel rushed by the staff even though we lingered long after dinner was finished.

BIG FAN of this new bar / jazz club.  If you've ever been to the Flatiron Room, it's very similar vibe, but a slightly bigger space I believe.  I met two colleagues here for drinks here after work and we really enjoyed the live music - it was similar to Nora Jones.  The drinks are pretty   pricey, so sip slowly or go on an expense account!

Modern classy establishment with great bar and table service. Jazz is a staple. We went here for Valentine's Day 2018. We enjoyed the ambiance, cocktail and wine service at the bar and food. It is a bit pricey as expected for a restaurant that coins themselves "Fine and Rare".

Ambiance and music was lovely. Great view of the jazz band and very nice decor. The bartender was great at explaining the different whiskeys in my flight and was very nice. Mixed drinks were weak. At the dinner table, the waiter forgot our appetizer, never answered our questions we had about an entree, and took forever to bring us the check. Food was mediocre. Paella had undercooked rice and was dry, pesto gnocchi was not very good either. The manager took 20% off the check but we felt that we were put up with and had to coax that out of him. Would not come back.

Great atmosphere and decor. The live jazz was so nice however I wish my husband could see the stage as his back was towards the stage. Not sure why they sat us there because there were better seats for both of us. The food was okay.
Place is great, love bringing people here to enjoy the live jazz. They play all the classics, the drinks are quality, and the food is great. Love it.

Went for a special birthday. Food was excellent , service was amazing. Chris made the night extra special. Chris's recommendation of the pork was spot on, pasta with Bolognese was delicious, Salmon was perfection. To top all of this off, there was amazing live jazz in such a cool old New York venue. Just go!
This place was beautiful. Servies was excellent also manager was very nice (-; highly recommand for dinner or drinks.
Had Christmas brunch here! GM Dasha is wonderful and took care of everybody in my party. I've been here several times and it has always excited my expectation.
Wonderful atmosphere. Great service and the music was terrific!  I highly recommend this special spot.
Undeniably pricey, this place is worth the price tag with a great atmosphere, cool decor and sensational cocktails.

Beautiful interior with matched small jazz combos make this restaurant a hidden gem. The service was great and the food delicious. Recommend setting a Saturday reservation for about 8:00 so you can catch the tail end of one band and the performance of a second one.
I celebrated my birthday here and the staff made sure my party was accommodated well. The cocktails were excellent, will definitely come back again.

Terrible service . The seats at the bar in the main space are about as uncomfortable as it gets. Waiters more interested in getting your credit card info than providing service. The hosts were dazed and confused. The food is mediocre. Fifteen minutes to get one drink.

Go for the single malts. They have a huge selection and offer flights of some very special scotch whisky. Enjoy the appetizers, skip the mains. Stay for the music and the space, it's comfortable and live jazz is always a treat. Don't sit at one of the raised tables. Too confining. Ask for a table near the fireplace.

I went here for my birthday brunch with some friends for the Sunday jazz brunch, and it was a very nice venue. There was live music playing while we sat at a table in front of the fireplace which helped since it was pretty chilly outside! My group wasn't feeling very adventurous with the drinks, so we didn't end up trying any of the cocktails, and mainly ordered separate dishes for ourselves. It does take a SUPER long time for the food to come out, so I'd recommend getting cocktails to help pass the time, or come with the expectation that you'll be waiting at least 30-45 minutes for your food to come out. To their defense, I think they were trying to get all of the dishes out at the same time...but the flatbreads for example does not take that long to prepare in my opinion! Overall, still a great place to dine.
No comment
No comment
What a wonderful experience with an amazing jazz group!! Wait staff was excellent and food was pretty good. Loved the interiors with clever art deco vibe.  Highly recommend it!
World class whisky and bourbon bar.  A bit pricey but great late nigh after dinner joint.

We came for a date night - this spot is absolutely perfect for that, or perfect for an intimate work dinner. The staff and atmosphere was amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly and once the music started getting going around 9, it was a great time. The drinks, as you can expect, are not cheap but are well made. The bartenders are knowledgeable and all of the ingredients are fresh. I was a bit disappointed by the food. We shared the salmon - which was a tad dry and lacked flavor, and the steak-which was a bit fatty. We also had the Brussels sprouts - very good, and the French fries (to die for). Overall a great experience, just wish those main entrees blew our socks off the way the atmosphere did.

We came here for Brunch on a summer Sunday. The atmosphere is pretty awesome...there was a jazz band playing--a cello, singer, and piano that really made the experience. We ordered a few different dishes. My fiance and I got the baked eggs and our cousins got the steak and eggs and the french toast. The clear winner was the french toast--it just smelled so good, but around the table, most of the dishes were quite liked. There was a minor snag with my dish--the eggs were a bit overdone when they came to the table so the chef re-fired the order, which was nice and appreciated. In the meanwhile, they brought a round of sample bloody mary's and comped us a dessert since the second dish took so long to remake (it's a baked dish, so I understand). Over all, service was excellent--Lauren our server understood the issue and was quick to fix. I would definitely come back here as the cocktails at the table were a hit (mimosa and highlander) and again, the music and the ambiance were stellar.

Service was amazing.  Servers were very attentive and helpful with recommendations not only for food, but for drinks.  Their cocktails were all amazing though my favorite of the night was their burbon old fashioned with smoked cherry wood.  The food was also impeccable with all of it coming out in good time and the tomahawk steak was done perfectly.  I highly recommend the truffle fries.  Great for a date night as the jazz provided great ambiance.
Everything from the cocktails to the food are amazing!!!  The atmosphere and live music make it a great night!!!!

I came here for NYE dinner. I love that they do coat check! The atmosphere is great! The decor is beautiful. There was a Post Modern Jukebox-esque band playing that was very good. Everything about this place was above average except the food. The food wasn't bad, however, I have had better food for a much cheaper price.
Great place in Midtown for a late night bite, a tasty craft cocktail, and good chill music.
No comment

The server was very engaging and very nice. Went there for a birthday lunch. Was very quiet and has a nice ambiance. This place is legit what the names says "fine & rare" they have these interesting art pieces placed around the restaurant. Food was a perfect portion for myself and it was delish!

On our last night  3/24 in New York we ran across Fine and Rare.   What a find!!! This is New York at its finest.  Great music, outstanding food and amazing drinks.  If only that was all that mattered but the over the top service and bartender were the best.  Thank you for making out trip end on a high note.

This place was exactly as expected. Great value for a high end steak/seafood restaurant. The branzino fish was just okay, the duck was exquisite. The ambience was excellent and romantic. it is a bit too loud to talk comfortably. also very close to other tables, can hear noth conversations. The live jazz musicians were perfect. The old fashioned drink was to die for. the bartender poured a horrible guiness. i gave 4 because was not however would give a 4.8

SURPRISE! We ended up here, not knowing what they were, after another place had a one hour wait. That was one of the better surprises in a long time. Spotlessly clean, soft lighting, friendly greeting. Live Music, No Cover Charge. Real Sweet-Voiced Singers. Four excellent dinners: steak, tofu, chicken, paella. Nice wine selection, plus mixed drinks. We cannot wait for our next visit. Easily accessible from the Q.

Time Out New York published a glowing review of the cocktails, decor, and other refinements at this place shortly after they opened, and I happened to read it yesterday while plotting a visit to an art gallery in the vicinity. My partner and I stopped in last night (a Saturday around 8pm) and really enjoyed ourselves. It's a large, upscale space with a very unique setup, including an ample stage for their wonderful jazz bands and singers. Coat check is complimentary and the hostess who greeted us seemed lovely. I ordered the Smoking Rum Old Fashioned with mesquite smoke (their signature cocktail and an olfactory marvel) and the Tim Tucker for my partner and I to share...somewhat unevenly because it was delicious and he is nice. Our server was extremely cool, too. I look forward to visiting again once the full menu is available, if not sooner.

At Fine & Rare last night to celebrate my husband's birthday.  It was a perfect night from start to finish.  We started with a Whiskey and Cheese pairing in their tasting room.  Jordan, the tastemaster, did a fantastic job. After that we had a great dinner - shared the Octopus app. and had Pappardelle Bolognese & Faroe Island Salmon for main courses.  All were excellent.  The live jazz was outstanding - Brian Newman's Quintet. This was a perfect evening that I highly recommend.  Finally, what made the night really special was Dasha, the GM.  She made sure our night was perfect every step of the way.  She knows what good service is and how to deliver it.  Thanks Dasha for making the night even more special.
No comment

Great venue, love the decor. Watermelon pomegranate arugula burrata salad appetizer was delicious, but the nocoise salad was flavorless. Steak was overcooked and fries were hard to eat (not fried crispy, but not in any means soft either). In summary, food was subpar. As far as service, thirty minutes to get water, an hour to get one appetizer, another hour for entree and an extra 30 minutes to get an added side of fries. Either the kitchen needs to get its shit together, or the restaurant needs more staff on the floor because my waiter had major bags under his eyes and looked like he hadn't slept in days. I had high hopes for this place but not even the live jazz performance can save this place.

I was lucky enough to be a guest here and was amazed by the walls of whiskey from wall to wall from floor to ceiling. I don't know how expensive the drinks are but as I said I was fortunate to be a guest and its probably the most extensive whiskey bar I've ever been in. The food was good as well, its a really fun place that just amazes.

they have live jazz every evening!  Fine & Rare is a cozy spot, with great drinks, fresh ingredients & friendly staff. the only drawback, for me, is its price tag.  go before everyone discovers this place!
Wonderful time! Food, drinks and atmosphere was great! Jazz playing through dinner and the mescal Manhattan was terrific! Gotta try....

Came to celebrate our anniversary. LOVELY. Mid century vibe, in both the menu and the live music and decor. The food was amazing and the service was attentive. A GEM of relaxation and quality in the middle of a busy city. We will be returning the next time I'm in NYC.
I love this restaurant! It's perfect for a date night. Talented jazz band, delicious food, and great drinks! Get the lamb chops if they're on special when you're there!!
Atmosphere great, musicians wonderful but the food was flavorless and overpriced.

Went here with a large group for dinner. Food was delicious. Scallops and carpaccio were very good. Chicken was fantastic. Steak was very tender and delicious. The desserts were great too.. my favorite was the sphere dessert- delicious! The restaurant has a cool vibe and the jazz singers made it a really nice experience.

Just went to jazz brunch here and it was so delicious. I had the salmon Benedict possibly the best I have ever had, with perfectly poached eggs, melt in your mouth lox, a hint of dill and a delicate hollandaise sauce over crispy potato pancakes. My son enjoyed the pancakes and we finished it off with a warm lava cake whose molten center would make Master Chef proud. All this while seated in a beautiful banquette, watching a talented jazz trio on stage, and surrounded by a warm and inviting decor that looks like a restored jazz club from a bygone era. Even if this place did not have music the prices would still be a steal for a fancy proper brunch.
Great service, great scene, great Booze and wonderful tuna poke! All around great! Came for my boyfriends birthday! Highly recommend
I really love this place. Kinda hiding place. Amazing food and the drink "eaten of garden" is yummy. We like jazz and trying go there and relax my evening. Definitely recommend.

We had a delightful time while visiting NYC.  Our server Fahed was absolutely the best. He described the menu to us in detail and answered every single one of our questions. We had the best service. The truffle fries were phenomenal. The music was beautiful. The entire experience was exactly what we needed. Thanks Fahed!
Rose and the cheese platter hit the spot. Devin was amazing company... def a great place to stop into if you're in the neighborhood... and if you LOVE whiskey!!
Just had a lovely birthday dinner here. Everything was absolutely perfect from start to finish! It truly made my day! Can wait to come back!
Wonderful ambience, entertaining live jazz music, great food, extensive selection of scotch and even better service. Dasha, the manager, helped make our 5 year anniversary very memorable!

We came in here for drinks on a Monday night. The bartender who served us was very good. The drinks we ordered were absolutely delicious. The vibe and ambience is great for a nice drink or a romantic date night. It's also a wonderful place for whiskey lovers! There's also live jazz playing which added so much to our experience. Will definitely be back here!

This is my second time at this restaurant and I went back because the food was amazing, the atmosphere reminds me of the 50s, very classic, live jazz, great place to have scotch and listen to live music. Presentation of food was impressive. I would not suggest this place for steak specifically, I thought steak was ok because I have been to many steakhouses and top of my list would be River Palm in NJ, Peter Luger, and Del Frisco's to name a few BUT they do have amazing appetizers which were delicious. I would definitely go back.

Had a long overdue reunion with some grad school friends.  Food, drinks and service were decent, but we were seated right next to the stage at the base of the short set of steps used by the performers to get on and off the stage even though the restaurant was not full.  There were plenty of other empty tables available the entire night.  We had to get up out of our seats and move our chairs and ourselves out of the way each time the performers had to get on or off, take intermission, or move their instruments on or off the stage.  This happened at least 6 times between the two bands performing. We weren't there long enough for the 2nd band's intermission; otherwise, we would've had to move at least 3-4 more times factoring in the intermission and the end of the 2nd set.  To add insult to injury, two of us were pushed back into the alcove such that we could not see the stage or performers at all.  Putting a table, chairs and diners right in front of the steps while the stage is in use is clearly a NYC Fire Code violation and ruined what was supposed to be a nice night with friends who hadn't seen each other in a few years.  For the amount of money we spent, we could've had a much more enjoyable, uninterrupted time at any of the other upscale restaurants in the city.
No comment

Cool new spot. Very nice interior and very cozy atmosphere. Talented and great live music performers everyday. Big alcohol selection and you can even buy your own bottle of liquor and come drink it any time you want. Can't wait when they will open full dinner menu.
No comment

This is a great spot for a decadent night listening to some great performers. The food is just okay, nothing mind blowing, but the atmosphere really makes up for it. I'd definitely go back for the pleasure of live music in a beautiful space. Check it out!

Had a meeting on 5th Ave. and needed a quick lunch prior to. Stopped in to Fine & Rare knowing nothing about the restaurant. The food was excellent. It was a quiet Monday so I had a lot of attention from the staff. I'll definitely return one evening for more good food and live jazz. This obe's a keeper.
Impeccable service, food & dessert, great ambiance and the music was phenomenal. Wonderful experience. I cannot wait to go back.
Fantastic food and service! From The live jazz music, to the decor and the whole vibe in here is great. The drinks are so delicious! Me and my friends will definitely be back!

Excellent spot for drinks, and a great jazz vibe to go along with your smokey whisky concoction. Thoroughly trained & attentive staff. The food choices on the menu were good, though there's not an extensive food menu to begin with.

Visited the city for daughters birthday. She located Fine & Rare and we went there for brunch   What a fabulous time. The food was fantastic and the music was wonderful. Highly suggest going!!  We will return once we return to the city!!
Great ambiance, music was great, food was great, cocktails too notch! Cooper was an amazing attentive server! Really loved the whole overall experience from entering to exiting! Highly recommend.

Not really for dinner. To big and your easily forgotten. It kind of misses on any style they were going for. Yeah you get the friends of the owners giving good reviews but it there few to begin with you have a un popular resturaunt who's owner doesn't have many friends = Not to friendly. Michael,

Service was TERRIBLE !!! Food was ok, awesome drink list. Music was amazing and  he only reason this place has customers is my guess the live music. Shameful to charge this much for food and rush hour paying guests out. We had apps dinner, a bottle of wine, dessert and We had to tell our waiter to leave us alone while we finished our after dinner drinks. Stop harassing your paying customers and focus on your service and quality of food.

We had a wonderful experience at the Fine and Rare jazz brunch on Sunday!  The service was perfect. Our server did not rush us and was so pleasant and friendly as we celebrated a birthday. The music was fantastic and just the right volume to enjoy but still converse. We sat in a spacious booth and the atmosphere was elegant but comfortable which is rare indeed. I would highly recommend this place and look forward to coming back again soon!
Fantastic experience. The team are so welcoming and warm and the jazz band was next level. Had such a great night, thank you! Will define be back.
Beautiful brunch. Food was beautiful. Staff attentive and friendly. Soft French Jazz made for a unforgettable morning.
The ambiance was perfect, the jazz was perfect, the whiskey selection was perfect, and the overall experience was perfect. It was far exceeded my expectations.

Cute little jazz spot right in Midtown. We went before the happy hour rush came in on so it was quiet when we first got there. Nice live jazz and great cocktails. I do wish the stage was a tad bigger.
No comment
No comment

I loved this place! The Jazz was a wonderful accompaniment to our dinner and conversation. Cocktails were amazing!  The manager Natasha treated us like special guests all evening.  I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys great food and drink with some live music.  Also, loved the atmosphere.

Ambiance is great and jazz band is lively. However, the food was greasy and subpar to say the least. The brussel sprouts were swimming in oil and undercooked, and the burger was wet with grease and overcooked. Way overpriced for what you're getting.

My girl friends and I celebrate our birthday every January, and I picked this restaurant because it served Restaurant Week menu. We got to sit at one of best table in the restaurant because we mentioned to the hostess Izzy that we're celebrating our birthdays. We enjoyed the live entertainment with very attentive waiter Fahed. The restaurant manager Mark came by the table several times to make sure we're enjoying the food and service. I mentioned my pork chop was a little over cooked. He immediately requested a new plate for me. Then he surprised us with desserts and champagne for our birthday! Great great service and food all the way! Can't wait to bring more friends s and clients to the restaurant again!!
We were seated at 11:00 and the kitchen stayed open for us.  Great atmosphere, good food and music!
Over rated and over priced. Service is terrible. Bartenders are slow as molasses and rude. Prices are out of control for a mediocre bar.  Never again.

Wonderful place for a date night or entertaining guests. Extensive fine drink selection and delicious cocktails. Food was very tasty (loved the vegetable tagine!) and the atmosphere was wonderful. Got to see two different live jazz performances during our meal. They were both spectacular! A unique experience and my boyfriend and I had such a great time!

A place with live music and good cocktails is rare in NYC these days.   Got there around 5:30 and they already had performers on the stage. The cocktails here are quite good. They don't come cheap but cocktails are made very well. We had the Ginger Brenner House, Highlander, a flight of Scotch Explorer, and the Smokey Old Fashioned. As for food, I would skip it. The pork chop we ordered was on the tough side but acceptable. However the sides, truffle fries and French lentils were subpar. We told the staff about the non truffle tasting truffle fries and they took it back to the kitchen. When they brought it back, I thought there would be some hint of truffle taste. There was NONE. So we didn't eat any fries. Onto the French lentils. One word. BLAND. We asked for the manager and brought this up with her. She apologized and made things right.  I would prob stick with cocktails and music but nevertheless service was great and they did what they had to in order to smooth things over. I would def come back for the music and the cocktails. The two different groups playing were quite good. The first group was better but the second wasn't bad either. The cocktails were done right. Our Scotch flight was presented well. They brought six glasses and then a caddy with all the Scotch to be poured. The guy pouring was pretty knowledgeable and we had a good flight! They also have other flights like tequila, rum,etc.

I loved the experience. Music was wonderful. When the band took breaks, the ambience music was a little too loud and a completely different genre which threw off the vibe. The food was excellent, scallops and salmon. The service was very attentive, but felt overly rushed. The main dish was served right when the appetizer plates were picked up. We wanted to enjoy the music but felt very rushed by all the staff. I would recommend spacing the dishes out more and not have staff hovering over the table..

My family and I came in for Father's Day brunch and I must say the service here is outstanding! Since the moment we walked in we were warmly greeted by the host Letty. The manager Masha personally walked us to our table and made sure we were comfortable and had a clear view of the stage. She constantly came over to make sure we had our food and drinks and that we were happy with our service she is a lovely person and very funny and sweet. She really cares about her job and most importantly the customers. Our server Greg came over to take our orders and when we couldn't decide on drinks or our meal he was very helpful and knowledgeable such a great guy and very funny aswell! Amanda the bar manager personally brought out my drink and let me tell you the drink was spectacular and made exactly how I asked. The food and drinks were all amazing and the dessert was even better!!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family!

2.5 stars. Food was sub par. For appetizers my boyfriend had the tomato salad which had waaay too much balsamic vinegar and I had the arugula salad which was ok. For our main course he had the paella which he said was ok, not great, and I had the Greek grain bowl which was 80% quinoa and had hardly any beans. They also ran out of tofu when I was there. So basically we paid $20 for a huge bowl of quinoa. The ambience is very weird. When the jazz band wasn't playing, they had songs that sounded like techno/electronic music blasting. Totally confusing. Would come back for the whiskey classes, but the prices are too high for the average food.

We fit this visit in between matinee Hamilton and Billy Joel at MSG.  Wish we had more time, because we certainly would stayed longer.  Loved it. Awesome cocktails... smoked rye old fashioned was fabulous. Had we stayed longer I wild definitely had another.  Music was wonderful.  We sat by the fireplace and it was not too loud so you could still carry conversation easily. Just right.  Food was outstanding, much better than I was expecting as we first planned this as a cocktail/music stop. We shared scallop appetizer and I had Duo of Duck.  Excellent!  We'll be back!
Music was great! But my drink was awful and food was cold sent back twice and still came back cold definitely won't be coming back

We came here for brunch on Xmas eve. They had a live band which was a nice touch. However, the food was less than appealing. The bread that they served was almost stale, I couldn't even chew it. My lobster roll was covered in mayo, a little sour and was probably only 2 tablespoons worth. My husband's baked eggs sounded amazing on the menu but was also disappointing when it was served - it was over cooked. Expensive and a waste of money.

This place is awesome.  The only thing holding is back is the service.  Unrefined, unenthusiastic, and just a little sloppy.  Food was excellent and the setting just phenomenal.  If they could give your staff a little "refinement"'to match everything else, you'll have a real winner.

Amazing place to take clients and impress the best of friends. Great place to get the deal done and celebrate birthdays. My favorite part? The amazing selection of rare drink.  Whiskey, tequila, and rum; all amazing stuff
Nice decor. Went on a weekday after work.  Great scene with nice music. Drinks are a amazing.

This is good place to go for transection of food and music but realize a bit of compromise on each.  There is no cover however the food and drink prices reflect this, but overall a reasonable value.  We were politely accommodated with a table near the music.  This is a small intimate venue and perfect for a romantic date night.  I would not necessarily recommend for multiple couples.   We arrived 8 30 and saw both bands.  The later band was definitely more professional so we would tend to come back for drinks and snacks rather than full dinner.  Would certainly recommend the meat dishes over the others.  We thought the wine pours a bit small so would suggest a bottle.  The service was attentive and certainly they made you feel welcome to leisurely listen to the music. We will be back.

This place has a wonderfully 1950s atmosphere complete with ambient lighting and modern flair. The music is great. We tried their rib eye steak which was quite accompanied by some satisfying sides. The real star though were the expert drinks. Highly recommend the Smokey old fashioned.

We went to this restaurant on the advice of the hotel concierge.  We went for Sunday jazz brunch, and were not disappointed.  I loved the old New York feel of the place, and the warm fire was welcome on a bitterly cold day.  Service was attentive, but not overbearing.  The cocktail menu was expansive and interesting.  I had a classic Bloody Mary, which could have been a tad spicier.  The brunch menu is diverse, with items ranging from classic breakfast items to interesting sandwiches and salads, to seafood towers.  I had the Laphroaig cured smoked salmon Eggs Benedict, which consisted of two perfectly poached eggs over a small slice of salmon on potato-leek pancakes.  The Hollandaise was yummy, but I had a little difficulty finding the salmon.  It came with a fresh arugula salad as a side.  My companion had the Seafood Cobb salad, which was topped with a egenerous portion of crab, lobster, and shrimp along with usual bacon, blue cheese, and avocado. 2 deviled eggs were the accompaniment.  The jazz trio was lovely and added to the ambiance. We will definitely plan a return visit when we're back in NYC.

Looked too stuffy at first but is quite chill inside.  Small party having the rum and whiskey flight and good conversation. Great date place.  Good mix of people. Live music was soothing.  Service was impeccable. Would come again.

Amazing cocktails with a great ambiance and live music.  Staff was very attentive- greeted at the door and found seats for us at the bar. Not crowded which was surprising bc the whole set up (fire place, decor, jazz) is kind of perfect. Drinks are a tad bit expensive.
This place probably has my favorite food! The flatbreads are amazing, the owner is super nice and I will defiantly be back!
Wow. Super evening this place just sticks out as so different. Drinks were awesome.Food was unique and tasty.. Entertainment made the evening special. We will be back for sure

Great food, drinks, staff and overall vibe! My favorite drink was the smoked old fashioned. Although there are only small plates available, they are very filling and delicious. I'll definitely be back!

Let's just say that finding this gem was the highlight of my NYC trip... not only was the atmosphere classy, the service and food was exceptional. Im not one to do things twice in NYC but I'll definitely be returning to fine and rare. Thank you for a memorable jazz experience

Mediocre. This place is charming and inviting but the price tag for a cocktail is a little too high when you're positioned in midtown east where everyone is looking for a happy hour special regardless of their age. I'd give it another try but overall not blown away. Service was pushy and rushed; was being asked if I wanted another drink when I was two sips in...clearly a slow night.

What a terrific experience at Fine and Rare! It's clear the proprietors have put a lot of thought and care into this establishment, with quality details from decor to music, cocktails, spirits, and a satisfying food menu. Tasty drinks and small plates, and superb service. Our server Ben took excellent care of us. Perfect for date night or a relaxed evening with friends.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for dinner Friday night. Cute place with interesting painting on the wall. The escargot and tuna was good. Our entree of the beef and the surf and turf was not enough for two people. Me and my friend ordered more. The staff was super friendly. So we ordered another appetizer and entree. The octopus and shrimp entree with the foie gras appetizer. We still think the appetizers were the best part of the dinner. The entrees were disappointing. The lava cake dessert was more like a chocolate bread with tiny bit of chocolate inside. The music was a bit loud and it felt like we were in a club. Hard to hear each other. The surf and turf the scallops were warm but the pork belly on it was cold. The size of the octopus in the entree was tiny compare to the salad. Would come back for the appetizers but not the entrees.
No comment

Delicious delicious French restaurant with great cocktails and tapas. I ordered the ouco buco which was great in a creamy mushroom sauce. The meat was real tender and fed off the bone! For drinks I had an espresso martini one of the best I have had excellent and chilled to perfection. Service was quality. The hip hop music playing in the background was not excepted at first but was a nice soundtrack to dinner!

Great food and drinks here! A nice, informal spot to grab dinner with friends. We had the French Bellini, daiquiri, bread, burrata, onion soup, mushroom risotto, pork belly, gratin cauliflower, and some other dishes I can't recall. The only dish that anyone critiqued was the onion soup; the rest was delicious. Our server was kind and efficient, it was easy to make a reservation, and prices were fairly reasonable. It was a little warm in the restaurant but that might have been because we were right next to a heated water pipe. I would come back!

Stopped by quickly to kill time while my friends and I were waiting for Attaboy (across the street). We got some small bites and a round of drinks and it was such a fun atmosphere. Would love to come back to try some more foods. The cocktail menu was expansive!
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: My favorite go to place ! You can get a beautiful espresso martini (as featured in GOTHAM magazine) and a beautiful sea food salad for a great price. The staff are super friendly , they accommodate you and will never have you waiting for a drink. The atmosphere artsy, fun, and young ! Start your night here whenever your in the lower east side , you won't regret ;)
No comment
No comment
No comment

You haveee to try the escargot here!! It's absolutely delicious and it tastes reallyy good with the bread! I also ordered the Roasted Octopus Chorizo, Mushroom Risotto and Roasted Ribs Basque Chimichuri. The octopus was not rubbery and had great flavor, the ribs were cooked to perfection and fell off the bone and the risotto was hearty and creamy. Overall, the food and service were great; definitely recommend this restaurant!
No comment
Way too crowded, the staff treated people poorly. Don't even bother. Would do zero if I could.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cute and cozy atmosphere. Dishes are small and pricey. Their meat dishes are a bit overcooked but tasty. Staff is friendly

Great food & cocktails. Abraham the bartender was so pleasant and he made fire pineapple daiquiris and whiskey sours. Foiegras was delicious along with the escargot. Only recommendation was to have an option of the escargot without the pastry puff (I apologize I'm a purist). Prices are more than reasonably and amazing friendly staff. Btw open on Christmas Day (the day I went). Will be returning, definitely a gem.
No comment
