No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is amazing!! their espresso martinis are superb but the service here is truly something else. Shoutout abraham and everyone who works here. I've brought different friends here and they all are amazed by how accommodating and friendly they are here. ilyyyyyyy

Came back to Lena just 2 days ago and I tried the baked Camembert with mushroom and truffle oil, steak, and duck crostini. I also got the kir royal french cocktail to drink. I really enjoyed everything but I actually wasn't too crazy about the duck crostini. The duck crostini was more of an aged duck on top of the bread with a good dallop of honey. The baked camembert with mushroom and truffle oil was soo good. Melty cheese with a good amount of mushroom and the delectable taste of truffle. The steak was also really good and the mashed potatoes that came along with it were soft and yummy! The kir royal was a nice light and sparkling drink!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food is delicious, the cocktails are really good too!! Can't really go wrong when you come here. We tried the burrata, roasted octopus, mushroom risotto and had a few cocktails. My go to when I'm in LES

Came here for a night cap with a group of 6. So, I can't comment on the food. We just had one round of simple drinks. All good. This review is for the chastising that my wife received from the bartender for wearing a mask. The second we walked in, he yelled "no masks here!" We assumed he was just joking. After a few seconds he yelled repeatedly, "we don't like masks here!" After being in shock at the moment, my wife asked "you like Trump?" He said "yeah I like Trump, Biden is raising my taxes." Truly a weird exchange, and one that should've never been initiated by the bartender as soon as we walked in.
No comment

I've been here a few times and thought it may become a les staple for me. However last time I went there with my friend - 2 weeks ago..I had the worst experience with the bartender. My friend and I enjoyed our first round of drinks and asked for a second, the bartender (I forget his name now, but he had dreadlocks) makes my friend their drink. 10 min later I ask for my drink, he gets angry and throws out my friends drink because I couldn't tell he was busy. I shouldn't have to wait an additional 10 minutes after my friends drink was made to have my drink and by no way should a bartender take your drink and throw it out. Even if they are having a bad day this is unacceptable. Luckily one of the other staff members calmed down the situation- also why I am leaving a 2 star review vs something less.
No comment
No comment

Our group sat at the bar Friday night and had round after round of fantastic cocktails. I think the name of the bartender who chatted and took good care of us was Abraham. We didn't eat but it smelled like garlic and tables had small plates of food. Will definitely be going back.
Food over rating the pizza is a crappy pizza and they came back to force you to tip them what they want. Never coming back
No comment

I will return for the French martini and duck confit appetizer.  Watermelon mojto (non-alcoholic) looked good.  Pleasant outdoor seating on the street -- high walls kept wind away .  Only one bathroom. Service is on the slow side so don't be in a rush.
No comment
Adorable spot with coffee up to 4pm and then drinks in the evening. Extremely charming and so sweet when we got stuck in the rain and needed a place to wait.
No comment
No comment

I'm so glad I found this somewhat "lowkey" brunch spot. The food was great and the serve was great as well. I got the scallops, Alla carbonara pasta, Savoyard pizza, and escargot. I recommend the scallops, pasta, and pizza (rich creamy yogurt flavor. Definitely on the stronger side) but I highly recommend it!
No comment

I came here with my family for a mother's dinner. We made reservations The food was definitely worth waiting for really loved the beet salad and the pizzas they had. The waiters were very sweet. My experience overall went pretty well it's a little wait for food but it was understandable. Really like the decoration inside.
LOVE LENA! best drinks, great environment, friendly staff, and the customers are just the best people.
No comment
I really loved the food I had at LENA. Service was great and the Cajun pasta was fantastic. I also had the créeme brûlée, which was great. The meal was a little on the pricey side, but it's worth it.
It was our first time back in NYC since Covid and we couldn't have picked a better spot. Hard to judge which was the best part because the staff, food and drinks were amazing. Great job Lena.
Fun place! We only had drinks (which were proper!) Great vibe and food looked amazing. Will definitely come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Far exceeded all expectations! Delicious cocktails, and the service was incredible! Sam took great care of us, and we would absolutely come back again. If I could give this place a 10 I would!

The food was amazing! The Brie with rosemary and honey, the cauliflower cacio e Pepe, the octopus, the creme brûlée was incredible and the service superb. We also had a lovely bottle of petit Chablis which was perfect with our dinner!

When I made the reservation at LĒNA, I almost canceled it because I found out that I was living 45 minutes from the restaurant. It was a great pleasures to find this hidden wonder! I was impressed by the service and the meal we  were served. My brothers and me had a great time catching up. "If you never tried some French food, you will be delighted to be at this place."

Came here for an early Valentine's Day dinner. We had to sit inside because outdoor seating is only for more than 2 people. Was excited to try this place out based on reviews. Unfortunately it was rly cold inside the restaurant that I just wanted to finish my food and leave. Service is amazing though. I ordered the beef dish and I rly enjoyed it. My husband ordered the pesto flatbread but he said it was just ok. I would have to say drinks are overpriced and I would expect them to be amazing but my French Bellini tasted very artificial.
Cute French wine bar with wide ranging food menu.  Great vibe.  Nice outdoor seating.  Super food, drink and service.  Very low hipster quotient for LES.

The outdoor dining igloos are a nice touch, well lit and heated. The cocktails were nice and strong and the service was good. I enjoyed the dishes but they didn't seem entirely French, more a little like French fusion.

First time in NYC and accidentally found this place, best experience me and my wife had in New York period!!!! Pierre (owner) give us best experience!!!and food on whole another level too!!! Thanks Pierre we will b back soon Yan and Alina

Truly a top quality bar and restaurant. Came here after after going to the sip and paint place next door. Not sure if the gentleman with the dreadlocks was the owner, but he deserves a lot of credit. He showed me and my family members an amazing time on our cousins birthday. Drinks and food were top notch. We took the business card to make sure we make our way back from jersey and even as far as Connecticut! 12 out of 10. Keep doing great guys!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stumbled upon Lena while out for a post-birthday dinner stroll in search of a relaxed romantic scene for a glass of wine and dessert. Lena could just as easily be nestled amidst similar cobblestoned Parisian streets and you'd be hard pressed to tell the difference. The inviting staff (Sebastian) treated us as if famille- the scene developed into the care free and easy summer evenings of our youth, watching the staff (and a few patrons) take turns playing catch with a Yankees apparel adorned boy, just barely 5 years old, while his mother sipped wine and enjoyed the evening. Glasses of 2015 Bordeaux came and went, as did the warm glazed rosemary roasted Brie and a light-as-air creme brûlée. The stressed days of COVID, vaccines, and travel restrictions seemed like years behind us as we traveled, if only for a couple hours, to another time and place altogether.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Beautiful wine bar with nice drinks! The staff were very considerate and genuinely nice, and the drinks were both refreshing and well-made, without being too sweet. Love it!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my new spot! The food is so amazing! Service so amazing. Abraham out does himself. I have a preference issue with creamy textures and he literally went through all of my choices with me based of cream level and then catered the one o chose to my preference. He also remembered us the next time we came back. The experience is so appreciated esp during corona times! Will be back ASAP.

I love this place! I only came for drinks, so I can't speak to the food menu, but the decor is incredible and they my favorite margarita (order their spicy margarita!) in all of NYC. If you're meeting a small group of friends for drinks, this is the spot!
No comment

Good place for a catch up with friends. I probably wouldn't  pick it to go on a date as it gets busy and loud but as a restaurant it's actually quite nice. I went there for dinner on a Friday night with a friend. We had some red wine, cheese, pizzetta and a chocolate lava cake. The food was very tasty. Service was attentive and friendly. I will most likely return.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Escargot was excellent margaritas were strong and flavorful, nut and olive dish was a surprising snack. Best part was the art by the restroom. Would eat here again.
No comment

A surprise find. Loved having wine here, it was like drinking at a friend's place (minus the couch, plus more than a few tables). Warm service. Stop by if you're in the neighborhood, or need a spot to take a date.

A welcoming, friendly, beautiful, romantic French wine bar!  The food is incredible - boeuf bourguignon!! The cheese selection! And they will guide you toward your perfect wine! Whether you want to sit at the bar and have interesting conversations with your fellow patrons while enjoying a small snack, or meet 8 of your best friends for dinner and drinks, or have a romantic meal à deux, Lena is the place! Every time I walk in there, I can't help but smile!! And, I'm always reluctant to leave! My fave place in NYC!
No comment

This is an excellent, cozy wine bar. I came with a group of 8 on Friday night. We made a reservation which I would recommend. We did a few bottles of wines and lots and lots of small plates. The food was amazing. And our server was great about making recommendations. The prices were also great. For being such a large group and ordering as much as we did, the bill was totally reasonable. I highly recommend for your next date night or wine night with friends.
No comment

Everything here is so so good. You have to get the  Duck Crostini!! They also have such great service here. Came here for brunch but ordered off their regular menu. Must visit! Outdoor dining is very cute as well. The staff here go above and beyond!

Loved this place! Came here with a friend before a concert and, embarrassingly, we pretty much tried everything on the menu. The meatballs and beef bourguignon were terrific. The bone marrow in particular was mmwhah chef's kiss! My friend didn't love the octopus but that was the only sour note. We got there pretty early in the evening and before it got busy we had pretty much every waiter in the place checking on us, which was more humorous than anything else. Overall great food, nice atmosphere and good service.

We were celebrating my birthday and Pierre was an amazing host, him and the staff were so patient while we waited for our party but still checked in and gave us ample time to review the menu. The wine selection is great and food options were amazing. We went with the chicken, beef bourguignon, octopus and a variety of appetizers including the potatoes au gratin. All the food was tasty, fresh and delivered hot! Pierre also have us a wonderful birthday celebration with a lava cake and Prosecco! What a great end to a wonderful evening. Highly recommend going here, you will not be disappointed!

I've never had a full meal here, but the cocktails are excellent and the employees are very friendly and kind. They have great coffee, and their outdoor dining situation is comfortable, well-spaced, and protected from the rain.
Great place. Service is amazing and so is the food. Nice ambiance. Definitely going to be going again!
Really lovely experience here! Food was wonderful, the service so accommodating and friendly and fun atmosphere. My fave was the burrata and the bourguignon was delicious! Lovely place to dine.
Very nice atmosphere. Good for a romantic date or an intimate group gathering. Had the Bourdeaux and enjoyed it. Pierre and staff were very welcoming and friendly.
No comment

The food was terrible. Literally terrible. Everything we order was bland and poorly done. The escargot was horrible and didn't even have snails in all the shells. We had to ask for bread for our charcuterie and duck rillette tasted like garbage. We will not be coming back. Ever.

column3: Town of Brookhaven, Long Island, NY
column6: We hold an speed dating event here. Very romantic space, great wine, food, music and service. Very great experience!!! I will recommend you to come for date. Romantic as Paris!

I have meant to write this review since October but time has gotten away from me. I had my 40th birthday lunch here and it was really such a great experience. From the planning to the execution, I could not have been happier. The food is delish (people keep talking about the Cauliflower gratin) and the service was perfect. It is a very cute and rustic vibe with beautiful artwork all around you. Whether you are planning a party or just having a meal, I highly recommend. Thank you for making my birthday so memorable :)

We went for a late dinner on a Wednesday night. Great food and service. We tried La Bourguignonne Tarte Flambé , Escargot and Scallops, also had some burrata salad. Everything was beautifully presented and delicious. Finished our meal off with some Creme Brûlée and Sauterne Dessert wine. We will definitely be recommending this place to everyone.

Cozy place, romantic atmosphere, friendly service. I've only been twice, but I already love it. The wine has been good both times, as was the food. The first time my boyfriend and I got a "choose four" charcuterie board- we chose brie, a sheep's milk cheese, chorizo and duck. The board was also served with nuts, honey and fruit. The second time we did grilled brie (I think) which came served over toasted bread. So good and I highly recommend it!
No comment

The hostess is beyond rude... will not be returning to this place and I wouldn't recommend going here unless you enjoy being in the presence of an absolutely crazy person and verbally assaulted in the bathroom.

Such an amazing find.  Great wine, delicious food and great service.  We had the rosemary Brie to start and were delighted.  Followed by escargot- fabulous, pizza la brittroise - enchanting; and lava cake that made us want  more.  Parfait!

I really hate to write a review on the service because I understand that restaurants sometimes just have a bad night, but the service was really horrible. There seemed to only be two people working the whole restaurant doubling as host and waiters, and it just was too much. I had a reservation and they almost didn't seat us, saying they were full, but they finally gave us a table. We then put in an appetizer and drinks, which was fine. When we ordered our main courses, we sat waiting for almost 2 hours. We tried to flag down a waiter to ask to check on our food, but it took them far too long to check on us. When they did, they told us they forgot to put our food in. They gave us one free round of drinks, but I really think we should've gotten a discount or anything because we were there for so long and hungry. They also had bread baskets but didn't bring it to us until they brought our food. The food was really good though, but just make sure they have more than two people working the restaurant.

I found this restaurant through yelp for a Thursday girls night and it's so cute. I love the decor and ambience. They did have a small selection for HH which I didn't mind and lasted til 7. Ordered a flat bread and a meat & cheese plate which was all very good. Because of the HH we ended up ordering the bottle which was reasonably cost. We had a creme brulee on the house but still ordered the chocolate cake. Loved the waitress there she was absolutely amazing. I would def go back, check it out !!!

Came here for Sunday Brunch and it was great! Loved the vibes/decor. The food was good as well! Highly recommend getting a couple items and sharing it as a group. Prices are great as well. It wasn't too expensive and the portions were good. If in the area, will come back for dinner and drinks!

AMAZING. Cute wine bar that is perfect for girls night or date night. I went for a bachelorette party dinner and the staff was amazing. Everyone is super helpful and can help with any wine questions. They will also let you try any wine you want before actually committing to it. I would definitely come back!

column3: Princeton Junction, West Windsor Township, NJ
column6: We stopped in for a quick glass of wine and were immediately greeted by the nicest and welcoming people. The vino was on point! We had to leave quickly as we had a reservation down the street. However we will definitely be back! :)

Came here on a Friday night since I heard there was some quaint live music going on from the Opus app! The wine is fairly priced, they have a menu of small bites and charcuterie, the environment there is really cozy like you're just chilling and chatting with friends rather than being in a stuffy formal sit down place. That night they had a great guitarist and violinist that came to perform that really fit the vibe of Lena, completely loved it!

I found LENA while searching for an intimate venue to host a wedding shower. I dined at LENA a couple of times before my event. Every time was lovely, the food and wine selection is top notch, the environment is elegant industrial chic, the servers are pleasant. My event went perfectly, we had the whole space to ourselves, the bride to be was so thrilled! Everyone loved everything from the food, drinks and fun servers and gallery of art. I highly recommend LENA for a date, evening with friends or to host your next private affair. We had less than 25, they can go up to 40.
Was there yesterday for Valentine's Day, place was nice foods was delicious and service was awesome! Will definitely go back. Highly recommend.

This place blew us away! My brother and I stumbled upon Lena Wine Bar and had the most fabulous time!! The ambiance was relaxed and inviting, with classic soul music playing and comfy couches to enjoy our wine and cheese, which was all excellent.  The owner Pierre was friendly and made us feel right at home. Our waitress was sooo sweet and knowledgeable about the menu and wine list, and she suggested great pairings that we talked about for days!  I will definitely return the next time I'm in the city!

Very cool spot with interesting by the glass wines and food to snack on while you drink said wines. The Tartes Flambees are like loaded flatbreads and were super filling. Service was really friendly. The sort of place you'd come with a small group of girlfriends you haven't seen in awhile. Would definitely come back for drinks!

UPDATE: the owner Pierre G will message you about your honest post and sound unpleasant. I never spoke with anyone about my disappointment in the soup, ate what I could, and paid for it. The owner claims he had explained to me "yesterday" (not the day I visited) what the soup was like even though I never met anyone other than my waitress. This just shows there are many who do not Iike the soup as he constantly seems to be dealing with it.
wonderful and very cozy place. delicious menu. very attentive staff, and a very skillful bar attender! def on my fave list now!

We went to grab a drink at the bar across the street and had an hour wait. We wanted to find a quick place for a drink and some snacks and stumbled into this place. I wish I lived in NYC or I would keep coming back. The flat bread was amazing, the wine was great and cheap for NYC standards, and the cheese selection was excellent. Not only was the food great but we spent some time talking to Pierre who is the owner and he is an awesome guy and very passionate with what he is doing with his restaurant.

Just want to say that this place BLEW us away. My boyfriend surprised me with an engagement party at this cute wine bar, they let us rent out the whole space on a Saturday for three hours through the app Peerspace. Could not have asked for better service. They let him come down a week before and try out the food and drinks before booking, during the party they were constantly checking in and making our guests feel right at home. The appetizers served were amazing! Overall 10/10 experience. Thank you so much LENA!
No comment

Had a really great time ! Delicious french wines ! Feels like France all over again. The owner Pierre was super friendly & helped me to pick my wine and food! You need to try the Brie tartine  & the french Pizza...ABSOLUTELY delicious. Looking forward to come back with friends.
Amzing wine perfect environment for a great night out . Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Strongly recommend for a great night out.

Came in for some wine and a cheese/meat plate. Lighting at least during the day is a little odd, the restaurant was very dark so much so that at first we thought it was closed. Wine is fairly priced but I felt that our meat/cheese plate was a little "light" for the price. Also it came on parchment paper on a wood board, which was kind of weird.... do they not wash their wood boards? Service was a little slow but polite. Decor is kind of tacky... but also cozy I would bring a friend here but not a date. I don't think if I was in the area I would come back. Has a lot of potential though.
No comment

Food was fine but not worth the price. The owner was extremely rude, confronting me and my friends about how he thought we hadn't ordered enough to merit being in his restaurant (we were 9 people and had ordered 7 dishes and 4 drinks all together). Lost my business.
Great spot for a coffee, wine, or beer to relax in or get some work done. Chill ambience, friendly servers, and good music.
New coffee shop in the area! I love the atmosphere and decor here! Coffee is great. Try the white truffle egg toast!
No comment
No comment
Good place with great service, coffee is really good. The sandwiches look amazing. I like the barista speaks French and they play Metallica!
No comment

AmaIng! Great wine selection and great food. Romantic and cozy atmosphere with excellent service. Delicious house-made desserts. Amazing assortment of French wines. Very welcoming in a good location not too far from the subway. A nice selection of French music, and an overall awesome experience with a group or for a date.
Another great dining experience at Lena last night. Always hit's the spot. Be sure to have the tarte flambee!
LOVE LENA! Our gorge little nextdoor wine bar. Beautiful range of wines and delish food. Highly recommended local

Couldn't be more happy to find a place like this in the lower Eastside, just few stops away from where I live. What a surprise! I came here with my friends & we enjoyed all dishes. Meat & Cheese, Flat Bread & Bourguignon were totally awesome. Pierre the owner is super friendly & knowledgeable about the wines. I'll come back for sure with a date.
No comment

LÉNA is absolutely amazing! The atmosphere, the food and the service is perfection thanks to Pierre the owner. I tasted the authentic flat bread, and the Boeuf Bourguignon, followed by the chocolate cake. I will definitely come back. The wine is fantastic & of course only French. Will be back with my friends.

Pierre the owner is very welcoming. His staff is really kind and attentive. Best place to hang out and enjoy a beautiful cheese plate together with some wine from their perfect selection. Definitely recommend.

A beautiful space with great atmosphere and great food and  selection of French fine wines.The Croque Madame is perfection and the French tartes are so delicious.  Great little spot for a date or group dinner. Will go back.
Pierre is a great guy with delicious food and the art exhibition adds to a beautiful atmosphere
No comment
The food remind me my own town in france. The Boeuf Bourguignon is incredible. Pierre was very welcoming. I will go back !
No comment
No comment
Beautifully designed space to grab a drink and food, get some reading in or hang out.
No comment
Really nice atmosphere and not too crowded on a Friday night! Great, friendly service and good food and drinks. Definitely take a seat on the couch in the corner for an even cozier time.

This is a hidden gem in the LES! Super intimate vibe with fantastic service. We got the 4 item cheese/charcuterie board,( with French Brie, truffle tremor, Serrano ham and chorizo), the Savoyard flambée, escargot appetizer, and chocolate cake for dessert. The board was a huge portion size, with generous amount of meats and cheese. The Brie paired with the honey was a match made in heaven! The Savoyard flambée was also delicious. The cheese melted in your mouth but the flat bread maintained its crispy crunch. The escargot came out piping hot and delicious. Surprisingly, it had a more parsley/lemony taste that was amazingly fresh and savory. Lastly, the chocolate cake was rich and decadent (but not too sweet) and was the perfect end to our meal. Also did I mention the happy hour?? From 4-7pm they offer $8 Malbecs. Overall amazing vibe,  food and drinks and service!! So glad to have stumbled on this place.

We popped in for a nice glass of wine after a round of dumplings next door and were so pleasantly surprised by the impeccable service and friendly staff, specifically from Alex. Alex is from the same part of California as us, and he went above and beyond to make our experience welcoming and warm. Not only was the pasta absolutely delish, Alex gave us thoughtful recommendations for other restaurants that he thought we may like and sincerely invited us back. We felt so welcomed by him, and the delicious food and Malbec. Thanks to Alex and all Lena staff!

First of all, my husband, friend and I walked out at the end of our meal marveling at how welcoming and friendly everyone was. The waiter chased after us to say goodbye and thank you, and that was after the owner, bartender and other waiter said goodbye as we were leaving. I'll be back for that kind of warmth alone. The food was quite good. I had the meatballs with a side of Brussels sprouts, my friend had the duck confit, my husband had the pork, and all of it was tasty. My husband also ordered escargot as an appetizer and had trouble getting one of the snails out of the shell - so they brought him another whole round on top of what he ate. That was really above and beyond. The wine and cocktail menu is very decent and they even had something non-alcoholic for me and didn't make me feel like a jerk for not drinking. The place was lively and charming, but not obnoxiously loud. We're definitely coming back with more friends.

Had dinner here this evening at the bar with a friend. The French wine was phenomenal, and the food was excellent. But the best part was the people there, the owner is so sweet and we started a conversation with lovely French people and had a fantastic time! Highly recommend.

Turku was a great server..she is super sweet.  Place is cozy n friendly.  Walked in to just have a drink but ended up eating everything...the food was super delicious.  Ordered almost everything.  Definitely going back again!
No comment

I found this little cozy place on yelp and decided to take my date here. Beautiful place. The Boeuf Bourguignon and the onion soup was delicious as were the cocktails!  Magnificent service, very friendly. Would also recommend this place for dessert such as the creme brulee which is house made absolutely outstanding! Definitely a place I will come back too again.
Great place to have a date or a friend to catch up.  Very small.  Rsvp is highly recommended.
Great French wine selection, Cody atmosphere and owner Pierre was a pleasure to talk with. Place just opened and we will be back.
They're young but they're delicious! Amazing wine and food menu. Must try if you're downtown...if you're not downtown then get there!

I had a date and wanted to take her some place special. We had not been here before but had heard good thing. We were not disappointed, two of us had the Beef Bourgogne was excellent and I had the Escargot. Probably the best Escargot I've ever had. The owner/chef Pierre, stopped by our table which was a nice touch. This is an outstanding location with an excellent staff, a decent menu range, and a superbly skilled kitchen staff. I will always bring special guests here as a first choice. Will definitely will be returning!

Wow!! What an amazing experience. Best date night place in the LES hands down. Run don't walk this place is going to be tough to get into soon (open 3 months). The menu is simple french and everything is delicious (charcuterie is great, homemade pâté). The wine list is direct with everything i tried being excellent (ask for recommendations from the knowledgeable staff, you can taste before you commit). Many are by the glass. French classics on the stereo at a volume you can easily talk to (a rarity in the lower east side). Impeccable & friendly service, especially welcome in the middle of a snowstorm. The owner Pierre is a pleasure to chat with & clearly loves his craft. worth every penny and by standards here a deal. the quality is outstanding. Thanks for turning a very cold day into an amazing & memorable night!

This one of the best wine bars in the city! Went for a late night dinner and was very happy with the service and food. We ordered a couple of glasses of the muscadet which was heavenly. It paired really well the Savoyard tarte flambée. The service was very attentive and the ambience and decors made it seem like I was back in France!
Great atmosphere, good tasting wines and superb customer service.  The ambience is great for either friends getting together or for date night!!!
Very comfortable wine bar in the lower east side. The food is tasty, the the wine is great, the help is warm and friendly. A positive vibe.

If is a wonderful cafe!  You wouldn't think to find such gem . When you first walk in you are welcome by a lovely hostess and makes sure from the very beginning that you will have a great experience. I met friends there because it was close se to the gallery we were going to. We liked their wine selection and the food was very good . I do think that they need to work on their escargot,it needs the shell and more butter. We met the owner and he was so great he explained all about the basque region. Overall it was a wonderful place to drink and eat with friends.
My friends and I were visiting the Tenement Museum and came in and sat at the bar. We were treated like family and well looked after. The wine and food was amazing. Great experience.

We had dinner on Friday night before going out to an event. They have a great selection of wine. The food was very good, and the staff was pleasant and efficient, which we appreciated as we were pressed for time. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and we plan on going back very soon.
This place made my entire trip! It was so much fun getting a little taste of Paris and speaking with the amazing chef. Highly recommend. Great cheese and wine selection and warm, cute atmosphere.

horrible service. had to wait to order, slow service, and again took a long time to receive and process the bill. other tables around us were having issues with service as well, so it wasn't just that we were picky!

EVERYTHING was next level. So well done and beautiful presentation.  The staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. New favorite place!  Brunch on Sunday was so fabulous that we had to return later in the week for dinner. It will NOT disappoint!
No comment
No comment
No comment

For a place to grab a drink and some snacks, I would definitely recommend Cool world. The oysters were top notch: good mignonette sauce and tomatillo hot sauce served with them. The fries, which I was wary of given they were pretty thick, were actually delicious. Super hot and crisp on the outside but somehow still tender potato goodness inside. Seemed a bit chaotic service-wise but they were very apologetic and ultimately it didn't impact us much.
Good ambiance. The wedge salad was SOOO good. I was pretty full by the time the French onion soup came so I can't fully judge it
No comment

Been here a few times, last 2 times were not great. First bad experience alerted management and they did acknowledge the mistake. Had dinner here last night. Ordered main course, side of fries, then oysters. Fries came first. Then main course, then oysters while I was working on the rest of the meal. No one helped clear the table or make room. Only when I got the bill did they take the oyster shells away. 3 bad oysters (were they preopened)?
Cocktails were delicious and so were the fried duck balls. Everything else is alright - not bad but not exceptional. Kind of pricy for what it is.

Came here during the NY marathon today and was such a let down. Ordered the soft eggs thing and it was terrible like soggy eggs even when I specified I wanted well done , it was not , also had no chicken when they said it did. Food took forever . My friend didn't order a sauce and they charged us for it. The waitress was very confused when we had a bill with two different charges which was very odd. Bad experience, would come back but only for drinks.
No comment
No comment

This is such a cool space and a great location, but there's so much turnover for some reason. Had high hopes that this chef would stick, but unfortunately, it just wasn't great. Awesome service but we had the potato app with cabbage on top which was okay but sort of strange--heavy on the acid and sort of like sauerkraut. Then the halibut was good, but about three bites. The portion was comically small. The waiter agreed and brought us shrimp cocktail and Brussels which was so nice, but they were so overpowered with spice that we were coughing and just couldn't eat them. Such a bummer bc it's lovely for so many reasons, but the food was just a miss.
Incredible. The dishes are decadent but light!  Flavorful without being overwhelming/distracting. Great service, vibrant crowd. Incredible chef.

Excellent fresh spot with a simple, yet unique menu that does not disappoint! The chicken and waffles were on point and all the sides were fantastic. Great cocktails too! The chef clearly ads his own flare to familiar flavors, and the care shines through. Definitely recommend!

Had a birthday dinner here last night. Food was great. It is very loud but I am also very loud so it worked out. But the STAFF- incredible. Truly charming and lovely in a neighborhood that doesn't always give the most welcoming of vibes. Brooks the bartender and Ben our server- truly lovely. Will be back asap. Get the rolls and steak frites!
Stylish and cool, great food and stellar drinks situation. Great addition to the 'hood
Scallops were awesome, as well ass the wedge salad and the mussels! Our cocktails were great and the wine program is nice - had a delicious sparkling pet nat. Great staff too!

Came here for my birthday a couple weeks ago. I love the ambience and location is great, however I don't think I've ever waited so long for a meal in my lifeIt's a new restaurant so I am sure they're working out some kinks but the service was wildly slow. There was about 3,000 servers working but no one was really working? We were in no rush and I'm not an impatient person but after waiting an hour for our first appetizer I was a little bit like y'all good back there? Food was okay. I ordered the fish which had a nice flavor but it was just a quarter sized slab of fish swimming in broth. I asked for some rice on the side to eat with it bc ur girl needs substance, but after 40 minutes of waiting I canceled it and ate my lil fish in ab three bites. Is this how the Williamsburg girls stay so fit? I also got the salad that had savory granola on top which was v weird and soggy. Anyway! I have no idea what I'm talking ab and I never write reviews but thought I'd share. I would come again bc I love the interior designers & drinks are good but I wouldn't come hungry lol‍
it was the best dinner i had in nyc. highly recommend. michelin quality at a low price
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really loved this spot for brunch. Not only was the food delicious, but I was incredibly impressed with the presentation. The Acai bowl was one of the best I've had in the city, and they made a great cappuccino. They have almond milk too! Despite being understaffed, our waitress was kind and attentive.
No comment
Always consistently good brunch/lunch food! Yum. The day I was there the poor waitress was running around taking care of all the tables solo. I felt bad for her!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Bright, Australian brunch spot in the heart of Soho! The inside is small so definitely make a reservation if you can. I got the purple sweet potato latte, the whipped mascarpone banana bread, and the seasonal scramble. I would probably skip the latte, it was lukewarm and tasted pretty artificial. The ribboned eggs on the seasonal scramble were done well, but the toast itself may have been toasted too long...it was nearly burnt! The star of the show was the banana bread! The coffee flavored mascarpone paired deliciously with the sweetness of the banana bread. For $11 it is quite expensive, but sharing it with the table was more than enough for me.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delicious sandwich on fresh bread and with really nice simple side salad. Was quick and efficient, nice decor, good service. Would certainly return!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Banana bread with espresso mascarpone -- yummy, not too rich. Steak sandwich was nice too
No comment
No comment

I can not rave Enough about this place! There were many place around but somehow my gut told me to just go there first and it do not lie. Bloody Marys were phenomenal! All the food was amazing  I would go back and recommend a 120%! Come and enjoy Brunch especially on Sunday! Loved it and all my friends did as well! Thank you for delicious food!

Casual spot with wait service and light fare in the healthy side. With that said they have an amazing banana walnut bread (gluten free) that is served warm and generously topped with espresso mascarpone, toasted buckwheat and honey. I had the pulled chicken salad bowl, not to be confused with the pulled chicken salad sandwich- both by the way are delicious and satisfying. Also tried the grass fed steak sandwich. The proteins are sandwiched between toasted sourdough bread which is crunchy and flavorful with the rest of the tasty combination of sandwich fillings. The menus do differ by location. It's worth going back to try out the other offerings at this and the other locations.

super cute interior! i got an acai bowl and it seemed to be pretty standard. it wasn't too sweet, which i liked, but it was your typical brunch fare with a cozy atmosphere. very good place to have a nice brunch conversation
No comment

One of my favorite brunch places in a super convenient location! Been twice, loved what I had the second time around WAY more -- not sure if it was a one off thing but wouldn't really recommend the poached eggs. The proportions are totally worth it and the food is great! Always had the most wonderful experiences with the waitstaff here as well, really nice spot on a summer day!

Underrated brunch spot in Soho! After battling multiple crowded restaurants in search for a table, Two Hands could accommodate us and even inside on a chilly day. Everything on the menu looked really good. I started with a croissant, which was buttery, crispy on the outside, and delicious. For an entree I ordered the brunch special (avocado toast with smoked salmon and poached eggs). This was my perfect idea of brunch food, and it was incredible. There was a healthy serving of smoked salmon and the eggs were nicely poached. Service was friendly and I would definitely come back!

Terrible service. Average food. Not worth your time or your money. New York has too many fantastic restaurant options to waste a meal here.

I came here with a friend for a late lunch and it was pretty good. I got the market plate with scrambled eggs. The sweet potatoes were cooked and seasoned very well and I also enjoyed the kale salad, but the eggs were a bit bland. The food was overall pretty tasty, but it took quite a while to come out. Not a bad option for brunch, but not my first choice.
Super friendly and helpful staff that are clearly working hard to deal with high demand. The food was delicious and creative. I had the seasonal scramble and it was amazing.
I don't understand the previous bad review, this place is amazing! The service was outstanding and the food was absolutely delicious. Best eggs ever and I love the presentation. We will be back soon!
Great for lunch or breakfast, you feel super healthy after eating here. Staff is very friendly.

Came here for brunch with a friend and was pretty disappointed. We arrived at 11am, which was on the early side it seemed, as we didn't have to wait for a table, but there was a crowd waiting by the time we left at 12:30pm. The service is really slow as they are quite busy. I was going to order the acai bowl, but after seeing the previous review and photo of it (it looked like a frozen ice cream scoop) I decided to go for something else. I had the pulled chicken bowl, which was $18 - that's the price of a dinner entree! The food was fine, but nothing special. The restaurant is also pretty cramped, so I wouldn't recommend it for groups or for leisurely conversations. My bill was $27 for the bowl and a coffee, which is crazy high.

Absolutely love this place. Staff is excellent as is the food. Breakfast sandwich is delicious as is the BLT, and avocado toast. Coffee is always fresh and hot. This has become my Saturday morning hangout. I do a little work before my food arrives and feel like I get a leg up on the day.

Was quiet on a Thursday morning, but the atmosphere was great, and I'm sure I had the best açai bowl I've ever had!! The staff were really friendly and encouraged me to try the DELISH taro latte. I always love coming here and this did not disappoint

This morning I had the breakfast burrito and taro latte! For the burrito I requested bacon be added, which I think was a great decision. It did have a little kick to it as there are jalapeños inside. Overall, was happy with my breakfast.

this place was on my list of places to try out, there was a wait but the hosts texted me once tables were ready. I had the perfect seat and the food was so fulfilling. I had the breakfast wrap and the rosemary rosado. It was amazing. They kept everything clean and surface was more than sufficient, even being busy. I highly recommend

Had the breakfast roll and rose tea for breakfast and was delighted by the fluffiness of the egg. The spicy Mayo added flavor and heat. Delicious.

Had breakfast here this morning with my wife for the first time and everything was so good!! A handful of our friends told us the coffee was amazing here and they were right. And the food was also great. I enjoyed my breakfast burrito and my wife loved the pulled pork roll she had. Can't wait to come back here again next time we are in New York.
Good service and outdoor dining great experience. Fast and quick service thank you guys wish come back ! Stay safe

Yummy food. Authentic Taiwanese. Highly recommend. Nice service. Sausage is delicious. Everything is delicious.

This place is amazing! Hidden gem! If you happen to go to a fair or bazaar and find this stand, definitely give it a try, you won't be disappointed. The woman serving the food was so nice and answered any questions. The food was delicious and made the experience come full circle. Give this a try! They have pescatarian options as well.

It was quite unique- in a good way! Definitely get the mushroom truffle croquettes, like 2 orders for yourself. It was amazing to say the least. Ants in a log noodles was yummy. Dumplings, I'd say pass. Will come back for those 2 foods and get 2 orders each. Yes!

Just come for the drinks and bar. Cocktails so tasty - drunken dragons milk is so sweet and creamy with coconut milk and green tea vodka, etc. Great service and bar area. The food itself though was very average and overpriced. Burger was cooked perfectly and very tasty. But both the burger and noodles pretty average and way overpriced for what they were

I loved the vibe in this restaurant, the food is incredible, the drinks are delicious. The appetizers are probably my faves, the mushroom truffle croquettes and the ribs were to die for. Definitely get the pana cotta and the malasadas. We got the whole fish which was soooo good. The service has been great both times I've gone.

Very interesting design and bar area. Would def recommend going even if its just for the design. The food is mostly fusion food so dont have the expectation of getting authentic food from Macao. The servers there were nice and attentive.

We had a lovely pre-theater dinner here. We sat at the bar while we waited for our friends, the drinks were good and the service was attentive. The whole place is very pretty. Service was just right, which is to say neither intrusive nor scarce. The food was very good and the seafood was fresh. For some reason I expected it would be more heavily seasoned but it wasn't, it was just right and flavorful for us. We enjoyed everything

This was my 2nd time dining here - first time was for a friends birthday and it was great! 2nd time the food was SO salty and probably a lot of MSG in it.  The cocktails are good but on the pricey side - $20+ for one cocktail. For the little food we ordered, the bill was around $224 with tip. I was looking forward to dining here, but my opinion has changed since the last time.  Other spots will have better food, although the ambiance here is nice!
Beautiful setting and great for happy hours after work. The food is not close to Asian so it was a bit underwhelming. Steamed fish was delicious but I'd say overpriced.

My husband took me here for the first time and was pleasantly pleased. The drinks were on point and so was the food.

I enjoyed my meal though I do wish that for the price it came with more that 5 French fries and a scoop of spinach. Our waiter was great he checked on us often and bantered with us at the table  I think if you want a cute, intimate, date night spot this could be it.

This place is great. Located in the mids of china town it is opened late.  And they serve food late hours. Ambience is great. Nice hip pop music. Upstairs. Super sweet waitress Kristine.  Food was limited options but again. It was very late. But it came out perfect. Then we went downstairs. Great music. Not crowded dance floor. And everyone enjoying themselves.  Recommend and will return.

I will honestly say, one of the best nyc dining experiences i have had - from the fish to the apps to the chicken, almost everything was incredible. Service was 6/5 and i loved the decor. 110% will be coming back!!

Right off the bat, I gotta say the place looks great. Furniture, music, ambiance, servers, everything about this place looks nice. I came here twice just for drinks before, and this was my first time for dinner. And here is why I'm leaving a two stars review: we got food poisoned. We ordered steamed mussels, dumplings and a big red snapper for two. Everything tasted pretty good - besides perhaps a bit too seasoned - but definitely the flavors were good. Too bad the fish was not cooked well and probably even too old. We spent the night in the restroom you can imagine why. Be very careful, and perhaps just come for drinks and music, but I do not recommend the restaurant.

Great food, vibes, and service! Everything we had was amazing and the place is super fun and eclectic. Ordered the shrimp dumplings, glass noodles, and steamed shrimp and loved everything! The cocktails are super creative and tasty too!

Amazing ambience. Sat downstairs in the lounge area at a booth and it was really good. Drinks were great. Got a few tequila drinks that hit the spot. The dumplings were really good. I got the African Chicken and the Crispy Whole Fish. The chicken was good chicken but quite underwhelming. Needed the side of hot oil I got. The fish was the best thing. Definitely saved the meal. The vegetable fried rice was just okay. Also needed the hot oil. the ambiance alone is worth a recommendation.

The appetizer menu was a compilation of all of the best small plates I know and love. The wine was amazing. Our server was incredible and all of the staff went above and beyond to provide us with an exceptional level of care.

Good atmosphere, friendly service and forward menu selection. We tried all 3 types of pies, chard octopus, blistered shishtis, and porter house for two, everything is so much fun. I was really surprised that the steak was so delicious. Small ones but a good restaurant for fun. Everyone enjoyed the cocktail.

This was an overall solid meal and dining experience. We ordered a couple dishes for the table and I liked them all except for the char siu baby back ribs. I LOVE cha siu baos, and have at least a couple stored in my freezer at all times, so I was really excited about the ribs. I felt like they just got the sauce flavoring wrong. To me the ribs were sickly sweet and tasted heavily of hoisin sauce. I wouldn't get those again, but very much enjoyed everything else. The dumplings (shrimp) were tasty, the bok choy was awesome and i loved the flavor. The bacon and shrimp fried rice was my favorite dish of the night. It was kind of unique and just really delicious. The ambiance of the restaurant was nice too. We went around 6:30 and it wasn't very crowded, which was nice.

My friends and I wanted to explore a neighborhood we don't regularly hang out in so we landed on TriBeca and started at Macao. When I walked in the atmosphere upstairs was cozy and sexy. Seemed like it would be nice to sit at the bar. However when it came time to seat the three of us they brought us downstairs to a less lit, less clean area of the restaurant and stuffed us in a corner despite there being an abundance of seating. We only had drinks and apps but had we stayed for dinner it would have been unreasonable. The apps and drinks were good but we got out of there pretty quickly...

The ambiance was really nice. Great for a date night. The drinks were good and the food was good but the menu was a bit limited. Waitress was very nice. Might be a bit overpriced but overall a good spot

Stayed upstairs at bar area.  This restaurant is very picturesque and decorated to theme. Their martinis were good and the staff was welcoming. A little quiet for a Friday night but it was also Easter weekend. Would come back again for food!

It was one of those afternoons where my friend and I just felt like hopping around to different spots to enjoy the NYC HH/night vibe. In the area and she recommended this gem of a spot since she often came here when worked in the area. First thing I noticed was the dim lighting which I am a huge fan of in restaurants and bars. We sat in the front where there is more of a bar setting but in the back is their restaurant. To be honest.... we did not eat but enjoyed a few of their drinks. One was a spicy style drink which was so good, but I sadly forgot the name of it. Our server was extremely helpful in picking out cocktails and had a funny personality which made the experience that much more enjoyable. I'd love to come back to this place for the atmosphere, drinks, and late-night partying which I hear is a VIBE!!!

Came here recently for dinner on a Sunday evening and had a wonderful experience! A friend had raved about this place and it did not disappoint. The interior decor is so cool and the place has a nice vibe. Our waitress was a doll and checked on us all night, she was so sweet. The menu is really eclectic and combines many international cuisines. We had the Ants climbing the tree (noodles), chicken & pork dumplings, mushroom croquettes and fried rice. Everything was delicious!! Oh and you must save room for the donut holes with vanilla cream and dulce de leche dessert! Also the drinks were amazing the bar is so cool. Would definitely come back to Macao!

Service was good... Not at the bar though. Food was pretty good. $38 for the steamed fish. Pot stickers were good. 3 appetizers, 3 mains, tip over $200. Pretty steep for Chinese food. Would I go there again... Nope.

Came here for a work event. We sat in the outside space. Beware not to sit next to the plants as there were so many bugs that I ended up getting so many bug bits during the whole dinner. The food on the other hand was really good. Would recommend the oysters and the lobster noodles. The noodles were seasoned really well and the lobster was super fresh!

The food here is amazing. You have to try the steam dumplings. They are huge and juicy. It tastes great in the chili sauce. The glass noodles dish is tasty too. The African chicken is my favorite. The coconut curry and tender chicken is amazing.  Served with a Cole slaw.  I like the cocktails they have here. The spicy margaritas is refreshing and addictive. On the weekends the djs are live from 11 to 4am. They have a low key room downstairs that is jamming. The djs there are amazing. They play everything so the vibe is very different. If you are looking for a late night meal, drinks and dancing, you got to come here.

the server kept telling them it was soup based and almost suggested they shouldn't order it. We were all confused as my friends still wanted that dish. I'm vegetarian/vegan and had the fried spinach dumplings. They were ok but would have preferred them without cheese. I did like the shishito peppers because they were vegan (I think) and the portion was generous. I ordered the hoisin noodles as it was pretty much the only entree available. It's called hoisin Hakka. To the restaurant, hoisin means seafood in Chinese so perhaps an update to the name would make it more clear. The noodles were disappointing. Very hard and I didn't finish them. Despite giving us a two hour dining limit our server was hard to pin down the rest of the evening. It took almost 30 mins to get our dessert and another 20 mins to process our cards. We asked for individual cards if possible and the server said it would take a longer "minute". Had we know it would take 20 we would have done one card. We left almost an hour after our allotted time so I guess there was a no show. From a sustainability standpoint it was generally fine but the disposable chopsticks swapped for reusable are low hanging fruit.

Ok folks. Don't bother. They think they are above actually seating you when you have a reservation. Major attitude from the dude at check in stand. Refused to seat us despite having a recent knee replacement and pointed us at the three deep bar and said go have a drink. Even more attitude and turning his back when told we needed to sit and asked why he wouldn't seat us. What a joke.  Maybe they think customers don't matter. Ok, clearly they don't. And no, I'm not out of town I've been in Tribeca for 15 years. Have frequented Macao often and had memorable experiences. Never again though. It's a shelling what it once was. They're dead to me. Plenty of other welcoming places around the corner.

Unfortunately my experience at Macao was not a good one. Despite having heard great things about the restaurant, their staff is extremely unprofessional. I suggest getting new bartenders!

What a night! I wanted to put together a dinner for my brothers birthday and we had the most amazing time. When I reached out to Stacey to help me organize this not only was she helpful with ideas but made the entire process seamless. She set up a table for ten of us and had it ready when we walked in. She knew the menu front and back , gave us recommendations and knew exactly how much food to bring out. We ordered perfectly. The bartender recommended a green tea vodka which I really enjoyed.  We would definitely stop here again for a drink if in the neighborhood.

The drinks and vibe were pretty cool but the bartender on the main level was one of the most rude people I've ever encountered, I think his name is Phillip. I ordered a drink and so did a random guy sitting next to me, after taking our order he just left the bar area, came back 20 mins+ later. Wtf.

After a long flight from CA to NYC for a wedding, we just wanted to feel the city before going to bed. This did the trick! Live ambiance with tasty food, good music, great drinks, and fun people. There is a bar, restaurant, and nightclub below. We enjoyed the bar and restaurant--too old for the club. The blush maiden was my favorite drink--loved it!

Wow Macao used to be my favorite place they had great food and amazing mixologist drinks. Now dont know what happened! The menu shrunk to one page lost so many good food options and the Bar Manager refuses to make certain drinks at the fully stocked bar. Why? Because we just dont! I havent had a drink in 3 weeks and was talking Macao up to a friend and was looking forward to having a well crafted cocktail here but apparently they "just dont" make what I want. No explanation, no reason they just wont. The place was completely empty and its just me and a friend and they refuse to make me one Long Island. They also refuse to make Lychee Martinis. Didnt know since the name is Macao they adopted communist rules as well and decide what you can and cannot drink. Youd think during a pandemic thats forcing all the restaurants in NYC to close up permanently and the fact I was sober and just wanted one drink theyd want to make some money and make me a happy customer. But nope! Bad Management! I have been coming here for 6 years and will no longer return or recommend anyone ever again! Sad! Go next door to Antique Garage they will let you drink whatever you want and its beautiful inside.

My husband took me here for a belated Valentine's day dinner.  Its a very busy place but they have seatings on 2 levels.  The lights were very dim, a bit too dark, I couldn't really see the delicious food.  Now on to the food, for starters we ordered the burrata and the chicken and pork belly dumplings.  Burrata is always yummy and gooey.  Their dumplings were also very delicious, but a little pricey for dumplings ($15).  Main course: lamb shank and lobster noodles.  The lamb shank was moist and tender and spiced with 5 spice over a bed of hidden polenta underneath the massive shank.  The lobster noodles were lightly flavored with 2 big pieces of lobster.  Overall, it was a delicious meal.
Formidable service, food, drinks and ambiance

Felt like eating in the bird cage. Greeted by friendly staff, served by awesome server and the food were simple yet the flavor was unforgettable. Oh my God I had so much fun when they were open before the pandemic hit! Dumplings and the burger are my to go-to. Music and drinks. Food. Crowd. I hope everything reopens in full capacity one day soon. Highly recommend for a middle of the night stop.

To our mains which consisted of lobster noodles and whole fried branzino. We left satisfied and it was a beautiful summer Saturday night. Oh and the cocktails were definitely a winner.

amazing cocktails!!!!!!!! and octopus!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! do not sleep on this place. perfect for date night!

Stunning romantic, exotic, moody atmosphere! I really love the ambiance of this restaurant. The Mata Hari was my favorite cocktail there, cognac based with gorgeous flavor. The food is rich and interesting. This place is a really enjoyable date night and somewhere you want to try if you are a foodie.

A friend of mine picked this restaurant and I had no idea what to expect. We waited at the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable. He chatted with us for awhile and it made the wait seem quick. The drinks were spot on. I rarely have food "experiences" but at this place I felt like I discovered new flavors. Each dish was unique from the last and offered something new. I was very impressed and can't wait until the next time.

Definitely want to come back here. We just went for drinks on a Monday night, but I was so impressed with the Dragon's Milk - a perfectly creamy and different coconut/green tea drink. I really think the atmosphere of this place would be good for a date even though I went with a friend! Also curious what dinner would taste like here. Judging from the drinks, and our amazing bartender, I certainly want to come back and find out :D

My favorite Saturday night / Sunday morning spot. I'm a Village gal & when I am feeling like I wanna be out but don't feel like gathering an entourage, I hit Macao all by myself. The crowd is mixed and happy. The music is a little something for everyone. Always a song I haven't heard in forever. I love sitting in corner at the bar and watch the energy onthe room... vibrant until the end. And the bar staff is a pleasure to watch in action. The way they make drinks is sexy  My favorite drink is the Odd Job. It isn't for the feather weight drinker  so don't order it if you're the Apple martini type. And be sure to put some grub in tummy. At 2am the kitchen is still open... I can't resist the  shrimp/ bacon  fried rice

Very unique, cool place. Has a good vibe. Wine choices are limited but pretty good and kept in a wine cooler (red one's as well) like it should be. Food is very delicious and staff very friendly. Will definitely be headed back from time to time!
We ordered the recommended items from a regular, I'd give the food 3.5, it's not bad but nothing I'd remember of. Atmosphere is great though. May go back to try the lobster noodle.

Came for dinner late last night and I'm soooo happy we found this place! The vibe and ambience was so amazing and we ordered from the late night dinner menu, we got the salt and pepper shrimp and the short rib beef burger and OMGGG it was so delicious! We will definitely be back !! Oooh and the service was good and our server was very attentive!!

An all around wonderful night out!  The ambience, staff, food and cocktails were perfect.  We shared a bunch of dishes and all agreed the whole fried branzino was the standout dish.  After dinner we headed downstairs for (many) more drinks and dancing.  We had a wonderful time!  Thank you Macao!

Over the years, I've had many of the cocktails here. The Dr. Funk, the Gola Lola, and the West Side are all exceptional but my absolute favorites are the Kaffir Jimlet [kaffir lime-infused fords gin mixed with lime juice & agave nectar], the Drunken Dragon's Milk [green tea vodka shaken with young coconut puree, thai basil & their house specialty five-spice bitters], and the Ciao Rizo [chipotle infused espolón blanco shaken with lime juice, lemongrass syrup & a pinch of cilantro leaves]. The place is typically packed so arrive expecting that but the ambiance is absolutely magical and the host staff always do their best to attempt to squeeze you in somehow. The bar staff is exceptional. I've shared a couple of small plates with friends and they've always been nice but the primary focus for me has always been the extraordinary cocktail menu.

4 stars only because I didn't taste the food. Service was great, bartender was very attentive and knew the history of the concept behind the restaurant. Will definitely be back to taste the food but the cocktail and wine menu is extensive and enjoyed the quick stop.

On a night where getting a reservation was near impossible, Macao came thru. I met up with a few friends for cocktails and was instantly impressed. A sweet tea vodka fan for life, I always judge a bar if they have that offering. Interesting they did not offer sweat tea vodka but rather had Green Tea Vodka. Always willing to give something new a try, I ordered one of the specials and it was delicious. Our stomachs were driving our ordering decisions. We tried several small plates and of note, the fried rice is what I best remember. Oh, and the doughnuts at the end were a very good choice. The food and the drinks were the highlights. The downside is the music was quite loud and it made it difficult to hear my  friends at time. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking to have an intimate dinner conversation . . .

Went to this place for the first time a few weeks ago and have already been back! The drinks are really delicious and special. My favorite is the drunken dragon milk - green tea vodka with puréed young coconut and lime - amazing flavor. Although it's a heavier, sweeter drink than I normally go for - I may already be developing an obsession with this cocktail. The mushroom truffle croquettes are incredible with just the right balance of flavors. The scallop and chive dumplings also achieve a great flavor. The burrata and sautéed kale were good picks too. The interior is very soothing and dark, it has a nice way about it. The staff is attentive and helpful. I will definitely be going back.

Macao Trading Company killed NYE 2018!! Strongly recommend that others check it out next year! On nights that aren't New Year's Eve, Macao remains my favorite oasis in NYC. First and foremost, you will notice the great, low-key vibe and decorations, supplemented by conscientious good service, killer cocktails and creative food. I've taken many friends here on Mondays for their wacky jazz band/burlesque extravaganza. Come in and unplug from the city for an evening.
The fried fish is EVERYTHING!!! Best fish I've ever had and I eat a lot of fish. Service was wonderful and the ambience is so perfect for a date. Intimate and cozy. I will definitely be back!

Great atmosphere and overall restaurant design, however the dishes that we ordered could have been a little better. We got the shishito peppers, char siu bbq pork ribs, African chicken, and hakka noodles. The shishito peppers were kind of bland, could be solved with more seasoning. The bbq char siu pork ribs were a little dry/hard but the overall flavoring was good. The hakka noodles were basically a vegetable lo mien topped with parsley and basil. The African chicken was good but was oriented more towards Thai cuisine because of the coconut curry. The place is on the pricier side hence why I had a higher expectation for the dishes.
The doors in Macao captivated me to stop in for a quick drink! Bartenders are very nice and I like that the chef was around. Cocktails were great

I stepped out of a steamy New York summer evening into the cool darkness of this Tribeca restaurant and was immediately transported. Such a chill vibe - you really feel like you've stepped into an old Macao outpost from last century. The food is both unique and delicious, a great fusion of Asian influences with a hint of global Portuguese. I grazed off of the appetizers and put together a meal out of the small plates - the chicken and pork belly dumplings, mushroom & truffle croquettes, char sui bbq ribs, etc. They have a fun selection of drinks, too, with a section on the menu devoted to "fancy cocktails." So many interesting choices, you should just order one of the welcome cocktails to tide you over while you try to decide on your second!

This review is from a tipsy, 2am POV. That being said, Macao enabled the night to continue fabulously with great music and a fun scene in the dance box downstairs. Service was prompt and all I remember were the smiles of everyone around me. Given the other reviews related to food, I can't wait to go back and try all the rest that this place has to offer!

You might walk past this one late night, hidden away at 311 Church street. The decor is said to be inspired by a 1940s gambling den with a very high ceiling, dark interior, a few lovely classic chinese paintings. We went Sunday night with a crowd of 7 and it was empty. They are crowded during the business week and charge executive prices. We ordered dishes conservatively - a few entrees and 2 of us had appetizers and my portion of the bill 1/7th was $70. My grilled octopus was tender and delicious. I had prosecco and the table ordered 2 bottles of wine ($50 each!) Wow. The music was 70s booming, neither disco Portuguese or chinese. All in all, ask someone to invite you.

This place is conveniently located for social encounters and casual dates. They have a wide variety of Mediterranean and tropical dishes. Among my favorites are the fish and black rice, along with the Portuguese white wine. Highly recommended!

One of my favorites! Everything is just right here! Bartenders and staff are awesome and take the time to let you in on what youre drinking. Food is awesome. Drinks are great. Also if you come on the weekend there is a dance floor below! It is awesome!

Gabriel is an AMAZING bartender. Polished, friendly and knowledgable; you won't miss out when he pours your drinks. Came all the way from SF to check this place out and it did not disappoint. I had the mushroom truffle croquettes and they were super tasty and paired well wit my whiskey drinks. I'll be back for sure!

Macao trading company. Went there in a Monday night and it happened to be live music night which was a pleasant surprise. Tasteful soft jazz welcomed us to the beautiful decor and cozy setting. I was there with 2 other guests and we all enjoyed our cocktails (sorry I can't remember the names). We had steamed shrimp dumplings to start which left us yearning for more. Definitely the highlight of our meal. Second highlight was the crispy fish. Flavorful and juicy just like it should be. The server kindly  offered to fillet us it for us, but I happened to be there with a chef thus we kindly declined. The fried rice was unfortunately pretty salty. Not enough to complain about but thought I should let readers know. Next time I'll ask for no salt and salt on my own.

I'm a vegetarian. I had the kale salad and the hakka noodles. Both were delicious. The place is nice.

Came here with a group of 8 and shared almost everything on the dinner menu. Every dish was delicious but portions were very small for the price. Very cool decor. The atmosphere is definitely an older crowd. Can get very loud and crowded. Service was terrible.

Great food, fast and attentive service, nice playlist and not too loud music, low lighting and dark ambiance: a great experience for an early dinner in TriBeCa

Dumplings are fair. Don't waste a course on them. Brussel Sprout salad is amazing. Crispy fish is excellent. Lobster noodles overrated. Lobster over cooked. Sichuan eggplant was delicious especially when eaten with black coconut rice. Fair service. Cool vibe.

Totally forgot I had previously written a review of this establishment.  Nevertheless, my more recent visit bears mentioning.  Dined at Macao for dinner on a Monday night.  Once again I was not disappointed by the food.  We had the crispy whole fish, african chicken, octopus, dumplings and chocolate torte.  Everything was marvelous.  However, what really takes the cake...or torte...was the live music Macao offers every Monday night.  The music the night we visited was along the lines of French cabaret.  The music, awesome decor and the general ambiance of this place really works to transport one away from the humdrum of the usual Manhattan dining scene (or...maybe it was my drinks???).  In any case, definitely worth visiting on a Monday night!

I really don't understand the high score. The menu is limited. We had ribs to start which were dry and over salted. The lobster in my lobster noodles was fine, but the noodles themselves were the exact taste and consistency of a packet/pot noodle. Really disappointing. Friendly service though.

This place rocks. Great bar scene. Amazing food. Unfortunately, we were a little rushed as we had to make a Broadway play. But the bartender was incredibly attentive and got us some quick bites quickly. The burrata cheese was phenomenal as was the octopus. The drinks were also great. Go with the bartenders recommendation.
Food was good but we left early because the waitress was just rude. As we paid, we found out there was a 20% gratuity charge so it makes sense why she was such a beezy.

Really unique spot on the edge of TriBeCa and Chinatown. It has a upscale trendy vibe when you walk in and an extensive cocktail menu. When speakers turned off for 30 seconds due to a technical malfunction and I realized my ears were ringing. Also the floor was so sticky that my shoe literally got stuck to the floor I was walking. I had to go back and get it. Fail.

Wow had an amazing experience thanks Alejandro ( bartender) for such a great attention , came to celebrate my bday and the experience was worth it it is my first time in NYC and I'll definitely repeat this place if I ever come back! Nice drinks, great service !

Amazing atmosphere, really friendly bartenders. I had the steamed dumplings and the fried rice with chorizo. The dumplings were tasty (pretty average, though), but the rice with chorizo was delicious. Try it with their made-in-house hot sauce. Somebody did an amazing job designing this place--really cool, dark vibe but not overdone. They have the windows boarded up and it's very intimate. Reminded me of the ruin bars in Budapest. Not super easy to find the entrance, but it kinda adds to the appeal.

Great food, but make sure to get an itemized receipt.  Just had the server give us our check and not tell us 20% auto gratuity was included.  Luckily we caught it.  The owner flipped out when we said something about it.  Be warned.  Very shady.  Trust is a big issue and will not be returning.

Amy B. took great care of us & the food was delish. Their late night menu is perfect. We were blown away at how cool & cozy it was while still being eclectic, decorative & current. Great job!

Decor is amazing. Tip: they have downstairs seating but worth waiting for a table upstairs, where you get the full effect of the decor. We had an amazing dinner Saturday night at Macao. Frannie was our waitress, and she was FANTASTIC. Extremely knowledgeable, very fun, helpful, guided us in the right direction with our food choices. She took very good care of us, some of the best service I have received in a long time. Having been in the hospitality industry for 10+ years, I can say with confidence that Frannie really wowed us. The food was delicious, the atmosphere was very lively & fun, overall just a great time!  Everything was reasonably priced as well, one of our lower priced dinners in NYC, but the value was high. Afterwards we went to the bar downstairs, and loved the DJ; he knew exactly what he was doing, and never was there a lull in the music that stopped the energy from staying high and keeping everyone dancing. LOVE IT!! Very cool looking place! I love the dimmed lights and candles, the spicy cocktail was delicious, food is amazing! Can't wait to go back!

Surly, ignorant staff.  Airline food from a microwave, having no connection with Macau, Portugal, China or anywhere else but a supermarket freezer.  Place looks cool because it's completely unlit.  Actually has the ambience of your grandparents basement.  Horrible.  Avoid it.

Vibes and decor very on point. Food meh. Basically, go enjoy a few drinks and the amazing ambiance but don't bother with a whole dinner.

Wow! Love this place. Came in with my boyfriend for Valentine's day. I ordered the halibut and he got the lobster noodles. We had Hillary as our waitress. So sweet and super professional. Kudos to the manager for hiring her. Inside, near the entrance, was a little packed but you should be okay as long as you have a reservation. Low lighting and intimate space. 5 stars all around.

Everything about this place rocks. The food is delicious, get the lobster noodles. OMG so good. The bar is great, the atmosphere trendy and original wi a good vibe and the staff very eager to please. They lost my husbands coat and he had to go downstairs to look for it with the hostess, but other than that, it was a fun night with great food.

What a gorgeous space! Loved listening to Carte Blanche there. Highly recommend the mushroom and truffle croquettes, the piri piri chicken and the shrimp fried rice.

I made reservations for a big group.  I called a few days prior to confirm and was instantly dissuaded.  The person that answered the phone was extremely snobby and cold.  I instantly canceled my reservations and took my business elesewhere

Really good food, yes prices are high but the service along with the taste make it well worth. Definitely try the African chicken or the lobster noodle. And their coconut dessert is very unique. It's about 7 min walks from the train, the interior is very pretty.

I love coming here! The Drunken Dragon Milk cocktail is my fav. Their menu changes every so often but the food is great. The setting is perfect for a date night.
Horrible food. Got sick from uncooked food. Make sure your food is cooked fully!! Wait staff seemed bored. So much better available close by. Spend your money somewhere else

Came here for a really early snack before a 1030 dinner. Absolutely solid and I cannot wait to try other things on the menu. We split an order of dumplings, half steamed and the other half fried. I was not a fan of the fried as it was definitely not what I was used to. It ended up being deep fried and not pan. The steamed were very good. We also got the Lobster noodles and oh my goodness. I'd come downtown just for that dish. I'd eat it every day if I could. It had an entire tail of lobster sitting on top that was grilled and seemingly, the rest of the lobster was in the noodles. Lots of chunks of perfectly cooked lobster through out. The sauce was super spicy and creamy. Cannot say enough about those noodles! For my cocktail (well I ended up getting 3 of them, that's how delish they were) I got the Yellow Fever. Peachy and full of fresh ginger. Fantastic little place.
Worse experience ever! Bad restaurant, bad attitude. Food has absolutely no flavor....Will never go back again and will not recommend anyone to come to this place!

I don't know if it was the Ziggy Marley blasting through the speakers, the moody lighting, or the bartenders "it's only Rock n Roll but I like it" tattoo, but I would gladly visit this spot again next time I'm in NYC. I had the vegetable dumplings and mushroom croquettes. Service was great and my vodka crans were delish.

I didn't eat here, someone recommended this place to go out on a random Thursday night and wow it was a blast! There's a basement area that had a great vibe. An intimate setting, cool deep house/prog house music with good drinks! Def going back there!

Food was pretty decent, but a bit on the expensive side.  Drinks were way too icy.  And service was not too friendly and super rushed... food started coming minutes after we ordered.... for the price we would have liked a longer meal experience.
