Almost a year later, and I'm back at Macao Trading Company--this time just for drinks.  My friends and I stopped here before heading to dinner, and grabbed a couple drinks a piece.  I started with a Drunken Dragon's Milk, as that was a favorite at my last visit.  For my second drink, I chose the Appolonia--solely because the blood orange puree fascinated me.  My friends chose the Gola Lola and Yellow Fever #2 as their first drinks, and finished with the Drunken Dragon's Milk.  If you are looking for something light, choose the DDM.  Our other drinks were INCREDIBLY strong, but artfully crafted by our awesome bartender--so, worth the instant buzz!

In the heart of TriBeCa lies paradise. This restaurant is cool with a capital c. Very nice ambiance with great music to boot. The food was really the definition of cool with a capital c. The African chicken had a fresh peanut curry, coupled with a surprising slaw--again, so fresh. The Brussels sprouts were drizzled in a nectar of the gods--lord knows what was in it. The Bok Choy was simple, tasty, and the ideal complement to the Frenzy of flavor happening on our plate. The cod was fine with a capital f. Not amazing, but again, fresh. We splurged on the rice pudding - 8$--got my child support payment so felt like a treat. Very good. Y'all should come here. If y'all don't, it's your fault xo

Try to get a booth or that one corner table. The delicious food, though both heavier than expected and a shade lighter on seasoning, didn't disappoint. Cocktails and desserts were creative and some had a sharp end note.

The food is decent (whole fish, eggplant and kale salad are sound choices) and ambiance is great when you are upstairs only but be prepared to be squished in a deafening loud and excessively humid/hot environment if you are seated in their lower level.  We were not seated for 90 minutes passed our reservation time, but when we were, the wait staff immediately poured us prosecco "on the house" as we were sitting down, as their apology- only to find that the bottles of prosecco were later charged to our bill.  Dishonest business practice. Only go here to eat if your other choices are booked.

One of the best place in Tribeca (and all of NY) hands down!  Servers, staff, manager all tops every time I've gone in there!  Food is incredible (try the croquets for an appetizer) and Dragons Milk as a drink is absolutely amazing!!

Fantastic food.  Solid drinks and a lively atmosphere.   Had the charred octopus. It was the right mix of tender and sweet.   Followed up with freshest shrimp dumplings I have ever eaten.    Very balanced flavors.

Macao Trading Company has one of the best build-outs of any bar/restaurant in the city. It looks like you're on a movie set. The vibe makes you feel like you're in the middle of a warehouse in Macao. The food and drinks are top-notch. The cocktail list is made by professional bartenders that really know what they're doing. The downstairs area is always fun and gets crowded. You must check this place out.
My favorite place because they love my favorite drink...Fernet. Also, I am a fan of asian fusion places so this is as good as it gets for me.  I even go here after hours and it's always perfect.

Went there the first week it opened and going back for NYE. The bar is great, the food is great and the people are great. Try the sirloin Portuguese style.

Had birthday here last night in their lounge, and it was a blast!! Fantastic bartenders, great DJ, ambiance was warm and lively and they held the lounge open for birthday celebrations despite a very packed bar upstairs. Super professional, loved it loved it loved it.

Slightly obsessed with this place. The ambiance is awesome, it's straight out of a movie, awesome old school Asian/Portuguese influence; the food is delicious, service is really good, and the drinks are to die for. There's an upstairs bar which is almost always packed and a small restaurant area. If you go on a Thursday-Saturday evening, they will also have the downstairs open. I love the downstairs, it's dark, lit with a bunch of candles, there are a few small tables and small bar and the bartenders are awesome. My favorite food items: mushroom & truffle croquettes, BBQ pork ribs and shrimp mozambique. All I amazing. I ADORE their Drunken Dragon's Milk drink, and their bashful maiden was really good too  If you tell the bartenders what type of liquor you like and the flavor you are looking for, they will throw something together and it will likely be AMAZING. My only minor complaint is, as one would expect, it's not cheap, but a super cool place.

The food here is amazing! They have great creative drinks. Delicious desserts( love those fried donut holes!). Very nice ambiance(Typically dark lighting). The bacon and Shrimp fried rice is sooo damn good you just want to slap someone( but don't!)! The Macanese Noodle dish is soooo upsettingly good it makes you want to do back flips!!( upsetting because you'll eat it too fast and then it's gone). The first 2 times I was there I had the dish was made with lobster( as described on the menu here). However I was just there yesterday and they had it with jumbo prawns and I actually preferred it with the prawns. Either it's made its totally worth the price. It is a bit spicy but I spice doesn't bother me.  Either way, the service is great, the food is awesome. A great place,  worth the trip way downtown.

Sexy vibes, sexy cocktails and sexy bartenders (ask for Papic), Macao will make your obnoxious group birthday dinner a little less painful. Beautiful space with unpretentious food and service, which is not to say their menu offerings aren't sophisticated and delicious. Would bring my white friends and Asian parents here... Which says A LOT.

This was a nice place to hang out late night with pleasant interior decor, strong drinks, prompt attentive service, and what my friends assure me was good food. This place gets 5 stars for two reasons. First, the drinks were tall and strong. Second, the service was quick and attentive. Captain Lou is an excellent drink with a profound ginger bite. While I didn't partake in the food this place had to offer, my friends devoured the offering and said it was delicious.
No comment

No comment
No comment

I visited Macao for the first time last week and have to say it was one of the best meals I have had recently. The interior of the space is dimly lit and stunning. Apparently it is fashioned to look like the brothels and opium dens of 1930's Macao. That definitely comes through, especially when you take a look at the artwork and scandalous figurines that pepper the stairwell to the downstairs speakeasy. Around 7pm on a Friday night there were plenty of seats available, but after 8pm the place really seemed to pick up. The drink list is great and we really enjoyed our cocktails. The favorite at our table was the Bashful Maiden.  Both the food and drink selection seems to be Asian inspired with an exotic twist. We split a number of appetizers and sides including the charred octopus, which was the best I have ever had. It had great texture and wasn't rubbery the way I have had it at some places. Our favorite thing by far were the mushroom and truffle croquettes. It was very difficult not to order more, they are a must!  Service was attentive and we were happy that they accommodated our walk in, despite there being a lot of reservations coming in. I will definitely visit again and would love to come back to the speakeasy for a sexy date night.

We went for Valentines Day and had an 8:30 reservation. Even though most tables were full the hostess graciously gave us a booth at our request. The atmosphere is reminiscent of a smoky dark old world bar in Hong Kong back in the 50s,60s. It is romantic and funky with interesting drinks. I had the Mata Hari a cognac based drink and my Husband had the Bashful Maiden a gin drink. We started with the chicken and pork belly dumplings and the spareribs. Both were delicious and flavorful. We ordered our 2nd round of drinks when Franny our wonderful server informed us that we would have to wait since a health inspector made a surprise visit. They have an A rating which they still have after inspection. They are not allowed to mix cocktails or cook until inspection was completed. We were happy to wait since we were in no rush and it was Valentines Day. After inspection was completed our African Chicken and Veggie Fried rice came out. We split both and the chicken was moist and juicy and I could've eaten the fried rice all day. We ordered the banana split which Franny informed us was on the house cause of the inconvenience! That topped off an already magical evening!!

Chicken and pork belly dumplings were amongst the best you'll have anywhere. The crispy fish was incredible but prawn noodles a touch underwhelming after the dumplings. Jasmine rice pudding was a delight. Drinks also fantastic.
No comment
No comment

Drunken dragon milk cocktail tasted pretty good but for $15 (+tip): not so sure. Cool pirates of the Caribbean-ey decor. If you like $10 for 4 dumplings you should be happy here. If you are not made of money find some place else to hang out.

This was my first stop on my first trip ever to NYC and it was wonderful. I was at the bar and the bartender Gabriel was nothing less than exceptional. He took great care of my sister and I and made the experience at Macao memorable. He was just great! Another foreign bartender was also very sweet and attentive. The vibe of this place is really cool too- loved it!

I made dinner reservations here with my girl friends for 7pm and got harassed by the bald bouncer of the lounge area at the entrance. He made me show him my ID and would not let me through until I did it. For dinner?! Seriously?! This guy was power tripping and cursing at me because I refused to give him my ID. Made no sense whatsoever. When I finally got in, I complained to the manager several times, who gave me a pathetic apology and told me to quickly sit down at my table. Turns out the bouncer was not supposed to be guarding the door checking for IDs till after 11pm. Total asshole. This place has horrible has customer service! Food was mediocre, too. I will never come back and will not be recommending anyone to go here.

Went here last Sunday exploring a new restaurant with friends and it was a really good experience. The food was amazing and the drinks were even better. Our waiter was real understanding that it was our first time and took his time to explain everything for us. I also found the price point to be fair. Definitely lay going here again soon. Would decently recommend the cocktails and ribs.

Have yet to find a flaw. I have been numerous times and each time is like the first. There are few restaurants in NYC that offer the service, food and ambiance that MTC provides which makes it one of the best. I love this spot and will continue to wine and dine there !!!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Drinks are probably better than the food, and definitely on the pricey side, but the ambience is great and cocktails are second to none.
The burlesque downstairs is fun - consistent delicious food - strong drinks and hot Serbian bartenders!
Great food, service, atmosphere. The fried rice is to die for and Daniello makes a mean drink. This place should not be overlooked.

The Macao Trading Company is a fusion of Portuguese and Asian, and isn't really that representative of Macau's actual cuisine, which is simpler and certainly less diverse. The atmosphere is fun and lively and the cocktails are extremely well made. It makes sense that this is the sister restaurant of Employees Only. The food was excellent, especially the shrimp and the ribs.

Came with a party of 8 on a sat night, the service was good, we tried bacalao, croquettes, dumplings, kale salad, ribs. Everything was good. For entrée , we had steak (a bit dry for medium rear), fried rice, which was very good and a dish similar to paella, which tasted fine. For desert , chocolate cake with chocolate ice cream (it was spicy, we didnt get it) and portugese donuts, were just ok. The drinks were not so good, many tastes like they had too much of sour mix . After diner, we went downstairs. It was crowded and hot, but it was ok for about an hour.  Overall, good experience.

I wasn't blown away by the food and the place was really loud. I was there with 6 people and basically could only talk to the person across the table from me. The cocktails were good though and the ambiance overall was trendy/fun.

Very cool interior,  amazing bartenders but pretty empty in the beginnings of the week. I was with my friend, had a couple of cocktails, I had an old fashion, and my friend a gimlet, the bartender really helped us with our decisions. I will definitely come back, probably for the weekend :)

Had dinner on 12/12/15. Decor is antiqued early 1900s style setting. Started off with their ribs and dumpling for apps. Then I had the African chicken with bacon and shrimp fried rice; delicious. My girlfriend had the fried cod, yummy. Service was excellent. We were in the basement seating. Good spot in Tribeca
No comment
My favorite place in entire city! Best cocktail! A great mix of west and east. Make sure you check out the bar downstairs! It surely will surprise you!
No comment
No comment

Went here last night on a first date. They sat us downstairs,  which kind of felt like a cave. There was an awful draft and the light from the utility room was annoying. The food was ok. Wine was good. A bit noisy. Our server was great though. Will likely come back to try other items on the menu and some of the specialty drinks. Ask to be seated upstairs if possible.

I got in late from Tampa, & Macao was near my hotel & the kitchen was still open.  I had steamed chicken & pork belly dumplings + African Chicken (piri piri) & coconut peanut sauce.  The dumplings & the sauce tasted great, but I wish the sauce had a little more viscosity.  The African Chicken was a treat!  The chicken was grilled over an open flame & the char & the slow heat of the piri piri marinade brought the best out in each other.  The coconut peanut sauce, was a nice way to fuse in some Indonesian flavors, and I pretty much licked my plate clean.
No comment
kale salad unremarkable, crutons were rock hard. ribs were decent, steamed dumplings chicken and pork dumplings were excellent. superb service and ambiance was like an old speakeasy.

Cocktails here were excellent, food not bad. However for $15 I expect more than four dumplings on an appetizer. I've never been anywhere the portion was less than 6 places. They only have wooden disposable chopsticks here which makes you question even more why your bill is $100+ here. Wanted to like this place, but there's much better Asian food at a better price all over the city.

I really like this place and it's a great date spot. I've been here 4 times and the food was always very good. The drink menu is fun and interesting with another bar downstairs. I recommend this place for a date or friends.

Good spot, gets crowded on weekends but cocktails are solid and food is tasty.  fun dance party down stairs when its going on.

After reading the reviews here, we were quite surprised at the amazing dinner we had at Macao.  The food here has been terribly under-rated (at least judging by the dishes we ordered).  Mushroom & truffle Croquettes were delicious, Mizuna salad was wonderful, LOVED the African Chicken (a highlight) and all the side dishes (great green beans).  Also enjoyed other dishes, such as the Pork Ribs and deserts.  I would be happy to go back any day.  (and of course great cocktails!)

I came for drinks and a party to Macao, it was decent. The decor has an Asian fusion thing going on. And the servers are playing along with the act. The place was lively and the crowd and music were good. I would love to try the food but I did not have time. I would say if the food is good this place could cruise into a 4 no problem. Based on drinks and price it however is a 3.
Curry Chicken and Dumplings are to die for! The fried rice and noodle dishes were average, but the drinks and atmosphere made up for everything. Awesome find!

My wife and I both disliked MTC. The food is quite plain and every dish came out to of the kitchen over seasoned or too salty to cover up the lack of taste in the dish itself or creativity of ingredients ... We were surprised that we got such mediocre dishes served to us. The room decor and menu listings promised us something more.  Very disappointed.

Try this place out for drinks and appetizers last night, and I was really impressed. The dumplings were delicious, not too overpriced, with a good portion size. The bartender made me a drink called the "Go To," which was similar to a Mojito and really delicious. This place has a fun atmosphere, and I heard that it gets crazier as the night goes on. We were there kind of early (left at about 11:30p) so it wasn't too crowded yet. The bartenders were friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back!

I've been here a few times last year and it is one of my favorite places.  The drinks are unique/good and the food is exceptionally tasty.  It's average to high on prices but your taste buds don't care.  I also came here for a night out with some friends visiting from out of town so I really like this place's versatility from a casual date place to after work drinks to a night out on the town spot.
No comment

OMFG! FINALLY! Living around the corner, not only closing of Sugar makes me happy but also finally having a place that has a great bar, very friendly staff and amazing food. I already went 4 times since they opened and had dinner twice. I cannot wait for the sangria recipe to be finalized but until then, the wines are just delicious. Ok, the food. Seriously, sick. The meatballs portuguese way are the best thing, the chinese way is also pretty great. The mushroom croquettes portuguese way are INCREDIBLE. Love the fried goat cheese, chicken dumplings, curry puff thingy and the sirloin portuguese way is to die for.

Pretty great find at 1am after an unsatisfying dinner at Catch. Concierge referral. Dumplings were great, menu was limited so can't really judge food based on one dish. Drinks were amazing. Cool room and a bartender to match. Order the Dragons Milk. Thank me later.
No comment
No comment

I love this place, it reminds me of one of the scenes of the East India Trading Company in Pirates of the Caribbean. The restaurant has two level, I recommend going downstairs as its quieter being away from the bar. The decor was awesome, but food was truly amazing. I had the pumpkin fries and chicken and pork steamed dumpling. Both were really good, the fries had just the right kick of pumpkin and paprika. The dumpling were tasty, and oh so porky goodness ;). For entrees I had the chili prawns which were really tasty, but not too spicy. The lobster and garlic noodles were out of this world awesome but be warned its a heavy dish, the noodle are really buttery. I order a brut rose champagne that went really well and reasonably priced. This place is definitely worth the trip.

I loved absolutely everything about this place from the moment we walked in until we finally shuffled out the door. The food was so delicious, the service was impeccable, and OH THE DRINKS!!!! I am not a big fan of alcohol, but I left there happily and pleasantly drunk. The drinks were too perfect to pass on. I strongly recommend the Bashful Maiden and/or the Drunken Dragon's Milk. This is a place I may become a regular at VERY quickly...

Came here Christmas eve to drink - It seemed to be one of the few places that had life.... The place itself looks really cool - and of course portuguese beer makes it more interesting... I asked for a Stella and the bartender handed me something else saying its jut like stella but portuguese.... might have been but at that point i couldnt have told the difference.... The crowded happend to be an eastern european mix of people - but i wonder what its like a usual night... music could have been better too...

Went hear for a girls night out and had a blast. My food was fantastic. I had the crisp whole fish and the bacon fried rice. So delicious. My friend had the lobster pasta which she said was okay and another friend had the cod which is a mild dish but she enjoyed it. Late night weekends the scene get really lively so the first time I visited here I had drinks and danced which was awesome but my dinner more recently is what's making me write a review. Yummy!!!!! Good spot!
Great location, great decor, great food, but eh-not-so-great service.  For my fellow vegetarians, I suggest the red kale salad, as well as the BBQ noodles.
No comment
We ate family style so were able to try a lot of dishes. Stick with the appetizers and desserts, they are the best dishes! We had pork buns, st

The place looks nice but the proprietor is rude and obnoxious.  There was a gentleman with the word principal on his shirt behind the bar.  He was giving his personal opinion on how people were dressed.  Costumer service is a total zero, you would expect more from a principal.  Plus it was designed poorly, people bump into each other and the crowd stinks.  Out of all the options in NY this is should be your last.
No comment
This place is perfect at 3am, feeling a little tipsy ... New York is ... Wow.  Mushroom truffle croquettes after amazing v-jay jam at M1-5 around the corner.  What a score!

Was very cool place with great food. Cocktails amazing and had the following food that I thought was great:: mushroom croquetts, bone marrow dish (crazy good), and  pork belly taco style with some type of soft puffy shell (this was my favorite .....I could have had this by myself instead of share with three people). Very good service even on a busy Friday night. I will be back foooooosure!
Great ambience, fantastic energy, good service, good food - what else do you need!
No comment

We went here with a larger group on a Friday night.  The place itself is very cool in an "this would only be in NYC" kind of way.  It's dark with an odd mix of cool vintage items collected above what appears to be a faux balcony.  The tables are small, sleek, wooden, with semi-uncomfortable wooden chairs that have a country, vintage feel.  The menu is diverse, an Asian infused menu for sure.  Our server was nice and attentive, albeit she seemed a little bit poorly educated on the menu.  As a result, I ended up with a dish entirely too spicey for me -- and thus left pretty hungry.
Great cocktails, wonderful service and great food. Super swanky and cool, the downstairs reminds me of La Esquina. Great spot to impress a date or to take some clients out to dinner.

Very BAD experience! Don't go! Waitress and manager were RUDE! Worst service I've ever seen. We complained that all dishes we ordered taste bad, and the manager responded "no one else complained about these dishes before, so I can do nothing at this point" so it's our fault then?! It's my friend's birthday dinner, and we all got pissed off by that manager's bad attitude. I don't usually make review on Yelp, but this time I really feel that I need warn everyone so that you don't need to go through what we experienced again.

Wow.  Macao has fallen.  This was a mediocre meal at best.  Once upon a time, a meal at Macao was tasty and fun.  There must be a new chef.  The menu has changed, favoring food that can be delivered quickly over food that is good.  Truly this was a banal and bad meal.  Our server was lovely, her service good, cocktails are still fun but that does not compensate for sad food.
My favorite thing about this place is that it's such a great atmosphere. The drink list is great and I enjoyed my prawns. Didn't eat a full meal but would be very interested in coming back.

Went out with my friend who is also my customer as I am his mixologist. We all had a great night. Drinks were good and nicely balanced, not too sweet, not too boozy, just right. The mixologists were friendly, knowledgable, and gave professional service. Will frequent again soon.
Gorgeous place!! Just had some appetizers here and everything was delicious. I can't wait to go back. Really want to see the lounge downstairs as well!
No comment

This was my first time at Macao and I must say that it is one of my favorite new spots to eat.  The decor is amazing and the atmosphere is really laid back, but with a very cool 1920's underground bar scene.  I went with a group and we ordered a ton of appetizers: our favorites were the jade dumplings and the croquette appetizer.  The cilantro sauce for the jade dumplings is out of this world.  For main courses we absolutely loved the paella and african chicken...the curry on the african chicken was really light but so full of flavor.  The service was really great as well, we will definitely be back.

Took a date here after other plans got ruined &  found this place by accident on my maps app on my iphone..... What a happy accident!  We forgot all about our ruined plans & had such a great time! The Paella is to die for!  The wait staff are Very friendly & Very knowledgable. The personal twist they put on their dishes & drinks... Oh wow!?! Things you love & thought couldn't necessarily be improved.... They've improved upon!   I've recommended this place to many friends & those who have visited all feel the same as I do.      Fantastic spot.... Highly recommended!

Was 20 minutes early for our 10pm reservation so we informed the host we were there and waited at the bar.  At 10:15 we were still waiting so I spoke to the host who then spoke to the hostess and then informed me the there was a "miscommunication"..meaning they gave our table away.  Now while he did his best to seat us as soon as possible (the second star is his E for effort)  he sat our party of three at a table for two.  Then our waitress could barely hear us over the music and got our order wrong.

There must be something in the oil at macau trading co. I'm still craving the mushroom & truffle croquettes, roasted brussel sprouts, pork belly and fried rice. They were so flavorful that we ordered seconds. We also had the fried fish (delicious), noodles and pork ribs (both only eh). As expected, it was busy and loud inside so it was difficult to hear anything being said to me from across the booth, but we were too busy eating anyway.

I liked Macao Trading Company but I didn't LOVE it ... and I wanted to love it.  The food was pretty good but not amazing.  The atmosphere was cute but the chairs were uncomfortable.  I'd come back but it's not at the top of my list.

This place is just ok.  We had a big table (8 people) and arrived 15 minutes late, but they held our table and we were seated right away. The Chile Shrimp are not at all spicy, and were way overcooked. I would have liked another drink or two, but no one came around to take our drink orders. Overall, it's dark and trendy, but so are a lot of places.

Not really the best interpretation of Fusion Chinese cuisine. Very simple menu - grilled pork chops were basic. The steamed cod was steamed slightly too long and the superior broth was very bland. The restaurants a few blocks down the road in Chinatown serve much better steamed fish. It is better to come here for its variety of drinks and cocktails but not so much for the food. The dragon's milk cocktail is filled with canned coconut milk.
No comment

Went here for my bday....yes it was a long time ago...and yes I've been meaning to write a review...but better late then never... Love the scallops and drinks r great dying to go back and share great times with great friends again
No comment

If I could do a half star Macao would get three and a half. I love this place on lots of levels. Great cocktails, good food and a terrific ambiance. Whether you are alone or with a group of 20, it is always a party at Macao Trading Co.

If i could do 3 and 1/2 stars i think that would be perfect. Macao has awesome dark atmosphere especially if you sit downstairs. Great for a date night. The drinks were really good and appetizers amazing. Where they fell short was the entre's. I would recommend this place for drinks and shared apps. Must try the bone marow!

I really want to go back to this place, since I just had a few drinks by the bar, but it's really beautiful and has great atmosphere.  I was here on a date, and frankly, at least he had good taste in bars. So even though my male companion was not a lasting one, I now have a great place in Tribeca to go for drinks. I also want to try the food, the menu looks great and Asian inspired.
How do I begin it's amazing! If you haven't being here you need to! The food is amazing!  cocktail lovers you will love this place drinks are great .
I really liked this place - beautiful decor, fun bar scene, and strong drinks.  I havent yet tried the food, but will definitely be back.

Recently my wife and I came here for a birthday dinner with about 10 people.  We really liked the food and drinks, lots of inventive combinations.  I particularly liked the African chicken and the bacon buns.  The sangria is great, too.  I'd like to give special recognition to our server, Michael, who did an excellent  job  handling the orders of the large group, and in particular in taking care of my wife's order - she has celiac disorder which means gluten can be make her very ill.  Eating out can be tricky since wheat is in so many dishes - but Michael's knowledge of the menu and his extra effort to check things with the chef led to a great dining experience.

Came here for a friends 30th bday and man this place delivered! Amazing staff and hostess and the food and drinks was top notch. The vibe of the restaurant is cool chic without being overdone. The patrons were also a good looking bunch too.
the ambiance was cool, the menu had very unique names for all the items, the service was excellent, the food didn't wow but it was enjoyable!

Some high points - excellent cocktails and interesting decor.  Kind of a speakeasy vibe, with a dark entry and no obvious sign.  Appetizers were good, if a little heavy.  Entrees were meh - good enough but not really worth the $25+ each.  If you want quality Asian, head down the block to Chinatown.  If you want to hide out in a place that looks like an opium den while drinking cocktails that sound like the signaure drinks of James Bond villains, head to Macao.  Skip the food, stay for the intrigue.

I'm weary of all "Asian Fusion" types, they're usually code-word for overpriced cocktail lounges trying to pass of as restaurants. What Macao provides visually it acutely lacks in taste. It's like walking into a James Bond movie set somewhere in a shady casino-cum-restaurant in Macao. If only the food could've been better than average I'd easily give this place a four. But the food was boring typical Asian Fusion crap, looks tasty but tastes whatever. We started with some dumplings that were easily forgotten. The chaozhou style steamed cod was definitely fresh but lacked in any complex tastes; something one would expect from Asian cuisine. Same could be said for the African chicken which was only slightly better. We also quickly forgot the hakka noodles, and as far as cocktails go, you'll note it doesn't have much alcohol. In shorty give this place a try for a date or a small friend gathering, if you want an actual tasty meal use Yelp so find some other place.

I really loved the decor and ambiance that flowed throughout Macao. As I attended a promotional event for a spirit brand here I was highly amused more by the amazing art and suprising choice of music. Kudos to the creative director or design team behind the look! I'd go back anytime just to look at all the items surrounding me.

I liked it but it was pricey for what it was. Not rediculous rip off pricey just pricey. It was great look and loud, the table next to us was talking at the top of their lungs, maybe a more normal group wouldn't have been so loud. they gave us the table right next to the kitchen door, usually I won't accept that in a place that's not absoultuly packed with a waiting list, which they were not. but the food was deliciuos if not a little affected by the chef's imagination. I want to go back but I'm going to wait and see if I make any money after the end of the year.
No comment
It's a great Portuguese/Asian fusion restaurant with exotic decor and good selections of cocktails. I love their Drunken Dragon cocktail and crispy whole fish, it was delicious.

Another casual but upscale spot to eat amazing food, meet interesting people and enjoy a wonderful cocktail when the Opium Den downstairs opens up. We ordered one of everything on the menu and it was all delicious. Visit late night. Meet (and love) Dushan.
Cocktails are strong and tasty - but on the pricey side.  Tried the glass noodles which were very good but a tad salty for me. Overall its a nice place for a few drinks and dinner. I'll be back
Real bartenders who know how to make a high quality drink. Havn't tried the food here but the drinks are top notch. Tequila is a must have here.

We had a company party here, and i think we had the whole basement rent out....serivce was good....drinks were good....but the food was soso...because the menu was pre-fix by my company, we werent able to ordered other food....but the ones we were getting wasnt good.....the food was on the salty side...and their lamb balls? were bad.....strong assss hell lamb taste.....yuck!

The food here is awesome!! The su chef Josh Goldstein does a phenomenal job of preparing high quality food! Besides the great food the decor is really prohibition era and reminds me of being at a place in the 1920's. There are two levels to this place one is underground and also has a bar while the main floor has a bar and a dining area.
No comment

Delicious and unique cocktails - Drunken Dragon's Milk and the Bashful Maiden are personal favorites.  The food, while not as exciting, are perfectly adequate in complimenting the drinks.  Nice ambiance - especially if you can get a booth!

The place is nice... reminds me of budakkhan or spice market (which i am not a fan of) but with a more intimate feel.  The menu wasn't very impressive nothing blew me away so we went with the chicken and pork belly empanadas to start and the duck special for two. The empanadas were ok I've had better and the duck was a bit salty. It's a nice place to try but I don't think I'd go back for food maybe just drinks if I was in the area.

Cool place for drinks and delicious food.  The wait staffs are friendly and like to have a great time with customers too.  I can't help comment on the food I ate because the drinks were flowing and had such a good time.  I highly recommend!
good food. good cocktails. great service. great atmosphere. I'm sold.
Always have a good time getting drinks here on weeknights or before going out. I'd skip the food. The atmosphere is great both at the upstairs bar and downstairs bar. Fun downtown crowd
Amazing drinks -- they're worth the $14. Try the dr funk.

I was here for a get-together from the company I work for. Before I went, i did my research and looked at the menu online. It wasn't too attractive since I'm chinese and everything on there was just regular chinese food (bokchoy, shrimp, fish etc). Once I got there, it all changed. The setting had an old fashion chinese restaurant feel to it. The food was great also. Loved the sirloin and the Drunken Dragon Milk was great. Since I'm not much of a liquor fan, this drink was satisfying. I totally recommend people to try this restaurant. I might or might not go there again though. One thing interesting about this restaurant is the X-Rated drawings on the walls near the restroom. That sure surprised me.
I dig this hidden gem.  Thoughtful menu, fresh ingredients, unique ambiance.  Ideal for late dining.

I reserve my usage of 5 stars but this place is DEFINITELY worth it!  I remember having an amazing steak, some slamming appetizers, and every and I mean EVERY drink I had was off the chain and I'm a mixologist for over 3 years so I know what makes a drink and what makes a DRANK...these folks don't play!!!
No comment

Striking place - really great atmosphere. That said I was there before 10, and I have a feeling it gets crowded and crazy as the evening goes on. A fun place to go early for drinks and I feel like it'd be a great place to take out of towners for a fun 'new yorky' vibe.
yum cocktails , food & hot people

This place gets it. Went there for a late late dinner (midnightish) and tasted most of the food on their late late dinner menu family-style: loved it all, from the noodles to the dumplings to the croquettes - great Asian fusion. Wine was good too, and served in generous portions. I think their cocktails are good though I haven't tried them, and both the upstairs and the downstairs bar areas are packed with beautiful people.

Only ever been here for drinks. Twice I think. It's a nice place in terms of ambiance and type of crowd it attracts but the cocktails were just above average. Their dragon drink is worth trying couple of times but really does not get you buzzed. The rest of the cocktails were pretty good but nothing to wow about. If I am passing by I would be up for a quick pop in otherwise I am not sure I would trek across town to go. Their drinks are on the pricier side for the quality I though. *shrug*
No comment

Recently returned from a trip to HK and dined w/ my fellow travel mates. Macao Trading makes a good attempt however we all agreed that the African Chicken was a miss, of course it can't compare to the original in Macao. The appetizers were amazing, I vote for the mushrooms, pork buns, squid, avoid the dumplings. Dr. Funk's bitterness definitely detracted from my turning 30 years old.

Shoot! I'm totally behind on my Yelp Reviews! I went to Macao literally a gazillion weeks ago but I only just remembered because - it's shit storming outside and I wish I was eating a donut. There's no reason why a donut should remind me of Macao you say....but there is. The whatever they want to name it - but it is actually a donut - desert at Macao is exactly what the doctor ordered as a remedy for Sandy... Do you think they're open? Do you think they'd deliver? Hmm...
I usually go to Macao for drinks and the food is an after thought; but recently sat down for dinner and their dinner is just as good as their drinks.

Went here once after a house part nearby.  It was fairly late on a Saturday night, like 2 am.  Bar area upstairs was pretty full but not too loud.  Downstairs was more crowded and more of a dance party, but people weren't really like dancing dancing.  Pretty fun overall.
Amazing place, delicious food and cocktails and the best bartenders in the city! It quickly became one of my favorite bars. I have fun every time I go there!

I went here after work to catch up with an old friend over drinks and food. We were seated at the bar in the basement- The room at first seemed more like a private room/lounge. But as the crowd picked up, it had alot of potential to hang out and meet others. Most of the patrons were mid 20-30s professionals and seemed a somewhat fashionable. The menu was interesting and I don't necessarily mean that in a skeptic manner. Basically, you can choose a dish and have it either Asian or Portuguese style. The dishes were good but not amazing. Based on my tastes, some of them seemed over-seasoned. I'm supposing this is due to their well made cocktails and the intention to drink more and snack lightly. Thus, I'd recommend this place more for drinks and crowd (if you are looking to start off your Friday in style).
No comment
The smell of fresh herbs, intimate service, and a memory of the best food you've tasted. This is it. And I read in People magazine that Beyonce and Jay-Z dined here last week. Ha!

I always have a delicious meal here.  Fun for groups.  Good bar upstairs and downstairs.  The meal here is such a treat.  Can get pricey, especially if you're having the fancy drinks.  Truffle Croquettes are amazing.

I recently visited this restaurant with some girlfriends on a Saturday night and it was packed.   We ordered 4 appetizers and 4 entrees.  Loved the mushroom and truffle croquettes and pork belly appetizers.  As for the entree, the crispy fried whole fish was delicious.  the noodle entree was just okay.  Service was mediocre.  The spiced sangria tasted like coke which was weird.

Went about a couple of months ago. Great food, very good service,  ambiance is very nice & décor quite different, good date spot too. Or for an intimate dinner with a small group of friends. The food portions were just right, and everything we ordered was simply delicious. Our server was very helpful in assisting us with wine/cocktail selection. Nice crowd.

I had dinner here last night with my BF.  This is one of the best meals ever! We were seated downstairs which was nice because it is much quieter than upstairs and we were able to have more of an intimate meal. Our server, Chloe ruled! She had really great food suggestions, but I hold a special place in my heart for her because she suggested one of the best drinks ever! I love the music, ambiance, and food. Yum yum! I will certainly come back again and again.
Love the bar. The decor. The food. It's a little expensive lest you'd be four stars.

This place was amazing! The food was delicious and the drinks were just right. My only complain is that I wish the portions would've been a bit larger; they tell you it's family style but I could've had a lot of those entrees by myself in one sitting and trust me I am no pig... so beware, for some reason I looked at the previous Yelpers pics and the portions on the pics seems like more than enough but I was a little disappointed. Taste wise, no complains there. We ordered the steamed chicken/pork dumplings which were great. We also had the mushroom and truffle croquettes and it was out of this world; if I ever come back to this place I would def get two orders of these bad boys, so friggin good! We also had the special fried rice of the night (spicy shrimp fried rice) along with the prawns and the african chicken which was more like a pigeon because it was so small. For dessert we had the brownie and the famous malasadas, both really good. We all ordered a whole bunch of drinks and out of everything my favorites were the Mikana (champagne based) and the Hong Kong cocktail, strong with a nice kick. Will def love to come back and maybe try a few of the other items on the menu and have a few of the above. Oh and I loved the decor, dark and cozy, great atmosphere for sure.
No comment

I did not know about the bar downstairs until last night, which I like much better than the place upstairs. It's cozy, small, and intimate, the decor and secretiveness set this place apart from other rather boring cocktail lounges. The drinks were strong and terrific. When I go to a cocktail lounge, I want to try new creations and engage with the bartender, which I very much enjoyed at Macao Trading Company! Can't wait to be back.

One of the more disappointing meals I've had since moving to New York. We ordered the truffle croquettes, pea salad, day boat cod, and fried rice. Everything basically tasted like salt with the exception of the cod which was bland, flavorless and swimming in soy sauce.
Dumplings excellent, peanut chicken tasty, the vibe perfect (not too scene-y) a and the cocktails amazing (in particular the Yellow Fever #2 for bourbon lovers). I'll be back.

Just dined here over the weekend and though it was pricey, well worth it. I had the African chicken and my friend had the hakka noodles. Delicious, delicious, delicious. Also decor is really cool. Cant wait to go back
No comment
Great service, great food, amazing mai tai cocktails and best of all - music and atmosphere! Will return.

Can't comment on the food as I've only been here for drinks on Friday and Saturday nights, but I absolutely love the ambiance of the place. Very good for dates, and the drink selection is above average. The reason why I want to give this place 4 stars is because it's a great place to take friends if you're in the Chinatown area. There really aren't many bars here but Macao Trading Co. really takes the cake in terms of providing a hospitable and fun bar in which to hang out.

This place has it all- great food, wonderful, fast service, well stacked bar and a very cozy atmosphere. It is incomprehensible to me how Macao was not packed solid last Sunday when we went there. With the whole fish (the second best I have ever eaten!!!) and the most amazing mint and dark chocolate gelato- people just do not know what they are missing. And it is reasonable when it comes to prices. Granted, the parking might be a little tricky, but isn't it a case just about anywhere in the city?
I really like this spot.  Great drinks & nice old-fashioned decor.
No comment

I really did want to like this place. Based on all the reviews I figured my bf and I would have a great dining experience.. This was not really the case. We walked in a few minutes late and our table was not yet ready so we waited at the bar. While we were waiting the hostess sat 2 couples before us and completely ignored us. The drinks were pretty good, and so was the crab dumpling appetizer. However, the chicken chinese style was worse than the $5 equivalent "chicken with cashew nuts"  at any other chinese restaurant. The prawns my bf ordered were a bit messy because they were not peeled and for $29 you would expect to get more than 4/5 prawns. Definitely not worth the price.

The drinks here are amazing, and the bartenders know exactly what they're doing.  Food was good, but pretty pricey.  Ambiance and decor were very nice.  A great date spot if you are willing to splurge.
No comment
No comment

Food was overpriced and underwhelming.  Starters are OK I would suggest sticking to those and sharing as opposed to mains. Dessert was awful, we had the donuts. Were dry and bland. My friends ordered red wine that came in the smallest dessert wine glasses. The waitress was extremely abrupt too. Definitely wont be coming back.
No comment

Average for a NY restaurant.  Prices were reasonable.  Food good, not great.  I had the romaine salad, the chili prawns and brussel spouts side.  Salad and spouts were way to oily.  COuld have used half that and had the same effect.  Prawns were great, would definitely recommend that dish.  Came early, bar was packed but dining empty.  However server was still very slow.  I haven't been when crowded but can only imagine.

I like the decor, nice and romantic. Food was a bit on the pricey side. The main entree doesn't come with anything, for 30 bucks at least could throw in some rice. Rice was extra $. Food was also very salty.

I went there last night with friends and it was great. The wait staff was very attentive my water glass ever barely went below half a glass. I had the Firecracker cocktail which was different but delicious, romaine salad, the chicken and pork belly dumplings, and the drunken berries for dessert. The romaine salad was tasty, a bit on the salty side but I loved it not so much the slivers of fish. The chicken and pork belly dumplings were delicious I couldnt get enough and the drunken berries were delicious even though obviously the berries weren't the sweetest because it was not in season. It was very vibrant but I could still have a conversation with my friends. I would definitely recommend even though it is pricey total with 1 drink, 2 appetizers, and 1 dessert was $52 (including tip) but definitely worth it.

Went to this place for a birthday dinner with about 10 other people. Overall, the experience was pleasant though the prices were a bit high for this level of place.  I cannot say that the food was great and so it gets 3 stars in my book.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here with a group of 6 for a post bday dinner party. It was perfect. Great hip vibe, great selection of cocktails, and the food was good. We tried a bunch of their cocktails and they were all really good, you probably won't go wrong ordering any of them. We ordered family style for 4 of us and were satisfied and full.  We started with the bacon buns, and dumplings-both were good.  The bacon was really pork belly and I'd recommend them over the dumplings.  Then we shared the cod, haka noodles, prawns, black rice and brussel sprouts. The haka noodles and prawns were my favorite. The prawns were just the right amount of spicy. The cod was good but unmemorable, I probably wouldn't order them again.

This is a great place!  Nice dark atmosphere, big bar, and cozy booths.  the food is limited, but just right for NYC standards.  Delicious! so much flavor!  we shared the dumplings, and the "paella" for 2, not called paella, but something that resembeled a paella.  in it was the best meatballs ever, with rice on the bottom that had the most wonderful taste, I never wanted to stoo eating it.  I wish the wine by glass was more extensive.  Prices for wine was very reasonable.  Will def return! Loved the vibe here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went there on a Tuesday after work night and happened to find Good cocktails, excellent service and good food: The mushroom croquettes, ny strip and crispy duck spring rolls were really tasty.... BUT, the  brussels sprouts are to die for.  Will definitely come back...
No comment
No comment

That day was my friend's b-day so my all friends were this bar for celebrating his bday! It was first time to be here as for me but it was very good! I went to the bar on the downstairs! This place looked quite interesting because they decorated with all Asian stuffs. It was cool and the atmosphere was good ! I think this place is good for hang out with friends! I love this atmosphere and the drink was good but not that spectaculars :)

I went here last night with a table of 8 and had a wonderful night. The atmosphere of Macao is inviting and intimate. The mushroom and truffle croquettes are a must! Our waitress, Lucy, was awesome - bubbly, informative and with honest advice about the food size and taste that helped us to choose a great meal.
love love love this place. awesome cocktails, great vibe. the music was on point. visiting from la and this place was the perfect new york vibe i was hoping for!

Everything was delicious. Fried rice could've been much better but nonetheless...enjoyed it! I went with a group of friends. Waiter was very informative, even suggested we visit their sister restaurant for some of the best drinks in the world!
No comment

It's a shame that Macao is only 3.5 stars rated. It deserves much higher reviews especially for their fabulous cocktails menu: original, delicious, and bespoke if you just ask for it. It is probably one of the top cocktail places in the city, simply because they hired incredible mixologists. Look for Gabe on Tuesdays and Thursday. He's a magician.
I've tried almost everything on the menu and it was all delicious. A great restaurant with good music and decor.

this place is run by chauvinistic pigs!  one particular bartender was particularly rude, being very bossy to the other staff and not friendly to the clients at all.  in general, these people are not gentlemen and do not know how to treat and talk to ladies!!  enter at your own risk!  on another occasion this place was booked for a birthday party.  they did not deliver what was promised.  a table downstairs was promised but the hostess postponed letting us down there, and actually didn't let us go down there the whole night... what a sham!  party guests were cramped in the front bar area with no where to sit.  what an awful disappointment.  drinks are expensive, staff is offensive... save your money and respect and go elsewhere.

On a Monday this place was sparsely populated when my friend and I stopped by to try our Gilt City tasting menu. I was pleasantly surprised by the selection and the number of courses. The food overall was very good. I had the oyster two way, octopus carpaccio, prawns, scallops, and malasadas. The portions were very small - I image they would be bigger for the a la carte menu - but everything was tasty. I definitely could have gone double portion on everything. The ambiance was dim and moody, pretty nice. Servers were very nice overall. I'm knocking off a star for the slow pace and lack of attention in service. It bothers me when a restaurant is only a quarter full but there are five servers clustered in a corner talking with each other and studiously avoiding eye contact with the customers. In the end the dinner was a 2+ hour experience and we had to take our malasadas to go and eat them in the train station, they were still good.
Beautiful restaurant. I love the atmosphere. The food is very nice and service is great.

came here only for drinks and was a fan of the Yellow Fever.  great place to stop by after having dinner in the Tribeca area.  rustic ambiance, trendy and ample amount of space around the bar whether you're with a date, girlfriend or small group.  only peeve, the cocktails are pricey!

This place is great.  I've come often for drinks and snacks in the past, but the restaurant has a new chef and the food quality has skyrocketed.  I love the Grilled Romaine Salad (sounds odd, but is fresh and delicious); Dry Fried Boneless Pork Ribs (big enough for a meal if you order rice too); and Organic African Chicken (spicy!).  Try the Fried Egg Tart for dessert. The bartenders are very knowledgeable about the drink menu and creative with special orders.

Macao is a nice place and the staff was very nice and attentive.  The food was meh.  Only reason I say meh is that I have had much better food for about a third of the price.  This is one of those typical trendy NYC restaurants where you are paying for the ambience as opposed to the food.  3 stars though because the service was really good.  But don't go here for anything special regarding the food.  It was suggested we do family style which is fine, but kind of annoying when the tables are rather small.  We got the crispy trutas, steamed chicken & pork belly dumplings, and dry fried boneless pork ribs for appetizers.  Broiled grouper, Macanese chili prawns, Wagyu flank steak, Niman ranch pork belly, ants climbing the tree, and pork fried rice for entrees.  Nothing was really out of this world.  Tasted all right, but really not worth the price.  I would honestly rather sit in a mom and pop joint with good food than a nice place with mediocre food.

yummy were the kale dish, mushroom croquettes, and scallop dish. it was a fun nite had by all. atmosphere is sexy, staff is a joy, events that happen at the downstairs bar are so much fun, and the food was great too.

We hosted a party in Macao's private room last night and it was fantastic! Everyone had a wonderful time. The staff was superb, extremely professional and accommodating. The bartenders served with flash and flare and somehow managed to keep up with demand. The food was delicious and plentiful. Truly excellent in every respect. All the guests, young professionals, had a terrific time and said Macao was the perfect party venue.
No comment
tried this place on a fri eve with frnds..don't miss 'mata hari'..the best cocktail.& great food..... fun vibe and the bartenders are def pretty cool..
best spot in TriBeCa! amazing drinks and delicious food!

Excellent food, great drinks. Restaurant upstairs is classy and the bar downstairs is hip! Cool crowd and music but can definitely hear your conversation and feel secluded with your company. Highly recommend
wow what great drink they have the menu is cool too and I love the downstairs lounge spot very cool really into this spat
The Bar is good and the apps are great.  Try the dumplings!

Went here last night for a friend's surprise birthday party and it was delightful. As you walk in past the metal doors and observe the dim lighting, dark brick walls, wooden ladders, and the balcony littered with random objects, you will feel like you're dining in a warehouse from the 1940s as opposed to a modern restaurant in Tribeca. The food and decor is supposed to be inspired from the era where Portugal had a colony in China. If the food recipe is accurate, one would conclude that soy sauce was used heavily in that colony. I ordered the Peking Style Pork Ribs with a side of fried rice and nibbled on other dishes of people sitting next to me. The dishes were served with decent portions, tasty, and definitely  unique but I just couldn't ignore the heavy use of soy sauce. For dessert, I had the Coconut Panna Cotta and the Portuguese doughnuts with rum sauce. Both great but everyone in our table attacked the Portuguese doughnuts. Since the place is not very large, they were able to provide attentive service to all the tables. I was informed that they also have a lounge in the basement but I did not get a chance to check it out. I recommend this place to those who are open to experimenting with something new.
I would definitely not recommend this place. My sister and I dined there about a month ago, and she got very bad food poisoning. The service was so/so.

I recently visited this restaurant with some friends and it was packed.   We ordered 4 appetizers and 4 entrees.  Loved the mushroom and truffle croquettes and pork belly appetizers.  As for the entree, the crispy fried whole fish was delicious.  the noodle entree was just okay.  Service was mediocre.  The spiced sangria tasted like coke which was weird. Overall good experience. May go back one day.

came here on one of the coldest nights this month. not sure what the vibe would be, but holy cow, i completely fell in love. very genial & talented bartenders. offered great advice on the menu & fun conversation. i would recommend this place to anyone. the waitstaff was great, the drinks were complex & crazy tasty, although a bit spendy. we had the dried beans, the crispy shrimp & the chinese style ribs. my mouth starts to water when i think of it. the food prices are totally reasonable, esp. for Tribeca. for drinks try the Yellow Fever or the Mata Hari - i would venture to say you probably can't go wrong - b/c i had a sip of my friend's, and i almost stole them from her when she wasn't looking.

I went ot Macao for a portugese wine and small plates tasting with my girlfriend. we had a blast, the place is really cool it has clandistine decor that makes you feel far away from lower manhattan. The wine was great and the apps were too. The staff was very friendly and helped us figure out what to do because it was very loose not like a structured tasting so you could pair whichever wine you wanted with the food and wew weren't sure if we could sit at the tables or had to stay at the bar. I can't spell our servers name but she was a very nice asian yound woman (I want to say Jin but.....) she described the food and the wine and was really nice and helpful. we both liked her a lot. The gentleman at the dooor Mauricio was very friendly as well. Oh and they played good music as well, you could see the place gets jumping the later it gets! They stay open and serve food late so if you're looking for a chill place to go with good food and a great vibe go here! I'll be back for sure

went this past Friday night..got there around 930 place was happening.....beautiful room  i mean just amazing so well designed....great cocktails....amazing talented bartenders...great service,friendly,hip knew menu inside and out...hostess/manager super cool and sexy..music excellent,bathrooms perfectly clean and then we started eating.......OMG it was horrible......only thing good i can say about the food was i didnt get sick....( we had 4 apps 2 entrees)........to wrap it up   go for cocktails we each had 2 different ones and they were top notch.....great wines by glass too....I really WANTED to love this place...would absolutely go back to drink.............sorry chef but food was awful

I was drawn here for the 4th time after experiencing great food.  The 4th time I was accompanied with 3 well groomed and dressed friends of mine.  After dinner, the manager invited us to go downstairs for drinks.  We then looped around to the downstairs lounge entrance and were intercepted by a pretentious, arrogant and rude door person who told us there was a "private party" downstairs.  I am a born and raised New Yorker and am well aware of the "private party" schtick.  I tried to explain we were patrons who were invited downstairs by the manager of the restaurant.  It seems he did not believe me and continued with the "private party" story.  I then went inside to inform the manager of what had transpired but ironically, after originally being invited, the spineless manager then told me that he has no pull at the door for the lounge downstairs.  Our waiter, who had waited on me the 3 other times I was there, came out to explain that we were regular patrons and should be allowed in but it seems by then the rude doorman's ego got in the way and he refused to let my party in clearly out of preservation of pride.  It's a shame that a place with great food is so rude to their regular patrons.  In a city with a thousand great restaurants, Macao should do a better job taking care of their customers.
the worst place possible.  stole my jacket and it took 30 min to finally get a menu at the bar.  go next door....so many better places than this ridiculously priced nonsense bar.

Amazing Italian food! It's a go-to spot in this neighborhood. The pastas are fresh and delicious, and the service is outstanding. Definitely recommend!

We had a birthday party celebration for 13 people Saturday evening. The food and the service was absolutely excellent. The whole room sang happy birthday and our guests thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and their meals. The homemade pasta was perfection and the eggplant Parmesan and chicken Parmesan were delicious.
Beautiful intimate restaurant. The staff are super pleasant and attentive. Everything we ordered was delicious. Definitely recommend for a special night out. A little pricey but worth it.

Overall I'll give it a 4 but I have notes. Some of the dishes were much better than others. Homemade pasta was worth it. The Brussels were not very good and the appetizer was not enough food to make sense of the price. Overall don't think I'd go back but glad I tried it.

Very cozy neighborhood spot with the type of menu which makes it hard to choose. All of what we tried was delicious and generously portioned. Wine list almost exclusively Italian with many bottles in the $50-60 range. Pleasant service too.
I got the ragu with meatballs and sausage. It was really delicious and an exciting add on was amazing garlic bread! It's really herby, soft, and buttery

Came in with high expectations and left quite disappointed. Ambience in here is great. However, the food was lackluster. We ordered the brussel sprouts and veal meatballs as appetizers. The brussel sprouts were were not roasted well at all and a bit flavorless, and the veal meatballs were mediocre and quite salty. We had the limone pasta and the Orecchiette with italian sausage as our main dishes. Limone was very watery and far too lemony. Orecchiette was not good -- sausage tasted like generic sausage from Stop and Shop, not good and very bitter. Did not finish it and had no desire to bring it home. The menu needs to be worked on with higher quality ingredients!!!!
Great Italian spot off of of smith street in cobble hill with a large menu and a great outdoor eating environment

They have a really cute backyard and we brought our dog to dine with us. I enjoyed my black pasta with calamari and my husband enjoyed his lemon pasta which was light and refreshing. They have excellent staffs who are friendly and accommodating.

Had brunch at the recommendation of a friend who had dinner here. Food was delicious and fresh. Service was good. They have a cute outdoor garden in the back that is shaded, so you're not baking in the sun. Nice and chill vibe.

My favorite Italian restaurant in the neighborhood. Amazing gnocchi, chicken parm, lemon pepper pasta... everything is delicious. Not over priced, and the staff is always friendly. Beautiful interior and boho back patio.
Everything here was delicious. Loved the muscles and black linguine. Chill vibes and friendly staff.
Solid food. Loved my clam pasta and tiramisu. Our large group had a wonderful evening thanks to the staff. They were very professional, efficient, and kind. Will definitely come back again.

I had seen this place multiple times on Yelp and live in the area. I had some friends over one day and we decided to walk over to give it a try. We seated outside (sidewalk), ordered a few drinks and appetizers, among them the prosciutto (it was ok, some random fruit was added which was a bit odd) and the classic bruschetta (this was great, we even added an additional order). We were just there for some drinks and apps, so decided to share an order of pasta and a salad. The salad was underwhelming and the pasta (Pasta Aglio) was good, although not life changing. I went inside to use the restroom and the ambiance is in fact great. It is beautiful inside and the back garden is very nice as well. I am not saying I didn't enjoy Gersi, but just can't get the hype. Service was great and very friendly, though.

Loves brunch here, everything was so so delicious.  Vaccines were definitely checked before entering and the staff was very courteous and friendly.  Ordered pancakes, French toast, eggs Benedict, bruschetta, eggs polenta, but the absolute best items were the house cured salmon and the aperol spritz!  I live in Manhattan so I think the prices here were very reasonable and definitely worth a visit for weekend brunch, thank you for the amazing meal! Will be back again!

not to be dramatic, but this was some of the worst food and service i've ever had. when my friend and i walked up to the host stand, the two hosts stared at us as if we were bothering or interrupting them from something; they were very unfriendly and didn't bother to ask if we were interested in a table. they took us to our table, but weren't greeted until 5-10 minutes after we sat down with water and bread, the few slices of bread we were given were STALE, they tasted like they were a day or two old. for our appetizer we split a mozzarella di buffala, and it didn't taste fresh either. we both ordered the cacio e pepe as our entrees. i had high expectations given that the cacio e pepe i had tried a few weeks ago at an italian restaurant in DC was amazing, but was immediately disappointed at the presentation when it was put in front of me. i was still hopeful that it would taste good, but after a few bites i realized how salty the dish was. i asked my friend what she thought and she agreed that it was extremely salty. we called our waiter over and he said, verbatim, "that's just how it's supposed to taste. would you like a box?" mind you our plates were full. we said that we didn't want a box, and he asked us if we wanted them to make it less salty, we almost felt pressured and like we had no other choice so we said ok. it came back extremely bland, but still salty. our waiter didn't even bother to ask if the cacio e pepe was any better than what we previously had. our server was no where in sight, so we had to ask a busboy for our check. our waiter willingly went over to our table a number of three times: when we ordered the food, when the food was dropped off, and when he dropped off the bill. he did not bother to go out of his way to ensure we had a good experience. we left the restaurant feeling extremely angry and disappointed.

So today we decided to be lazy and order breakfast. I had scrambled eggs with home fries & bacon while my bf had the French toast with a side of bacon . Everything was delicious  it came with complimentary bread, beans and a side salad . The bread was nice and soft and the bean were quite tasty ... my only issue was salad . There was so much dirt and grime on the leaves  it's obvious no one has rinse them ...

Best Italian in the neighborhood.  Great owner.  Great staff.  Even the non Italian items are incredible !

What a great spot!  I have walked by this place many times over the years and only tried it for the first time a couple of weeks ago.  We sat outside on the back patio which is covered (yet still airy), and dog-friendly (so that our toy poodle could accompany us).  The atmosphere was lively, bustling and fun.  The service was speedy, attentive and friendly.  The food was very good.  I want to check out their brunch next!
My favorite Italian restaurant in the neighborhood! Sitting inside takes me right back to the cozy and delicious restaurants in Italy. The food is always fresh and delicious!

Had a reservation for 8pm, was told our table was "just getting up" 3 times but we weren't seated until after 9...at a cramped table by a door to the outside that waiters kept squeezing past us to open, blasting cold air on our backs. They gave us free drinks to "ease the pain" which was a nice gesture, and waitstaff service was solicitous, but it isn't quite make up for the wait and BS from the hostess. Food average. We'll go to Sociale or Fragole instead next time. Oh, and they didn't check for vaccinations, nobody wore masks, and the place was packed. At your own risk, folks.

My boyfriend and I had our New Year's eve dinner here.  The space is a lot bigger than I initially thought. There's a dining areas in the front, then a secondary and more spacious dining area in the back.  We had the Burrata, Tagliatelle ala Bolognese and the Pappardelle with wild mushrooms.  The Burrata was extremely fresh and well made.  The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente.  I will definitely come back again to try the other dishes.  The food was excellent!

This place is one of my favorites! Beautiful space, delicious food, always consistent with flavors, which is huge for me. I don't know how they season chicken Parm, but it's insane! It's delicious! I never ever order chicken when I'm out, cause it's too simple- but this place is an exception! So worth it!

What a great find! Booked this for a birthday dinner and I'm so glad I did. We were seated in a gorgeous courtyard in the back (they also have patio seating in the front) and the staff was so accommodating even with our large party. The food was all amazing (we got a variety of bruschetta and pastas, the panzanella salad, and the roasted chicken entree) and they have great service. They used to be cash only but do take credit cards now. Highly recommend!!!

So good and simple.  Started with grilled octopus, perfect size for two.  The beet and goat cheese ravioli hit the spot.  I don't usually order pasta or cheese  but this was not too heavy or cheesey. It made me want more but I felt satisfied.  My bf's hanger steak was okay.  It had a side salad so for Paleoans it was a healthy portion and combination.  We shared a classic molten chocolate cake with berries and cream and after it was finished, everything in the world seemed fine.  Gersi has a following now so on Friday nights, expect a wait for a table or be seated at the bar.  It seems to be the hot new spot in CG/CH.  Kudos to them for serving unpretentious food that can be regular fare for families and folks in the area.  Prices are reasonable because it's cash only.  Don't know why they don't take credit cards but if they did, it probably would be even harder to get in.

Exceptional service and ever better food! If you go to or are in Brooklyn this place is a must visit. The homemade meatballs are to die for and my personal favorite! One of a kind taste!

I decided to try Gersi last night based off of the reviews. The food was fresh and homemade. It was delicious! The wine was excellent! The service was friendly and knowledgable. I am so happy I discovered this restaurant! I will definitely be back!

Such a great find!!! I'm not an expert in Italian food but after going to Italy this past fall, I at least experienced what good Italian food tastes like. This place reminded me of that, the consistency of how the noodles were cooked, the flavors and freshness. It's also a really nice ambience with a cute backyard and very affordable. My friends and I tried a few items off the menu, including the lemon pasta, garlic bruschetta, fennel salad, tagliatelle Bolognese, and mussels. The only thing I didn't really care for was the fennel salad but I also don't like the black licorice taste of fennel. We also had some excellent Chianti. And actually my favorite part was the bread they give you in the beginning with some white bean spicy spread. I can't wait to go back!!!

OMG. What a lucky find. In the neighborhood looking at new apartments and came across this gem. The eggs ragu were phenomenal. I wish I had a bigger stomach to soak up all the sauce w bread! I'm def coming back here again!

This is a neighborhood gem of a place. The ambiance is adorable, the food is amazing and the service is super friendly. We went with a hungry group of 7 and everything we ordered was delicious. There were some standouts, though. You MUST get the burrata, cacio e pepe, tagliatelle bolognese and save room for dessert. The tiramisu and the panna cotta were top notch. I don't mind cash only places when the food is this good and the prices are reasonable. Another plus: they take reservations. Our group will definitely be back.

Very quaint little restaurant. I would recommend a reservation for Friday and the weekend. I have sat on the patio, adorable set up and lighting. Good assortment of wine and reasonably priced. The chicken parm and the rigatoni ragu are by far my favorite. I would love to branch out and try more dishes, but those two never disappoint.

I must say, I really had a good feeling about this place coming in. Everything seemed alright at first but it seemed like our waiter was very distracted while serving us.
