The staff was very nice but you definitely need to make sure that kind of behavior stays outside of the restaurant because its not fair to us and made us uncomfortable.

Best description of the food was "meh". I could have made better at home. It was loud and there was no cell signal in the restaurant. Tried to see the positives but it was a struggle? The bread was good, affordably priced

One of our absolute neighborhood favorites for dining out and takeout. Their pick-up and delivery service has been superb during The Pause, quality food and timely service as top notch as ever. Treat yourself!

I choose to give up all other food and only eat the Gersi French toast. I don't even like French toast, but will live off of theirs. Divinity. It is that good. I had a pasta and ragu that was also incredibly delicious and we got one French toast for the table. It felt like blood sport to finish it off so we had to keep ordering it. So great. And don't get me started on 2 for 1 Bloody Mary time. Yummmm love it here.
No comment

Recently had brunch and had a very enjoyable meal.  We sat outside under their front awning which was recessed far enough way from passers by so no issues there.  Service was good and friendly, there enough to take care of us but not excessive so we could also enjoy our meal at a leisurely pace.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich and my friend, the grilled cheese. Both were nicely presented and delicious. My side salad was fresh and not over dressed.  I did check out the back yard for possible meals but as someone mentioned it's not really set up well as the top tent, which would be mostly fine on its own, has side coverings which ends up making the space more enclosed then it should be in this COVID sensitive times. Also as a matter of safety the above large fan is actually forcing air downward which is pushing the warm exhaled air of the diners back down, again not the type of air flow you want.  Nevertheless while I wont be using the back yard I would definitely return to eat at one of the sidewalk tables.

Coming back from the Mets game we bailed at Atlantic Ave and stumbled on this gem on Court St. Sat us without a reservation and the service was top notch. My wife loved the Butternut Squash Soup and my liver pate was wonderful. The butterfly salmon and black ink pasta were superb. Our only regret was not sitting in the back cafe which was beautiful. The desserts could of been a bit better but did not detract from a great experience and a definite spot we would return to with friends and/or family. Already spread the word to my son who just moved into the neighborhood.

Loved the ambience - tightly packed tables, votives on each, bustling action and patrons enjoying themselves.  Cash only, very reasonable prices.  The menu was good and food outstanding.  Fabulous beet salad, branzino fish was great, pasta outstanding, and very good chianti.  But here's what I didn't like -- the waiter.  As a good Yelper, I checked in on Yelp when we got there.  You get a free order of garlic knots by doing this.  I showed the waiter my phone and he said he would place the garlic knot order when we placed our entire order.  Really?  OK.  I felt like he rushed us throughout the meal.   No sooner had the garlic knots arrived and then our salad was there.  Halfway through the salad the main course arrived.  This is a 5 star restaurant.  Maybe we caught our server on a bad night.

Living only a few blocks away I've always wanted to try Gersi once they moved in. We visited on a Friday night, when other plans were cancelled, made last minute reservations and were accommodated right away. The place was packed when we first walked in, as to be expected, but to my pleasant surprise we were escorted to the back where they had a beautiful seating area in an outside tent. I wanted to try everything on the menu as they had an array of options but we went with the brussel sprouts and bruschetta (both were equally delicious and refreshing) for our appetizers and for our entrees we had the spaghetti limone and the skirt steak (cooked and flavored to perfection). The server was very attentive and even offered up a wine suggestion to my partner for her spaghetti, which she loved. After we discussed dessert, as we usually don't eat dessert at the same place we eat dinner, but the server offered us a tempting dessert menu. After looking it over we decided to go with the chocolate lava cake and the vanilla panna cotta. My partner loved her lava cake, the panna cotta could have used a little more flavor/sweetness but was smooth and creamy. Needless to say overall it was a great experience. The food was delicious and fresh, the service and ambience were on point.  We will be back.
No comment
Absolutely delicious burrata appetizer with good veggie and meat options. We came as a party of 6 and sat inside but the garden looked incredible. Def recommend
GraT place good food good service we had grilled veggies I had fish my friend had chicken al was good

Such an amazing atmosphere and I loved all the food I was able to try. I ordered the lemon pasta and holy crap it was good (drain the bowl of the lemon juice though because it gets a little too sour at the end)

I've loved this restaurant since it opened but had a very disappointing experience tonight--overcooked, over-sauced rigatoni that no self-respecting Italian chef would serve. I hope that it was just a matter of the B team being in the kitchen. I'll give them another chance and hope that tonight was an isolated case.
No comment
Nice casual spot, cute backyard. Cacio e pepe was the right amount of peppery and creamy. The chicken was delicious and the garlic toast is a guilty pleasure.

Been twice and sat at the bar both times. Great service and drinks both times despite it being so busy. Food was amazing especially the bruschetta, polenta, and I really enjoyed the pappardelle w/ mushrooms and the kale & ricotta ravioli. Will definitely be going back!

I came with my friends because they said it was good. Unfortunately This place was very packed too small to fit people. We also had a reservation too and it's just a lot of people in one place! One of the biggest downer is that the system the have for bills is atrocious. It looks like a calculator receipt and you didn't even know what was that price for! Also then to find out they only do cash was a nightmare. It is 2018 get updated please! Such a horrible experience and just a hassle trying to pay a 200 dollar bill with like 4 other people !!

I have lived in the neighborhood for almost four years and don't know how I missed Gersi's opening. I am a Frankie's die hard, but the food here is superior. I've never had a bad dish from their main menu, and there's always a long list of specials. The Spaghetti al Limone is way better than anything should ever be (I almost didn't order it bc it seemed too "simple" but shit, it's divine), and everything else is outstanding as well. It can get busy and feel a little cramped, but that doesn't really bother me. Also, the bar is a great and easy place to have a meal and a great glass of wine by yourself.
Love me some Italian food!! Celebrating our dear friend wedding, so glad we came, food is Amazing, service is right on top! Chef Fernando made us feel home!!
Great service. We went in before our 6pm reservation in nother restaurant and ended up staying for dinner. Drinks are on point and food is just as great. Will definitely come back

AMAZING Italian food. I'm pretty sure everything on the menu is incredible but we had the garlic bruschetta, double kale Caesar, spaghetti al limone and then my absolute favourite, the tagliatelle with mint. It might seem like a strange thing to order but it's so delicious - you have to try it. Great house red wine and the only disappointment was that we didn't have room for dessert after loading up on the delicious bread and oil that was brought to us when we arrived.

Terrific neighborhood Italian in a tiny space. 5 stars because of price to deliciousness ratio and because they switched us to a large comfortable table when I I told them we were entertaining family from out of town. 3 hours of relaxed drinking and eating and everything was great- aperol spritz,  kale Caesar, mozz and flavorful tomatoes, pork chop, black pasta with calamari, branzino- all delicious. Even my kid's butter pasta was fresh and perfectly cooked!
Omg so good!!! I'd eat here every day if I lived in Brooklyn. Great house made pasta served in the beautiful back garden. Don't forget to try the tiramisu it's awesome!!!
The reviews are stellar but the food is just ok . True it's cheap but you get what you pay for ... staff was nice though ...

Gosh I am so conflicted here because I love this place, the food is good, the drinks are good and the staff is friendly; however the coffee is not, I've tried ice coffee, and their hot coffee, now I drink a lot of coffee but the coffee here does not agree with me. I'm hoping they can improve this; perhaps try "French Press"?

Absolutely delicious and creative dishes, lovely staff, excellent atmosphere but you get rushed and pushed to choose and eat quickly because of the line spilling onto the sidewalk. Another inconvenience: you can only pay cash, which is announced in large letters outside. This is gross, mafia-like and it screams: We don't care about the customers, just the wad of bills that they're supposed to show up with.
Delicious food. Incredible service. Such a rarity to find the whole package in MYC these days. Great date spot. Order off the special menu with reckless abandon.
No comment

Great neighborhood spot.  Good Prices and quality food.  Service was good but the only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because after we finished out meal it took 35 minutes to get our check.  They also know how to take and KEEP a reservation.  I was given the proper expectation that they would either have a table or a hightop table at the bar.  We ended up at the hightop right at the window - great ambiance.

I've eaten at Gersi and ordered for delivery before. Both times the experience was perfect, and the food, delicious. One of my favorite items is the garlic bruschetta. I just ordered for delivery and received a garlic bruschetta that was nothing more than a cold piece of bread with parmesan cheese sprinkled over it. It was never even put in an oven. The cheese was not melted in the slightest, and it had absolutely no garlic flavor to it at all. The beans and oil that come with the regular bread was ten times more garlicky. Considering the fact that I was really looking forward to it, I'm extremely disappointed.
Very good. Light, doesn't make you feel like you are eating unhealthy. Cozy. Cash only. Early close, 11pm.

Found a new Italian gem!! Went there for a mid week dinner. Found a quaint and cozy place with lovely staff. To start there was a complimentary plate of garlic white beans with bread and foccacia that was very tasty. To follow we got the steamed mussels, octopus and kale panzanella salad. Loved the kale and mussels. My date had the salmon and I had the skirt steak (which was delicious and served a toasted crusty bread that soaked up the amazing marinade from the steak) and the lemon pasta which was a lovely surprise of flavors. And I can't forget about the delicious wine. We finished our meal with a piece of tiramisu. That was good but I might not order again. Overall it was a very memorable dinner and will definitely be back.

I took my son and his fiance here based on the reviews. I agree with the great reviews and I agree with the prior reviewer that the pork chop is great, it was fantastic. Thanks for the tip! Also very happy with pur other items, the meatball appetizer, and grilled vegetables appetizer. My son enjoyed the chicken parm special. His fiance enjoyed the bolognese dish.  The staff were friendly.

Wow !!! Where to begin ...What an amazing place and great service !! This neighbourhood needed a place that is so well priced and has such a great menu full of traditional Italian dishes!!! We had the eggplant with fresh tomato and the kale salad to start. Both options were absolutely delicious . For mains we had two pasta dishes - the black linguini and the spaghetti al Limone. They  were both so fresh and simple but so vibrant at the same time . The portions and the pricing at the restaurant are out of this world !!!! You will be surprised how good the value for money is . The staff are super friendly too ! Will be definitely coming back here . Well done to the owners for making this one of the best places in the neighbourhood with such a lovely outdoor area as well !!!
Delicious great food, not to mention very friendly warm service! Pastas were great, as were the generous wine pours. Great new addition to our neighborhood.

This place just opened and is already one of my favorites in the neighborhood. The backyard is lovely, the interior itself cozy and relaxing. The servers and managers have always been incredibly nice to us, and the food is SO SO GOOD. We have tried the chicken (large portion, soft and flavorful), all of the bruschetta (all great!), the spaghetti a limone (the best thing on the entire menu), the tiramisu (solid), and several specials (always a good mix, never boring). And the prices can't be beat in this neighborhood--some of the entrees are below $10, which is rare for this kind of food and experience in Carroll Gardens.
Great food. Great atmosphere and everyone that works there is great with kids. Leave room for the homemade desserts. Will dedenitely come back for more of this great authentic italian food. Great
Most excellent! wonderful pasta, great specials, very good service and fantastic music! loved it, just make sure to have cash!

Great addition to the neighborhood! Consistently good food for dinner and brunch. Pastas, salads, entrees all excellent for dinner, egg dishes and pancakes for brunch, along with a wonderful atmosphere.

Absolutely the best. Went for SundayBrunch. Definitely going back. Great wait staff and Chef Fernando is is the best. Being Italian I don't usually eat out for this type of food but this is really authentic well prepared and delicious. The back out door garden is a perfect backdrop for the food, and a perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine. I don't usually comment on decor but it is a really beautiful place.

We were a party of 6 last night. We sat outside and had an incredibly delicious meal. We ordered starters family style and we ordered a lot - meatballs were good, kale kale Caesar excellent, calamari, bruschetta - everything good! Main courses all great, beautiful outdoor seating, staff super nice and very accommodating - highly recommend

We loved everything about this place. The evening was perfect to sit outside. There were a lot of food options (almost too many to be honest). We each started with an adult beverage, appetizer and pasta dish to finish. We ordered the lemon pasta like most everyone else and yes it was delicious, the others standout dish was the kale gnocchi in tomato sauce - this dish was amazing!
Food is low grade Italian. The place where you see pieces of garlic floating in your dish.

New italian in CG.   Finally! Something new, absolutely delicious and well priced.  Gersi is unpretentious, simple Italian served in a charming seeing (lovely backyard), by an attentive and charming staff.  We've already eaten there twice, and they've only been open four days.  So far we've had the roasted chicken, double kale caesar salad and spaghetti limone.  All were absolutely delicious.  The owner treated us to an order of tiramisu our second time back, which was also delectable! Go before the crowds discover this new gem.

In fairness to the restaurant, gave Gersi another go after a tepid first experience.  On the second time around, service was attentive yet not intrusive.  Orders came out quickly and we had a very good experience.  The food was great, as first reviewed.  Tender, perfectly cooked pork chop with a delicious reduction and a nice portion of garlic flecked broccoli, and again the wonderful half chicken.
No comment

Awesome! Great attentive service without being overbearing. The food. Just what we needed. Great flavor and jut the right portion size. Real home cooking. And the wine was also great. Had two different wines with my meal, and loved them both. A real cozy atmosphere, and very accommodating to our sleeping baby! (yes, we got to enjoy our meal due to a sleeping baby!! ). Can't wait to come back

My friend and I stumbled upon this gem after a long walk from Manhattan. The garden is beautiful and the service was incredible and attentive. It's cash only but the prices here are so affordable and the food is AMAZING! We got the spaghetti al limone, the pasta con pomodoro, the bruschetta, the eggplant and garlic side dish...it was all delicious. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. You have to go here - and sit in the garden!

Phenomenal in every way - the staff are delightful, warm and welcoming, the decor is perfectly unassuming and natural (the garden is amazing) and the food is sublime - truly made with top-notch ingredients, skill and love.
No comment
Cash only! My bf and I ate here and the Cacio e Pepe was horrrrrrible and the spaghetti and meatballs were aaaamazing!!! So 3 star average :) guess it depends on what you get.

Warm and cozy vibe. The restaurant was packed, so we ate on the back patio.  Our server recommended a great bottle of wine, helped us explore the menu, and I could eat the butternut squash soup by the gallon.  All of the pastas were fantastic as well.  Definitely worth checking out.
The service was very attentive and the food was so flavorful.  It was a relaxing dining experience. Great food, perfect evening, Worth the travel! Thanks Gersi and Staff.
Great food and always friendly service. A bunch of good vegetarian options including Strozzapreti, Spaghetti al Limone, and Cacio e Pepe. They will also do 1/2 portions for kids if you ask.

An absolute neighborhood gem. Rivals the better Italian spots in Manhattan. Small inside space with a large backyard. Large portions for a reasonable price. We have been a few times, the kale salad and garlic bruschetta are tasty. They bring fresh bread, so don't fill up on the bread apps. The lemon pasta is one of the best dishes, and the tagliatelle with ragu is wonderful. They had a chicken parm special that was tasty, too. Make a reservation if you plan to pop in during busy hours. Highly recommend, and hope they stick around!

Very reasonable prices, nice ambiance and good food.  My only complaint would be with the overall service. Went there on a relatively busy night but there wasn't a wait for tables, yet three different people asked us how many were in our party and told us to hold on before anyone sat us, then it took forever to take our order, give us water, we had to ask two different people for bread, when the food came we didn't have utensils, etc.  There was one great bearded waiter doing the work of three.  Everyone was super nice though so I'm hoping it was just an off night.

Just left here - I had an 8:00 reservation and wasn't seated til 8:50. Once seated it took another 20 minutes for a waiter to come over. The service was terrible. Food was average. No one gave a -ish. No one said anything about the wait. Will never go back.

Just left Gersi, can't even wait to go back again. In every aspect this restaurant is outstanding. Based on a previous great experience here, my girlfriend and I chose to visit again for our date night. The hostess, our server Genti, and the the rest of the staff we encountered were so kind and certainly did not cease to impress. To begin our meal, they brought us fresh bread with no hesitation of bringing us seconds after we quickly devoured the first helping. For our appetizers/entrees we both had a piece of the garlic bruschetta, I had the roasted chicken with mashed potatoes, and she had the chef's special risotto with butternut squash and pancetta. The serving sizes were large and perfect enough for us to have epic leftovers for lunch the following day. Lastly, we split a rather large cappuccino and the molten chocolate cake with warm berries and whipped cream, which was the perfect ending to our meal. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who loves Italian-style cuisine made with complete care and impeccable service.

Their bolognese is gluten free and you can ask for any pasta to be gluten free. Excellent food (both gluten free and gluten full), good service, and they're always willing to answer gluten related questions and not make you feel rushed which I really appreciate.

Gem of a backyard. A teeny bit of disorganization (we had like 4 servers at one point), probably due to newness of the place. Although the veal meatballs and grilled veggie appetizers made up for any miscommunications. Genuine servers who give a damn were attentive and sweet. My fave part was when they turned off all the lights in the backyard and out came two desserts with sparklers for a bday at the next table. The entire backyard sang Happy Birthday to our neighboring diner.

Both my food and wine were tasty and reasonably priced. A couple of complaints, the wine list (small black lettering on a dark tan background) was difficult for me to read, given the low lighting.  Also, after seating your patrons, please level your tables. Otherwise Gersi is a much needed good Italian restaurant addition to my hood. If it wasn't kid friendly it would be perfect.

Frankly feels like this place slightly overrated. I've been there a couple of times now and both times were not impressed by the pasta. The environment is super cute, great for a date, except that it's a very busy and crowded place, so it's tough to expect perfect service. To give its credit, the free bread and bean sauce are amazing. We had the butternut squash soup of the day and it was good as well. But the pastas were just so so. I've gotten the pasta with ragu and pasta Bolognese. The first was too sweet and the second was too acidic.
No comment

I'm amazed at these reviews. I got delivery and this was the worst food I've ever had. We couldn't eat any of it. Delivery was fast and the food was warm but tasted awful. We threw it out and made frozen pizza. Maybe in restaurant is better? But it really seemed like it was the food.

I was so pleasantly surprised by this place! It's cozy and rustic. The prices are totally fair, and the food is delicious! A bottle of great Montepulciano was only $24. The mushroom pasta was our favorite, although I believe it was a special. The server even treated us to a tiramisu--on the house! My friends and I can't wait to go back.

Simple, authentic Italian food that hits the mark at reasonable prices. Spaghetti al limone is great; also recommend the kale Caesar salad with grilled salmon. Service is warm without being overbearing. Overall a great value and a nice addition to the neighborhood. I've been twice so far and will be returning!
No comment

What an amazing hidden gem this place is! Food is so simple but so flavorful, this is our new go to Italian restaurant. We had the garden salad and tried almost 5 different types of pasta, and they were all delicious! Servers were also super friendly which made our experience even better, I will definitely be back :)

My experience here was an all-around success! The decor is cute and classy and the food is phenomenal. Our server, Jase, was informative and attentive. I love it when the wait staff is super passionate about the establishment. I ordered the mozzarella basil tomato and calamari appetizers and they exceeded my expectations. Pleasing to the mouth and the eyes! I highly recommend the pork chop.

It's hard to fine a truly excellent spot. Gersi had excellent service and delicious food. Plus, the cost was extremely reasonable for the neighborhood. The roasted chicken was cooked to perfection. We will be back!

Gersi deserves 5 stars for their service, food, value, and atmosphere. I can't say enough good things about them. Another restaurant screwed us on our reservation for my girlfriend's party and left our party of 20 devastated. Gersi was there with unbelievable service, allowing us to make last minute reservations for our entire group without any issues. We arrived with tables beautifully set up in their outdoor garden. Service was superb, the drinks were tasty, and the food was delicious. They were very attentive to the group. When it was time for the cake, they dimmed the entire garden area, making it feel very special. Everyone in the group had a great time. We would definitely recommend coming here, it's a great place for small or large groups, families, or a date night. Don't forget -- cash only!
Only accept cash. Definitely recommend Gersi for the great atmosphere and delicious food. Would recommend the Homemade Tagiatelle Bolognese as well as the Roasted Chicken.
It's a really fantastic restaurant. The food is delicious, the decor is beautiful and charming, and again the food is completely delicious. Such a neighborhood gem.
No comment

Loved this place. Intimate, warm, and a wonderful staff. We had the chicken parmigiana, spaghetti with lemon and cacio e peppe, amazing! Prices couldn't be beat and the warm olive oil and bread that was served was a great start to the whole meal. I would come back here in a heartbeat!

I can only judge this place based on the deliveries I've gotten from here, but based on the takeout I can't imagine how good the food is in the actual restaurant.  This place is consistently delicious - I mean delicious - with perfectly al dente pasta, clean flavors, fresh bread, and the best ingredients overall (I've even gotten steamed broccoli which I wasn't sure was worth the price, but it was so perfectly cooked and so good).  Recommend the spaghetti al limone in particular.
You know those perfect little places where food, ambiance and service are all spot on? The ones you don't tell people about because you don't want it to get too crowded? For me that's Gersi.
One of our favorite restaurants in Brooklyn. Excellent food, reasonable pricing, and great ambiance.
Had brunch here with my friend on Saturday. I had the egg Benedict and he had the egg and steak. Everything was way too SALTY! Even the salad! All I tasted was salt. Had to drink plenty of water.

Tasty but..cash only? If you can deal with that, it's like "Supper" only better. Good food, friendly service. Portions are generous so salad, two pastas and a side of roasted vegetables were all tasty but too much for one sitting. Larry the server was very attentive. Would definitely go there again l

I went here for Christmas Eve dinner with five other people and every single one of us came out extremely satisfied. Carroll Gardens is a very old school Italian neighborhood and it's not easy to sustain a business as the mom and shop trend in this area (sadly) seems to be disappearing. I wish these guys the best of luck! Support your local business. This is definitely my new go-to Italian joint...amazingly delicious and depth to their sauces, prices are right and staff are very very attentive and personable.
Great food!  Great service!  Great value!  The bruschetta was amazing, as was the homemade pasta.  Don't forget order the tiramisu!
Overpriced, nothing special. Corn soup was watery, drinks were watery, pasta was fine, bruschetta was pizza parlor quality garlic bread.
Amazing place with outstanding food service! I came here with my friends for dinner and we had a fantastic time in the outdoor seating area. Will definitely be coming back soon!!

Like this place. Want to come back. Nice wine and food. Definitely will come back. If you are around go for sure you will will enjoy. Drinks, food and atmosphere is great. Make a reservation an advance to not wait.

20 something of us, we were completely disorganized - all our fault, nothing to do with the restaurant. Our waitress, sorry I don't know your name, this great women with beautiful red hair, was tremendously helpful and SO patient with our large group. Food was very tasty. Wonderful evening all around. Thank you!

Came here this week for my daughters baptism party on a recommendation. So glad it worked out, gersi and his staff are top notch. He was really helpful with organizing a menu and making the day as perfect as it could be. My whole family was pleased with the food and the service, and that's no easy feat. If you want good food , good service and a great ambiance definitely check this place out. You won't be disappointed. Thanks again gersi and staff, you all were amazing!

Had an early dinner at Gersi with my husband and kids yesterday and couldn't have been more pleased with our experience. We sat outside in the lovely garden and enjoyed the fresh air and peaceful ambiance. As a person of Italian descent myself, I am quite hard to please when it comes to Italian cuisine. I can happily say this restaurant surpassed my expectations and was even better than my grandmother's cooking (thank goodness she doesn't read yelp reviews). I highly recommend the strozzapreti and the garlic bruschetta... but truthfully, we tried so many dishes and there wasn't one disappointment. We will be back again and again.

This was one of the best Italian places I have ever eaten at. Everything from the bread to dessert was absolutely fantastic. Everything was homemade and so fresh! The service was also wonderful. If you are looking for an authentic quintessential Italian restaurant this is the place to go! Absolute hidden gem and can't wait to be back!

One of my new favorite places to eat! The food is consistent and delicious. The lemon spaghetti and the garlic bruschetta are great. The bolognese was very good as well. The prices are decent and the atmosphere, both inside and outside in the garden is quaint. Overall lovely place-great atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food.

Went out to eat for a late dinner and everything was amazing. We got the mussels and mozzarella for the appetizers. Both very delicious and a great portion size. The pasta limon was beyond amazing and incredibly delicious. We also got the Grilled salmon which was cooked to perfection. I will be coming back for sure!
So happy and charming.  Felt like I was on a back porch of a little Italian townhouse.  Food was perfect- flavorful beyond belief.  Recommend highly!!!

Came here for dinner at 5pm with a reservations for three  on a Saturday night. Coming early was good decision since the place fills up quickly and tables very close together with high noise level. But the food made up for that. Was particularly pleased and impressed when the wine we wanted to order was not available and our waiter gave us a more expensive one at the lower price. Food was excellent and plentiful. Appetizers of grilled vegetables and enormous portion of bruschetta were superior. I chose the salmon served over arugula and it was perfectly cooked. We stayed for about two hours and never felt rushed even with many people outside waiting to get in. Will definitely return. Just wish they accepted credit cards!

First time here. Had brunch and our table ordered the pancakes and the eggs polenta. The dishes were excellent; so this place will join my regular brunch-place rotationwhich includes these other neighborhood favs: Libertador, Chez Moi, Kitchen, The Jakewalk, and Hunter.

Excellent service, beautiful interior-exterior, loved the outdoor space, wonderful vibes, and SCRUMPTIOUS FOODS. Will absolutely be back. Nothing is better than excellent service to top off a delicious meal.
The bean dip, the mashed potatoes, and the roasted cauliflower are all exceptional. I haven't tried the pasta but this place is a find. And they deliver!
Good Italian food, my dad had the pork parmesan and his words were "it was out of this world!" Everything else we had was also very good. We will be back! Cash only

We had the most wonderful dinner here last night. The food was amazing, the wine was great, the service was friendly and excellent - and best of all was the cozy, intimate setting in the back patio. Can't wait to come back!

Just got home from an INCREDIBLE meal here and couldn't wait to add a review!! My dad and I stopped in tonight and were blown away by absolutely everything we ate. We have tried almost every restaurant in the area over the past year and this is our new favorite! The complimentary bread and bean dip was fantastic, and we also had the watermelon basil as an appetizer which was delicious. My dad got the pork chop and raved about every single bite - said it's the best pork chop he's ever had. He even raved over the steamed broccoli on the side! I had the most interesting dish and didn't know what to expect - grilled polenta with prosciutto and parmesan- and it was so incredibly delicious!!! We must have told the owner 10x how much we were loving our food. We had to try the dessert too and had the most perfectly cooked molten lava cake with insanely delicious whipped cream. I sound like a broken record but the food here is really worth writing home (or to Yelp) about!!  The decor and ambiance is also great - loved the open kitchen and the backyard garden, and the bathroom is beautiful!!  I predict in a couple months they'll have a line out the door.  It only got better when we got the bill - prices are so reasonable and portions are large. So happy to have Gersi in the neighborhood - I'm already looking forward to returning!!

This restaurant has a lot going for it. There's a full bar and a backyard dining area. The indoor dining area looked very comfortable as well. The service was great, very friendly and easy going. The food was tasty, fresh, and extremely well priced. Although this is a cash only establishment, our dinner (for 2) was under $60. We had alcohol, two entrees, an appetizer, coffee and dessert. In terms of value, this restaurant is a steal. If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd probably come here every night for dinner! Thank you Gersi. This was the highlight of my trip to NYC!

I was sad to see that Dosa Royale had moved from this spot, especially since it added some much-needed culinary diversity to the neighborhood, but this place is great! It's cozy and the staff is friendly, and I love that instead of butter with your bread, you get cannellini beans in oil :) We weren't thrilled with the drinks - one was wrong and one just didn't taste great - but they were strong and not expensive for the neighborhood. The food was really the star - my husband raved about his pork chop and my chicken parm was amazing. I'm daydreaming at work right now about eating the leftovers for dinner. Which brings me to the portion size and value - thumbs up. Can't wait to go back with friends and family.
Great neighborhood spot! Kids loved the pasta with meatballs and sausage and the clams and salmon and everything else was delicious!

Only open 3 months and the hostess is still getting her "sea legs" (we had to wait significantly longer than she said) but the food is absolutely unbeatable at their prices. The buffalo mozzarella was delicious and the portion large. I'm a big eater with a ravenous appetite and I would highly recommend this place. Service is so friendly that it makes you feel like you're not in New York.

We encourage everyone to stop in to Gersi's restaurant in Carol Gardens, Brooklyn. The food was amazing (especially the trout) and the service was polite and professional. We enjoyed our meal in the relaxing outdoor space. Great addition to the neighborhood.
SO GOOD!!  Every bite of everything I had was wonderful, down to the perfectly grilled english muffin for my burger.  I plan on making this our regular spot.  Great and friendly service!!!

Great food, great prices, great atmosphere, great service. Can't beat that. We went for Sunday brunch and ordered the steak and eggs, zucchini omelette, and pancakes. I'd recommend any of them. And get the tiramisu, it's amazing. We'll definitely be back.

My family had the best dining experience at Gersi's .  The homemade pasta was out of this world, bruschetta was excellent we ordered a second one.  Three of us had the black linguine and calamari which was excellent.  The people and the service were wonderful.  A must stop if you are ever in Carroll Gardens

Our new favorite restaurant in Carroll gardens! Saturday night dinner for four was amazing!  Started with veal meatballs and an order of their lemon pasta. Both delicious. Will order lemon pasta as entree when we return! Our entrees choices included the roasted chicken , chicken parmigiana, the Bronzino and the pasta strozzapreti which were all winners!! Our waiter was wonderful and attentive. Can't wait to go back to gersi!
Dope place. Staff was wonderful, prices were reasonable, food was delicious. I'm from out of town, but the place was recommended by a friend. Will come back.

One of my favorite places in Brooklyn. I have been coming here since they first opened and I have not been disappointed yet. The prices are super reasonable and the food is amazing. If you are looking for good Italian in Carroll Gardens, this place is a must.

I called Gersi several times before we went there and they do not answer their phone nor did they have a recorded message for information. We did not make a reservation and were not sure if it was open so when we arrived we were informed that the only seating available was for people who made a reservation. Wish the communication from them was better. Since we were hungry and didn't have time to find another restaurant we sat at the bar to eat. We ordered an asparagus appetizer to share, a grilled skirt steak, the Pappardelle with lamb ragu and Homemade Tagliatelle Bolognese. The appetizer was a bit pricey for the amount you get - 7 stalks for $13.95.  The skirt steak was good. It was marinated well and cooked exactly as ordered. It is served on a thick slice of bread which soaks up all of the juice. Next time I would order it without the bread or have it on the side. The pasta dishes were way overcooked and both sauces were overly salted. We were not impressed with either dish and would not order pasta again if we decide to return. Overall the atmosphere is good and the servers were attentive enough. We did not complain about the food while we were there because it was edible but definitely nothing outstanding. A pet peeve of mine is over salted food. If the food is flavorful and it is made well there is no reason to over salt it.

Gersi nails the simple things that so many other restaurants seem to fail at--for example, a warm, welcoming staff that is just the right amount of attentive. The food is delicious and nicely presented without being pretentious; the servings are generous without being sloppy. It accepts reservations and offers daily specials. I was there on New Year's Eve, and it was packed, but the whole meal went down without any mistakes or complications. They didn't rush to get our group out, even though there was clearly a crowd waiting to get in. I know this all seems very basic, but it seems more often than not restaurants fail to meet some of these basic rules of hospitality--and I want to properly thank the Gersi staff for making my NYE special. When it first opened, I thought the owners must be insane for opening an Italian restaurant in a neighborhood swimming with decent Italian restaurants--but I'm glad they did.

We reserved a table for Valentine's day well in advance of the date and were excited to try a new spot in our neighborhood. Upon arriving on time for our reservation, we were told that they were running behind - this was said in a very rudimentary, unapologetic manner with little elaboration. We were not in a rush, so waited patiently outside, but it became more and more apparent that the hostess had no idea how to handle the situation - instead of keeping us up to date on the status of our table, she continuously mumbled vague apologies and seemed uncomfortable, but offered no solutions or hospitality. Finally, after waiting 25 minutes past our reservation time, we asked if any tables were wrapping up and she said they were just finishing up their food - unclear as to whether they were going to get dessert, more drinks, etc. There was no forthrightness and the restaurant was clearly being poorly managed on a holiday. By booking back to back tables, they compromised their later reservations. We abandoned the reservation and went to a different similar location in the area who welcomed us with open arms. Very disappointed and will not attempt to eat here again.

Went To Gersi last night for a birthday dinner with my husband. Sometimes I feel like if youve been to one Italian restaurant youve been to them all, but this was actually different. I am Italian and have been to enough to know this place is on the money. Fresh ingredients that dont try to hard and end up coming together to be great. We shared the Siclian salad with ricotta salata (delish but a bit too cold for me) and the roasted garlic bruschetta with palmigiano cheese (excellent). For our entre my husband got the Rigatoni mezzi with meatballs and sausage. I gotthe spaghetti al limone which if you like lemon is excellent. A few simple, fresh ingredients and viola...fantastic. I must also add that being a meatball snob means its really hard to try someone elses meatballs let alone like them and they were really surprisingly good. Tiramisu and capuccino for dessert, also good. I felt compelled to approach a man that I thought was the manager to tell him it was great. Turns out it was the owner and I told him id leave a nice well deserved review. Go. I doubt you will regret it.

This place is fantastic! The decor is beautifully charming, the staff is extremely attentive and warm, and the food was stellar! Gersi is brand new, and is already one of my girlfriend and mine's favorite restaurants in the neighborhood. We ate out back on their patio which is beautifully designed, covered in plants and herb gardens, and continues the same charm as the rest of their restaurant. We ordered the Bresaola to start (which is AMAZING), and two beautifully made pasta dishes, spaghetti limon and the bolognese Ragu. Both were exceptional; simple and sensationally seasoned. Everything is extremely fresh and made on the premises, including the perfectly cooked homemade pasta. Gersi the owner, whom the place is named after, greeted us  when we sat down and pointed us to a delicious Barbera to start. He is Albanian and we quickly I bonded over the fact that I have been to Albania before and that the Italian food was incredible there. He assured me that he I would like the meal then, and he was absolutely right. Gersi completely lived up to the real deal! We spoke with him throughout the night and found him to be extremely sweet, soft spoken and accommodating. We finished the meal with the tiramisu which was honestly one of the best I have ever eaten - again, incredibly fresh. Well priced , great portions and completely delicious, we will be going back to Gersi very often!
authentic & delicious food! friendly but unobtrusive service-i'll be back!
No comment

No comment
The best breakfast BURRITO I have ever had!!! And the Mexican latte was delicious and flavorful. The ambience was very warm and inviting as well. Good date breakfast spot on a rainy day.

To die for! I love chilaqueles it's my go to! Authentic without a doubt. I had the chilaquiles with steak and they were the best I've ever had. Salsa on chilaqueles is authentic and tasteful with a good kick. Everything was very flavorful. My husband had the chorizo burrito and it was very good. Sister had chilaqueles burrito with chorizo and that was my fav. 10/10. My husband got Café de la olla which is also a must and chai latte was really good as well. Owners are so nice and humble. Don't think twice just go!

Our initial dining experience in New York led us to this restaurant, which exceeded our expectations. The food was delightful, and the coffee was exceptional. While my fiancé craved the torta of chilaquiles, which could easily satisfy two individuals, I savored the green chilaquiles, complete with a fried egg, which was nothing short of delectable. Regrettably, seating was constrained, and there were no in-house restroom facilities, prompting us to deduct one star. Fortunately, our hotel was conveniently nearby, alleviating any inconvenience caused.

Great place for a casual breakfast/lunch/brunch. It's small but nicely decorated and with a few tables indoors and out front. We were greeted by the owner, who was very welcoming and helpful. We had the torta with chorizo and the chilaquiles with cecina. They were both delicious, but my favorite was the torta, super flavorful and an interesting mix of textures. The latte 'cafe de olla' was also very tasty - creamy, not too sweet, and flavored with spices. I would definitely recommend checking it out!

Amazing amazing amazing food. We got the avocado sandwich. I think it's called the Chilaquiles Sandwich. We also got two chai tea lattes and everything was amazing. Sorry for the picture. It was so good we ate it first. lol

A restaurant that just does Chilaquiles? I had to try it out when I heard about this place and it was all I'd hoped it would be. My son tried the Chilaquiles with red and green sauces and i had the torta - both of which were fantastic! The Mexican latte was super creamy and just the right amount of sweetness too. Might have to try the burrito next time.

Great service and vibes. Awesome casual a lunch spot. The food itself was OK though. Seems very authentic but it's very heavy on tortilla chips. Good new spot to try out

I had lunch here recently based upon the excellent reviews, sadly I came away completely unimpressed. The staff is very nice, the space is very clean and well set up, it was the food where they lost me. I got their namesake bowl for lunch. The sauce was quite tasty, but the problem was that almost all it was was tortilla chips drowned in the sauce. There was very little of the meat protein I had chosen, barely a couple of small bites in the entire bowl. I would equate it to a serving the size of a single slice of bacon, and maybe not even that.  I came away still hungry for some protein.

This place is cute and yummy. It is a small restuarant owned by a young friendly couple. The staff is nice, the space is lovely and the food feels homemade. Unfortunately, it is all super heavy so you can't eat here too often which is sad because it is a nice place. I wish they had some small lighter things and I would go all the time!  The coffee is good! Expensive but good.
This place is delicious! A little expensive but definitely worth it. The salsa in the chilaquiles divorciados is a little spicy but not overwhelming. The latte Mexicano is delicious, not too sweet.
Best mexican breakfast in the city, hands down! The owner and staff are also super friendly! Can't wait to come back here
Attn: Vegetarians of NYC!!! Do yourself a favor & stop by. You won't be disappointed!

Nice place. The staff was very friendly and the service was good.  The neighborhood is safe. I had the chilaquiles with salsa verde.  They were good but average.  I would recommend this place but it's not amazing. So 3.5 stars
Great food and lovely people! Had Chilaquiles divorciados, café de la Hoya latte and orange juice! Muy delicioso

I went here on September 15th because I heard they were doing a party for Mexican Independence Day. I got the chilaquila torta because I wanted to try something new. Wow it was great and just the right amount of spice. Will definitely come back for Sunday brunch

Cafe de Olla and chilaquiles omg this place is delicious and I want to now live on this block
Loved this place!! Poncho and Susana offer the best service. Don't overlook the arroz con leche and make sure to try the Mexican latte.
Chilaquiles divorciados are delicious!! My café de olla latte so good! Definitely recommend and will come back.

Finally some good and legitimate chilaquiles in NYC. I had the chilaquiles divorciados and they were amazing. Latte de olla is a must!! Will definitely be back to try their burritos and tortas! Staff is so friendly and the place is so cute and welcoming.

Mexico born and I just moved here from Texas. I have been searching for something that tasted like home. This was it. So good . I had the chilaquiles divorciados with chicharrón and egg. Will definitely be back again! The owners were attentive and so kind. 10 out of 10 for Authenticity and taste!
Amazing authentic Mexican food. Delicious! Owners are so nice! Places to sit indoors and outdoors. Would definitely come back. Highly recommend!!!
Delicious Chilaquiles! Café latte mexicano is so good highly recommend you try this place out
The chilaquiles and café de olla of my dreams! So delicious, fresh, and made with care
It was amagazin! I love the chilaquiles divorciados! please you need try the bread! It was delicious! real Mexican food
Super cute spot for a quick lunch. The torta chilaquiles was very good and filling! Mexican owned so you know it's going to be good. Will definitely be back to try more stuff from the menu!
Excellent!!  Both red and green sauces are tasty and have a great depth of flavor.  Portions are much bigger than they look in the pics.

Amazing service! The Food is delicious but the café de la olla is the point to get! I come to get that everyday! I love this place I really recommend it for people who loves Mexican coffe and food go to La Chilaqueria!
Excellent burrito. I've been living in San Diego for years and this is the closest I've had.

My avocado toast needed lemon juice, salt, pepper, whatever. I took bites from my friends dishes. Very meh. Long wait on a Saturday afternoon but well worth it. The server was friendly. The food was amazing. The pancake burrito a perfect blend of salty and sweet. The chicken on the waffle was crispy but juicy. The Omlette fluffy and soft. The smoothie was an explosion of sweetness! Only place I'd dock on is the donut wasn't the freshest. The Mac was cheesy, gooey goodness but a little waterier than we'd like. Looking forward to going back to try more

This place was an amazing find! Great atmosphere, friendly and quick service and the food... amazing! We both had the Chicken and Waffles and my son had the Red Velvet Cake Shake... amazing!!!

This place sure doesn't look like my Mom's kitchen. It is a cool spot with an eccentric and fun interior. There is a lot of seating so don't worry about finding a place to sit. It was busy though so must be good. I ordered the avocado toast and I thought it had too many onions. They overpowered the dish. The other items were good. I liked the potato side dish. I would stick to the waffles and pancakes if you come. Cool spot!

Super funky spot for the mommy's and friends, please don't forget your child at home. Music was great for a Sunday evening, you got a little bit of everything. Menu was overwhelming. Food was really good, Buffalo Mac & Cheese Balls packed hella flavor with the sauce. And the Pancake Burrito was just what I was looking for in that crazy menu lol. Drinks were good and playful, I had Party Punch! Coffee is pretty decent too. My waiter lacked in performance but the one that took over while he went on break was great. Think of this as an updated IHOP.
Great little restaurant, huge portions, okay service. I still dream about this chicken sandwich
Cool spot for adult and kids both to enjoy simultaneously....my kid loved the cake shake. I ordered the Electric Lemonade drink from the bar and it was strong and good.

They don't take reservations so you have to give your name and phone number for them to text you when a table is available. We went today around 2pm and we're told it would be 15-20 mins but was about 10 mins. We got the Buffalo Mac n cheese balls, the bedrock pancakes, and the gymbod. My mom liked her gymbod but the eggs were a little bland. The Mac n cheese balls were too spicy for my tastes. They were also very heavy and one was enough to make me nauseas. The ball without all the stuff on top was flavorful. I was worried about ordering the bedrock pancakes because I don't like pancakes or overly sweet things. It wasn't overly sweet which was surprising. The pancakes had a lot of flavor. There was a lot of food and a lot of fruit.

I have thought about these pancakes every day since I've had them. Mac & Cheese pancakes!? Who would have thought! Sooo good! Wait was minimal, service was good. Can get pretty crowded, great for families. All the menu items are fun and creative like what I had. They are famous for their crazy shakes did not get one but looked great!

Avocado toast is so refreshing and delicious. Staff is courteous and little to no wait. We went twice during our 2.5 day stay in NYC. Highly recommend the chicken sandwich. I don't know why, but it was the best chicken sandwich of my life. That may have been the hangover talking but I will absolutely go here again if I ever have the misfortune of being in NYC in the future. This is a gem!

Came in the morning on a Monday. There was no wait but quite a few tables. I ordered bacon (well done) & a side of breakfast potatoes. The other person at my table ordered the bed rock pancakes. The bacon was cooked how I asked but the breakfast potatoes were lack luster. They were dry & lacked flavor. The bed rock pancakes is huge portion so it may be good to split unless you are starving or have a big appetite. Staff was friendly but things needed to be wiped down better.

The food here was really good. Considering it was NYE we only waiting about 10 mins before we sat down. I recommend trying the Turkey bacon & the shrimp n grits. There's a kids menu (kid friendly). Also try the tequila sunrise.
No comment

Just cruising around the area with my fiance and found this little gem. It's very welcoming when entered. It's a very chill vibe. Very spacious. A very great selection of comfort food. All day brunch was a plus. Ordered steak and eggs and tried their "Heavy Metal Fries" as well as their mocktail "Nojito No Problem" which was amazing. She ordered the "Chicken and Waffles" with a side of sweet potato waffle fries and brussel sprouts. She loved her food as well. This place is definitely a nice place to hang and vibe and would definitely recommend this place to anyone

Seriously one of the BEST brunch spots in NYC. They have some of the spunkiest drink & food menus I've ever seen. For drinks, we got the cinnaboozy latte & get-out-of-swamp cocktail, which were an absolute 10/10. The chicken and waffle (which comes with a side of cholula honey & bechamel sauce) was probably the BEST one I ever had at any restaurant. No, really. If you're a chicken and waffle fan, then this is a must-try.
No comment

This place proves the Nelson Algrin rule to "never play cards with a man  named Doc and never eat at a place called Mom's." Cold eggs, under-toasted toast. The limp toast costs $4. Really?  Extra 3 percent on your tab for credit cards. Yeow. So many good places in HK for breakfast and brunch but this place is not one of them. Maybe it was an off day -- but the price of a slice of toast and the credit card fees are ridiculous at a diner-type restaurant, even if the food had been good. Btw, I voiced my surprise to the waitperson, who listened nicely and said "I don't set the prices" (actually, I already knew that) and she said she would pass my comments along.  No visit from the manager.

Went here with colleagues on a work trip and then recommended it to everyone who needed a place for breakfast. Portions are huge. The pancake burrito was a great blend of ingredients but definitely a heavier option while the omelette was the best I have ever had. Cremini mushrooms and Gouda cheese were perfectly blended and the béchamel sauce was the ultimate topping. If you are in NYC near Hell's Kitchen I highly recommend stopping for a meal here.

What a treasure. The food was unique and amazing. Wish we lived in Manhattan so we could go there on the regular. Will definitely be back next time we are in town.

I loved this place. I got the chicken and waffles and it was amazing!! People so nice. I also got the strawberry milk shake. Sooooo good!!

Super fun ambience great service food was delicious. I ordered the fruity pebbles pancakes with fruit it was soooo good , the fried chicken sandwich yummy chicken soft bread and alvocado toast on everything bagel so flavorful I over ate definitely and would come back

Bday brunch for the newest teenager in the family.   She had an omelet with a side of bacon.  She thought bacon was a little thick but liked the omelette.  The little wifey had avocado toast and seemed to enjoy it since she was licking the plate when she finished her last bite.   I had the pancake burrito minus the meat since I am vegetarian and substituted mushrooms and added avocado.    I was very pleased with my selection and left satisfied.   Good atmosphere, decent price and friendly service.   Cool place to go to and would definitely recommend if your cool.    Happy bday to the young one.   Take names and kick ass.

Loved this little place. Nostalgic homage to all things Mom! Loved the tv moms pictures. The music was excellent; Motown, old school R&B. The service was great. Love my drink and everyone loved their food. Found it on Yelp and was glad for it.

Went out for my friends birthday on a busy weekend during brunch time and it was very packed but our table for 6 got seated in less then 20 minutes. Seated in a warm booth outside it was very nice and cozy the inside had a vintage diner vibe. The steak and eggs were great perfect medium rare on the steak seasoned just right and the eggs runny over easy. Although i couldn't enjoy their crazy looking shakes and pancakes this place was still a gem for me in hell's kitchen.

One of my fav diners in the city! I've been to the Hell's Kitchen and Astoria locations of this restaurant with groups and nobody has ever been disappointed. The menu is really fun with large portions. The shakes are amazing, the Mac & cheese is awesome, and I like the interesting breakfast combos that they have. They're open late on the weekends which is great too! The decorations are unique and good vibes!!

My daughter and I absolutely loved this place. From the ambiance to the staff and the drinks to the food... we were in absolute good heaven. It's definitely a spot I would like to check out during evening hours, as well.

will always come here it's so delicious and really like home cooked food tbh you can't go wrong with stopping by for all day brunch option. had waffles for dinner and it was a hit! there's a wide array of drinks too if you're into that and also the best quality chicken. i don't recommend the mac and cheese side but the tater tots and waffles with chicken was a hit! 10/10 can't wait fo try the rest of the menu here.

Ordered the Fried Chicken Sandwich & Buffalo Mac & Cheese Balls from here!! The sandwich contained buttermilk fried chicken breast with garlic aioli, pickle slaw, and pickle chips on toasted brioche. It was mouth savory and the salad it came along with it was delicious as well! The cheese balls were fresh made buffalo mac and cheese rolled into balls then fried and served with buffalo ranch sauce. These were too good and addicting!!⁣⁣

Was looking on Yelp for a good breakfast/brunch place in the Union Square area. Found Mom's Kitchen and so glad I did. The pancake burrito was insane! The staff was polite and service was excellent. All the meals coming out looks delicious. Highly recommended!!!

Oh my god! 1st time at Moms Kitchen and Bar and it was so amazing. Probably one of the best restaurants I've ever been to in New York. We tried the fries, chicken, Mac n cheese, Brussels and the Orange drink was great. It's definitely a filler for sure. The waiter was great and it has a great atmosphere as well. I recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting New York or living here. Check this place out!

Great food and quick service. Great menu options. Brunch food is a must! Bloody Mary could have a little less horseradish for me but still yummy.

What a great place for breakfast. So many options and the atmosphere was nice. Staff was friendly, will come back again
This place rocks ! The staff is super friendly and the food is great. Came around 9pm and it was a really chill atmosphere . Very welcoming ! Food rec has gotta be the chicken and bacon waffle !
Love this place. Huge boozy drinks, yummy pancake burrito. Perfect day after drinking spot. Very chill spot, inside and outside seating. Lunch and dinner mostly.
Really fun place. Great food. They have great cocktails and shakes. Love the decor and theme. Had a delicious vegan chicken sandwich with tater tots. Kid friendly in Hell's Kitchen

I can't comment on the food because I didn't order food but the drinks are amazing! Very light and refreshing mocktails  the chocolate drink was also good but heavy (as expected). Server was very pleasant. Ambiance- It has a very family friendly atmosphere because of all the creative drinks.
Took my family here for their first trip to NYC, they loved the outdoor seating. Breakfast was good. We got there before the rush.

Cozy comfort food - creative menu item names too! The pancake burrito was a fun, unique dish I haven't seen elsewhere. Avo toast was pretty standard tbh but still very tasty. Nutella shake was absolutely divine and there was no way one person could have finished it on their own and still had room for actual food. Any place that serves breakfast all day is always a win in my book!

Delicious breakfast. We ordered the GymBod, eggs and bacon, and the kids had chocolate chip waffles and pancakes. All of food came out hot and delicious.  Service was also great. It's a small enough place where the waitress we had was very attentive to our party.
Food was good, not great. However, staff and service was amazing!  The music was on point playing hip hop and R&B

Mom's has delicious desserts, so photogenic, primed and ready for the gram. Supposedly they do a kickin' brunch but I'm more likely to roll through for happy hour or to get some late night sweets. Food menu is pretty good, though some menu items can be a little overwhelming. I'm a sucker for some fried cheese curds though.

A pretty neat place to try. It has some really innovative menu items. I specifically had the chicken and waffles (it was huge) as well as the cheesy grits. Both was really tasty and great. If you have time to try something just to try something new, then I'd recommend.

Super decadent menu, giant milkshakes and cocktails, and great hangover food. Pretty pricey but if you're needing some love check this place out.

We wanted something to eat after our show and walked a few blocks.  I wanted to eat inside because the ambience seemed cool but it was freezing inside so we sat by the sidewalk. We ordered a hamburger with fries and a veggie burger with a side salad . I'm trying to eat a bit healthier and the Veggie burger hit the spot.  Very flavorful, nice sized,  and I enjoyed the dressing on the salad.  The star of the show was the Cinaboozy Iced Latte. It was so good I would go get one right now if I were close by.

Such a cute spot! Love the decor, good tasting food and cocktails. I got the hot girl summer drink, which was just spicy enough and not too sweet. Comes with a pink flamingo! Didn't like the avocado toast (very runny eggs and I personally didn't think it had enough flavor) and they were very kind, taking it back and making me the breakfast sandwich instead, which was very good. My friend liked her milkshake and food as well. Only other downsides are that the seats are a bit uncomfortable, but I'm super picky about seating lol, and they didn't come by to refill our waters more than once, maybe twice. Our waiter was really nice and I'd definitely come back!

I can see why this is such a fun brunch spot, or dinner even if you're in the mood for certain food items.  The menu is quite expansive and I honestly think that there is some thing for everyone in this menu whether you are a carnivore or a vegan.  The prices are super reasonable and the portions are very generous.  I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was really tasty- the grits were the right amount of creamy and the shrimp was cooked well and doused in the perfect amount of butter (as in a lot lol).  My cousins enjoyed their meals as well.  Whether you're near this location or the one in Astoria, Mom's Kitchen truly has a fitting name and is certainly worthy of a try.

The most delicious comfort food. The breakfast burrito is amazing! Scrambled eggs, cheese, and bacon wrapped in a perfectly cooked pancake with yummy syrup. Yum! The drinks are boozy, big, and better than many places.

Came for brunch. Wait wasn't too long. Got seated outside which was comfy. I had the avocado toast and coffee. My partner in crime had steak and eggs with a mimosa. Comes in a big glass but is served with ice??? Which is weird and certainly cuts down in how many ounces you are consuming... it's a cute place. I'd go back for sure.

One of my favorites and I need to go back. This place sends me back to childhood. Not to mention their food is amazing. But they're cocktails and milkshakes are even better! You will not be bored here. This place is for the girls brunch!!!
No comment

A friend asked me where I wanted to eat for brunch, so I replied somewhere where I would feel ashamed of myself after eating.  So we came here!   You have a mix of safe and more eclectic options, cocktails, and even jello shots.  I went with the pancake burrito, which to be honest looked a little sus in the pictures, but looks way better in person.  It was delicious!   Also went with the spicy hot girl cocktail, or whatever it was called.  It has a little spice, but not overwhelming. It comes served in a blowup flamingo that you get to keep!  Cocktails come in two sizes: reg mason jar or a whopping 32 oz if you goal is to get tore up.  My friend tried a cocktail that was terrible, and we asked if we could switch it for something else, and they did.  That made up very happy.  Anyway, they have some pretty hefty dessert options, so eat light or just come for dessert.
Great decor and the vegan chicken sandwich was on point with tasty sauce, vegan cheese and the chicken had a great texture. A repeat for sure.
Unconventional American breakfast spot with interesting renditions of staple orders. The chicken bacon waffle w/ honey+cheesy sauce was worth the trip. $14 a dish. 4/5 stars as a breakfast spot.

This was our last meal out before ending our week long trip to NYC, and it is probably a good thing we found it at the end of our trip or we might have eaten here every day.  We could not decide what we wanted so we split a couple of things, but wish we could have tried even more. We loved the atmosphere, and service, and the food was really fantastic!  I look forward to our next trip to the city just to come here!
Yummy dishes with a unique flair to each one! Not basic diner food so be aware of any picky eaters. Great first stop in New York!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was absolutely amazing. My fiancé and I really enjoyed this spot! We just landed in NYC for his 30th and found this place on Yelp for the good eats. The food was delicious. I had the shrimp and grits, my man had the buffalo chicken wings and both were 10/10. We got strawberry mimosas and only needed one for the entire meal! Our waiter was so dope that we asked him for recommendations to some fun inexpensive cultured activities in the area and he directed us to the hostess Benny for better info. Benny put us on! He gave us a list of affordable options that saved us so much time and money already! 100% recommend for the vibes, people, energy, and even direction for next moves!
No comment
No comment

We love trying unique things and this was just a six minute walking distance from times square and it definitely was worth the wait love the atmosphere love the staff and what we tried on the menu was amazing. I didn't get a picture of the milkshake that we got, but we got the M&m milkshake and it had a piece of cake on top of it. What was pretty cool is they had really good music playing but all the TVs had cartoons playing for kids so definitely all around family good restaurant. Much love from Oklahoma
No comment
No comment
Delicious drinks and food. I tried the cinnabuzz latte and it was fantastic. Avocado toast, pebbles pancakes and pancake burrito were all great and really generous portions.

Service here was sweet but slow we had to ask for anything we needed. Food looked very pretty but the taste fell short. We got the pancake burrito and it just tasted like something they get prepackaged and heated up. The bacon was hard and gummy on it. Smoothie was pretty but tasted eh. Pancakes were the same way. Interior decor is cool and I like the vibe. Spent $60 before tip I would skip this place next time.
No comment

My only problem with this place is the ice tea wasn't great. I don't know why New York can't figure out the freshly brewed iced tea thing.  LA wins on that category. . But that's me being nitpicky. Our meals were absolutely delicious and our server was cute and sassy and professional and fun.   I'm sure the food had a ton of butter in it but I didn't care because it was delicious. I also loved all the pride representation.   Shrimp and grits were crazy yummy.  I could have stuffed myself with another order, it was that good.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fun atmosphere! Great for kids. Yummy pancakes, chicken & waffles. Cartoons on and friendly staff.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a cool place! We went for breakfast and next time we want to go for dinner! Loved the atmosphere and food. Highly recommend. Such fun food. Wanted a mimosa but we had a full day planned so I guess I have to go back! Loved the vibe of this place.
Food was good! Food came out super fast! Great service. Servers were very attentive. The ambience is great. Love the 90's R and B playlist.
Incredible menu, everything was delicious can't wait to go back! It was a bit chilly when we went but it was well worth it!
No comment
JUSTIN and Kianna WAS OUR server and WAITER, he was on top of things, love his service, would definitely come back and hope to see them both, they were always smiling and happy. Made my day
No comment
No comment
No comment

Hands down the ABSOLUTE nicest collective of people in the hospitality and service industry. I am 9 months pregnant and ready to be done. When we got here we put our name in for the waitlist about 35 minutes. A few minutes later the host noticed how ginormous I am and SO KINDLY sat us (God Bless him). Our server Aubrey was so so kind and made some suggestions which we appreciated. I got the chicken sandwich with the side salad and the fries. The salad was absolutely delicious and the chicken Sam was so large (two giant pieces of chicken) that my husband had half too. The vibe and music in this place is absolutely speaking to my little 80's child heart. I haven't heard these jams since high school and I am HERE for it. I am SO glad we found this place.

Went here after a show at Lincoln center. Not too far of a walk. The food was delicious and hot. The service was great too. Sat at the counter and the woman behind the bar was funny and personable. My friend and I got the cinnaboozy latte and since it was pretty cold out we got it hot. A lot of times cocktails like this are cute for a picture and not much else, but this drink was not only cute but soo delicious!

Hmm. what can I say, buffalo cauliflower bites were bangin!!. and i also recommend the Buffalo Mac and cheese balls.. dang these things were addicting, the perfect flavor per bite. and since youre at it, might as well check out their selection of milk shakes, I had the red velvet one, it came with some raspberry kitkat on top of the red velvet cake which was served on top of the thick milk shake!! yup.. had to split it with my friends but was sooo worth it!!. this is my usual stop everytime I go to the city!
It was so good! Service was great. Price was reasonable. The portions were huge. Definitely a must stop if in NY

Super super yummy Chick'n and waffles.  first time coming here recommended by a friend and I have no regrets coming to give this place a try myself while in town. So good and super yummy! Our service was great. I will be coming back. I recommend you going if you haven't yet - shakes are to die for if you're a shake lover!
Terrible service, terrible food. The waiter was very rude. There are multiple food options around the restaurant you should try. Don't waste your time
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Awesome food, the chicken and waffles were crazy good. We'll be back next NYC trip for sure! LOVE IT.
Great food and service! Chicken was amazing. With the honey! Loved the food and atmosphere
Came in with appetite :) tried woodland omelette with salad. It's pretty good. Server at the bar was very nice and efficient.

The food was so good I didn't get to take a picture it didn't last on the table , the drinks u could pass YOU SHOULD PASS it  wasn't worth it. we sat in the middle on the right hand of the restaurant it was flies all over the service was fast and keep in mind when u walk in the host don't even let u in the restaurant door its like they stop u not sure what that's about. Would i go back maybe in the summer we didn't like the flies or when we walked in my partner held the door and we stood in the door way to talk to the host so i will give a update in 2023

Cute place, attentive staff, food and drinks are delicious. One star down because we felt rushed out. Didn't finish our food and they kept trying to take our plates and asking if we were done. The place was not packed.
Excellent food. We went mid afternoon and there was no wait. The shrimp and grits was amazing.
No comment
Awesome place. Love the environment and food! Got shrimp and grits and it was amazing. Best grits I have ever had. It was a Friday night and we got seated within minutes. Definitely will be back!

Will most definitely return, cute & cozy restaurant.  The food was good, I ordered the shrimp & cheesy grits I was happy I also ordered a side of turkey bacon & fried egg . I wish the bacon was cooked a little harder ( I'll but that request in next time ) my girlfriend ordered pancakes & home fries. ( she was happy ) the service was good nothing to be mad about attentive, checked in a few times while we were sitting & we sat at the bar . The food came out quick. My mimosa was bomb

The food was decent - I got the Buffalo Mac & Cheese balls (very creative & tasted okay). The service was very slow but the waiter was nice. Overall the restaurant was cool but workers need more attentiveness.

Came here around 5 and had some great food and service!! We got the Mac and cheese & Buffalo Mac and Cheese balls which were delicious! For our mains we got the Cobb salad add bacon which was perfect. Next time I'd love to get a milkshake!

Really cute cool vibe. I loved the static pop music playing in the background. It set the tone for this upbeat diner/cafe. There was vibrant pop art of our favorite TGIF sitcom moms. The menu was colorful and creative. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive. Mom's was a nice surprise and will be a place I recommend if and when in New York.

Great ambiance, quick service, reasonable prices and tasty food. If you are looking for a spot that feels like a neighborhood diner, this is your place. Conveniently located about 10 minutes from Times Square, you get a nice experience without all the hustle and bustle.

column3: Coral Gables Section, Coral Gables, FL
column6: Super amazing place second time here the chicken and waffles are the best I highly recommend this place they have two locations in New York City

I was really in the mood for an omelette and wanted something quick, so this was pretty perfect. I was seated immediately with an attentive server. The atmosphere seems fun and childish but not in a bad way per se. Within 5-7 minutes of ordering at most, I got my omelette with home fries. The omelette was very solid (nothing to truly write home about), but the home fries needed some seasoning for sure and a bit more crisp to them. Definitely a decent place to stop by for some fun or a quick meal. 4.2/5
No comment
Quick service, good food and we literally planned what we'll order next when we go back :)

Diner food with some flare. I got the short rib dinner with mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese. Everything lacked salt. The short ribs were not very tender but decent enough. Mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese lack luster. Husband enjoyed his burger and fries, but nothing extraordinary. They had some fun things on the menu like shakes and specialty brunch items which we would come back and try to give them another shot when we were wanting something on the sweeter side.
No comment
Had the chicken and waffle and it was amazing, would definitely come back!! The Dadmosa was pretty tasty as well
No comment

Just ok, wasn't at all impressed.  Summer time maybe okay to wait for a table but winter it's just too cold to wait outside.  Also, tables to close and tight to one another, and I wasn't impressed with the drinks.
No comment
Everything was perfect! Found this on the Yelp ap and it was great food service and atmosphere
Chicken & Bacon Waffle & a Cinnaboozy Iced Coffee: I was alone and got seated super quick! Food came out fast too  Big portions as well. Staff was very friendly
Food was great the service was good and the vibes are immaculate. I would definitely come back. Potatoes are a mix of sweet and regular

Very unique plates and drinks. I am a fan of chicken and waffles and they did their thing! Two big pieces of chicken covered in white gravy sitting on top of thick cut bacon with a waffle! Sooo good, I definitely recommend this place! The staff is super friendly and our order came out so fast! The mac & cheese was Bussin' Bussin'!!

This was my first time coming here, and the food/drinks were decent! Great service as well. Only issue was that the heater next to our original table was leaking? So we asked to switch tables, and the waitstaff were very understanding and accommodating.
No comment
Love the atmosphere and service! We got the bedrock pancakes so delicious! We also got the fried chicken and this was the downfall it was so under seasoned did not taste the garlic Aioli
Awesome food great service the food was good the chicken was so crispy would go again!
No comment
Ambiance on point , service super great and on it . Food let's just say all the plates where good and filling . A must when you come to NY . Might have to try it before we go back to AZ
No comment

What a gem of a place. Nostalgic with the 90s themed decor and playlist.. even had Doug playing on the tvs! Sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly. Ordered the shrimp and grits which was tasty, didnt taste anything cheesy but i liked the gravy. The side of bacon was AMAZING..thick cut and super crunchy, parts of it were even crackly like chicharrones (or like a fried pork rind)- very cool. My mimosa was huge!! I could definitely repeat this breakfast spot!
Updating my previous 5-star review to say that Tina is a wonderful waitress/server. Can't wait to return and try more things on the menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
