Found this place after a boat tour and didn't want to spend hundreds eating on the water. It was amazing and the proportions were humongous. We could have shared one plate with a third person. Definitely will go back next time in in NY.
What a fun joint and a must try in NYC!  Colourful dining rooms, great tunes and friendly service.  Had their famous chicken and waffles, $20 and enjoyed the cheesy béchamel and Cholula honey!
No comment
No comment
Went here for brunch with a few friends, the host was lovely and sat us immediately. our server came to us asap and got us drinks and food was great  will be back
Very small menu.  Mac n cheese was not very good. Got the steak and eggs.  Eggs were not cooked well at all. Steak was good

This was such a fun restaurant! The menu was fun and colorful and the items on the menu were unique and had fun names. The restaurant itself felt exciting and cool with fun music that helped the mood. The avocado toast was a delicious combination of crispy bread, drippy eggs, and the fresh vegetables made a nice though. The breakfast sandwich was good, but the homefries made the meal and were seasoned to perfection! I'm a sucker for chocolate and peanut butter so The Mr. Fluffalupagus was the perfect choice. Such fun and unique presentation, but still so yummy!
Heavy metal fries and giant margs! What is better than that? Always a fun time at moms! Their brunch is great too!
Food was amazing and the recommendation/service from Chance B was 10/10 - would definitely come back! The music and atmosphere was also vibe-y!
No comment
No comment

My friend and I were able to get a table outside in the covered seating at Mom's Kitchen and Bar at about 8 pm on a Saturday evening. She ordered the Mac & cheese pancake due to the intriguing nature of the dish and I stuck with the classics and got the chicken and bacon waffle. The pancake was very interesting in that the mac and cheese was incorporated into the pancake batter and was not served separately with the pancakes as one may have anticipated. They clearly added the macaroni and the cheese separately into the batter as the macaroni was largely tasteless. However, they definitely get points for inventiveness. My chicken and bacon waffle was pretty good, nothing special, but I wish there were smaller chunks of chicken for easier consumption and a crispier waffle. We shared the cookie stand milkshake at the conclusion of our meal, and our first impression was that the shake should have been bigger for the price we paid. However, they were very accommodating once we told them that we were sharing as they gave us two straws and two spoons in a mug. The paper straws sadly made it difficult to drink the slurp up the milkshake since I guess the mixture would get stuck on the paper. Overall, the restaurant had interesting decor and dishes but at times we felt neglected by the service and if eating outside, the fans are quite aggressive when turned on.
No comment

Don't tell your dentist you ate here. I honestly wasn't a fan of the food as it's not your typical nyc brunch. It's more touristy, the menu is more limited, but shame on me for not doing my research ahead of time so I won't ding them for it. Service was excellent. Facilities were clean. Food was exactly what they said it would be.
No comment
No comment
Amazing food loved the service loved the decor OK I LOVED  everything, we will definitely be back again and loved my duckie

AMAZING service and an even better breakfast. I got the avocado toast which was great but wished I had gotten the chicken and waffles. They had Arthur playing on TV the whole time which was a fun vibe. Iced coffee was available as well which was huge
No comment
No comment

I saw this place on Yelp and when I was just walking around hell's kitchen the night before I came across it. The menu looked very very interesting and it looks like a cute little place to pop in for breakfast or brunch. I was very intrigued by the menu creations such as the macaroni and cheese pancakes. I came here on my last day in New York for breakfast and the waiter recommended to me the burrito pancake as one of the customer favorites. I figured I've never tried a pancake burrito in my life so why not try 1 now. 1st of all even though I pretty much ate all of it this is definitely something you could split with someone else. Whoever came up with the genius idea of a pancake burrito needs an award lol. It was so delicious and the pancake was fluffy and flavorful. The addition of the fillings were great. I will say Hell's kitchen had some of best selection of restaurants in Manhattan that I saw while there. We need a location in Tampa Bay hint hint lol. Highly recommend this place.

Went cuz it's down the street from the hotel and the reviews are good. The food was good but not amazing. The place is super cute and a nice spot for brunch as they serve breakfast all day. There is outdoor seating. We had the short ribs and fried chicken and gravy. They were ok. The sides are really the stars here. I really enjoyed the grill corn and cheesy grits.
Was excited to try this place out... the male hostess was very rude and does not know how to talk to people
Awesome food!! And lots of it! Loud local spot, mom's is a killer stop for great southern cuisine, come hungry.
No comment
Great shrimp and grits! The turkey bacon was delicious as well.  Service was a bit slow and inhospitable.
No comment
No comment

What a quirky and fun diner! There may be a wait during the weekends but line runs fast. My bf and I like sitting at the countertop! The Mac and cheese pancakes are amazing (I can't help but continuously choose the same order.) He had the steak and cheese, surprisingly well- cooked for a medium rare. Coffee is light and smooth. Maybe next time I'll try a malted milkshake and another crazy brunch dish.  The interior is reminiscent of the 90s, my time with Spongebob, strawberry shortcake dolls, cute metal lunch boxes, and Nickelodeon cartoons on tv.
No comment
No comment
Chicken Sammy is fantastic.  Juicy on inside. Crunchy  breading on the outside.   Highly recommended.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Moms kitchen was cool vibes bartender waiters. Overall great experience. I had the duckie slide which was very good and the Buffalo wing also good. Looking forward to seeing going back.
No comment

Amazing food and service!! Very affordable too. Enjoyed it with a group of 10 for the very first time. Only wish is that they would do reservations because we called ahead days an advanced and gave them a "heads up" and we got there on time and still had to wait for an hour to get a table. Otherwise food and experience was great!

Wife & I came for breakfast after seeing all the great reviews. We had like a 10 min wait, which wasn't bad for a Sunday morning. Staff was friendly and we didn't wait long for our food and the place was packed. Menu had lots of good sounding options, but the sweet tooth kid in me opted for the Bedrock Pancakes. I was in all my glory as this was everything I hoped for and more. I mean fruity pebbles in big fluffy pancakes topped with blueberries and strawberries. Seemed like everyone around us was getting the same thing. I'll say it's probably a staple here. My wife got the woodland omelet and loved it. It was a ton of food and she couldn't finish it. We had to split the How the Grinch Stole Christmas seasonal shake. It was insanely good, mint chocolate chips and vanilla ice cream with green sprinkles. Breakfast for two of us came to $50+

This place is seriously the CUTEST with YUMMY food! We stumbled upon this on our way to Circle Line for a cruise. I had the shrimp with mac and cheese that was SO YUMMY! MY husband had the chicken sandwich! We would totally eat here again!

AMAZING!!! This was our favorite stop in NYC. We ordered the Bedrock pancakes and the Mac and cheese pancakes. Both were outstanding! Not a bite was left. The Mac and cheese pancakes sound strange but they are so worth it. I was completely full afterwards but I couldn't pass on the holiday special shake: The Grinch Who Stole Christmas. I may have felt sick for a few minutes afterwards due to the crazy amount of sugar- but it passed and I have no regrets! That shake was amazing and again- not a bite was left. Run to Mom's!!!
The chicken bacon waffle was a delight, the service was great, fun drink choices and very 90s kids ambiance!
I loveeee this place the food is fantastic and the service is tops. I loved the French toast I'm definitely coming back! Highly recommend
No comment
Great atmosphere and even better food!  service was fast and efficient . highly recommend!
No comment
The food was amazing. They also have delicious vegan options. I would definitely come back here and recommend this place.

Had the breakfast sandwich with home fries. Well that ain't bacon and those aren't home fries. The bacon was tough and stringy like beef jerky. I actually had to chew it for a long time. Tasted like it was days old bacon that wasn't cooked right when it was fresh. A few pieces were so hard I had to remove them from the sandwich. Diced sweet potatoes and red potatoes just aren't home fries without peppers and onions. Those are diced sweet potatoes and red potatoes. Waitress was very nice and food was served fast. This was a Tuesday morning at 930 am. Everything should've been fresh.
Amazing milkshakes! Fun location for drinks and tasty snacks to meet up with friends. Great staff too!
No comment

Tina was a tentative waitress. The vibe was so hot girl summer like my drink!  The decor... wall paper and floor was so cool. They have phone charger outlets.  The food was fresh and generous portions. I had the chicken salad and my guy had the cheeseburger and fries. Definitely going to be repeat place to go to.

The inside was fully decked out in Halloween theme! The inside was retro and plenty of outdoor seating as well. We got placed in their queue system and was texted when to go back. The service was attentive! The seasonal drinks were unique and tasted great! I got the hot girl summer (in the middle of October haha). I ordered the breakfast sandwich and the extra large English muffin made it very filling! The side salad was refreshing. Enjoyed my experience!
Fantastic Food, Great service. Wonderful atmosphere. Would highly recommend for any type of meal!
Such a wonderful place for comfort food imo. Ordered the chicken and waffles and satisfied two happy customers. Also ordered a mimosa and  it tasted exactly as a mimosa should
Fun setting, friendly service, yummy food - trifecta for a good brunch! Our little family enjoyed the pancake burrito, steak and eggs and the breakfast sandwich and weren't disappointed.

First time In NY and came visit this restaurant just from searching around the area. We walked up and was told we'd have to wait 45 minutes. We almost left but stayed, I'm glad we stayed. The food portions were huge and delicious. I tried the veggie burger, avocado toast, shrimp and grits, waffles, and cauliflower. Everything was amazing! Our waiter Kiana was amazing!!! She assisted and checked on us often we never needed for anything. I'd give this place 10 stars, oh and the music 100 . Great time!
My buddy recommended this place and it did not disappoint! I ordered the woodland omelette with curly fries and it was great! Drinks were good as well. Would definitely come back again!

The menu here is unique so most of our party ordered from the side's menu. The food and service were good and my husband enjoyed the Bedrock pancakes. The portion was huge and he made sure he ate every bit of it!
Friendly staff, great food in a good location. Recommend avocado toast or chicken and waffles.

Sometimes you go to a restaurant for the food, sometimes for the vibe, and other times you may go because the people who work there are some of the greatest humans ever! Well I can promise that if you go to Mom's Kitchen, you'll be getting to experience all 3!!! I'd been there in the past, but my experience today was top notch. From the tasty boozy latte to the scrumptious pancake burrito, the dining experience for my friends and me was flavorful and well worth the price. The service was timely and done with such kindness by our waiter, Cole, who was a complete sweetheart. But the icing on it all was the fabulous care and welcome shown to us by the host, Benny! Talk about feeling like you're being welcomed by an old friend...Benny was supportive, helpful, and fun as hell!! I'm telling you, go to Mom's Kitchen on a weekend day and you're going to be happy you did!!!
No comment

Had a really nice breakfast here this morning with the fam. Food was delicious and they offer great portions. Service was solid and staff friendly and accommodating. Would definitely come back again. Oh, and the decor is cool too!!!
No comment
Great milkshakes and awesome service! Added benefit they were playing SpongeBob on TV

Popped by this place for breakfast while looking for a bagel spot in the neighborhood. Wasn't expecting to be amazed, but wow!!!! This was an incredible breakfast with such a diverse menu, would highly recommend! We had some basic things today, but will be back to try other things!!!
No comment

Fanfuckingtastic! This place doesn't miss. Such a cute, clean, and friendly establishment.  The service is A+ and our waiter made great reccomendations. Every bite of the food tasted sinful.  The drinks were delicious.  The vibe is off the charts. No crumbs were left.
Food is so good. Shakes make me happy. I has the oreo cookie shake, also they had a hocus-pocus trivia night. That was very fun.
No comment
No comment

OBSESSED is an understatement. The entire vibe of the place was excellent from the decor, to the staff, and right down to the food and drinks they set in front of me. Giant portion sizes- perfect to share or have leftovers to take home! and nothing on the menu is less than unique and something I've never found anywhere else.

Best service and food ever! Ate here twice and Benny greeted us so nicely and sat us immediately. Drinks are delicious and definitely worth it. Couldn't have asked for a better host than Benny. Food came out pretty fast and HOT. Definitely would recommend this place when visiting NY
Good diner/comfort food. Big portions, very friendly staff. Loud music though, so don't expect an intimate conversation.

My first experience at moms wasn't so good, but I went back and have continued going back, visiting other locations. I always get the chicken and bacon waffle dish , the cheese and hot honey sauce are so good . The drinks are pretty good as well.
No comment
LOVE LOVE LOVE Mom's Kitchen & Bar. Food was amazing, server was amazing, love the vibe. We need to plan another trip to NY so we can go back to Mom's!
Food and drinks here are just astounding! The service was excellent as well! Bought my cousin and her wife T-shirts for them to use on the next gay pride!

Great atmosphere. Love the decor. My husband and I had boozy milkshakes. They were incredible! You must try one of their milkshakes. Definitely worth the calories. We had the fried cheese curds. We couldn't stop eating them.  So good. I had the chicken and waffles. They were ok. Chicken was a little dry. My husband had the pancake burrito. Cool idea but looked better than it was. With that said he still liked it. I saw all the huge sandwiches going to other tables that looked incredible. I would definitely like to go back and try the other foods on the menu.
No comment

The wait was 45 mins long, but understandable for a Sunday.  The portions were very hugeee, you can just get one thing and share to be honest.  The plates are very unique and over the top.  This is a place to go for the experience, not as your regular breakfast spot.  The prices are high- $17 for a shake, crazy!  But like I said I came for the experience so it was like a one time thing for me to splurge on.

the pancake burrito is DELICIOUS wow. I don't even know how they make this thing it's a monster but it's so good. $20 it's a little expensive but def got two meals out of it cause it's massive and it's so delicious so pretty worth it. it's basically a mcdonald's mcgriddle but better and all of the flavors work so well together. if you like a combination of sweet and savory flavors you MUST get the pancake burrito that's all
Great spot, Very eclectic. The Buffalo wings were excellent and the chicken and waffle was incredible. Great customer service as well.
Great food for the soul, don't worry about your waistline, this isn't that kind of place. Loved the breakfast so much, I cancelled trying a different place and came back for round 2 the next morning.
Loved the fruity pebble pancakes! Service was ok, food was excellent.
This place was great.  It was fun, upbeat and had great food.  If we ever back in NYC again, I would definitely stop by.
The milkshakes are great! We has the fried chicken and gravy which was deliciously presented. My daughter had a great time.
No comment
Cute little spot. The vibe was good and fast service. I got the chicken bacon waffle. I asked for normal syrup and it was yummy. Drink was good too! I'm coming back for the Bacon Mac and Cheese.

We ate here prior to seeing The Play That Goes Wrong and it was The Meal That Went Wrong. We were seated promptly as it was not very busy but was then promptly ignored for a very long time. When we were finally able to get the attention of a server and get menus it was another long wait to order. When you are eating out before a show you get a bit anxious when things are slow, so glad we gave ourselves lots of time. Food (wings, cauliflower, burger) were meh to bad. Nobody finished their meals or the apps. Server disappeared for a long time on us and our table neighbors. We all bonded over the experience. I'd not recommend.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: Not the vibe i was expecting but as the night went on later there was definitely more adults lol. The food was pretty good but quite expensive. The drinks were also more expensive then intended. There were little add ons that added up to a lot.
No comment
The s'mores milkshake was good, I had the chicken and waffles with the cheese on it and personally did not like it. Service was great though and food came out fast.
My pancakes were a little over the top. They were amazing.  Going to try the steak and eggs next time.

Man, what's gem we stumbled on! This place was fantastic. Kind of a hole-in-the-wall vibe; nothing fancy. But my dinner was amazing and the drink delish! And our waiter was pleasant and fun. Get the crispy chicken...that gravy was to die for!

Fun Drinks, delicious food and Rugrats on all the TV's, what else's do you need. We decided on Mom's Kitchen & Bar for an early dinner before going to see a show on Broadway.  My Chicken and Waffles were delicious and my cousin enjoyed their over the top S'more Money S'more Problems Milkshake. The alcoholic drinks were so fun, I had the Hot Girl Summer which was served in an inflatable pink flamingo and an alcoholic juice pouch!! If your looking for great food, fun drinks with throwbacks to the the 90's check this place out!!
Always Great food and vibes love this place . I love that it also caters to every diet needs .Until we meet again
No comment
No comment
Great atmosphere, service, food and drink options. We sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and attentive. Definitely would return when visiting NYC again.

Tbh the food was pretty good. The texture was a but weird because it was soft but also had crunchy bacon bits at the same time? But the taste was very very very very very very good. and i ended up getting the chocolate milkshake after. (i honestly don't remember what it was i just know it has some type of chocolate flavoring) and it was super good. The wait wasnt too long, and it wasn't too loud either. The other food looked so good too, and the waiter was nice.

Went to brunch for the first time and this place was the ABSOLUTE BEST!! I highly recommend coming here. Even though there was a 15 minute wait, it was well worth it. The staff was friendly and helpful but the food was the absolute star of this place. Compliments to the chef. Definitely will be going back.

Came here for brunch while on a group trip, we found this establishment on a google search. It was a short wait, maybe about 25min. We did sit outside and the booth set-ups were great. Their menu titles and entrees are so unique and interesting. We had the Buffalo Mac n Cheese Bar as an appetizer and emmm "no" they were very soggy like and extremely salty to consume. For my entree, I had Bayou Shrimp. My goodness, those shrimp were amazing; cooked and seasoned to perfection and paired with elote corn (BABY! It tasted AMAZING "you hear me" whoever was the chef, did that!!) and a spring salad with a raspberry based dressing (AMAZING). The Sangria was fine, I had the large size. Our waiter and host was very friendly and had a great sense of humor, we felt welcomed and appreciated as patrons! I recommend this establishment.
No comment

We were with friends half vegan, on vacation. & wanted a brunch drink. This place fit the bill. But the ambiance was so 80's retro (as best I can describe). Everyone in our group found something fun, the staff was on point, always attentive and helpful. Food was way out, so big and too much!   But we still talk about the fruity pebble pancakes, wow!!   If we had kids with us, we might have given them some
On a weekend trip to NYC from SC and I'm super impressed! Excellent menu, nice vibe, food and service was amazing!!!

Just pure fun ! Original and a great spin on food and cocktails!!!  I love pizazz and all Glitter with this place. Cute inside and out. When I return to New York Mom's is on my list for a good brunch, cocktail and patio time!!!!

What a super cute and fun little place, and the food was so good! We received excellent service, and a fantastic recommendation from our server to try the adult ducky beverage; it was so refreshingly delicious! Definitely would recommend!

A pleasant surprise. I loved the old school theme and their  diligent safety precautions. The skilled Caprisun was cute and different ... served in the same pouch. I had the strawberry shortcake shake! Very rich and more than enough. My friend visited 3 times in a week because the food was so good.
No comment
No comment
went after a show for the first time and absolutely LOVED the energy and food here. Great customer service and great eats!
No comment
Came this past weekend. Short wait time. The food was exquisite. Everything from the pancakes to the burgers were great. I'd definitely return.
No comment
No comment
Amazing and elevated comfort food!! Came for my mom's birthday and if def exceeded expectations
No comment
Phenomenal atmosphere!! I loved the food and cocktail menu, super fun names and a full vegan version of the best dish. 10/10 would recommend!
Really good. Got the pancake burrito ! Highly recommend. Milkshake was great... don't like the straws but still great

We visited because of the excellent reviews on Yelp. It was an experience but I don't think we are coming back. The portions are huge and food styling/ decoration is 80's kitschy which gives a character to the place. However, the food is TOO much (even if you eat half of it) and not so tasty. A lot of whipped cream, a lot of syrup, huge pancakes. This restaurant probably attracts a lot of tourists.
No comment
Fun Atmosphere and good diner food.  We had Chicken and Waffles and their buffalo mac and cheese balls.  Both were delicious.  Service was quick and friendly.

Visiting from Dallas and wanted some comfort food. Found this place on a google search and it was soooooooooo good! We sat at the bar and Sarah took care of us. She was such a good time. She made the drinks so good and her conversation was engaging. I highly recommend this place. Good music, good vibes, good food and drinks, and the best Sarah around!
Excellent . Enjoyed food. Large portions and great service. Don't miss ordering cheese curds.
No comment

I come to NYC every summer and I stay in the Times Square area. I am always looking for places that are not tourist traps and have good food. Price also plays a factor. I found this place online and decided to give it a try. The portions are substantial and the food was very tasty. I had the chicken and bacon waffle and it was delicious. The service was great and the staff was friendly. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was it was on the pricey side for breakfast/brunch. I really wanted to try a shake but it was $14 !! I would go back to Moms.
No comment
No comment
The maple bacon Bloody Mary is to die for. Such a funky vibe, incredible service and high energy ambiance. Friendly people and fun to just soak it all in. Perfect stop for a Sunday!

Came here on a Saturday night for drinks with a friend before heading off for the night. The vibe and atmosphere of the place is amazing. We were seated quickly! I ordered the Drink the Rainbow and my friend ordered the Rose Colored Glasses. Drink the Rainbow was delicious and strong! I wish I was hungry and gotten some food, but there's always next time!
No comment
Great breakfast! Portions are generous and the staff was very attentive to customer needs.

The portions here are huuuugggeeee. They always have a huge like and wait on the weekends especially for brunch, you are better off going during the week. They have a lot of creative foods there. I got a breakfast wrap, wrapped in pancakes! And a lot of fun cocktails on the menu.

Okay, this was GOOD!!! Thank you Justin for the pancake burrito recommendation . We had a variety of selections: chicken and bacon waffles; avocado toast revamp and breakfast sandwich. I vote my pancake burrito and chicken and bacon waffle was hands down the best!  Please try this place while in NYC
Great service. Really friendly and welcoming. Incredibly unhealthy food and portions.

Nice atmosphere. The sausage was excellent, however the pancakes were huge and also tasted chewy and undercooked. The omelette my friend had was fair. Nevertheless, I would visit again to try more dishes and enjoy the location..

Good food, good service, loud. Saturday afternoon, place was packed, but food and service excellent. Didn't get a puc if the Avocado Toast, but thik top notch Eggs Benedict on 10 grain toast. Didn't need to eat the rest od the day. Definitely requires a rwturn visit.

If I could give this place more stars, I would! I've been to NY a few times and never visited this restaurant. However, on my most recent trip for a bachelorette party we found this spot after the place we were originally going to was not what we wanted. From the moment we walked in we were excited! The ambiance is very comfy but energetic! We sat outside because it was a beautiful day and the tables are still covered. All the staff were friendly and attentive. The drink choices were creative and amazing. You need to try the Chicken & Waffle from here. Best I've had in a long time!

This restaurant is the cutest and the food is delicious!!! We went for my bday and it was the best experience ever! They had good drinks the watermelon one was the best! The chicken and waffle was delicious! Then they brought me out a surprise bday shake and sang to me! I cried it was amazing and I'll def go back again

Got the bigass cocktail for $20 what a steal!! The food was out of this world and the environment was playful yet welcoming to families. Would love to come back to NYC  and visit again, they need to have more restaurants around, definitely one of my favorite places I have ever been to eat :)

Amazing service! Our server did a great job... He went above and beyond with his service. Enjoyed dinning there. They had both indoor and outdoor dinning was nice. Their outdoor dinning had heaters which was pretty convenient as it was it cold... Food was amazing! Definitely have to try this spot! First time here while visiting New York & don't regret it! Definitely also recommend the Buffalo Mac & Cheese Balls they are !!

Wow is all I can say! I went in yesterday 5/1 with my boyfriend after a broadway show. Our server was incredible. I can't remember her name but she had long brown hair. First off the Chicken & Bacon Waffle was amazing! Along with the chicken and gravy, the chicken they used was so crunchy and delicious. We had to try the fruity pebbles pancakes and wow they were amazing! We left stuffed and with a Togo bag since there was so much chicken on each entree. The atmosphere of the place was nice with great music and a cute 90's theme going on. They even have a drink with an inflatable flamingo! I would highly recommend this place!!!

First morning in New York found this cute little dinner in Times Square. They have everything from waffles to burgers. I got the chicken sandwich which was delicious but was huge, I was only able to eat half the chicken sandwich so it might be shareable between two. They also have different speciality shakes. Overall food was delicious and recommend moms
Convenient and cost-efficient. Great milkshakes and they are decorated nicely. Reminds me of a diner back in the day... like the ones that used to serve on roller skates.
No comment

Food was delicious, the waitress suggested the pancake burrito  & it didn't disappoint. My husband & daughter had the waffles & chicken, that sauce they put on the chicken is  Huge portions. Staff was friendly & welcoming, highly recommend

Food 4.5 stars, service 6 stars. Armando and his team served me quickly and efficiently on a night when I needed to get to the theater. I ordered the Creole shrimp with the cheesy grits and pickle slaw. (The slaw was a little onion heavy for my taste. ) Really enjoyed my meal and will be keeping this place in mind for future pre-theater inexpensive food.

Here on vacation and went to Mom's for dinner. Cute place with great comfort food. I had the chicken and gravy with mashed potatoes and green beans. Three crispy chicken breasts, silky potatoes and tasty green beans. My husband and son had burgers which were big and juicy. We finished it off with two very large shakes. Fluffleupagus and goon to a Goblin, both large and delicious. Waitress, Hannah was welcoming, friendly and helpful. Loved the experience!

Woahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh . The sizes are great ... The shrimps and grits were out this world !!!! It's hard to find a place where that dish is made to perfection . Service is fast wait can be long but they seat you pretty fast . I have returned again and it's still great !!

My daughter and I have been in town for a week from San Diego and have now had Mom's twice and have been blown away. First of all the server we had both times was Chance and he couldn't have been more attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, for breakfast the other day we had a pancake burrito which is savory and filling, and for the sweeter side of breakfast we shared the Cinnamon french toast and it was absolutely delicious. Also the rainbow bright shake was outstanding. Today we had the Heavy Metal fries that were so filling and delicious and the Bowl of soul(tomato soup) so thick and creamy and the Grilled chicken cranberry salad. all were top notch and couldn't have been better. the music and atmosphere are so fun and thanks to everyone at Mom's for such a great experience.

Let's start from the beginning. This weekend was a birthday celebration for my niece. We decided to have a staycation in the City and she remembered this awesome restaurant. We decided to have brunch on Saturday. The wait time wasn't too bad...30 minutes and to my surprise...it was exactly 30 minutes when I received the text that our table was ready. The host was very friendly as well as the rest of the staff. The atmosphere was vibrant and brought back memories of my childhood. The lunchbox on the table and cartoons playing on the TV. Our food came out quickly and it was delicious. If you're looking for a down to earth breakfast/brunch spot, this is it!  You won't be disappointed. Oh...they do have a decent amount of outdoor seating. Hope you enjoy!
Breakfast was great at Mom's Kitchen. I was hungry and service was good with minimal wait. It's conveniently located in mid town New York City - close to the theater district and Times Square.
No comment

IMHO totally overrated. My breakfast sandwich and "home fries" were completely bland. What they call home fries is basically potato and sweet potato chunks, but both equally flavorless. Thick cut bacon on the sandwich is a poor choice, as the eggs are soft and crumbly, leading to a messy tug of war as you try to bite both. $5 bodega egg sandwiches are better and easier to eat. My wife enjoyed her short rib salad at least. Sorry Mom, not a fan.

While visiting NYC on a Sunday afternoon, my girlfriend and I were in the mood for a place with some cool brunch dishes.  We were going to see an afternoon Broadway play, and wanted to get a bite to eat beforehand.  So, we found this spot, and we were so glad we did.  There was about a 20 minute wait, but that was fine with us.  They offered outdoor seating, but since it was a cold day, we chose to wait for an inside table.  Once we were seated, we started with getting some coffees while we looked through the menu.  They had so many cool options; we couldn't decide on what to get.  We chose the pancake burrito and the chicken & bacon waffle; and decided to split both items between us.  (Both of these items had the most pics and reviews on them, so we figured we couldn't go wrong with either).  The food came out quick, which was great, and both of these brunch dishes were excellent.  The pancake burrito was amazing and the chicken & bacon waffle was spectacular.  They were both just so good, I couldn't choose which one I liked better.  Plus, the portion size is large, so you definitely will be stuffed after eating a meal.  Prices were fair too.  Overall,  we loved this place and our brunch dishes. Highly recommended and we will be coming back to try some more of their menu items for sure!
No comment

This place was very accommodating for our group of 6 and they had a lot of fun drinks! Pretty basic American food-- it was tasty and we had awesome service. They had their TVs streaming Rutgrats which I thought was pretty cool!

Great service! We had to show our vaccination card to enter and be seated! This was so nice and different! I loved the choices! My husband got the shrimp and grits and I had the steak and potatoes. The home fries are cut red potatoes and sweet potatoes together it was so delish!
Went on a Sunday morning-- lucked out with no line! Quick service , good food and fun nostalgic atmosphere !
Excellent service! Great food! Chicken and waffles come with bacon and 2 chicken breasts

We really liked this place. The milkshakes were awesome and the food was pretty good. My wife had tomato soup which she did not love and the Mac n cheese which was better. I had a burger which was also fine...not amazing, but good. The real stars of the show were the milkshakes! We got a few. Just check out the pictures...they speak for themselves.
No comment
Loved the environment! Food, music and drinks on point. I got the steak and eggs, my sister got the chicken sandwich. Portions are HUGEEE

When here for the first time during a visit and have to say, it was amazing!  Great food and trendy little place. Our waitress was incredible and kind. Very welcoming. Good atmosphere!  You have to try it.
No comment
Party vibe restaurant. Love it. Quick service and good food/drinks. Will be back for sure.
No comment
Great vibe! Felt like I was in the 90s with the decorations and even the Rugrats on the tv. Solid food and great service, big thank you to Zach the bartender
The food was amazing and the mimosas were huge. I definitely think this is right for brunch for sure.
Delicious food and great service.  Music choice was fun and upbeat.  Avocado toast and fried chicken sandwich were very tasty.  We wanted to have room for shakes but were too full.

Not a huge selection for breakfast but definitely something for everyone! I had to try the pancake burrito and it was good! Huge and really would be good for two people. I wish the bacon had been inside instead of on top! My husband had the sandwich and said it was good (it was a big sandwich) but there was sweet potatoes in the homefries which he does not care for, just an fyi. Decorations are interesting and staff was very friendly! Saw kids in there enjoying pancakes as well!
The chicken and waffles were out of this world - it's now a constant craving. Their spiked hot chocolate was also great.

One of the better casual restaurants in the city of New York, my husband and I always visit this restaurant we've never been disappointed, I suggest this is a must visit Restaurant and enjoy yourself.
No comment
Incredible service and warm atmosphere from Mom's. This is the place for some chicken and waffles!
No comment

Had breakfast during our kids Graduation Trip to Times Square in New York City. Had the pancake burrito and my sister had cheesy grits & shrimp so we could share. Both Delicious! My son had mac & cheese pancakes and that was also delicious! Coffee was strong just how I like it. Service was great, staff was super friendly as well. Definitely returning to this spot!

First time here & came with a group of 7 friends on a Sunday. We were expecting a long wait since it was Brunch time. Waited no longer than 3 mins & sat in their outdoor seating area which was cozy. The host called us Family which was really endearing. Food & drinks came out soo fast, which was a pleasant surprise! Heads up they're BIG portions. Shout out to our waiter Miller who was excellent! Super friendly & attentive. Thank you for making our experience a memorable one, will be back again.
Fun atmosphere and good food and drinks! Great place and experience both times I've been there.
Great food, excellent service, enjoyable experience. Ambiance is fun, too. Really enjoyed the tim lunchboxes.

I've been to this place twice and so far so good! This last visit Ty was my server and he was PHENOMENAL, full of personality and extremely knowledgeable about all the dishes/drinks on the menu! I ordered the steak eggs n salad..and so delicious! Meat was tender and seasoned to perfection! I also ordered this seasonal coffee/vodka/kaluha drink w cinnamon roast crunch whip cream and a cinnamon bun on top! All super yummy!! I so love the MOM THEME all over the place and pics filled the room of old soul artist tv show personalities etc.. def a place I'd recommend if you want a cool chill hop vibe and they treat customers like royalty!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was supposed to be a casual brunch before going to a show. It turned out to be one of the best brunches that have crossed over my tastebuds. Sangria- great flavor. Chicken sandwich- PERFECTION. I need to come back for this experience again. Friend ordered pancake burrito and reports that it's tasty, and a must try. But how can I not order that chicken sammie...bring a friend!

This place is amazing. The food is delicious, and the drinks are strong... unless you're doing non-alcoholic drinks of course, but you won't be disappointed. We brunched with the family and everyone left full and happy!

It was my first time coming to this place and it was a wonderful experience. The Bedrock pancakes I got were so fluffy and filling. The fruity pebbles added such a fun and tasty touch. I also enjoyed my Cinnamon city shake which was unlike something I've ever had before I came here. Overall they definitely deserved 5 stars.
Gigantic portions and delicious food. Loved the atmosphere, and all the servers were very nice
Pretty good breakfast spot, service was great. Our server was quite entertaining. I'll eat there again.
AWESOME! Very welcoming ! Staff is so Great ! Food was Delicious !!! I def recommend! There's a wait ! But Hey it's because of the great service and food! So def worth it !! Kids friendly!
Rozena is not the biggest fan of white people food so it was okay for her. Pretty big portions.

I stopped at Mom's on my way to a play on a Saturday at lunchtime. I was so impressed with this place. I got in after a 15 min wait and ordered the Short Rib Sandwich. It was so delicious. I took my time eating this sandwich because I wanted to savor every bite. You would think a short rib sandwich is no big deal, but at Mom's, it is. The service was fabulous and it will not be my last time stopping to eat here the next time I am in town. Please try this place; you will enjoy it.
The service was great. Casual environment but fun and the food was amazing! Big portions and great value for the cost! Would definitely come back!

Food is AMAZING here. However, I went for a celebratory lunch with my best friend, and we had trouble finding a waiter to ask for our bill and for a box to take our food home. To my surprise the hostess rudely replied "You can ask your server" and smirked. I have never in my life heard a response like that. The staff at Mom's Kitchen should work cohesively with each other, as well as practice great customer service. I'm just sad, because I've been raving about this place to all of my friends, and this incident really changed the way I feel about dining at this establishment. I hope this gets addressed, and that I am the last customer this happens to.
Went here in March and the chicken and waffles were TEW GOOD. That hot sauce mixed with honey wheww.
I've been coming here for years. Love the food. However my dish this time was smaller. The omelette was never this small in the past...the taste also seemed slightly different.
No comment

The BEST place to eat brunch! Everything was on point today from customer service, friendly staff, and quick wait staff. Chance was my waiter and he absolutely fabulous!! I loved how nice he was, and very friendly. Michelle was fabulous and nice as well. Can't wait to come back!!
While the food was quite delicious, I thought the prices were on the high end for the neighborhood. Therefore, giving this place 4 rather than 5 stars.
Sarah was an awesome server with great suggestions!  She was super attentive and personable.  The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great!  LGBTQ+ friendly!  Check out the milkshakes!!!
Huge portions.  Delicious shakes.  Highly recommend the chicken and waffles!
No comment

The place was clean and decorated in fun colors and patterns. We went specifically because of the reviews and it did not disappoint. The service was great, the food was amazing and the coffee was hot. The favorite dish of the morning was the Chicken & Bacon waffle. I got the sauces on the side but ended up pouring all of them all over it and it was absolutely amazing. I didn't think I would like the cholula honey but I LOVED it. It was a balance of spicy and sweet with the chicken. I would 100% recommend if you like chicken and waffles. We will be back again next time we are in the city.
Absolute gem! Service was fantastic and food was divine! I had the breakfast sandwich and my SIL the avocado toast. SIL said the avocado toast was the best she's ever had.

O M G . i saw the photos and thought I HAD to come but man, oh man! this place blew my expectations out of the ROOF! despite the fact that this place is a bit out of the way and not directly "near" a subway line, everything else is a plus! no reservations accepted so once you go, you put your name down (this was on friday 12pm) they stated a 20 minute wait but it ended up only being 8 minutes. there's ample amount of seating inside and outside. the outside seating is not really "outside" because you're in a set up with close doors and heaters but it's fine, more spacious than the inside seating (from what i could see). my friend and i shared the steak & eggs and the fruity pebble pancakes and it was definitely filling. the steak is ACTUAL steaks and seasoned pretty well ( a little salty but that was okay because of the sweetness of the pancakes). the pancakes are HUGE and covered with fruits so it's not all just sugary goodness. the service was pretty good and quick. probably sat and ate all within 45-60 minutes. 10/10 recommend! the flavors were all there!

Came here w a friend, he ordered chicken and gravy and I ordered chicken sandwich. Food was delicious, service was really friendly, and prices are affordable! The chicken was delicious and well marinated, really crispy as well. Fries were good. Would def come back if it weren't so far from the train! But maybe someday when I'm really craving diner food

We went to Mom's for my sons 21st Birthday and it did not disappoint!!! The drinks, on point, the service... 5+++++ stars. Chance made our experience  extra special. It was drag night and Peachez and Skye Walker provided a fun and entertaining night. The drinks, the food... top notch. Get the Mac and Cheese! We will be back.

Took my mom and sister to Mom's kitchen upon a recommendation from a friend before a Broadway show.  We did not have a reservation, so we requested an indoor table and was told the wait would be 25mins.  The table becomes available and then we get escorted by the host through the restaurant to enviably be taken to an outside table.  I told her we requested an indoor table because it was cold and pouring rain.  I saw some tables available inside but the host stated this is the only one. I asked if we could get one inside, she states we cannot and that if we want an inside table, we would go back to the bottom of the waitlist and have to wait an additional 25min.  She was incredibly rude and unapologetic about their mistake. The food was not good enough to come back.

I went here on a Sunday afternoon. I had the steak and eggs. The service was very fast, and the server did an excellent job. That being said, the steak was overcooked and under-seasoned, and the eggs were a bit bland. I didn't feel like it was worth it to send it back in the moment, but I probably wouldn't go back, especially considering the cost.
No comment

What can I say about this place. They did not disappoint! Their food was very flavorful and big portions. Friendly wait staff and they were very attentive. I got the chicken and waffles, which were a total flavor town and big portion. My bf got the pancake burrito which was also amazing. He said it could have had a little more sausage in it.  I think we both agreed that they could have a few more options for breakfast such as a omelet but everything was perfect! Their memos was delicious and huge. And the bloody Mary was on point with its flavors. When we come back in town, we will definitely visit again.
The presentation was excellent, but the pancakes were not good. I wouldn't go back when I go back to NYC.  It was also overpriced.
No comment
No comment

Was able to get seated without much of a wait. I ordered savory which was probably a mistake. Go for sweet if you go to Mom's since I think that's where they shine. Server was friendly but service was a bit slow. Can't really go wrong with going here but didn't knock my socks off either.
No comment
Food was amazing! Our server Chance was AMAZING and just gave off the best vibes. First time here and I could definitely become a regular with the fantastic customer service .
No comment

Very good!!! Love the music selection. Our service was pretty decent. I had the steak and eggs. They over cooked my steak, but the home fries and eggs were delicious. The MOM-osa was HUGE and delicious. It definitely got me feeling warm inside!

Fun food and drinks. Drinks are a bit pricey but they're good! Food is always on point. Overall, in my opinion, it's pretty affordable. The service is fast! Not a long wait time for food at all. The servers ensure you're enjoying your food and check up on the table to make sure everything is okay pretty often. A comfortable and upbeat vibe. Each experience has always been great. I already can't wait to go back.
The food is very dry. Chicken breast and steak look like being overcook. I ordered medium rare and I got like medium steak

Had THE BEST service of my LIFE at Mom's. My waiter Noah was an absolute sweetheart and gave my boyfriend and I the BEST recommendations. I'm not that girl who usually reviews places but I literally felt like I knew Noah for soooo long with how personable and sweet he was. Definitely coming back again and requesting Noah if he is around.

We had an amazing brunch at Mom's Kitchen! Prices were so decent for NYC, and portions were huge- including booze. Their brunch cocktails are to die for, and the bartender really makes sure you'll get a good buzz from just one. My boyfriend had the chicken and bacon waffle, and he ate nearly the whole thing. It was incredible- I definitely stole a few bites. I had the mushroom scramble (don't remember the name but it was filled with mushrooms and gruyere. Their breakfast potatoes have a mix of both regular and sweet which I loved. Everything was so delicious and the service was awesome. Will for sure be back next time we're in the city.
Such a great find! Not too busy, amazing boozy milkshakes and the food was amazing! The staff was very attentive and friendly as well, we will be back!

Lucas Lucas Lucas!  We love love love him!  Great food.  Great vibe.  Great music.  Great everything.  I do not normally Ike to repeat experiences, but we will definitely go back and see our man Lucas again.  Thank you Mom!!!

Absolutely delicious food, great portion size, lots of outdoor seating. When you put down your name, you get a text with a live list of guests waiting to see when it's your turn. Service is on the slower side, but overall friendly and they do not rush you out. Would highly recommend!
I had the Mom's burger and Momma was making miracles even though it wasn't Thanksgiving.

Back again and can't say enough about Mom's. It is my go to in the area. Comfort food, good music, kitschy decor, great drinks and shakes and an amazing staff. Noah was our waiter and he was amazing. Great suggestions for drinks and more. Ease do try their seasonal Spices Fashioned!! So great.
No comment
No comment

Ok, I cheated...on health. Moms Kitchen & Bar left me no choice. After indulging in what was a 3 course sugar rush, I understood why there was an hour wait to sit & line wrapped around the block to get on the list. The Bedrock Pancakes rocked me to sleep on the walk in. I felt like I was 8 again sneaking a whole box of fruity pebbles cereal to my room lol. Next up, The Chicken & Bacon Waffle. Juicy with every bite; big thick cut bacon and chicken breast topped with Cholula honey and cheesy sauce. Beautiful warm taste. I finished up with a big mouth shake called "S'more money, S'more problems"... story of my life. This included: Vanilla ice cream, Chocolate/ Vanilla hot syrup, Marshmallow fluff, honey, crushed graham crackers, & mini Hershey bars. I was in a food coma on the way home. Well worth it might I say. Go check this place out if you're looking for a fun full-ed BRUNCH with great service!
This was a nice stop for lunch. The food was tasty and fresh. We sat outside and I thought it was gunna be cold but it was just fine. Would recommend for sure. Great service as well.
No comment
No comment

We were in NYC with our son and this was a great dinner option for our family. Pancakes for the kiddo, adult food and drinks for us. Good and fast service and convenient location to our hotel on 8th Ave. Food was good. Not the best we've ever had, but it filled us up and we left happy.
Chicken & Bacon Waffle and the gigantic mimosas left me full for the entire day. Everything we ordered was fresh and made to order. ZERO complaints and of course the prices were perfect.

Wait was 30 min but was worth it good was delicious Had the mom's burger. Was soo hungry I forgot to take a pic. Only thing I didn't like was my egg whites was still runny. But other than that delicious. Fries and patty was fire . What's also enjoyed is the farmers market near by so the wait was not boring.

Visited Mom's with my hubby this morning and had a great experience. Angelina, our attentive waitress, recommended delicious dishes such as the breakfast sandwich and French toast. I also enjoyed the bacon Bloody Mary. Top tier food and service. Will definitely be going back to try other items on the menu!
Good was fine, but service was just OK. I always seek locally owned restaurants when I travel, so this one disappointed...
No comment

First trip to New York and this was our first meal! I had the Braised barbecue short ribs with street corn, my husband had the Mom's burger, and our kids had the chocolate chip pancakes.  It was delicious. Everything was amazing and we were so full we had to take a nap afterwards.  Highly recommend Mom's Kitchen!
No comment
No comment
Fantastic service for 8 of us (without a reservation on a Saturday night)!  Food was good and drinks were strong.  :)
No comment
Delicious breakfast!! Fried chicken on waffles, and avocado toast were big hits! Will definitely recommend to friends.

Great atmosphere and excellent food. I wasn't very hungry and had the tomato soup. It was clearly freshly made from actual real tomatoes (not a given in a restaurant in a touristy area) - it did honour to the restaurant's name! My daughter was simply blowen away when her pancakes arrived (yes, you can order brunch all day - even for dinner). The portions are big - but also very tasty! Keep in mind that it is also a bar - the music was a bit loud, so maybe not the right place if you want a quiet dinner.

Came here w/ two kids and two adults !!! We sat out door it was heated but bring a sweater ! I really enjoyed the food here and would definitely come back for indoor seating it was so packed inside and since We had the kids I didn't wanna overwhelm them w/ the noise but will definitely visit the food was great !
A little pricy but the food was sooooo good. Will definitely be back. Definitely wish they took reservations cuz there was a wait.

Service was great. Our server was a Cali girl just as we are from Cali. I got the breakfast sandwich w/ bacon and home potatoes (which I believe had red potatoes and sweet potatoes). THEE BEST breakfast sandwich I have ever had. It's huge too. I didn't eat it all but I warmed it up back in our hotel room and it was just as amazing.  My hubby got the steak and eggs (over easy). Cooked to perfection (medium rare). He got the maple bacon Bloody Mary and I got the Hate 2 C U Cocoa which was perfect for a cold day. We'll be back on our next visit.
Nice spot. Great service. Cammy was great. And the food was spot on. And OMG! THE BEST BACON! You can go plain or fancy with your breakfast choice. Either is great.

HUGE portions, the chicken dinner had three fried chicken breasts, the best gravy I've ever had, creamy and delicious mashed potatoes, and garlic butter green beans. I barely made a dent before I was full- but I highly recommend. Great atmosphere, even better food.

Waited an hour to sit, as expected, and the food was very good. It was a perfect diner breakfast with a modern, fun twist! Had the pancake sandwich and I would eat it again any day. Not sure if I'll be back any time soon due to the wait time, but I'm glad I went!
No comment

What a fun breakfast menu. If you're a kid (or kid at heart) many creative twists on eggs, pancakes, avocado toast, shakes ... watching the plates/drinks go by was mouthwatering. There are traditional breakfast plates so from fussy to fun loving eaters - every thing is delicious!
Amazing food! I have never had a bad meal here and the service is amazing! I got the fried chicken sandwich and it was to die for. The drinks can be a little sweet, but very cool!
Food was okay, they need better drink options. I also wish the waiter was more attentive, asked for the same thing like 4 times.
My favorite brunch/lunch place in hells kitchen.  My go to order is the chicken & waffles (not pictured)  I had to try something this time particular day. Highly recommended.
Pretty good food. Large portions. Cooked well. It is loud inside, wait staff aren't very attentive, but the price is fair.

I loved Mom's Kitchen! I sat at the bar for some breakfast - the avocado toast with hollandaise on the side was delicious! Hit the spot. The service was awesome - great energy and everyone in there seemed very happy, which I will take any day of the week. I like their menu  - the cocktails and milkshakes look ridiculous in a great way. Next time you're in Hell's Kitchen - stop in to Mom's!
No comment

Great with the caveat there is a long wait. Don't expect to be seated in less than 30 - 60 minutes and you are golden. Solid breakfast fare, terrific service and fun likely atmosphere. The turkey bacon is fantastic too.
No comment

We came at 10:30 on a Saturday and had around a 30 min wait for a table for 3. I didn't expect it to be so busy so early! It was worth the wait - food is a bit expensive but the servings are HUGE. Service was also super friendly. Can't wait to be back to try some more of their menu.
Definitely try the Cajun Shrimp and Cheesy Grits. It's not spicy at all. The grits are very creamy and the shrimp have loads of flavor. This filled me right up.

My review of Mom's restaurant and bar located on the northwest corner of 48th Street and 9th avenue in Hell's kitchen. Today is Sunday June 12th 2022 when I walked into Mom's restaurant and bar I found myself back in time on June 12th 1976. Cartoons on the big screen TV, those old 10 lunch boxes we had when we were kids holding the condiments on the table. Photos of memorabilia of TV shows from 1970s and before. The music was disco from the 1970s as well playing at a volume that was high enough to enjoy yet low enough to have a conversation with your fellow peers. I had the chicken bacon waffle for breakfast. Which had great reviews on Yelp and wish they highly recommend as well and with good reason, it's their best seller. As I was walking out I passed from some patrons and told them the food he was so good and they told me they already knew that and they look very happy to be there. The chicken bacon waffle consists of a Belgian waffle topped with a sweet honey syrup and about three pieces of thick bacon. Then on top of that they add two pieces of fried chicken breast very crispy and they cover that in cheese I forget which kind and the cheese has bacon bits in it. I recommend you let the bacon melt a bit when it's served for more enjoyable eating experience. I'm going to say what lots of food critics say and that is if you go anywhere for breakfast and Hell's kitchen go to Mom's restaurant and bar for breakfast you can't go wrong. This day's got to be the single most enjoyable eating experience I've had in a while. In closing I want to add that I first visited mom's back when they first opened and I had their breakfast sandwich and it was great wonderful service quick and courteous the food was excellent. That may have been as far back as 2017 I'm glad you're still around. Thank you Mom I will be back.
No comment
Place had no wait and food was pretty good. Service could be slightly better but def worth a stop if you're in the area

Great atmosphere. Fun people and delicious food. I got the chicken & waffles, which was huge and amazing and some fancy drink for like 30 bucks. Bartender and servers were all nice and having a good time. The eclectic mix of people was wonderful.

I thought this place to be just barely okay. I got the Hot Girl Summer drink and wasn't the biggest fan of it (the person who I came with who also ordered that drink agrees that it wasn't the best). The chicken filet sandwich was soggy from all the coleslaw on the bun but the actual filet was really dry and hard. The music was all over the place and they had Cartoon Network on. Bummed!
The food and atmosphere are great. Our server Kiana was the best. She has fantastic customer service.
Absolutely Delicious!! Every bite! Kiana is the sweetest, most patient server I've ever had! Will definitely return upon my next visit.

Very interesting place. The menu is not great with few choices. If you have children then they may love it, as fruity pebbles are part of some menu items. I ordered a waffle which had no flavor at all!! No coffee choices either x
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place I went to on the way to a show and the menu impressed me.  First off, the food was wonderful!!!  I ordered the fried chicken platter.  It comes with two sides, I got the Tater Tots and Mac n Cheese.  The Chicken was one of the juiciest pieces of chicken I ever tasted.  The Tots were standard tots, nothing memorable but was fine.   The Mac and Cheese was easily one of the best versions of Mac and Cheese I ever tasted.  Next time I go, ill order the same chicken dish but double up on the Mac if they allow me to because it was THAT GOOD!   The chicken dinner plate was $21.99 very reasonable for three big pieces of chicken and two sides.  Highly recommend  going here again, especially if you love good comfort food!

Fabulous place! I will definitely come back on my next visit! The 80s vibes are amazing. I had the fruity pebbles pancakes. Absolutely delicious. They were not too sweet but had the perfect amount of cereal flavor. Even the whipped cream tasted fruity! We also had an order of the Mac n cheese as an appetizer. Super cheesy and great flavor. I could taste the Gruyère.
No comment
Great atmosphere, big portions, great comfort food. Get the chicken sandwich, it's worth it. Kinda wish they took reservations but regardless, a great place
No comment

The food and service was yummy and impeccable! Our server (whose name escapes me) was absolutely amazing and speedy! My hubby and I look forward to coming here every so often when we're in this part of the city!
No comment
This place is sooooooooo good! Made me feel very nostalgic hehehe! I had the pancake burrito and it was AMAZING! Our server was Ryan and they were great! Ryan was super nice and hilarious!
Awesome place, awesome food, awesome aesthetics, and awesome customer service, definitely want to go again.
No comment
Great service, great Mom-osa. Loves the omelette with mushrooms. Breakfast sandwich was enjoyed by my sister.
No comment
Last nights dinner was great. Service was fast and food was fresh and tasty. Glad to have gone there to celebrate a friends birthday! Definitely a place I recommend.

Mom's never fails to please! This place is well oiled machine. Great bar and food service, great employees and management. After the last few visits, we have tried 3/4 of the menu and I can honestly say you can order just about anything and it will be amazing. We also recently attended their murder mystery dinner and will be back for more in the future. You must visit Mom's if you're in the area, they are super consistent and the best place for comfort food.

This was one of the BEST places we ate breakfast at while in NYC. So much so we went more than once. I can't say that both times that we went the food was great, the ambience was great and the staff is just GREAT! The first time we went the kids and I sat inside. My son ordered the Buffalo Mac N Cheese balls, my daughter had the avocado toast and I had the Bedrock Pancakes. We all really enjoyed the food...although I think we all liked my pancakes the best since my son finished what I couldn't. The second time we went we sat outside to enjoy the great weather that morning and it was just as wonderful. I ordered the pancakes again and this time so did my son and daughter and then my husband ordered the shrimp and grits. This day my husband received his coffee in a mug that had lipstick stains on it but the staff was on it and quickly exchanged it out. Then we all got our food and my husband again had his breakfast order mixed up and given the wrong thing....but once again the staff was on it and quickly made it right. Those two incidents though would never be enough to give anything less than 5 stars. I truly enjoyed the food and the experience at Moms and will make this a regular stop when I'm in town.

ABSOLUTELY THE BEST PLACE EVER! The waiter Chance was the best! He was prompt taking our order, getting us the food and helping us with the quick checkout! Highly recommend this place! Make sure to ask for Chance as your server!
Great food and even better service! The drinks were large and delicious! Benny was amazing!! He was so hospitable and paid great attention to our table. Love his attitude!
The food not as good as my last visit. My waiter may have been new and keep forgetting everything we requested.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was expecting more probably due to the reviews and popularity. Its just ok. The pancakes and waffle does not taste good. The prices are also on the higher side for it to just taste ok. Also please change the brand of your napkins. U touch it gently and theres crazy lint flying everywhere. I wiped the rim of my cup and those things got into my drink. The tables are small, i was uncomfortable dining the whole time.
Always a great time! Food is incredible and the drinks are wonderful. Ryan was so great and hilarious and took phenomenal care of us. One of my favorite spots!

Midtown gem. We didn't need reservations for dinner. Stopped by before we left the city. Everyone's meals were delish with great portions (2 meals for each of us). We were too full for a milkshake at the end. That was disappointing!
No comment
Omg I will come here every time I'm in town my server Sarah was THE BEST! and made our breakfast experience better than we could imagine. Food 5stars and so is the service!
No comment

Food was delicious! The fruity pebbles pancakes were so good - just the right amount of sweet for it be a good breakfast & a treat. Our waiter, Chance, was awesome and provided a super comfortable dining experience! He was the perfect mix of attentive & funny. 10/10 would recommend stopping by if you're in Hell's Kitchen!
Excellent food and drinks. Will definitely return soon. The pancake burrito was great.

The drinks are fun and delicious. I can't remember what I ordered, but it had skittles. The wait staff was super kind, even though we came in kind of late. The food was pretty great too and the portions were huge.
No comment

Ok so I thought the fruity pebbles pancakes would be nasty but was surprised that the plate was cleaned! This is enough for two people to share. The steak was cooked well and the Gouda added to the eggs (have to ask) was a nice touch. Service was good and left satisfied.
The food is amazing & the staff is super nice !! I suggest the chicken and waffles !!
No comment

Very fun place for breakfast. We actually went for brunch, but was able to off menu. I just wanted a plain waffle with none of the extras and was pleasant surprise it came exactly like I wanted it. Staff are nice and the place has a good vibe to it. I go back there for breakfast again any day
Everything was amazing. We had the best time! Great service, great ambiance. My Mom-mosa actually had plenty of champagne in it!!

This was a fun find - after a day of heavy sightseeing, we were hungry and looking for something comforting.  Mom's Kitchen fit the bill in all ways.    The service was excellent- we were greeted at the door by friendly staff.  Our server was helpful.  I had the chicken and gravy with mashed potatoes and green beans. My only complaint for the whole review is the tiny cup of gravy.  It tasted great but I expected it to be more of a centerpiece of the dish since "gravy" is part of the name.  My husband and a friend had the burger and both said it was excellent.  The quality of the burger meat was good. Our other friend had the famous chicken and waffles with cheese/honey gravy. I was dubious but the flavor combination was delightful.  Prices were lower than expected for two blocks from Times Square - and well worth the walk.  This Hoosier had a great home cooked meal in the middle of NYC and appreciated it.
Our waiter, Chance, was sexy, personable, and a top notch server.  Food was delicious!  Watermelon Sugar High cocktail hit the spot on an exceptionally warm NYC afternoon. Highly recommend MOMs
The food and milkshakes are beautiful to look at but the taste is average. I was sad that the chicken and waffles were dry.

Food was so delicious!! I went with my two daughters on a Thursday afternoon so we had no wait time at all. I had the caprisun drink which wasn't too strong but is still very effective lol. The servers were fast, nice and continuously asked if everything was ok. I will definitely come back again. Oh and FYI the portions were pretty big so we were full before we got to try any of the shakes  We'll come back just to try them.

Great food and mimosas! Slow service. We got the potato skillet and Buffalo Mac and cheese balls; I'd highly recommend the Mac and cheese balls, but the potato skillet could've been more flavorful. The "Mom-osas" were tasty, strong, and huge. The only downside was how long it took for our food to arrive but that might've been because it was a little busy.
A little on the pricier side but my god the portions are massive. Food was absolutely delicious, no complaints here!

AMAZING Mac and cheese balls everytime. I don't think I've ever had better ones before. Noah who was our server was amazing and so attentive to our needs ! Also very knowledgeable about the area around us which was so helpful !!
The waitress Jay was AMAZING!!! The food was great, drinks were amazing and she even noticed it was my friends birthday from checking ID and brought over a birthday drink to sing happy birthday!
No comment

We were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was especially considering some of the different offerings with massive portions and good efficient service kept the place humming. I ordered what a breakfast burrito  which was served in a massive maple-infused pancake (eggs, sausage, bacon and cheese) whereas my wife ordered a bagel with pork roll, cheese pepper jam on an everything bagel. Good stuff, yes;good for you, no. Nonetheless, we couldn't finish the portions and glad we decided not to order any sides. The dishes were brought out quickly and were still hot when we finished. I do think, though, the pancake, should have been a bit thinner, because I really had a hard time coming close to finishing it and ate about a half as it was super filling. The staff was friendly and helpful with the prices in line with what you got. The inside was an eclectic, kitschsy style, with no real direction. Overall, a good choice )after leaving a different  choiceless, non-attentive restaurant a few blocks away). It may, though, be a good place but probably a one and done.

Excellent neighborhood diner for brunch and great drinks! My Bloody Mary was tasty, spicy and overflowing. Over medium eggs were perfect, multigrain toast and turkey bacon hit the spot. Coffee was strong and flavorful. Don't mis out!
The food here is consistently delicious and the variety of choices make us keep coming back! Love their seasonal options too!
Had the most wonderful time tonight. The food was delicious. Noah our server gave excellent recommendations and was sweet as pie. Thank you!! I'll be back!

It was good. The service was even better! It's such a welcoming vibe. I got the chicken and waffles. The cheese side was to die for. Never thought I'd want something like that on my chicken and waffles but...a definite win! 10 out of 10 for sure.

Just WOW!! This place was amazing. My sister and I went to this place while visiting New York and we absolutely loved it. I got the chicken and waffles with bacon and my sister got the fruity pebbles pancakes. Both soooooo delicious. So many flavors, just AMAZING.
No comment

Awesome unique food choices. So delicious. My husband got cheese curds and they looked great. I had the mom osa. I plan to come back in an hour for one of the shakes. The rainbow bright and velvet teddy sound amazing

Very lively restaurant with music. Bartender is awesome!! Ambience very much a bust diner. Door staff lady was a bit cranky and unfriendly but the bar tender made up for it. Waffle and chicken with honey very good. Waffle is firm and bit tough but good quality food. The grits with cheese was wonderful! Coffee is strong and tasty. I would come back for sure. Saw plenty delicious drinks mimosa style or with beer and orange juice. Bacon was delicious as well. Aside for lady at door it's hearty high quality food and worth it. Milkshakes are insane!
Great food and service. I had the chicken bacon waffle and cinnamon toast milkshake. Both were amazing. I'll be back.
Excellent, loved the staff, food was amazing - i got the steak and eggs for breakfast, will definitely come again!

In new York and decided to try something different as I always do and boy was that a great idea. Moms was great big portions and everything is prepared well and different. My wife has the pancake burrito breakfast thing and it looked amazing and tasted it as well as I stole some. I had the shrimp and grits and it was amazing had a cheese sauce and a gravy that I thought would make it weird but I was wrong it was amazing.
Visited this past week. Loved the food, the vibe and the people. Our server was Chance and he took great care of our large and demanding group. You gotta get the pancake burrito!
No comment

Waited 1hour and 30 min it was totally worth the wait. Great Service, everyone is really friendly. Size of portion of food is a lot. We also tried the Mac and Cheese Ball delicious! Will be coming back soon!! Ooo and make sure you try the shakes! You won't regret it !

We were looking for a good place for Sunday brunch on our last day in NYC.  We found Mom's on Yelp and decided to try it and we were not disappointed. The menu has food and drink combinations that you've always kinda thought about putting together but you maybe were scared to try it because you thought it might not taste good. But this *ish was delicious!  We sat at the bar because it's was packed and ended up with the best server in the world, Daniel.  He was personable, honest, fun, and hella fast.  It was amazing to watch him single handily expedite drinks to customers, take care of us, engage with other customers at the bar and just be overall tha BOMB! But I think y'all want to know about these drinks and the food right?  I had the tomato bisque to start.  It had a nice rich tomato flavor and was really tasty.  My next course was the Chicken and Bacon waffle. Having all 3 of my favorites in one dish topped with gravy! OMG!  I was in heaven and ready for a  afterwards.  Overall excellent service and great food!
Mom's was the BEST! We have an annual romantic getaway to NYC and found Mom's on our most recent trip. The food was amazing and the milkshakes are unparalleled. You must go ... and go hungry!

In New York for a show in the blizzard and found this place on yelp! So glad We did. The food was delicious!! Wait staff was great and the decor and atmosphere was so fun. Love all the lunch boxes on the tables!! We will definitely be back and recommend to our friends visiting NYC
Good food -- Good times -- Good atmosphere -- Ruben is one of the nicest people we ever met -- He is awesome!
The food and ambience were amazing. Everything on the menu sounded delicious and I cannot wait to go back.  This time I got the mom-mosa and the short rib salad

I've been here for both brunch and dinner. Their menu is extravagant, to say the least, and the food tastes amazing. Huge portions. My only complaint is that their margaritas were not as strong as my friends and I had expected, but the pricing of this place + the friendly waitstaff makes it a MUST on your list of midtown restaurants to hit.
No comment
Disappointing. Chicken Bacon Waffle was dry and none of the food looked like the pictures. I guess it depends who is cooking. Went far out of my way for this breakfast and won't be back.

The whole vibe is amazing.  A fun place with incredible food and great service.  Ryan M crushed it behind the bar! We loved it so much, we came back for brunch the next day.  Also incredible! Possibly my favorite place in NYC

Very cool, relaxed vibe; interesting, satisfying menu; and friendly, helpful staff members. Only taking away a half star because it took a bit too long to have my order taken (so 4.5 total), but I did enjoy the outdoor seating and the people-watching. Plan to check out their brunch next time I'm in town.

We are in NY vacationing. Every time we come we try and find different places to eat. We really enjoyed this place! We tried the chicken and bacon waffle and the pancake burrito and my husband and I both enjoyed our food! It was a pleasant surprise. We will most likely go again tomorrow and see if the experience is the same...lol!

Mom's was a GREAT experience. Was looking for a place for dinner in neighborhood after meeting my boyfriend after his shift. It was Pride Sunday night and understably HK was PACKED. We got a table outdoors at Mom's. I had my dog with us, so we didn't mind sitting outdoors but the host offered to seat us indoors because it was a bit hot & humid. The food was delicious. The frozé hit the spot.. The service was great. They're dog friendly(which is always a plus in my book). The staff was really amazing, even after what I can imagine was an insanely busy shift. I/we would mos def would visit again. Thanks for the great experience.
No comment

One of my favorite spots for brunch in the city! Drinks are always phenomenal, and certainly worth the price. I've tried a large portion of the Mom's Kitchen menu and everything has exceeded expectations

Fun and youthful vibe, delicious food/drinks, and amazing staff. Alan our waiter did a fantastic job. He definitely gave a lot of positive energy and brightened the day despite the weather. Overall, I had a great time dining with them and would highly recommend anyone to check this place out.

Amazing food and really friendly service. It's hard to beat Mom's. Definitely worth a visit.

This place is awesome me and my family came to eat here while we were visiting the city. I love the nostalgic retro vibe it has. The drink "pop that" is a 10/10 I would probably skip on the Jell-O shots though. The avocado toast is pretty good but the best thing they probably have is the pancake burrito! My only complaint is that our server left halfway helping us out. Other than that this place is great! Definitely check it out.
The food and staff were amazing. The shakes were delicious. A bit pricey, but the food made up for that. If you are in the area I definitely recommend coming here. It's also SO PRETTY.

I was so excited to try this place once I saw the menu, I even talked about coming back multiple times for my short stay in New York to try all the milk shakes! But I was super disappointed in our service. I watched all the tables around me get served, offered refills, and get theirs checks while my girlfriend and me sat ignored. We got our food but it felt like after we finished our dessert our server Noah had decided to ignore us and not check if we needed boxes or our check, in the end we sat for about 35 minutes after finishing dessert before I asked for my check and our server Noah brought it over to us as if we didn't sit there ignored. The food was amazing, the shakes are to die for, but for a place where their catch phrase is "welcome home" the hospitality it very much lacking!
